original: de yi de ni dngos med 'dod //
analyzed: de yi de ni dngos med 'dod //
translated: But that is not so, for that is held to be a non-entity.

original: cis na rgyu las 'byung ma yin //
analyzed: cis na rgyu las 'byung ma yin //
translated: How is it not produced from a cause?

original: zhes smras te //üîΩgzhon nu ma len gyis 'dod pa de dang de dag bsal ba ni dngos po rnams kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes smras te // gzhon nu ma len gyis 'dod pa de dang de dag bsal ba ni dngos po rnams kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Thus he says.üîΩKumarila‚Äôs refutation of those assertions is stated in the passage beginning with ‚ÄúThe subsequent state that is the nature of the effect . . .‚Äù

original: 'bras bu'i bdag nyid phyi ma ni dngos po gzhan kho na med pa gang yin pa de ni me dang 'brel pa la sogs pa las sol ba la sogs pa 'byung ba ni kho bo cag mngon par 'dod pa nyid de /
analyzed: 'bras bu'i bdag nyid phyi ma ni dngos po gzhan kho na med pa gang yin pa de ni me dang 'brel pa la sogs pa las sol ba la sogs pa 'byung ba ni kho bo cag mngon par 'dod pa nyid de /
translated: We do indeed assert that charcoal, etc., arise from contact with fire, etc., but that is only another entity, a non-entity.

original: 'on kyang dngos po gzhan rgyur khas blangs pa na me la sogs pa bud shing la byed pa med par dngos po'i bud shing la sogs pa'i gnas skabs kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on kyang dngos po gzhan rgyur khas blangs pa na me la sogs pa bud shing la byed pa med par dngos po'i bud shing la sogs pa'i gnas skabs kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: However, when you assert that another entity is the cause, then fire, etc., would not act on fuel, etc., and would be only the state of entities such as fuel.

original: des na yang ji ltar me la sogs pa dang 'brel pa las sngar bud shing la sogs pa nye bar dmigs pa las gzhan pa de'i bsgrub par bya ba'i yang don byed pa de bzhin du sol ba la sogs pa skyed pa na nye bar dmigs par thalüîΩbar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na yang ji ltar me la sogs pa dang 'brel pa las sngar bud shing la sogs pa nye bar dmigs pa las gzhan pa de'i bsgrub par bya ba'i yang don byed pa de bzhin du sol ba la sogs pa skyed pa na nye bar dmigs par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, just as fuel and so on are observed prior to their relationship with fire and so on, and they are also the objects of the activity of fire and so on, in the same way, it follows that when charcoal and so on are produced, they would be observed.

original: ci ste dngos po @229b gzhan zhig nas med pa'i ngo bo de skyed pa ni bud shing la sogs pa zhig nas med pas ji ltar nye bar dmigs par thal bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste dngos po @229b gzhan zhig nas med pa'i ngo bo de skyed pa ni bud shing la sogs pa zhig nas med pas ji ltar nye bar dmigs par thal bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: But if you think that the state of nonexistence of another thing is produced, then how could the state of nonexistence of fuel and so on that has been destroyed be observed?

original: 'di snyam du dgongs pa yin te 'jig pa 'di bud shing la sogs pa las gzhan ba lang la sogs pa dag kyang dngos po de ltar ma gyur cig snyam nas sol ba la sogs pa la zhig pa rnam par 'jig pa'i rgyu mtshan brjod pa yin no
analyzed: 'di snyam du dgongs pa yin te 'jig pa 'di bud shing la sogs pa las gzhan ba lang la sogs pa dag kyang dngos po de ltar ma gyur cig snyam nas sol ba la sogs pa la zhig pa rnam par 'jig pa'i rgyu mtshan brjod pa yin no
translated: The meaning of this is as follows: If you think that this destruction is different from fuel and so on, then, like cows and so on, it would not be a thing. Therefore you assert that the reason for the disintegration of destruction, such as charcoal, is the state of nonexistence of another thing.

original: // gal te 'di yod pa las de ldog pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: // gal te 'di yod pa las de ldog pa yin no zhe na /
translated: But if you think that it is the reversal of its existence,

original: tshig la mkhas pa'i ngo mtshar de gang yod pas ldog pa yin /
analyzed: tshig la mkhas pa'i ngo mtshar de gang yod pas ldog pa yin /
translated: What is so amazing about being skilled in words?

original: ci yang ma yin pa'i rang bzhin ni khas ma blangs pas de nyid dngos po gzhan pa sol ba la sogs pa la ldog par brjod na /
analyzed: ci yang ma yin pa'i rang bzhin ni khas ma blangs pas de nyid dngos po gzhan pa sol ba la sogs pa la ldog par brjod na /
translated: Since the nature of nonexistence is not accepted, if you say that it is the opposite of other things, such as charcoal,

original: de'i don 'di grub zin pas sol ba la sogs pa'i dngos po'i sol ba la sogs pa yod pas sol ba la sogs pa la zhig pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i don 'di grub zin pas sol ba la sogs pa'i dngos po'i sol ba la sogs pa yod pas sol ba la sogs pa la zhig pa zhes bya'o //
translated: then the meaning of that is established, because the existence of things such as charcoal is called ‚Äúthe destruction of charcoal.‚Äù

original: sol ba la sogs pa de yod pas de yod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sol ba la sogs pa de yod pas de yod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But the existence of charcoal is not the existence of that.

original: rang gi bdag nyid kyi rgyu'i dngos po mi rigs te me la sogs pas de skyed par brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi bdag nyid kyi rgyu'i dngos po mi rigs te me la sogs pas de skyed par brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not logical that the nature of the cause is the same, because it is said that fire and so on produces it.

original: bud shing nye bar bcom pas sol ba la sogs pa 'byung bas 'di 'jig pa'i ngo bo yin no zhe na /
analyzed: bud shing nye bar bcom pas sol ba la sogs pa 'byung bas 'di 'jig pa'i ngo bo yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that charcoal and so on arise from the destruction of fuel, and therefore it has the nature of destruction,

original: nye bar bcom pa zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig / gal te ldog pa ni sol ba sogs pa'i mtshan nyid du khas len na snga ma las khyad par med do //
analyzed: nye bar bcom pa zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig / gal te ldog pa ni sol ba sogs pa'i mtshan nyid du khas len na snga ma las khyad par med do //
translated: what is this so-called destruction? If you accept that cessation is characterized by charcoal and so on, there is no difference from the previous case.

original: de'i phyir rang gi ngang gis ldog pa na shing la sogs pa la me la sogs pas sol ba la sogs pa skyed pa nyid ni mdzes te /
analyzed: de'i phyir rang gi ngang gis ldog pa na shing la sogs pa la me la sogs pas sol ba la sogs pa skyed pa nyid ni mdzes te /
translated: Therefore, when it naturally subsides, it is beautiful that fire and so on produce charcoal and so forth from wood and so on.

original: de lta na yin na shing la sogs pa de bzhin du nye bar dmigs pa la sogs pa thal bar ji ltar 'gyur /üîΩgzhan yang / gal te dngos po gzhan pa la zhig nas med pa 'di'i 'gyur ba rjes su skyes pa yin na ni mar me dang blo la sogs pa zhig pa de dag gang las dngos po gzhan pa'i zhig pa rnam par gzhag par bya /
analyzed: de lta na yin na shing la sogs pa de bzhin du nye bar dmigs pa la sogs pa thal bar ji ltar 'gyur / gzhan yang / gal te dngos po gzhan pa la zhig nas med pa 'di'i 'gyur ba rjes su skyes pa yin na ni mar me dang blo la sogs pa zhig pa de dag gang las dngos po gzhan pa'i zhig pa rnam par gzhag par bya /
translated: But if it is like that, then how could it follow that wood and so on are observed to be similar?üîΩMoreover, if this nonexistence of destruction in another thing were to arise after it, then from what would the destruction of a lamp and mind and so on be posited as another thing?

original: gal te de yang mi gsal ba'i bdag nyid kyi dngos po 'gyur ba kho na la zhig par dmigs so zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de yang mi gsal ba'i bdag nyid kyi dngos po 'gyur ba kho na la zhig par dmigs so zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is observed that destruction is just the transformation of a thing that is not clear,

original: mar me la sogs pa'i ngo bo mi gsal bar 'gyur ba la tshad ma med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mar me la sogs pa'i ngo bo mi gsal bar 'gyur ba la tshad ma med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: then because there is no valid knowledge of the transformation of the nature of a lamp and so on into something unclear,

original: gang gi tshe nus pa'i ngo bo thob mi gsal ba yin pa de'i tshe nus pa ni 'bras bu mthong ba las dpag par bya ba'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir med pa ji ltar mar me la sogs pa'i nus pa'i bdag nyid du gnas par brtags par byaüîΩ/ yang na ma tshang ba med pa'i bdag nyid thob @230a * //
analyzed: gang gi tshe nus pa'i ngo bo thob mi gsal ba yin pa de'i tshe nus pa ni 'bras bu mthong ba las dpag par bya ba'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir med pa ji ltar mar me la sogs pa'i nus pa'i bdag nyid du gnas par brtags par bya / yang na ma tshang ba med pa'i bdag nyid thob @230a * //
translated: When the nature of the potentiality is not clear, then since the potentiality is an entity that is inferred from seeing the effect, how can it be non-existent?

original: pa'i nye bar dmigs su rung ba mi gsal ba yin na 'di la yang de'i bdag nyid du gnas pa'i tshad ma med pa nyid do //
analyzed: pa'i nye bar dmigs su rung ba mi gsal ba yin na 'di la yang de'i bdag nyid du gnas pa'i tshad ma med pa nyid do //
translated: Or, if the non-clear potentiality is the object that is perceived as having the nature of being complete, then there is no valid cognition of its nature.

original: mkhas pa ni tshad ma med pa'i tshig la gus par mi byed pa dang / bdag nyid med pa'i phyir ji ltar yod pa yin /
analyzed: mkhas pa ni tshad ma med pa'i tshig la gus par mi byed pa dang / bdag nyid med pa'i phyir ji ltar yod pa yin /
translated: The wise do not respect words that are not valid cognitions, and since it has no self, how can it exist?

original: blo la sogs pa rnams kyi 'gyur ba dang yongs su 'gyur ba gzhan du byas pa'i brtag ba rgyas pa zhar la byung bas chog go //
analyzed: blo la sogs pa rnams kyi 'gyur ba dang yongs su 'gyur ba gzhan du byas pa'i brtag ba rgyas pa zhar la byung bas chog go //
translated: The extensive analysis of the transformation and complete transformation of the mind and so on is sufficient as a digression.

original: gal te dngos po gzhan sol ba la sogs pa ni sgrib pa yin pas bud shing la sogs pa nye bar dmigs par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya bar 'dod do zhe na /
analyzed: gal te dngos po gzhan sol ba la sogs pa ni sgrib pa yin pas bud shing la sogs pa nye bar dmigs par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya bar 'dod do zhe na /
translated: If you maintain that the other thing, such as charcoal, is the obscuration, and therefore the fuel, etc., is not perceived,

original: ngo bo nyid gzhan ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid gzhan ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: then NƒÅgƒÅrjuna says, ‚ÄúAnother nature, etc.‚Äù

original: rang bzhin gzhan pa 'di bud shing la sogs pa sgrib par rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rang bzhin gzhan pa 'di bud shing la sogs pa sgrib par rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not logical that this other intrinsic reality is the obscuration of fuel, etc.

original: de so na 'dug pa'i ngo bo bud shing la sogs pa de la gyur pa sgrib par yang nye bar dmigs su med pas mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de so na 'dug pa'i ngo bo bud shing la sogs pa de la gyur pa sgrib par yang nye bar dmigs su med pas mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not tenable that the fuel, etc., which is the intrinsic reality of that [other intrinsic reality] is perceived as an obscuration.

original: dngos po 'ba' zhig gi rang bzhin ma yin la /
analyzed: dngos po 'ba' zhig gi rang bzhin ma yin la /
translated: It is not the intrinsic reality of just the thing.

original: dngos po gzhan ni 'jig pa'i rgyus mi byed pas so //
analyzed: dngos po gzhan ni 'jig pa'i rgyus mi byed pas so //
translated: And another thing is not made by the cause of destruction.

original: dngos po dang dngos po med pa yang byed pa med do snyam nas /
analyzed: dngos po dang dngos po med pa yang byed pa med do snyam nas /
translated: If you think that neither a thing nor a nonthing is made,

original: 'jig pa'i rgyus zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'jig pa'i rgyus zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: then NƒÅgƒÅrjuna says, ‚ÄúThe cause of destruction, etc.‚Äù

original: ga las she na /
analyzed: ga las she na /
translated: Why is that?

original: dngos po med pa sgrub pa dang ma yin par dgag par yang /
analyzed: dngos po med pa sgrub pa dang ma yin par dgag par yang /
translated: Because a nonthing is not established as an affirming negation or a nonaffirming negation.

original: brjod pas 'dod pa ma yin te med pa mi gzhan gyi 'bras bur khas len par byed pa na ci bud shing la sogs pa'i ngo bo las don gzhan pa zhes bya ba 'am /
analyzed: brjod pas 'dod pa ma yin te med pa mi gzhan gyi 'bras bur khas len par byed pa na ci bud shing la sogs pa'i ngo bo las don gzhan pa zhes bya ba 'am /
translated: It is not asserted that the result is different from the object, because if one accepts that the result is different from the object, then is it different from the nature of fuel and so on, or is it different from the nature of fire?

original: tha dad pa dang tha dad pa ma yin par rnam par rtog pa las ma 'das pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha dad pa dang tha dad pa ma yin par rnam par rtog pa las ma 'das pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not asserted that the non-existent is the effect of something else, because when one accepts that, one does not go beyond the conceptions of ‚Äúother‚Äù and ‚Äúdifferent‚Äù or ‚Äúnon-different‚Äù in regard to the nature of fuel, etc.

original: de la yang bshad zin pa'i skyon nyid do //
analyzed: de la yang bshad zin pa'i skyon nyid do //
translated: And in that case, the previously stated errors would apply.

original: 'o na ni med par dgag pa ci yang ma yin pa'i ngo bo 'di me la sogs pa las skye bar khas len te de yod kyang bud shing la sogs pa rang bzhin med pa gang la ni /
analyzed: 'o na ni med par dgag pa ci yang ma yin pa'i ngo bo 'di me la sogs pa las skye bar khas len te de yod kyang bud shing la sogs pa rang bzhin med pa gang la ni /
translated: Well, then, this non-existent, which is the negation of something, is accepted as arising from fire, etc., because even though it exists, it is not the case that fuel, etc., which are essenceless,

original: snga ma'i skyon du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: snga ma'i skyon du 'gyur ro //
translated: would have the previously mentioned errors.

original: de yang nges par me la sogs pa yod pa dang med pa'i rjes su byed pas de'i 'bras bu de'i yod pa'i tha snyad du byed la gzhan yang de'i rgyu mtshan gyis yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang nges par me la sogs pa yod pa dang med pa'i rjes su byed pas de'i 'bras bu de'i yod pa'i tha snyad du byed la gzhan yang de'i rgyu mtshan gyis yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And that is definitely the effect of fire, etc., because it occurs in dependence on the existence of fire, etc., and because it is conventionally designated as existing due to that.

original: de skad du /
analyzed: de skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: shes pa'i spyod yul gyur pa na //
analyzed: shes pa'i spyod yul gyur pa na //
translated: That which is the object of cognition

original: de yod par ni nye bar dmigs //üîΩzhig la zhig pa'i ngo bo de //
analyzed: de yod par ni nye bar dmigs // zhig la zhig pa'i ngo bo de //
translated: But it is perceived as existent.üîΩHow could the state of having ceased

original: ji ltar 'bras bur 'gro ba min //üîΩdper na sngon med las byung ba'i //
analyzed: ji ltar 'bras bur 'gro ba min // dper na sngon med las byung ba'i //
translated: Be the effect of that which has ceased?üîΩFor example, a thing that arises

original: dngos po rgyu las skye ba yin //
analyzed: dngos po rgyu las skye ba yin //
translated: From a cause is a thing that did not exist before.

original: byung zin pa ni mi 'gyur ba //
analyzed: byung zin pa ni mi 'gyur ba //
translated: What has arisen does not change;

original: de ni rgyu las byung ma yin //
analyzed: de ni rgyu las byung ma yin //
translated: It does not arise from a cause.

original: ces smra ba na /
analyzed: ces smra ba na /
translated: If you say, ‚ÄúA thing that has ceasedüîΩIs the cause of an existent effect,‚Äù

original: dngos po @230b dgag pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te //
analyzed: dngos po @230b dgag pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te //
translated: What is the state of having ceased?üîΩWhat is the state of having arisen?

original: 'di'i dgongs pa ni gang gi tshe dngos po gzhan pa'i tshogs pa la ltos pa med pa tsam nyid na ci yang ma yin pa'i ngo bo'i zhig pa yin pa de'i tshe de la byed pa po'i byed pa mi srid de srid na ni chos can kho naüîΩla de srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di'i dgongs pa ni gang gi tshe dngos po gzhan pa'i tshogs pa la ltos pa med pa tsam nyid na ci yang ma yin pa'i ngo bo'i zhig pa yin pa de'i tshe de la byed pa po'i byed pa mi srid de srid na ni chos can kho na la de srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The intended meaning of this is as follows: When a thing is merely devoid of dependence on a collection of other things, it is a state of having ceased that is not anything at all. At that time, it is impossible for it to be an agent. If it were possible, then it would be the basis of that.

original: gal te de yang ma byung ba las byung bar khas blangs pas 'bras bu nyid du 'gal ba med do zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de yang ma byung ba las byung bar khas blangs pas 'bras bu nyid du 'gal ba med do zhe na /
translated: If you accept that it arises from what did not occur previously, then it is not contradictory for it to be an effect.

original: ma yin te byung ba chos can la yod pa'i ngo bo thob pa na dngos po med pa nyams pa yin no //
analyzed: ma yin te byung ba chos can la yod pa'i ngo bo thob pa na dngos po med pa nyams pa yin no //
translated: But that is not so, because when the nature of the existent is obtained, the non-existent is lost.

original: gang gi phyir byung ba zhes bya ba yod par brjod kyis myu gu la sogs ba la yang yod pa'i sgra 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir byung ba zhes bya ba yod par brjod kyis myu gu la sogs ba la yang yod pa'i sgra 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan ma yin no //
translated: Because the so-called existent is said to exist, the reason for applying the word existent to such things as sprouts is not established.

original: gal te don byed par nus pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te don byed par nus pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is that which is able to perform a function,

original: nus pa thams cad kyis stong pa de lta na ji ltar shes pa'i yul du 'gyur /
analyzed: nus pa thams cad kyis stong pa de lta na ji ltar shes pa'i yul du 'gyur /
translated: then how could it be the object of consciousness, since it is empty of all abilities?

original: rgyu ma yin pa ni yul ma yin te ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: rgyu ma yin pa ni yul ma yin te ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'am /
translated: That which is not a cause is not an object, because that would lead to an absurd consequence.

original: de'i yul ma yin na ji ltar rgyu dang ldan par rtogs pa yin /
analyzed: de'i yul ma yin na ji ltar rgyu dang ldan par rtogs pa yin /
translated: If it is not the object of that, how is it known to be a cause?

original: dngos por gang gis brjod /
analyzed: dngos por gang gis brjod /
translated: By what is it said to be an existent?

original: ci yang ma yin pa'i ngo bo kho na dngos po yin no snyam nam shes pa skyed par byed pa nyid ji ltar nus pa de dag 'brel pa ma yin /
analyzed: ci yang ma yin pa'i ngo bo kho na dngos po yin no snyam nam shes pa skyed par byed pa nyid ji ltar nus pa de dag 'brel pa ma yin /
translated: If you think that the nature of nothing at all is an existent, how could that which produces consciousness be related to that which is not able to do so?

original: gal te shes pa'i yul med na ji ltar yod par 'gyur /
analyzed: gal te shes pa'i yul med na ji ltar yod par 'gyur /
translated: If the object of consciousness does not exist, how could it exist?

original: 'di ni 'bras bu yang ji ltar yin /
analyzed: 'di ni 'bras bu yang ji ltar yin /
translated: How could it be a result?

original: gal te rang gi rgyu yod pa las yod pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te rang gi rgyu yod pa las yod pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that it exists because its cause exists,

original: de lta na 'bras bur yod pa de shes pa'i yul yin no //
analyzed: de lta na 'bras bur yod pa de shes pa'i yul yin no //
translated: then that which exists as an effect is the object of cognition.

original: 'di ltar gal te rang gi rgyu yod pa las byung ngo zhes shes pa na yod do zhes pa yang shes so //
analyzed: 'di ltar gal te rang gi rgyu yod pa las byung ngo zhes shes pa na yod do zhes pa yang shes so //
translated: In this way, if you say that it arises from the existence of its cause, then you also say that it exists.

original: gang gi phyir yod do zhes pa dang bdog go zhes mkhas pas brjod pa ni yod pa dang yin pa dang mchis pa dang bdog pa sgra'i ming yin gyi don dam par na don la tha dad pa 'ga' zhig kyang med do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir yod do zhes pa dang bdog go zhes mkhas pas brjod pa ni yod pa dang yin pa dang mchis pa dang bdog pa sgra'i ming yin gyi don dam par na don la tha dad pa 'ga' zhig kyang med do //
translated: Because the wise say that ‚Äúexists‚Äù and ‚Äúis‚Äù are synonyms for ‚Äúis existent,‚Äù ‚Äúis real,‚Äù ‚Äúis present,‚Äù and ‚Äúis possessed,‚Äù ultimately there is no difference in meaning.

original: gal te med pa'i bdag nyid de byung ba 'di yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te med pa'i bdag nyid de byung ba 'di yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that this non-arisen thing is existent,

original: ma yin te 'gal ba'i phyir gang gi phyir ma byung ba'o zhes bya ba med par brjod na de ji ltar byung ba yin no zhes bstan par bya /
analyzed: ma yin te 'gal ba'i phyir gang gi phyir ma byung ba'o zhes bya ba med par brjod na de ji ltar byung ba yin no zhes bstan par bya /
translated: then that is not so, because it is contradictory. If you say that it is non-arisen, then how can you say that it is arisen?

original: gal te ngo bo 'ga' zhig gis rab tu gnas pa shes pa'i bdag la so sor snang bas yod pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te ngo bo 'ga' zhig gis rab tu gnas pa shes pa'i bdag la so sor snang bas yod pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is not existent because it does not appear to the cognition that is well established in some nature,üîΩthen that is not so.

original: shin tu lkog tu gyur pa'i mig la sogs pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shin tu lkog tu gyur pa'i mig la sogs pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: The eyes, etc., which are extremely hidden, would not exist.

original: ma yin te de dag shes pa'i rgyu'i ngo bor snang ba'i phyir ro zhe na /üîΩ'di yang 'byung bar byed pa'i ngo bor snang ba'i phyir dang dngos po thams cad kyis dben pa ji ltar byung ba @231a * //
analyzed: ma yin te de dag shes pa'i rgyu'i ngo bor snang ba'i phyir ro zhe na / 'di yang 'byung bar byed pa'i ngo bor snang ba'i phyir dang dngos po thams cad kyis dben pa ji ltar byung ba @231a * //
translated: If you say, ‚ÄúNo, because they appear as the nature of the cause of that cognition,‚Äù

original: dang 'brel pa yin /
analyzed: dang 'brel pa yin /
translated: then this is also the case with the elements, because they appear as the nature of the cause of the arising of the effect, and because, just as they are devoid of all entities, how could they be related to what has arisen?üîΩBecause they are the cause of the manifestation of some nature and of cognition, they are similar in appearing as the nature of the cause.

original: ngo bo cung zad cig gis mngon par gyur pa dang shes pa'i yin pas kyang rgyu'i ngo bor snang ba mtshungs pa'i phyir dang rgyu ma yin pa yul nyid du mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ngo bo cung zad cig gis mngon par gyur pa dang shes pa'i yin pas kyang rgyu'i ngo bor snang ba mtshungs pa'i phyir dang rgyu ma yin pa yul nyid du mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And because it is not logical that a noncause is an object.

original: kho bo cag kyang dngos po med pa'i blo ni rang gi bag chags yongs su smin pa'i rjes su 'gro bas yul med pa nyid do //
analyzed: kho bo cag kyang dngos po med pa'i blo ni rang gi bag chags yongs su smin pa'i rjes su 'gro bas yul med pa nyid do //
translated: We also say that a cognition that lacks an entity is devoid of an object because it is the result of the ripening of its own habitual tendencies.

original: dngos po med pa 'byung bar byed pa la ji ltar ma yin par dgag pa dang med par dgag pa tha dad par brjod pa yin /
analyzed: dngos po med pa 'byung bar byed pa la ji ltar ma yin par dgag pa dang med par dgag pa tha dad par brjod pa yin /
translated: How could it be that a nonentity is the cause of arising? We speak of a negation and an absence of negation.

original: gal te de'i ngo bor mi byed pas ma yin par dgag pa las de tha dad do zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de'i ngo bor mi byed pas ma yin par dgag pa las de tha dad do zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is not a nonimplicative negation because it does not have the nature of that,

original: ma yin te med pa'i ngo bo yang 'byung ba las 'gal ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma yin te med pa'i ngo bo yang 'byung ba las 'gal ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: then it is not so, because the nature of nonexistence is not contradictory to origination.

original: byung ngo zhes bya ba byung zin pa'i yod pa la mi slu ba ste /
analyzed: byung ngo zhes bya ba byung zin pa'i yod pa la mi slu ba ste /
translated: The word ‚Äúoriginates‚Äù is not deceptive with regard to the existence of what has originated.

original: de la ji ltar yod pa'i ngo bo'i rnam pas ma yin par dgag pa yin /
analyzed: de la ji ltar yod pa'i ngo bo'i rnam pas ma yin par dgag pa yin /
translated: How can it be a nonimplicative negation in terms of the nature of existence?

original: de nyid dgag pa'i don du gcig par 'gyur te thams cad du sgrub pa gtso bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid dgag pa'i don du gcig par 'gyur te thams cad du sgrub pa gtso bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It would be a negation only, because in all cases affirmation is primary.

original: gang gi tshe de ltar na cung zad cig rnam pa 'gas ldog pa yin pa de'i tshe de ni de ma yin pa las tha dad pas de las bzlog par shes so //
analyzed: gang gi tshe de ltar na cung zad cig rnam pa 'gas ldog pa yin pa de'i tshe de ni de ma yin pa las tha dad pas de las bzlog par shes so //
translated: When it is like that, in some way there is a negation. At that time, because it is different from that which is not that, it is understood as the opposite of that.

original: de yang med pa ni thams cad las ldog pa yin par bshad la dngos po nyid ni 'ga' zhig gis byed pa de bzhin du 'dis dngos po la dmigs par bshad par 'gyur na /
analyzed: de yang med pa ni thams cad las ldog pa yin par bshad la dngos po nyid ni 'ga' zhig gis byed pa de bzhin du 'dis dngos po la dmigs par bshad par 'gyur na /
translated: And that is explained as the negation of everything. Existence is made by some. In that way, it is explained that this is the observation of existence.

original: de dag tha dad pa ni med do //
analyzed: de dag tha dad pa ni med do //
translated: But there is no difference between them.

original: tha dad pa med na ma yin par dgag pa ma yin pa dang / skabs ma yin pa brjod par yang 'gyur te dngos po ldog pa'i skabs su med pa'i bdag nyid kyi dngos po gzhan brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha dad pa med na ma yin par dgag pa ma yin pa dang / skabs ma yin pa brjod par yang 'gyur te dngos po ldog pa'i skabs su med pa'i bdag nyid kyi dngos po gzhan brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If it is not different, then it is not a non-affirming negation, and it would be stated out of context, because it would state another entity that is not the nature of non-existence in the context of the negation of an entity.

original: rang gi ngo bos med pa'i bdag nyid ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bos med pa'i bdag nyid ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not that it is not by its own nature,

original: rang gi ngo bos med na 'bras bu nyid du 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bos med na 'bras bu nyid du 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because if it were not by its own nature, it would be contradictory for it to be an effect.

original: gzhan gyi ngo bos yin na ni dngos po thams cad med pa'i bdag nyid du 'gyur te bum pa dang la la zhig khyad par med do //
analyzed: gzhan gyi ngo bos yin na ni dngos po thams cad med pa'i bdag nyid du 'gyur te bum pa dang la la zhig khyad par med do //
translated: If it were by another's nature, all entities would have the nature of non-existence, because there would be no difference between a pot and something else.

original: yang na yin du chug na med pa 'di me la sogs pa dag las de 'byung ba yin na cis na shing la sogs pa nye bar mi 'gyur /
analyzed: yang na yin du chug na med pa 'di me la sogs pa dag las de 'byung ba yin na cis na shing la sogs pa nye bar mi 'gyur /
translated: Moreover, even if it were so, if this non-existence arises from fire and so on, why would fuel not be nearby?

original: 'di ltar me la sogs pa gzhan gyi byed par don 'di grub pa'i phyir bud shing la sogs pa ldog pa med pas na snga ma bzhin du nye bar dmigs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar me la sogs pa gzhan gyi byed par don 'di grub pa'i phyir bud shing la sogs pa ldog pa med pas na snga ma bzhin du nye bar dmigs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Because this matter is established by the activity of another, such as fire, fuel and so on would not cease, and therefore it would be perceived as before.

original: gal te de nye bar bcom pa las zhig pa skye ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de nye bar bcom pa las zhig pa skye ba yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that destruction arises from the destruction of fuel,

original: ji ltar de nye bar bcom pa yin /
analyzed: ji ltar de nye bar bcom pa yin /
translated: how can fuel be destroyed?

original: re zhig zhig pa med pa ma yin te bud shing yod pa'i dus su de med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: re zhig zhig pa med pa ma yin te bud shing yod pa'i dus su de med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Fuel is not without destruction, because it does not exist at the time of its destruction.

original: @231b me la sogs pa rnams kyis zhig pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: @231b me la sogs pa rnams kyis zhig pa ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not destroyed by fire, etc.,

original: mi mngon pa nyid du de dag byed par khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi mngon pa nyid du de dag byed par khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is accepted that they make it invisible.

original: bcom pa na zhig pa'i med pa ma yin te bud shing la sogs pa nyams pa dang dus mnyam par thal bar 'gyur bas zhig pa dang 'jig pa de la rnam par rtog pa rnam pa gsum rnam par gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bcom pa na zhig pa'i med pa ma yin te bud shing la sogs pa nyams pa dang dus mnyam par thal bar 'gyur bas zhig pa dang 'jig pa de la rnam par rtog pa rnam pa gsum rnam par gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: When it is destroyed, it is not the nonexistence of destruction, because it follows that it would be simultaneous with the deterioration of fuel, etc., and because the three kinds of conceptions of destruction and cessation are not tenable.

original: des na thug pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: des na thug pa med pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, there is an infinite regress.

original: gal te de nyid zhig pa bud shing la sogs pa la me la sogs pa skye ba na ldog pa des na 'di mi dmigs pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de nyid zhig pa bud shing la sogs pa la me la sogs pa skye ba na ldog pa des na 'di mi dmigs pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that when fire, etc., arises from fuel, etc., it is destroyed, and therefore it is not perceived,

original: ji ltar gzhan gyis gzhan ldog pa yin na ha cang thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji ltar gzhan gyis gzhan ldog pa yin na ha cang thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: how can one thing be destroyed by another? That would be absurd.

original: gal te 'di rgyu dang ldan pa de dag nyid tha dad pas tha dad par cis na mi 'gyur /
analyzed: gal te 'di rgyu dang ldan pa de dag nyid tha dad pas tha dad par cis na mi 'gyur /
translated: If this is the case, then why don‚Äôt the effects differ due to the difference of their causes?

original: 'bras dang nas kyi myu gu yang rgyu tha dad pa bdag nyid tha dad pa shin tu mtshan nyid mi mthun par mngon sum gyis nyams su myong ba nyid du nges pa yin no //
analyzed: 'bras dang nas kyi myu gu yang rgyu tha dad pa bdag nyid tha dad pa shin tu mtshan nyid mi mthun par mngon sum gyis nyams su myong ba nyid du nges pa yin no //

original: 'ga' zhig mi nus pas 'jig pa'i rgyu mi rigs pa dang de nyid don med pa'i yang phyir ro //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig mi nus pas 'jig pa'i rgyu mi rigs pa dang de nyid don med pa'i yang phyir ro //
translated: Some are incapable of destruction because the cause of destruction is illogical and that itself is meaningless.

original: gal te dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo 'jig pa zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: gal te dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo 'jig pa zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: If the intrinsic reality of things is called ‚Äúdestruction,‚Äù

original: 'jig pa'i ngang tshul can te /üîΩrang gi ngo bos mi @232a * //
analyzed: 'jig pa'i ngang tshul can te / rang gi ngo bos mi @232a * //
translated: it has the nature of destruction.üîΩIf it does not endure by its intrinsic reality, it cannot endure, like a mustard seed on the point of a needle.üîΩThere is no cause of destruction at all.

original: gnas na gnas par mi nus te khab rtser yungs kar bzhin du de la 'jig pa'i rgyu ni ci yang ma yin te rgyu gcig yin zhe na /
analyzed: gnas na gnas par mi nus te khab rtser yungs kar bzhin du de la 'jig pa'i rgyu ni ci yang ma yin te rgyu gcig yin zhe na /
translated: If it is asked, ‚ÄúIs there one cause?‚Äù

original: bdag nyid 'jig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag nyid 'jig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is because of self-destruction.

original: de'i rang gi ngo bo nyid ni mi gnas pa'i rang bzhin nyid de /
analyzed: de'i rang gi ngo bo nyid ni mi gnas pa'i rang bzhin nyid de /
translated: Its intrinsic reality itself is the nature of nonendurance.

original: rang bzhin ni gnas par mi nus te khab rtser yungs kar mi gnas na 'bad pas 'bras bu dang ldan par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin ni gnas par mi nus te khab rtser yungs kar mi gnas na 'bad pas 'bras bu dang ldan par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The intrinsic reality cannot endure, like a mustard seed on the point of a needle. If it does not endure, it is not possible to have an effect through effort.

original: 'dir khyab pa bstan pa ni gang zhig gang gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'dir khyab pa bstan pa ni gang zhig gang gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Here the pervasion is taught with ‚ÄúWhatever is destroyed by what‚Äù and so on.

original: de'i ngo bo ni rang bzhin gyi skyed par byed pa'i rgyu las yin gyi rgyu gzhan la ltos pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i ngo bo ni rang bzhin gyi skyed par byed pa'i rgyu las yin gyi rgyu gzhan la ltos pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Its nature is that it is produced from a cause that is its intrinsic nature, and it does not depend on another cause.

original: bsal ba la sogs pa zhes bya bas ni dpe rnam par 'grel to //
analyzed: bsal ba la sogs pa zhes bya bas ni dpe rnam par 'grel to //
translated: The words ‚Äúmanifestation, etc.‚Äù illustrate this.

original: de'i bdag nyid la rgyu gzhan la mi ltos pas khyab la /
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid la rgyu gzhan la mi ltos pas khyab la /
translated: It is pervaded by the fact that it does not depend on another cause for its nature.

original: de'i bdag nyid du sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid du sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma bstan pa ni /
translated: The proof that it is its nature is stated:

original: de'i bdag nyid la gang gi rang bzhin yin pa de'i rang bzhin gyi de'i bdag nyid med pa rgyu gzhan la los pa na ni rang gi rgyu las sgrub pa'i rang gi ngo bo nyid med pas bdag nyid med pa ni rang bzhin med par thal bar 'gyur
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid la gang gi rang bzhin yin pa de'i rang bzhin gyi de'i bdag nyid med pa rgyu gzhan la los pa na ni rang gi rgyu las sgrub pa'i rang gi ngo bo nyid med pas bdag nyid med pa ni rang bzhin med par thal bar 'gyur
translated: If it did not exist by its own intrinsic nature, which is its nature, and it existed by the intrinsic nature of another, then it would not be established from its own cause, and it would not have its own intrinsic nature. Therefore, it would follow that it would be essenceless.

original: bas so // de dang 'dra ba ni gsal ba la sogs pa dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: bas so // de dang 'dra ba ni gsal ba la sogs pa dang ldan pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúLike that‚Äù means like the manifestation, etc.

original: yang ni phyi nas so //
analyzed: yang ni phyi nas so //
translated: ‚ÄúAgain‚Äù means later.

original: de'i bdag tu byas pa'i phyir ni mi gnas pa'i chos can du'o //
analyzed: de'i bdag tu byas pa'i phyir ni mi gnas pa'i chos can du'o //
translated: ‚ÄúBecause it is made into its nature‚Äù means because it is a phenomenon that does not endure.

original: rgyu gzhan la mi ltos so zhes bya ba ni tshad ma'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: rgyu gzhan la mi ltos so zhes bya ba ni tshad ma'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: The result of the valid cognition is that it does not depend on another cause.

original: gal te mi gnas pa'i chos can zhig yin na ni 'jig pa'i rang gi ngo bo nyid kyis rang gi rgyu las grub bo zhes bya bar ni phyogs la chos bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: gal te mi gnas pa'i chos can zhig yin na ni 'jig pa'i rang gi ngo bo nyid kyis rang gi rgyu las grub bo zhes bya bar ni phyogs la chos bsdu ba'o //
translated: If it were a non-enduring thing, then it would be established from its own cause by the intrinsic reality of destruction. This is the inclusion of the property in the subject.

original: 'gal bas khyab pa dmigs pa 'di ni rgyu gzhan la ltos pa dang mi ltos pa dag phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid des 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gal bas khyab pa dmigs pa 'di ni rgyu gzhan la ltos pa dang mi ltos pa dag phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid des 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The observation of the pervasion by contradiction is because of the contradiction of the mutual exclusion of dependence and independence in regard to another cause.

original: rgyu gzhan la mi ltos pa ni /
analyzed: rgyu gzhan la mi ltos pa ni /
translated: Independence from another cause

original: de'i rang gi ngo bos khyab pa'i phyir ro //üîΩ'dir gzhan gyi tshig gi dogs pa'i go skabs ni sa bon la sogs pa bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de'i rang gi ngo bos khyab pa'i phyir ro // 'dir gzhan gyi tshig gi dogs pa'i go skabs ni sa bon la sogs pa bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: is pervaded by its intrinsic reality.üîΩHere, the opportunity for doubt in the words of another is stated by ‚Äúlike a seed, etc.‚Äù

original: 'di snyam du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'di snyam du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The doubt is stated by ‚Äúit might be thought, etc.‚Äù

original: de nyid rnam par dbye ba ni 'ba' zhig skyed par mi byed do zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid rnam par dbye ba ni 'ba' zhig skyed par mi byed do zhes bya'o //
translated: The analysis of that is stated by ‚Äúit does not produce only that.‚Äù

original: gang las yin zhe na /
analyzed: gang las yin zhe na /
translated: From what?

original: chu dang zhing la sogs pa rang gi rgyu nas tha dad pa myu gu la sogs pa skyed pa'i rang bzhin yang sa bon la sogs pa rnams kyi bdag nyid la ltos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chu dang zhing la sogs pa rang gi rgyu nas tha dad pa myu gu la sogs pa skyed pa'i rang bzhin yang sa bon la sogs pa rnams kyi bdag nyid la ltos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and water, fields, etc. are the nature of producing sprouts, etc. that are different from their own causes, because they depend on the nature of seeds, etc.

original: des na de'i rang bzhin ni rgyu gzhan la ltos pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ma nges pa yin no //
analyzed: des na de'i rang bzhin ni rgyu gzhan la ltos pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ma nges pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is indefinite to say that their nature does not depend on other causes.

original: de bzhin du bud shing la @232b sogs pa rang gi rgyu las 'jig pa'i bdag nyid du grub pa'i 'jig pa ni bdag nyid 'jig pa yin no zhes bya ba ni dpe don yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de bzhin du bud shing la @232b sogs pa rang gi rgyu las 'jig pa'i bdag nyid du grub pa'i 'jig pa ni bdag nyid 'jig pa yin no zhes bya ba ni dpe don yin no zhe na /
translated: In the same way, the destruction of fuel, etc. is established as having the nature of destruction from its own cause. The example and meaning are as follows: Destruction is self-destruction.

original: sa bon la sogs la bzhin du ma nges pa ma yin no //
analyzed: sa bon la sogs la bzhin du ma nges pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not indefinite like seeds, etc.

original: gang las she na /
analyzed: gang las she na /
translated: From what?

original: de'i rang bzhin du myu gu la sogs pa skyed par byed pa'i sa bon la sogs pas myu gu la sogs pa skyed pa'i phyir de'i bdag nyid 'di rgyu gzhan la mi ltos pas so //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin du myu gu la sogs pa skyed par byed pa'i sa bon la sogs pas myu gu la sogs pa skyed pa'i phyir de'i bdag nyid 'di rgyu gzhan la mi ltos pas so //
translated: Because sprouts, etc. are produced by seeds, etc. as their nature, this nature of them does not depend on other causes.

original: phyi nas zhing la sogs pa la ltos nas skyed pa ma yin pa dang sbyang ba la sogs pa na gnas pas kyed pa la sogs ma yin te de'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pa'i rang bzhin nyid kyi myu gu la sogs pa skyed pa'i ngo bo nyid
analyzed: phyi nas zhing la sogs pa la ltos nas skyed pa ma yin pa dang sbyang ba la sogs pa na gnas pas kyed pa la sogs ma yin te de'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pa'i rang bzhin nyid kyi myu gu la sogs pa skyed pa'i ngo bo nyid
translated: It is not produced in dependence on a field, etc., nor is it produced by abiding in a seed, etc., because it is not the nature of a seed, etc.,

original: med pas de ni de'i bdag nyid kyi mtshan nyid can gyi rgyur gnas pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: med pas de ni de'i bdag nyid kyi mtshan nyid can gyi rgyur gnas pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: since a sprout, etc., which is not the nature of a seed, etc., does not have the nature of being produced.

original: des na ma nges pa ma yin no //
analyzed: des na ma nges pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not indeterminate.

original: 'o na ni ngo shes pa'i mngon sum kho nas sa bon la sogs pa gcig gi ngo bo nyid du rtogs so //
analyzed: 'o na ni ngo shes pa'i mngon sum kho nas sa bon la sogs pa gcig gi ngo bo nyid du rtogs so //
translated: But it is just the perception of recognition that understands the nature of a seed, etc., as one.

original: de la 'di skyed par byed pa'i rang bzhin nyid dang skyed pa ma yin pa'i rang bzhin nyid kyi mtshan nyid tha dad pa ga las yin /
analyzed: de la 'di skyed par byed pa'i rang bzhin nyid dang skyed pa ma yin pa'i rang bzhin nyid kyi mtshan nyid tha dad pa ga las yin /
translated: How can it have the nature of producing that, and the nature of not producing that, which are different characteristics?

original: gang gi phyir ma nges par mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir ma nges par mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Why is it not indeterminate?

original: ngo shes pa tshad ma ma yin pa ni ma yin te de la sngar med pa'i don rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshad ma'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i phyir yod pa dang yang dag par 'brel pa'i dbang po rnams las byung ba ngo
analyzed: ngo shes pa tshad ma ma yin pa ni ma yin te de la sngar med pa'i don rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshad ma'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i phyir yod pa dang yang dag par 'brel pa'i dbang po rnams las byung ba ngo
translated: It arises from the sense faculties that are related to existence and reality.

original: shes pa ni mngon sum kho na yin te mngon sum las gtso bo'i tshad ma ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: shes pa ni mngon sum kho na yin te mngon sum las gtso bo'i tshad ma ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: It is only direct perception, because there is no valid cognition that is more primary than direct perception.

original: gang las de'i yul tha dad par grub pa'i gnod pa yod pas 'di dag tshad ma ma yin par 'gyur zhes dogs pa la /
analyzed: gang las de'i yul tha dad par grub pa'i gnod pa yod pas 'di dag tshad ma ma yin par 'gyur zhes dogs pa la /
translated: Since there is no contradiction in the existence of a different object from that, how could these not be valid cognitions?

original: de nyid kyi zhes bya ba smos te skyed par byed pa dang / skyed par nges pa ma yin pa 'gal ba'i chos gnas bas so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi zhes bya ba smos te skyed par byed pa dang / skyed par nges pa ma yin pa 'gal ba'i chos gnas bas so //
translated: In response to that, he says, ‚Äúbecause of the contradiction of being and not being its producer,‚Äù because the contradiction of being and not being a producer is established.

original: de dag gi gnas skabs ni skyed par byed pa dang skyed par byed pa ma yin pa'i gnas skabs sa bon la sogs pa'i dngos po tha dad pa'o //
analyzed: de dag gi gnas skabs ni skyed par byed pa dang skyed par byed pa ma yin pa'i gnas skabs sa bon la sogs pa'i dngos po tha dad pa'o //
translated: Their states are the states of being a producer and not being a producer, which are different things, such as a seed and so on.

original: dngos po tha dad par nges pa ni zhen pas so //
analyzed: dngos po tha dad par nges pa ni zhen pas so //
translated: The certainty of the difference of entities is due to adherence.

original: 'di ltar 'bras kyi sa bon ni de'i myu gu'i rgyu'i rang bzhin yin te de yod na 'bras kyi myu gu yod pa mthong ba'i phyir mngon sum gyis khong du chud do //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'bras kyi sa bon ni de'i myu gu'i rgyu'i rang bzhin yin te de yod na 'bras kyi myu gu yod pa mthong ba'i phyir mngon sum gyis khong du chud do //
translated: Thus, the seed of rice is the nature of the cause of its sprout, because when it exists, the rice sprout is seen to exist.

original: nas kyi sa bon yang de skyed pa'i rang bzhin de yod na 'bras kyi myu gu mi dmigs so //
analyzed: nas kyi sa bon yang de skyed pa'i rang bzhin de yod na 'bras kyi myu gu mi dmigs so //
translated: The seed of barley is also the nature of its production, because when it exists, the rice sprout is not perceived.

original: des dben pa'i nas kyi sa bon 'dzin pa ni mngon sum gyi ngo bos rtogs so //
analyzed: des dben pa'i nas kyi sa bon 'dzin pa ni mngon sum gyi ngo bos rtogs so //
translated: The apprehension of the seed of barley, which is devoid of that, is understood by the nature of direct perception.

original: de bzhin du 'dir yang gnas skabs @233a * //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dir yang gnas skabs @233a * //
translated: In the same way, here also, the seed in the state

original: kyi sa bon ni de'i myu gus dben pa dang dben pa ma yin pa'i gnas skabs 'dzin pa ni mngon sum gyi stobs nyid kyis rang gi myu gu skyed par byed pa dang skyed par mi byed pa'i rang bzhin cis na nges par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: kyi sa bon ni de'i myu gus dben pa dang dben pa ma yin pa'i gnas skabs 'dzin pa ni mngon sum gyi stobs nyid kyis rang gi myu gu skyed par byed pa dang skyed par mi byed pa'i rang bzhin cis na nges par mi 'gyur /
translated: is apprehended as devoid of or not devoid of its sprout by the power of direct perception itself. Why would it not ascertain the nature of that which produces its own sprout and that which does not produce it?

original: gal te gnas skabs tha dad par 'dod pa nyid de gnas skabs can tha mi dad pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te gnas skabs tha dad par 'dod pa nyid de gnas skabs can tha mi dad pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If you maintain that the different states are not different from the one having the states,

original: de'i gnas skabs kyi ngo bo gzhan gyis dben pa mngon sum la snang bar thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i gnas skabs kyi ngo bo gzhan gyis dben pa mngon sum la snang bar thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then it follows, absurdly, that the nature of its states, which is devoid of otherness, would appear to direct perception.

original: bdag nyid kyi ngo bo ma yin pas dben par rang gi shes pa la snang ba gang yin pa de ni mngon sum du mi rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyi ngo bo ma yin pas dben par rang gi shes pa la snang ba gang yin pa de ni mngon sum du mi rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Whatever appears to one's consciousness as devoid of a nature that is not its own is not, in fact, a direct perception.

original: gal te gnas skabs can dang ldan pa'i rang bzhin tha dad pa med pas ji ltar ngo bo gzhan yin zhe na /
analyzed: gal te gnas skabs can dang ldan pa'i rang bzhin tha dad pa med pas ji ltar ngo bo gzhan yin zhe na /
translated: If you say that the nature of the one having the states is not different from the states themselves, then how can it be a different nature?

original: 'o na ni gnas skabs rnams mthong ba'i ngo bo ni tha dad pa'i gnas skabs lta bur bdag nyid tha dad pa de tha dad pa yod pa tha mi dad pa dang 'brel pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'o na ni gnas skabs rnams mthong ba'i ngo bo ni tha dad pa'i gnas skabs lta bur bdag nyid tha dad pa de tha dad pa yod pa tha mi dad pa dang 'brel pa ma yin no //
translated: Well then, the nature of the states, which is seen to be like different states, is not related to a different existence that is itself different.

original: des na 'di gnas skabs bzhin du tha dad par nyams su myong bas ji ltar gnas skabs su byed pa po yin gal te gnas skabs tha dad pas kyang tha dad pa'i ngo bor de bzhin du rnam par 'jog pa'i phyir rnam pa 'ga' zhig gis kyang tha
analyzed: des na 'di gnas skabs bzhin du tha dad par nyams su myong bas ji ltar gnas skabs su byed pa po yin gal te gnas skabs tha dad pas kyang tha dad pa'i ngo bor de bzhin du rnam par 'jog pa'i phyir rnam pa 'ga' zhig gis kyang tha
translated: Therefore, since it is experienced as different from the present, how could it be the agent of the present?

original: dad pas nyes pa med do zhe na /
analyzed: dad pas nyes pa med do zhe na /
translated: But if you posit it as different in terms of its different states, then it is not different in any way, so there is no fault.

original: gang zhig mdun na gnas pa'i bdag nyid la 'di gnas skabs so zhes brjod pa des gnas skabs de dang ldan pa tha dad pa dang de tha mi dad pa nyid ni rnam pa 'gas yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni long ba'i 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: gang zhig mdun na gnas pa'i bdag nyid la 'di gnas skabs so zhes brjod pa des gnas skabs de dang ldan pa tha dad pa dang de tha mi dad pa nyid ni rnam pa 'gas yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni long ba'i 'dod pa'o //
translated: But the one who says, ‚ÄúThis is the present state of the self that is in front of me,‚Äù posits that the self that possesses that state is different from that state, and that it is not different from that state in some way. This is the assertion of a blind person.

original: des na 'di mngon sum gyis de'i bdag nyid ma yin pa'i ngo bo gzhan du snang bar thal bar 'gyur ba mi bzlogs so //
analyzed: des na 'di mngon sum gyis de'i bdag nyid ma yin pa'i ngo bo gzhan du snang bar thal bar 'gyur ba mi bzlogs so //
translated: Therefore, it is not averted that it is seen by direct perception to have a different nature from that.

original: des na bdag nyid tha dad pa'i gnas skabs bzhin par thal bar 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: des na bdag nyid tha dad pa'i gnas skabs bzhin par thal bar 'gyur ba'am /
translated: Therefore, it follows that it would be different from the present state.

original: gnas skabs can de bzhin du gnas skabs rnams tha mi dad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnas skabs can de bzhin du gnas skabs rnams tha mi dad par 'gyur ro //
translated: and in the same way, the states would not be different.

original: de dag kyang rnam pa 'ga' zhig tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa bsam par bya ste /
analyzed: de dag kyang rnam pa 'ga' zhig tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa bsam par bya ste /
translated: And those should be considered as different or non-different in some way.

original: de lta na gnas skabs can dang de'i gnas skabs ni bdag nyid tha mi dad pa dang ldan pa na /
analyzed: de lta na gnas skabs can dang de'i gnas skabs ni bdag nyid tha mi dad pa dang ldan pa na /
translated: Thus, if the one having states and its states are not different in nature,

original: rnam pa 'gas tha mi dad pa'i rgyu mtshan dngos po gzhan zhig 'dod par bya ba dang / de bzhin du de yang de rnam pa 'gas tha dad pa yang gzhan yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa 'gas tha mi dad pa'i rgyu mtshan dngos po gzhan zhig 'dod par bya ba dang / de bzhin du de yang de rnam pa 'gas tha dad pa yang gzhan yin no //
translated: then one should accept that they are different in some way, and that they are not different in some way. And in the same way, that also is different in some way, and not different in some way.

original: de rang bzhin gcig par shin tu tha mi dad pa'i gnas skabs dang ldan pa ni brgyud pas shin tu tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa dngos po gzhan pa zhig tu thal bar 'gyur ba dang / rnam pa 'ga' zhig tha dad pa'i @233b rgyu mtshan gyi ngo bo ni gzhan yin pa la de bzhin du de las gzhan pa la yang yin pa'i phyir dngos po re re la dpag tu med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de rang bzhin gcig par shin tu tha mi dad pa'i gnas skabs dang ldan pa ni brgyud pas shin tu tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa dngos po gzhan pa zhig tu thal bar 'gyur ba dang / rnam pa 'ga' zhig tha dad pa'i @233b rgyu mtshan gyi ngo bo ni gzhan yin pa la de bzhin du de las gzhan pa la yang yin pa'i phyir dngos po re re la dpag tu med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: And if the reason for the difference in some aspects is that the nature is different, then it would follow that each thing would have an infinite number of natures, because it would be like that in relation to something else that is different from it.

original: dpag tu med pa'i ngo bo snang ba ni mngon sum gyis nyams su myong ba med de nyams su myong ba med na ji ltar brtag pa bdag nyid bslu bar bya ba'am /
analyzed: dpag tu med pa'i ngo bo snang ba ni mngon sum gyis nyams su myong ba med de nyams su myong ba med na ji ltar brtag pa bdag nyid bslu bar bya ba'am /
translated: An infinite number of natures appearing is not experienced by direct perception, and if it is not experienced, how could it be imagined?

original: de'i phyir gnas skabs kyi ngo bo rnam par dpyad na dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa las mi dmigs pa'i phyir dang / dpag tu med pa'i ngo bor thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir rnam pa 'gas tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa dang ldan pa'i gnas skabs can gyi med pa kho na'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir gnas skabs kyi ngo bo rnam par dpyad na dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa las mi dmigs pa'i phyir dang / dpag tu med pa'i ngo bor thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir rnam pa 'gas tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa dang ldan pa'i gnas skabs can gyi med pa kho na'o //
translated: Therefore, when the nature of the occasion is analyzed, it is not perceived as an object of perception, and it follows that it has an infinite nature. Therefore, it is definitely nonexistent, having an occasion that is either different or non-different.

original: de yang skyed par byed pa dang / skyed par mi byed pa'i rang bzhin gyi gnas skabs tha dad pa dang ldan par mngon sum gyis rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang skyed par byed pa dang / skyed par mi byed pa'i rang bzhin gyi gnas skabs tha dad pa dang ldan par mngon sum gyis rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Moreover, it is directly perceived to have an occasion that is different in nature, sometimes producing and sometimes not producing.

original: de gcig pa nyid du mngon par zhen pa'i ngo bo shes la nyams su myong bas gnod pas ji ltar tshad mar 'gyur /
analyzed: de gcig pa nyid du mngon par zhen pa'i ngo bo shes la nyams su myong bas gnod pas ji ltar tshad mar 'gyur /
translated: Since it is undermined by the experience of knowing the nature of the conception of its oneness, how can it be valid cognition?

original: gang gi phyir sa bon la sogs pa rnams myu gu la sogs pa skyed pa'i rang bzhin can yang de'i bdag nyid kyi rgyu gzhan la ltos kyang snga ma'i gtan tshigs ma nges par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir sa bon la sogs pa rnams myu gu la sogs pa skyed pa'i rang bzhin can yang de'i bdag nyid kyi rgyu gzhan la ltos kyang snga ma'i gtan tshigs ma nges par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Because seeds and so forth have the nature of producing sprouts and so on, even though they depend on other causes of their own nature, the previous argument is not indeterminate.

original: gnas skabs can 'ga' zhig yod du chug kyang de yang de nyid kyis tha dad pa skyed do //
analyzed: gnas skabs can 'ga' zhig yod du chug kyang de yang de nyid kyis tha dad pa skyed do //
translated: Even if there were some such state, it would be different from that very thing itself.

original: de lta na de dag skyed par byed pa dang skyed par mi byed pa'i gnas skabs dag yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni bdun pa'i gnyis pa'i tshig yin pas de'i tshe 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na de dag skyed par byed pa dang skyed par mi byed pa'i gnas skabs dag yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni bdun pa'i gnyis pa'i tshig yin pas de'i tshe 'gyur ro //
translated: In that case, it would be the state of producing it and the state of not producing it, and this would be the statement of the second half of the seventh verse, so it would be at that time.

original: des na don 'di skyed par byed pa'i gnas skabs dang / 'di skyed par mi byed pa'i gnas skabs ni dngos po'i chos kyi mtshan nyid tha dad pa'i rang bzhin du ma yin pa de nyid kyi phyir skyed par byed par dang skyed par mi byed pa'i rang gi ngo bo yin par mngon sum gyis nges par grub bo
analyzed: des na don 'di skyed par byed pa'i gnas skabs dang / 'di skyed par mi byed pa'i gnas skabs ni dngos po'i chos kyi mtshan nyid tha dad pa'i rang bzhin du ma yin pa de nyid kyi phyir skyed par byed par dang skyed par mi byed pa'i rang gi ngo bo yin par mngon sum gyis nges par grub bo
translated: Therefore, this meaning is the state of producing it and the state of not producing it, and the nature of the characteristic of difference of the property of the thing is not that very thing itself. For that very reason, the nature of producing and not producing is definitely established by direct perception.

original: // tha dad par nges pa'i mtshan nyid du de la tha snyad byed pa'i yul la chos 'gal ba gnas pa'i mtshan nyid bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: // tha dad par nges pa'i mtshan nyid du de la tha snyad byed pa'i yul la chos 'gal ba gnas pa'i mtshan nyid bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The characteristic of ascertaining difference is taught in order to show the object of convention, which is the characteristic of the abode of contradictory properties.

original: gnas skabs kho na myu gu la sogs pa'i skyed pa'i rang bzhin du brjod par nus pa ma yin pas gnas skabs med pa'i phyir nus pa thams cad spangs pa'i mtshan nyid ni med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnas skabs kho na myu gu la sogs pa'i skyed pa'i rang bzhin du brjod par nus pa ma yin pas gnas skabs med pa'i phyir nus pa thams cad spangs pa'i mtshan nyid ni med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: It is not possible to say that the nature of the seed is to produce the sprout and so on. Therefore, since it has no temporal stages, it follows that it would be devoid of all potential.

original: de'i phyir yod pa gcig tu ngo shes pa rnams la dngos po rnams kyi snga ma dang phyi ma'i dus dag skyed pa'i byed pa dang skyed par mi byed pa'i rang bzhin tha dad par rnam par 'jog pa'i mngon sum gyis nyams su myong ba'i rgyu mtshan gyis
analyzed: de'i phyir yod pa gcig tu ngo shes pa rnams la dngos po rnams kyi snga ma dang phyi ma'i dus dag skyed pa'i byed pa dang skyed par mi byed pa'i rang bzhin tha dad par rnam par 'jog pa'i mngon sum gyis nyams su myong ba'i rgyu mtshan gyis
translated: Therefore, for those who recognize that it is one and the same thing, the direct perception that posits the difference between the earlier and later states of entities‚Äîthat is, that they have the nature of producing and not producing‚Äîis undermined.

original: @234a * // gnod par ji ltar tshad mar 'gyur /
analyzed: @234a * // gnod par ji ltar tshad mar 'gyur /
translated: How could it be a valid cognition?

original: de'i snang ba tha dad pa med pa'i ngo bo ni brdzun pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i snang ba tha dad pa med pa'i ngo bo ni brdzun pa nyid do //
translated: The nature of the appearance of that thing is false.

original: dbang po las byung ba'i nyams su myong ba 'jug pa yod pa 'di la rab tu sbyor ba med pa'i phyir rab rib la sogs pas bskyed pa bzhin du mngon sum du ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: dbang po las byung ba'i nyams su myong ba 'jug pa yod pa 'di la rab tu sbyor ba med pa'i phyir rab rib la sogs pas bskyed pa bzhin du mngon sum du ga la 'gyur /
translated: Since it is not applied to the experience that arises from the sense faculties, how could it be direct perception, like that produced by cataracts and so on?

original: don byed pa'i rgyu mtshan can gyi ngo bo yang sa bon la sogs pa las gzhan ma yin te don dam pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don byed pa'i rgyu mtshan can gyi ngo bo yang sa bon la sogs pa las gzhan ma yin te don dam pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The entity that is the reason for the performance of an action is not different from the seed, etc., because it is ultimate.

original: rang bzhin gyis yod pa gang khong du chud pa'i phyir ngo shes pa tshad mar 'gyur na don byed pa'i nus pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir don dam par yod pa'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis yod pa gang khong du chud pa'i phyir ngo shes pa tshad mar 'gyur na don byed pa'i nus pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir don dam par yod pa'o //
translated: If recognition were valid knowledge, it would be because one understood intrinsic reality. But it is not valid knowledge, because it is characterized by the capacity to perform a function.

original: de'i phyir 'dra ba gzhan byung ba'i rgyu mtshan 'di yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dra ba gzhan byung ba'i rgyu mtshan 'di yin te /
translated: Therefore, the reason for the occurrence of another similar one is this:

original: skra shad dang chu shing gi sdong po la sogs pa bzhin du rnam pa 'dra ba tsam gyis snying 'phrogs pa rnams 'khrul pa nyid du de kho na nyid nges pas bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: skra shad dang chu shing gi sdong po la sogs pa bzhin du rnam pa 'dra ba tsam gyis snying 'phrogs pa rnams 'khrul pa nyid du de kho na nyid nges pas bsam par bya'o //
translated: Those who are captivated by mere similarity, like the appearance of floating hairs and a plantain tree, etc., should be understood to be mistaken.

original: des na yod kyang skad cig ma re re'i tha dad pa nye bar mi rtogs pas byis pa rnams gang gi tshe mi mthun pa'i rkyen dang phrad pas mi 'dra ba'i dngos po gzhan skyed pa de'i tshe 'di'i de kho na nges par gyur na ngo shes pa'i
analyzed: des na yod kyang skad cig ma re re'i tha dad pa nye bar mi rtogs pas byis pa rnams gang gi tshe mi mthun pa'i rkyen dang phrad pas mi 'dra ba'i dngos po gzhan skyed pa de'i tshe 'di'i de kho na nges par gyur na ngo shes pa'i
translated: Therefore, though it exists, since it is not perceived as distinct in each moment, when childish beings encounter incompatible conditions and generate other dissimilar things, at that time, if they ascertain its reality, then the object of recognition does not occur.

original: dmigs pa mi 'byung ngo //üîΩde rnams pa gcig tu nges pa'i shes pa skyed par byed pa la gzhan zhig 'dra ba tha dad pa yang med de rang gi rgyu'i stobs las 'ongs pa'i rang bzhin gyi dbang gis kha cig tu rnam pa gcig tu nges pa'i shes pa'i mtshan nyid dam /
analyzed: dmigs pa mi 'byung ngo // de rnams pa gcig tu nges pa'i shes pa skyed par byed pa la gzhan zhig 'dra ba tha dad pa yang med de rang gi rgyu'i stobs las 'ongs pa'i rang bzhin gyi dbang gis kha cig tu rnam pa gcig tu nges pa'i shes pa'i mtshan nyid dam /
translated: The object of recognition does not occur.üîΩThe cause of generating a consciousness ascertaining a single aspect does not exist as different from that, because by the power of its own cause, it is by the power of its own nature that it is characterized by a consciousness ascertaining a single aspect, or it is characterized by the function of the object, such as the cognition of the object, and there is nothing else.

original: don shes pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid don gyi bya ba byed pa las gzhan ni med do zhes mkhas pa bstan bcos mdzad pas rnam 'grel du bshad pas 'dir mi smra'o //
analyzed: don shes pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid don gyi bya ba byed pa las gzhan ni med do zhes mkhas pa bstan bcos mdzad pas rnam 'grel du bshad pas 'dir mi smra'o //
translated: The author of the treatise, the scholar, explains this in the PramaÃÑnÔ¨Å avaÃÑrtika, and therefore I will not discuss it here.

original: gdon mi za bar sa bon la sogs pa skyed par byed pa dang skyed par mi byed pa'i gnas skabs ni dngos po tha dad pas ji skad bshad pa bzhin du khong du chud par bya'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir tha mi dad pa la rjes su dpag pas
analyzed: gdon mi za bar sa bon la sogs pa skyed par byed pa dang skyed par mi byed pa'i gnas skabs ni dngos po tha dad pas ji skad bshad pa bzhin du khong du chud par bya'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir tha mi dad pa la rjes su dpag pas
translated: In order to demonstrate that the state of producing or not producing a seed, etc. is definitely a different thing, as has been explained, he says:

original: gnod pa ni dngos po rnams zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: gnod pa ni dngos po rnams zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The refutation of non-difference is:

original: sa bon la sogs pa rnams rang gi 'bras bu skyed par byed pas so //
analyzed: sa bon la sogs pa rnams rang gi 'bras bu skyed par byed pas so //
translated: because seeds, etc. produce their own effects.

original: rang gi ngo bo de dang de rnams la yod pa las gzhan du gyur pa med pa'i phyir res 'ga' ba'i skyed par byed pa ni mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo de dang de rnams la yod pa las gzhan du gyur pa med pa'i phyir res 'ga' ba'i skyed par byed pa ni mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they do not exist apart from their own nature, which exists, it is impossible for them to produce intermittently.

original: de'i ngo bo myu gu la sogs pa skyed pa'i rang gi ngo bo phyis bzhin du ni 'bras la sogs pa'i rgyu nye ba bzhin du'o //
analyzed: de'i ngo bo myu gu la sogs pa skyed pa'i rang gi ngo bo phyis bzhin du ni 'bras la sogs pa'i rgyu nye ba bzhin du'o //
translated: Because their nature, which produces the sprout, etc. is the same as before, like the cause of the sprout, etc.

original: snga ma sbyang la sogs pa na gnas pa'i dus su yang rang gi @234b 'bras bu skyed par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: snga ma sbyang la sogs pa na gnas pa'i dus su yang rang gi @234b 'bras bu skyed par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: It follows that it would produce its own effect even when it is in the state of being a seed, etc.

original: de lta na 'bras bu la sogs pa nye ba yang sa bon la sogs pa'i rang gi ngo bo kho nas 'bras bu skyed kyi gzhan gyi ngo bos ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta na 'bras bu la sogs pa nye ba yang sa bon la sogs pa'i rang gi ngo bo kho nas 'bras bu skyed kyi gzhan gyi ngo bos ni ma yin no //
translated: Thus, even when the effect is near, the seed generates the effect only by its own nature, not by the nature of another.

original: gang yang 'di de'i tshe 'bras bu skyed par byed pa'i rang bzhin phyis yod pa gang yin pa de nyid yin no zhes ngo shes pas mdun na gnas pa'i skyed par byed pa'i rang bzhin snga ma'i ngo bo la tha mi dad par nges pa yin pa nges
analyzed: gang yang 'di de'i tshe 'bras bu skyed par byed pa'i rang bzhin phyis yod pa gang yin pa de nyid yin no zhes ngo shes pas mdun na gnas pa'i skyed par byed pa'i rang bzhin snga ma'i ngo bo la tha mi dad par nges pa yin pa nges
translated: And when it is recognized that ‚ÄúThe nature that generates the effect at that time is just the one that exists later,‚Äù then the nature that generates the effect that exists now is ascertained to be nondifferent from the nature that existed previously.

original: na sngar yang cis na de'i 'bras bu byed pa ma yin /
analyzed: na sngar yang cis na de'i 'bras bu byed pa ma yin /
translated: If that is so, then why did it not generate its effect previously?

original: sbyor ba ni gang dang gang gi tshe skyed pa'i rang bzhin de dang de ni de'i tshe skyed par byed pa nyid de /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang dang gang gi tshe skyed pa'i rang bzhin de dang de ni de'i tshe skyed par byed pa nyid de /
translated: The argument is as follows: Whenever something has the nature of generating, it is generating at that time.

original: skyed par mi byed pa dang skyed par byed pa 'gal ba'i phyir gzhan yang de'i rang bzhin thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skyed par mi byed pa dang skyed par byed pa 'gal ba'i phyir gzhan yang de'i rang bzhin thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: Because it is contradictory for something to be both non-generating and generating, it would follow that it would obtain the nature of generating.

original: dper na de nyid kyis sa bon la sogs pa nye ba'i dus bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na de nyid kyis sa bon la sogs pa nye ba'i dus bzhin no //
translated: For example, it would be like a seed, etc., at the time when it is near.

original: sbyang la sogs pa na sa bon la sogs pa 'di yang rang gi 'bras bu skyed par byed pa'i rang bzhin nyid du ngo shes pas rnam par 'jog pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni thal bar rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: sbyang la sogs pa na sa bon la sogs pa 'di yang rang gi 'bras bu skyed par byed pa'i rang bzhin nyid du ngo shes pas rnam par 'jog pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni thal bar rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: The pervasion is established by the principle of identity.üîΩThe pervasion is established by the principle of identity.

original: de skyed pa ni ma yin te de'i phyir de skyed pa'i rang bzhin ma yin no zhes bya ba ni bzlog pa'i sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: de skyed pa ni ma yin te de'i phyir de skyed pa'i rang bzhin ma yin no zhes bya ba ni bzlog pa'i sbyor ba'o //
translated: The pervasion is established by the principle of identity.üîΩThe pervasion is established by the principle of identity.

original: gang dang gang gi tshe skyed pa'i rang bzhin la log pa'i 'bras bu mi skyed pa de dang de ni de'i tshe skyed pa'i rang bzhin ma yin te /
analyzed: gang dang gang gi tshe skyed pa'i rang bzhin la log pa'i 'bras bu mi skyed pa de dang de ni de'i tshe skyed pa'i rang bzhin ma yin te /
translated: The pervasion is established by the principle of identity.üîΩThe pervasion is established by the principle of identity.üîΩThe pervasion is established by the principle of identity.üîΩThe pervasion is established by the principle of identity.üîΩThe pervasion is established by the principle of identity.

original: dper na 'bras kyi myu gu skye ba'i rang bzhin las log pa'i 'bras bu mi skyed pa'i ko tra ba'i sa bon bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na 'bras kyi myu gu skye ba'i rang bzhin las log pa'i 'bras bu mi skyed pa'i ko tra ba'i sa bon bzhin no //
translated: The pervasion is established by the principle of identity.üîΩThe pervasion is established by the principle of identity.üîΩThe pervasion is established by the principle of identity.üîΩThe pervasion is established by the principle of identity.üîΩThe pervasion is established by the principle of identity.üîΩThe pervasion is established by the principle of identity.üîΩThe pervasion is established by the principle of identity.üîΩThe pervasion is established by the principle of identity.üîΩThe pervasion is established by the principle of identity.üîΩThe pervasion is established by the principle of identity.üîΩThe pervasion is established by the principle of identity.üîΩThe pervasion is established by the principle of identity.üîΩThe pervasion is established by the principle of identity.üîΩThe pervasion is established by the principle of identity.üîΩThe pervasion is established by the principle of identity.üîΩThe pervasion is established by the principle of identity.üîΩThe pervasion is established by the principle of identity.üîΩThe pervasion is established by the principle of identity.üîΩThe pervasion is established by the principle of identity.üîΩThe pervasion is established by the principle of identity.üîΩThe pervasion is established by the principle of identity.üîΩThe pervasion is established by the principle of identity.üîΩThe pervasion is established by the principle of identity.üîΩThe pervasion is established by the principle of identity.üîΩThe pervasion is established by the principle of identity.üîΩThe pervasion is established by the principle of identity.üîΩThe pervasion is established by the principle of identity.üîΩThe pervasion is established by the principle of identity.üîΩThe pervasion is established by the principle of identity.

original: 'bras la sogs pa'i rgyu nye ba las sngar 'bras bu skyed pa'i rang bzhin las ldog pa can gyi 'bras bu'i sa bon la sogs pa yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba 'di khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras la sogs pa'i rgyu nye ba las sngar 'bras bu skyed pa'i rang bzhin las ldog pa can gyi 'bras bu'i sa bon la sogs pa yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba 'di khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: The reason is: because the seed of the effect, etc., is the opposite of the nature of producing the effect prior to the proximity of the cause, such as the sprout.

original: de'i phyir rjes su dpag pas kyang gnod par nyams su myong bas ngo shes pa ji ltar tshad mar 'gyur /
analyzed: de'i phyir rjes su dpag pas kyang gnod par nyams su myong bas ngo shes pa ji ltar tshad mar 'gyur /
translated: Therefore, since it is also contradicted by inference, how can recognition be a valid cognition?

original: 'dis gnod par byed pas tshad ma ma yin pa'i phyir ji ltar gnod par byed par 'gyur /
analyzed: 'dis gnod par byed pas tshad ma ma yin pa'i phyir ji ltar gnod par byed par 'gyur /
translated: Since it is not a valid cognition because it is contradicted, how can it contradict?

original: tshad mas ma nges par gyur na gang gis na gnod pa gcig la gcig brten par 'gyur /
analyzed: tshad mas ma nges par gyur na gang gis na gnod pa gcig la gcig brten par 'gyur /
translated: If it were not ascertained by a valid cognition, by what would the contradiction be mutually dependent?

original: ngo shes pa tshad ma ma yin pas 'di rjes su dpag tshad ma gnod pa med de 'on kyang rang gi bsgrub bya la 'brel pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ngo shes pa tshad ma ma yin pas 'di rjes su dpag tshad ma gnod pa med de 'on kyang rang gi bsgrub bya la 'brel pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Since recognition is not a valid cognition, this inference is not contradicted by a valid cognition, but rather it is related to its own probandum.

original: de yang bzlog pa la gnod par byed pa ni tshad ma'i stobs kyis nges pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang bzlog pa la gnod par byed pa ni tshad ma'i stobs kyis nges pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Moreover, the contradiction of the opposite is ascertained by the power of a valid cognition.

original: ma yin te mngon sum ni gzhan pas tshad ma'i gtso bo yin no zhe na /
analyzed: ma yin te mngon sum ni gzhan pas tshad ma'i gtso bo yin no zhe na /
translated: No, because direct perception is the chief means of valid cognition.

original: ngo shes pa mngon sum du grub pa med do zhe na rjes su dpag pas mngon sum gyi @235a * //
analyzed: ngo shes pa mngon sum du grub pa med do zhe na rjes su dpag pas mngon sum gyi @235a * //
translated: If you say that recognition is not established as direct perception, then inference is the means of valid cognition.

original: bdag nyid du yod pa la gnod pa yin no zhes ni mi smra'i /
analyzed: bdag nyid du yod pa la gnod pa yin no zhes ni mi smra'i /
translated: We do not say that inference is the means of valid cognition that establishes the existence of the self of direct perception.

original: mngon sum stobs dang ldan pas ci zhig byed /
analyzed: mngon sum stobs dang ldan pas ci zhig byed /
translated: What is the use of powerful direct perception?

original: de ni don med na med pa'i phyir tshad mar brjod do //
analyzed: de ni don med na med pa'i phyir tshad mar brjod do //
translated: It is called a means of valid cognition because it does not exist when the object does not exist.

original: rjes su dpag pa de yang don dang 'brel pa'i rtags las skyed pas mtshungs pa'i phyir khyad par ci yang med do //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa de yang don dang 'brel pa'i rtags las skyed pas mtshungs pa'i phyir khyad par ci yang med do //
translated: Inference is also generated from a reason related to the object, so there is no difference at all.

original: gal te rjes su dpag pa dang 'gal bar brjod kyang ngo shes pa'i tshad ma de dang rnam pa mtshungs pas gcig tu ston na ni sngon po dang cig shos kyi me tog la sogs pa kha phye ba'i dngos por gcig nas tshad ma ma yin no //
analyzed: gal te rjes su dpag pa dang 'gal bar brjod kyang ngo shes pa'i tshad ma de dang rnam pa mtshungs pas gcig tu ston na ni sngon po dang cig shos kyi me tog la sogs pa kha phye ba'i dngos por gcig nas tshad ma ma yin no //
translated: If you say that although it is stated to be contradictory to inference, the means of valid cognition of recognition is the same as that, then when it shows one thing, such as blue, and another thing, such as a flower, it is not a means of valid cognition.

original: me tog gi 'bras bu la sogs pa'i 'bras bu mthong bas dpag pa nas tha dad pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: me tog gi 'bras bu la sogs pa'i 'bras bu mthong bas dpag pa nas tha dad pa ni ma yin te /
translated: The result, such as the flower or the fruit, is inferred from seeing the result.

original: mngon sum gyis de ltar med par myong ba dang ngo shes pa'i tshad ma 'gegs pa'i skad cig ma'i 'jig pa'i grub par rgyas par byas pas chog go //
analyzed: mngon sum gyis de ltar med par myong ba dang ngo shes pa'i tshad ma 'gegs pa'i skad cig ma'i 'jig pa'i grub par rgyas par byas pas chog go //
translated: It is not different from the seed, because direct perception experiences it as not different. It is sufficient to prove the momentary disintegration of things by the refutation of the valid cognition that recognizes it as different.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar gnas pa'i rnam par skyed par byed pa dang skyed pa med pa'i gnas skabs kyi sa bon gyi dngos po tha dad pa de'i phyir mtha' ma'i gnas dang khyad par med pa de ma thag tu myu gu la sogs pa'i 'bras bu skyed
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar gnas pa'i rnam par skyed par byed pa dang skyed pa med pa'i gnas skabs kyi sa bon gyi dngos po tha dad pa de'i phyir mtha' ma'i gnas dang khyad par med pa de ma thag tu myu gu la sogs pa'i 'bras bu skyed
translated: Since the seed‚Äôs state of existence, which is the producer of the sprout, is not different from the seed‚Äôs state of nonexistence, which is the nonproducer of the sprout, therefore, without any difference from the final state, the seed immediately produces the effect, the sprout.

original: pa gang yin pa de kho na myu gu skyed pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: pa gang yin pa de kho na myu gu skyed pa'i rang bzhin no //
