original: de dag kyang skud pa'i rgyus byas pa'i bye brag de dag la mi ltos pa'i gnas skabs tha dad pa'i bdag nyid 'khor ba la sogs pa las rnam par phye zhing rnam par dpyad pa'i rang bzhin du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag kyang skud pa'i rgyus byas pa'i bye brag de dag la mi ltos pa'i gnas skabs tha dad pa'i bdag nyid 'khor ba la sogs pa las rnam par phye zhing rnam par dpyad pa'i rang bzhin du 'gyur ro //
translated: The shape of the clay is not different from the clay, because the clay is the cause of the shape of the clay.üîΩThe shape of the clay is not different from the clay, because the clay is the cause

original: de'i phyir rgyu rnam pa gsum du gnas pa las skye ba'i bum pa de las gzhan pa re re'i 'bras bu dang gnyis pa'i 'bras bu tha dad pa'i ngo bo skyed pa'i phyir tshogs pa tha dad pas tha dad pa'i rgyu nyid phan tshun mi mthun pa'i ngoüîΩbor 'gyur ro //üîΩdes na nye bar sbyor ba'i 'bras bu'i rang bzhin gyi bye brag ma 'khrul par grub bo //
analyzed: de'i phyir rgyu rnam pa gsum du gnas pa las skye ba'i bum pa de las gzhan pa re re'i 'bras bu dang gnyis pa'i 'bras bu tha dad pa'i ngo bo skyed pa'i phyir tshogs pa tha dad pas tha dad pa'i rgyu nyid phan tshun mi mthun pa'i ngo bor 'gyur ro // des na nye bar sbyor ba'i 'bras bu'i rang bzhin gyi bye brag ma 'khrul par grub bo //
translated: Therefore, the pot that is produced from the three causes existing in a collection is the effect of each of the two, and it is the effect of the collection of the two. Since it is produced as a different entity from each of the two, the collection is a different cause from each of the two.üîΩThe entities of the two causes are mutually incompatible.üîΩTherefore, the effect of the collection is established as a distinct nature that is not confused with the effects of each of the two causes.

original: de yang re re gnas skabs su 'byung ba de ni rgyu'i bye brag gi rjes su 'gro ba dang ldeg pa'i rjes su @240b byed pa des cha shas kyis skyed ba ni med do //
analyzed: de yang re re gnas skabs su 'byung ba de ni rgyu'i bye brag gi rjes su 'gro ba dang ldeg pa'i rjes su @240b byed pa des cha shas kyis skyed ba ni med do //
translated: Moreover, the effect that arises in the state of each of the two causes is not produced by a part of the two causes, because it follows the particularities of the causes and it does not follow the particularities of the two causes.

original: de dag re re'i skyed pa nyid kyang dngos po nyid de re re'i rigs mi mthun pa'i rgyu gzhan dang nye ba las mthong la de dang nye ba las bye brag mthong ba'i phyir de skye'o zhes bya ba 'di ni de kho na nyid sems pas rnam par
analyzed: de dag re re'i skyed pa nyid kyang dngos po nyid de re re'i rigs mi mthun pa'i rgyu gzhan dang nye ba las mthong la de dang nye ba las bye brag mthong ba'i phyir de skye'o zhes bya ba 'di ni de kho na nyid sems pas rnam par
translated: The cause of each of these is a thing, because when one is near a different cause that is not of the same type, it is seen, and when one is near that, a difference is seen.

original: dpyad pa yin no //
analyzed: dpyad pa yin no //
translated: This is the analysis of reality by the mind.

original: gang gi phyir 'bras bu'i bye brag don du gnyer ba rgyu du ma yongs su bzung ba byas nas phan tshun phan 'dogs par byed pa brgyud pa'i 'bras bu la mi slu ba ni 'bras bu skyed par 'os ba'i rgyu'i tshogs pa'i dngos po yin pa'i phyir ro
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'bras bu'i bye brag don du gnyer ba rgyu du ma yongs su bzung ba byas nas phan tshun phan 'dogs par byed pa brgyud pa'i 'bras bu la mi slu ba ni 'bras bu skyed par 'os ba'i rgyu'i tshogs pa'i dngos po yin pa'i phyir ro
translated: Because one who seeks a particular effect, having taken up many causes, makes them mutually helpful, and the result is not deceptive, it is the nature of the collection of causes that is fit to produce the effect.

original: // gang gi phyir de ltar tshogs pa'i bye brag las bye brag tu gyur pa'i so phag dang 'khor los rnam par phye ba'i bum pa ste /
analyzed: // gang gi phyir de ltar tshogs pa'i bye brag las bye brag tu gyur pa'i so phag dang 'khor los rnam par phye ba'i bum pa ste /
translated: Because in this way, from the particular collection, there is a particular distinction, such as a pot distinguished by a wheel and clay.

original: des rnam par phye ba ni bum pa'i mtshan nyid 'bras bur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des rnam par phye ba ni bum pa'i mtshan nyid 'bras bur 'gyur ro //
translated: That which is distinguished by that is the characteristic of a pot, which becomes the effect.

original: de'i phyir de ltar bshad pas rdza mkhan las ni 'jim pa'i gong bu spangs ba de ni tshogs pa gzhan pa'i nang du 'dus pa'i 'jim pa'i ngo bo ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar bshad pas rdza mkhan las ni 'jim pa'i gong bu spangs ba de ni tshogs pa gzhan pa'i nang du 'dus pa'i 'jim pa'i ngo bo ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, since it is explained in this way, the clay lump that is abandoned by the potter is not the nature of clay that is included in another collection.

original: 'bras bu 'ga' zhig 'jim pa'i gong bu'i rgyus phan btags pa'i bdag nyid kho na de dang bye brag tu byed pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu 'ga' zhig 'jim pa'i gong bu'i rgyus phan btags pa'i bdag nyid kho na de dang bye brag tu byed pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the cause that specifically distinguishes the effect, which is the nature that is helped by the cause of the clay lump.

original: 'jim pa 'ba' zhig ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'jim pa 'ba' zhig ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not just the clay,

original: de dang de'i tshogs pa las phyi rol tu gyur pa'i dbyibs kyi bye brag rdza mkhan gyi nye bar len pas phan btags par byas pa nyid kyis 'jim pa'i dbyibs kyi bye brag gi bdag nyid kyi 'bras bu'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dang de'i tshogs pa las phyi rol tu gyur pa'i dbyibs kyi bye brag rdza mkhan gyi nye bar len pas phan btags par byas pa nyid kyis 'jim pa'i dbyibs kyi bye brag gi bdag nyid kyi 'bras bu'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the shape that is external to that collection is the cause of the effect that has the nature of the shape of the clay, since it is helped by the action of the potter.

original: de ltar na tshogs pa'i bye brag las 'bras bu'i bye brag tu 'gyur ba'i dpe bstan nas lhan cig byed pa nyid du mas kyang du ma'i bdag nyid du 'gyur ba spangs par ston pa ni /
analyzed: de ltar na tshogs pa'i bye brag las 'bras bu'i bye brag tu 'gyur ba'i dpe bstan nas lhan cig byed pa nyid du mas kyang du ma'i bdag nyid du 'gyur ba spangs par ston pa ni /
translated: Thus, having taught the example of the particular effect arising from the particular collection, he teaches the avoidance of the many entities of the many co-operating causes:

original: de nyid kyi bum pa zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi bum pa zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: In that very pot, etc.

original: 'jim pa dang rdza mkhan gnyis lhan cig byed pa dag phan tshun phan 'dogs par byed pa'i bdag nyid gang gis nus pa'i bye brag ni rkyen gzhan dang lhan cig pa'i gnas skabs bye brag can du rung ba de'i yul de ni gnas skabs gzhan pa'i yul tha
analyzed: 'jim pa dang rdza mkhan gnyis lhan cig byed pa dag phan tshun phan 'dogs par byed pa'i bdag nyid gang gis nus pa'i bye brag ni rkyen gzhan dang lhan cig pa'i gnas skabs bye brag can du rung ba de'i yul de ni gnas skabs gzhan pa'i yul tha
translated: The clay and the potter, as co-operating causes, mutually assist each other. By whatever nature, the particular capacity is suitable in the particular situation of the other conditions, that object is the object of the other situation.

original: dad gyur kyang ji ltar de gzhan las tha dad pa de ltar ngo bo ni tha dad pa med do //
analyzed: dad gyur kyang ji ltar de gzhan las tha dad pa de ltar ngo bo ni tha dad pa med do //
translated: Even though it is different, just as it is different from the other, so the entity is not different.

original: 'bras bu'i rang gi ngo bo yang du ma nyid dang gcig pa nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: 'bras bu'i rang gi ngo bo yang du ma nyid dang gcig pa nyid ma yin te /
translated: The entity of the effect is also not many or one.

original: de rnams kyis bskyed pa'i 'jig pa dang dbyibs kyi bye brag gi bdag nyid de bzhin gyi tshogs las skye bas tha dad pa'i phyir tha dad pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyis bskyed pa'i 'jig pa dang dbyibs kyi bye brag gi bdag nyid de bzhin gyi tshogs las skye bas tha dad pa'i phyir tha dad pa'o //
translated: and the shape of the collection of those is different from the collection itself.

original: gal te de gzhan las yin pa bzhin du rang gi ngo bo la tha dad pa med do zhes @241a * //
analyzed: gal te de gzhan las yin pa bzhin du rang gi ngo bo la tha dad pa med do zhes @241a * //
translated: If it is not different from the other, then it is not different in its own nature.

original: ji ltar shes par bya zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar shes par bya zhe na /
translated: How is this known?

original: 'jim pa dang dbyibs dag ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'jim pa dang dbyibs dag ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: It is said, ‚ÄúIf the clay and the shape . . .‚Äù

original: gang gi tshe rdza mkhan dang 'jim pa de'i gnas skabs su 'byung ba'i nus pa'i bye brag gi yul 'dzin pa dang dbyibs dag gi bye brag gi bdag nyid de ni gzhan las yin pa bzhin du rang gi ngo bo dag kyang tha dad pa de'i tshe 'jim
analyzed: gang gi tshe rdza mkhan dang 'jim pa de'i gnas skabs su 'byung ba'i nus pa'i bye brag gi yul 'dzin pa dang dbyibs dag gi bye brag gi bdag nyid de ni gzhan las yin pa bzhin du rang gi ngo bo dag kyang tha dad pa de'i tshe 'jim
translated: When the potter and the clay are the object of the power that arises in that situation, the shape is different from the clay, and the clay is different from the shape.

original: pa dang dbyibs phan tshun bdag nyid ma yin pa phan tshun spangs pa'i bdag nyid kyi rgyus dbyibs kyi khyad par dang 'jim pa'i ngo bo dang dbyibs kyi bye brag ni de gzhan gyi ngo bo bzhin du snang ba med do //
analyzed: pa dang dbyibs phan tshun bdag nyid ma yin pa phan tshun spangs pa'i bdag nyid kyi rgyus dbyibs kyi khyad par dang 'jim pa'i ngo bo dang dbyibs kyi bye brag ni de gzhan gyi ngo bo bzhin du snang ba med do //
translated: And the shape is not the nature of the clay, because they are mutually exclusive natures. The particular shape and the nature of the clay and the difference in shape do not appear as different natures.

original: gang dang gang gi rang bzhin ma yin pa de dang de'i bdag nyid ni rang gi 'dzin pa'i shes pa las snang ba med de gzugs dang ro'i shes pa bzhin no //
analyzed: gang dang gang gi rang bzhin ma yin pa de dang de'i bdag nyid ni rang gi 'dzin pa'i shes pa las snang ba med de gzugs dang ro'i shes pa bzhin no //
translated: Whatever is not the nature of something does not appear as that nature to the consciousness that apprehends it, like the consciousness of form and taste.

original: de ma tshang ba'i nus pa las skye ba na de'i ngo bo'i rjes su byed par mi rigs te 'khrul pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur bas de'i dbang gis don rnam par gzhag pa med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ma tshang ba'i nus pa las skye ba na de'i ngo bo'i rjes su byed par mi rigs te 'khrul pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur bas de'i dbang gis don rnam par gzhag pa med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If it arises from a potential that is not complete, it is not reasonable that it should conform to that nature, because it would be mistaken. Therefore, it would follow that the object would not be established by its power.

original: de'i phyir 'jim pa dang dbyibs dag gcig gi bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir rgyu du ma las 'bras bu du ma'i bdag nyid yin pa'i ma nges pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'jim pa dang dbyibs dag gcig gi bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir rgyu du ma las 'bras bu du ma'i bdag nyid yin pa'i ma nges pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, because the clay and the shape are not the same nature, it is not definite that the effect has the nature of many from a cause that is many.

original: mig la sogs pa tha dad pa'i ngo bo dag lhan cig byed pa las 'bras bu gcig byed pa 'gal ba yin no //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa tha dad pa'i ngo bo dag lhan cig byed pa las 'bras bu gcig byed pa 'gal ba yin no //
translated: It is contradictory for different things such as eyes and so on to be co-emergent causes of a single effect.

original: de dag thun mong pa'i tshogs pa zer gcig pas 'bras bu gcig byed pa 'am /
analyzed: de dag thun mong pa'i tshogs pa zer gcig pas 'bras bu gcig byed pa 'am /
translated: They are a single group that is a common cause of a single effect.

original: tha mi dad pa'i ngo bos thun mong ma yin pa'i rgyu dang 'bras bur 'dod pa yin te /
analyzed: tha mi dad pa'i ngo bos thun mong ma yin pa'i rgyu dang 'bras bur 'dod pa yin te /
translated: Or they are asserted to be uncommon causes and effects by way of an undifferentiated nature.

original: 'di dag kyang tshogs pa gcig pa la ltos nas rgyu dang 'bras bu gcig pa nyid brjod kyi don dam par de'i tshogs pa'i nang du 'dus pa'i rigs mthun pa'i skad cig ma gzhan skyed pas tshogs pa gzhan pa'i bdag nyid kyis 'bras bu gzhan skyed pa yin
analyzed: 'di dag kyang tshogs pa gcig pa la ltos nas rgyu dang 'bras bu gcig pa nyid brjod kyi don dam par de'i tshogs pa'i nang du 'dus pa'i rigs mthun pa'i skad cig ma gzhan skyed pas tshogs pa gzhan pa'i bdag nyid kyis 'bras bu gzhan skyed pa yin
translated: Moreover, they are said to be a single cause and effect in dependence on a single group, but in reality, they generate another homogeneous moment that is included in that group, and thus they generate another effect by the power of another group.

original: du zin kyang ji ltar rkyen gcig skyed par byed pa cung zad kyang med pa de bzhin du rkyen du ma yang skyed pa yin no //
analyzed: du zin kyang ji ltar rkyen gcig skyed par byed pa cung zad kyang med pa de bzhin du rkyen du ma yang skyed pa yin no //
translated: Even though this is so, just as a single condition does not generate anything at all, in the same way, many conditions do not generate anything either.

original: rgyu du ma las 'bras bu du ma nyid khas blangs pa la res 'ga' zhig kyang gnod pa med do //
analyzed: rgyu du ma las 'bras bu du ma nyid khas blangs pa la res 'ga' zhig kyang gnod pa med do //
translated: But it is not contradictory to accept that many effects arise from many causes.

original: de na 'bras bu gcig pa la ltos nas du mar thal bar 'gyur ba ni ldog pa la the tshom za ba yin te /
analyzed: de na 'bras bu gcig pa la ltos nas du mar thal bar 'gyur ba ni ldog pa la the tshom za ba yin te /
translated: Therefore, the consequence that a single effect would arise from many causes is doubtful, because the refutation depends on the proof.

original: sgrub bar byed pa thun mong du grub pas bsgrub par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: sgrub bar byed pa thun mong du grub pas bsgrub par bya ba yin no //
translated: The proof is established by the common establishment of the proof.

original: 'o na ni 'jim pa dang dbyibs kyi bye brag dag ngo bo gcig kyang ngo tsha med bar grangs can la sogs pa rnams tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa 'dod pa ji ltar rkyen du @241b ma las skye ba gcig nyid 'di dper 'gyur /
analyzed: 'o na ni 'jim pa dang dbyibs kyi bye brag dag ngo bo gcig kyang ngo tsha med bar grangs can la sogs pa rnams tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa 'dod pa ji ltar rkyen du @241b ma las skye ba gcig nyid 'di dper 'gyur /
translated: But if the difference between clay and shape is the same in substance, how can the Vaisesikas‚Äô assertion that they are different or not different be an example of the production of a single effect from many conditions, like the shameless one?

original: thams cad du rdzas dang rnam grangs dang ming dang mtshan nyid dang 'bras bu dang tha dad pas tha dad pa yin gyi /
analyzed: thams cad du rdzas dang rnam grangs dang ming dang mtshan nyid dang 'bras bu dang tha dad pas tha dad pa yin gyi /
translated: Everything is different because of the difference in substance, number, name, definition, and result.

original: yul dang dus dang ngo bo tha mi dad par 'dod de dper na bum pa dang gzugs la sogs pa de bzhin du bum pa ni gcig dang gzugs la sogs pa ni mang po zhes brjod ba ni grangs so //
analyzed: yul dang dus dang ngo bo tha mi dad par 'dod de dper na bum pa dang gzugs la sogs pa de bzhin du bum pa ni gcig dang gzugs la sogs pa ni mang po zhes brjod ba ni grangs so //
translated: They assert that the object, time, and entity are not different. For example, just as a pot and form, etc. are said to be one, and form, etc. are said to be many, they are different in number.

original: bum pa dang gzugs pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni ming tha dad pa'o //
analyzed: bum pa dang gzugs pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni ming tha dad pa'o //
translated: A pot and form, etc. are different in name.

original: rjes su 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid rdzas dang rtag pa'o //
analyzed: rjes su 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid rdzas dang rtag pa'o //
translated: The characteristic of following is substance and permanence.

original: ldog pa'i mtshan nyid tha dad pa dang skad cig ma'o //
analyzed: ldog pa'i mtshan nyid tha dad pa dang skad cig ma'o //
translated: The characteristic of turning away is difference and momentariness.

original: rgyal dpog pas kyang cung zad cig dus gzhan du gnas pa'i mtshan nyid kyang tha dad pa'o //
analyzed: rgyal dpog pas kyang cung zad cig dus gzhan du gnas pa'i mtshan nyid kyang tha dad pa'o //
translated: The Vai≈õe·π£ikas also assert that there is a slight difference in the characteristic of enduring in another time.

original: bum pa chu 'dzin par byed kyi gzugs ni ma yin la /
analyzed: bum pa chu 'dzin par byed kyi gzugs ni ma yin la /
translated: A pot holds water, but form does not.

original: gzugs kyi dngos po la chags pa zhes bya ba 'bras bu tha dad do //
analyzed: gzugs kyi dngos po la chags pa zhes bya ba 'bras bu tha dad do //
translated: The characteristic of the result is different, as in the statement, ‚ÄúAttachment to the entity of form.‚Äù

original: de ltar thams cad du rdzas dang rnam grangs la sogs pa tha dad pa dang yul la sogs pa rnams kyis kyang tha mi dad pa'i phyir 'jim pa dang dbyibs dag 'jim pa dang rdza mkhan dag gis rnam pa 'ga' zhig skyed pas rgyu gcig pa la gcig
analyzed: de ltar thams cad du rdzas dang rnam grangs la sogs pa tha dad pa dang yul la sogs pa rnams kyis kyang tha mi dad pa'i phyir 'jim pa dang dbyibs dag 'jim pa dang rdza mkhan dag gis rnam pa 'ga' zhig skyed pas rgyu gcig pa la gcig
translated: Thus, in every way, substance, enumeration, etc. are different, and also the object, etc. are not different. Therefore, since clay and shape are produced by clay and the potter, they are one cause.

original: yod pa nyid do //
analyzed: yod pa nyid do //
translated: One exists in the other.

original: ji ltar gcig pa de bzhin du de rnams tha mi dad pa'i bdag nyid skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji ltar gcig pa de bzhin du de rnams tha mi dad pa'i bdag nyid skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Just as one is, so they are, because they are produced with the nature of non-difference.

original: du ma'i rgyu gang yin pa de las du ma nyid de gang gcig pa nyid gang yin pa de ni lhan cig byed pas tha mi dad pa'i ngo bo gcig pa ni rgyu gcig pa nyid yin pa'i phyir 'khrul pa med do zhe na /
analyzed: du ma'i rgyu gang yin pa de las du ma nyid de gang gcig pa nyid gang yin pa de ni lhan cig byed pas tha mi dad pa'i ngo bo gcig pa ni rgyu gcig pa nyid yin pa'i phyir 'khrul pa med do zhe na /
translated: If many are the cause, then many results are produced. If one is the cause, then one result is produced. Since the nature of the single cause is non-different from the co-existent cause, there is no error.

original: de ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: de ni mi rigs te /
translated: That is unreasonable.

original: rang bzhin gyis tha dad par khas mi len na gzhan du na tha dad par mi 'grub pas du ma las gcig pa'i 'bras bu skyed pa la 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis tha dad par khas mi len na gzhan du na tha dad par mi 'grub pas du ma las gcig pa'i 'bras bu skyed pa la 'gal ba med do //
translated: If one does not accept difference by intrinsic nature, then difference is not established in any other way. Therefore, there is no contradiction in producing a single result from many causes.

original: rang bzhin gyis tha dad par khas blangs pa 'jim pa dang dbyibs dag tha dad pa med pa'i bdag nyid de /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis tha dad par khas blangs pa 'jim pa dang dbyibs dag tha dad pa med pa'i bdag nyid de /
translated: The difference between clay and shape, which you accept as being different by intrinsic reality, is not the same as the identity of shape and clay.

original: dbyibs dang 'jim pa'i ngo bo'i bye brag rnams de dag snang ba med pa ni spang bar dka' ba nyid do //
analyzed: dbyibs dang 'jim pa'i ngo bo'i bye brag rnams de dag snang ba med pa ni spang bar dka' ba nyid do //
translated: The difference between the nature of shape and the nature of clay is difficult to eliminate, since they appear to be different.

original: gal te rang bzhin gyis tha dad pa med pa chos dang chos can gyi rnam grangs la sogs pa tha dad du zin kyang tha mi dad do //
analyzed: gal te rang bzhin gyis tha dad pa med pa chos dang chos can gyi rnam grangs la sogs pa tha dad du zin kyang tha mi dad do //
translated: If they are not different by intrinsic reality, then even if the enumeration of the attributes of the bearer and the attributes of the entity are different, they are not different.

original: gzhan gyi ngo bo tha dad par grangs la sogs pas kyang bdag nyid tha mi dad pa la gnod par mi nus so //
analyzed: gzhan gyi ngo bo tha dad par grangs la sogs pas kyang bdag nyid tha mi dad pa la gnod par mi nus so //
translated: The difference in the nature of the other, even by enumeration, cannot invalidate the identity of the self.

original: re zhig grangs tha dad pas nus pa med de /
analyzed: re zhig grangs tha dad pas nus pa med de /
translated: First, enumeration cannot invalidate it,

original: rdzas gcig pa la tha snyad mang po mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdzas gcig pa la tha snyad mang po mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because many terms are seen for a single substance.üîΩFor example, just as the term ‚Äúguru‚Äù is used for many, the term ‚Äúform‚Äù is used for many, since the term is not seen to be definite.

original: dper na bla ma zhes bya ba bzhin du mang po'i tshig brjod pa la nges pa ma mthong ba'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa 'dir rgyu @242a * //üîΩmtshan ma yin te /
analyzed: dper na bla ma zhes bya ba bzhin du mang po'i tshig brjod pa la nges pa ma mthong ba'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa 'dir rgyu @242a * //üîΩmtshan ma yin te /
translated: Here, form and so on are the cause of the term.

original: gzugs la sogs pa rgyu mtshan yin na ni bla ma zhes gcig gi tshig res 'ga' zhig kyang mi brjod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa rgyu mtshan yin na ni bla ma zhes gcig gi tshig res 'ga' zhig kyang mi brjod par 'gyur ro //
translated: If form and so on are the reason, then the word ‚Äúonly‚Äù would never be uttered.

original: gal te chos can gyi ngo bo brjod pa srid pas brjod par 'dod do zhe na /
analyzed: gal te chos can gyi ngo bo brjod pa srid pas brjod par 'dod do zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is possible to state the nature of the subject, and that is why you want to say ‚Äúonly,‚Äù

original: de gcig pa nyid brjod par 'dod pa thams cad dang / bla ma dag mi snang ba yin par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de gcig pa nyid brjod par 'dod pa thams cad dang / bla ma dag mi snang ba yin par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then it would follow, absurdly, that all those who want to say ‚Äúonly‚Äù and all those who want to say ‚Äúnot‚Äù would not appear.

original: 'bru zhes rigs brjod pa na chos can dang / gzugs la sogs pa ma brjod pas gnyis ka'i ngo bo cung zad kyang bshad pa med de //
analyzed: 'bru zhes rigs brjod pa na chos can dang / gzugs la sogs pa ma brjod pas gnyis ka'i ngo bo cung zad kyang bshad pa med de //
translated: When the word ‚Äúseed‚Äù is uttered, since the subject is not stated, not even a bit of the nature of the subject is explained.

original: dngos po rnams la bla ma'i sgras brjod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dngos po rnams la bla ma'i sgras brjod pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the word ‚Äúonly‚Äù is uttered in regard to things.

original: ji ltar chos can gyi ngo bo la srid pas gcig tu brjod pa 'dod pa yin de'i phyir bla ma gcig pu zhes gzhi mthun par bstan pas rnam grangs pa yang gcig gi grangs kyi yul la de yang rnam grangs pa'i ngo bos tha dad pa yin no
analyzed: ji ltar chos can gyi ngo bo la srid pas gcig tu brjod pa 'dod pa yin de'i phyir bla ma gcig pu zhes gzhi mthun par bstan pas rnam grangs pa yang gcig gi grangs kyi yul la de yang rnam grangs pa'i ngo bos tha dad pa yin no
translated: Just as it is possible to say ‚Äúonly‚Äù in regard to the nature of the subject, so it is possible to say ‚Äúonly‚Äù in regard to the nature of the reason. Therefore, because the word ‚Äúonly‚Äù is used in common in both cases, the reason is also the object of the number one, and it is different in nature from the reason.

original: // ji ltar grangs tha dad pas tha dad par grub pa yin /
analyzed: // ji ltar grangs tha dad pas tha dad par grub pa yin /
translated: How is it established as different by virtue of a difference in number?

original: ming yang brda'i rgyu mtshan can te /
analyzed: ming yang brda'i rgyu mtshan can te /
translated: A name is a sign of a convention.

original: de yang 'dod pa la rag las nas 'jug pa'i phyir gang las don tha dad pa yin /
analyzed: de yang 'dod pa la rag las nas 'jug pa'i phyir gang las don tha dad pa yin /
translated: Moreover, since it is applied in dependence on desire, how is it a different object?

original: gcig la yang mi tha dad pa mthong na ji ltar tha dad pa'i rgyu mtshan yin /
analyzed: gcig la yang mi tha dad pa mthong na ji ltar tha dad pa'i rgyu mtshan yin /
translated: If it is seen that it is not different in one, how is it a sign of difference?

original: dper na dbang po dang brgya byin dang rtseg ma 'dzin ces bya ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na dbang po dang brgya byin dang rtseg ma 'dzin ces bya ba bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like the words ‚Äúsense faculty,‚Äù ‚ÄúIndra,‚Äù and ‚Äúholder of the peak.‚Äù

original: 'dir yang dbang byed pa dang brgya ster ba dang / rtseg ma 'dzin pa'i nus pa tha dad par rtogs so zhe na ;
analyzed: 'dir yang dbang byed pa dang brgya ster ba dang / rtseg ma 'dzin pa'i nus pa tha dad par rtogs so zhe na ;
translated: Here, too, the capacity to rule, to give a hundred, and to hold the peak are understood to be different.

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: No, they are not.

original: thams cad bya ba dang byed pa po ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: thams cad bya ba dang byed pa po ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because all are neither action nor agent.

original: dbang ster ba dang / brgya ster bar nus so 'dzin to zhes bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: dbang ster ba dang / brgya ster bar nus so 'dzin to zhes bya ba ma yin no //
translated: It is not that ‚Äúthe capacity to give a hundred‚Äù and ‚Äúthe capacity to hold the peak‚Äù are said to be able to give a hundred and to hold the peak.

original: de lta na ci zhig yin /
analyzed: de lta na ci zhig yin /
translated: What is it like, then?

original: chos can gyi ngo bo yang gcig tu khas blangs pa'i phyir dang / nus so zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig de brjod pa na gzhi mthun pa mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos can gyi ngo bo yang gcig tu khas blangs pa'i phyir dang / nus so zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig de brjod pa na gzhi mthun pa mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the nature of the subject is accepted as one, and because when the words ‚Äúis able‚Äù are uttered, a common locus is seen.

original: 'khrul pa'i shes pa'i yul ma yin pa'i phyir nye bar btags pa mi rigs so //
analyzed: 'khrul pa'i shes pa'i yul ma yin pa'i phyir nye bar btags pa mi rigs so //
translated: It is not reasonable to impute that, because it is not the object of a mistaken consciousness.

original: gang dag gi rnam grangs kyi don 'ga' yang rjes su rtogs pa med na 'di de la ci zhig brjod par bya /
analyzed: gang dag gi rnam grangs kyi don 'ga' yang rjes su rtogs pa med na 'di de la ci zhig brjod par bya /
translated: If there is no understanding of any of the meanings of the synonyms, then what is there to say about this?

original: mtshan nyid tha dad pa'i gtan tshigs kyang ma grub pa'i phyir dang / gcig gi dngos po la lar rjes su 'gro bar grub pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mtshan nyid tha dad pa'i gtan tshigs kyang ma grub pa'i phyir dang / gcig gi dngos po la lar rjes su 'gro bar grub pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The reason of different characteristics is also unestablished, and the existence of one is not established as being everywhere.

original: de lta na gtan du gnas pa'i rtag pas rdzas rtag pa ma yin par ngo tsha med par 'dod de /
analyzed: de lta na gtan du gnas pa'i rtag pas rdzas rtag pa ma yin par ngo tsha med par 'dod de /
translated: Thus, the shameless one asserts that the permanent substance is not permanent because of being permanent in the sense of lasting forever.

original: yongs su gyur pa'i rtag pa khas blangs pa'i phyir snga ma dang phyi ma'i skad cig ma'i rgyun tu gnas pa 'di rnam grangs pa lta bu ni ma yin te /
analyzed: yongs su gyur pa'i rtag pa khas blangs pa'i phyir snga ma dang phyi ma'i skad cig ma'i rgyun tu gnas pa 'di rnam grangs pa lta bu ni ma yin te /
translated: This is not like the synonyms, because it is asserted to be permanent in the sense of transformation, and it endures as a continuum of earlier and later moments.

original: rgyun chad @242b pa'i ngo bos rnam grangs pa nyid de /
analyzed: rgyun chad @242b pa'i ngo bos rnam grangs pa nyid de /
translated: The nature of the nominal is discontinuous.

original: rnam grangs pa'i ngo bo 'gal ba'i phyir rdzas rtag pa yin no zhes khas blang bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: rnam grangs pa'i ngo bo 'gal ba'i phyir rdzas rtag pa yin no zhes khas blang bar mi bya'o //
translated: Therefore, one should not accept that substance is permanent, because the nature of the nominal is contradictory.

original: 'di yongs su gyur pa'i rtag pa ni gtan du gnas pa'i rtag pa bzhin du srid bar mi 'gyur ro //üîΩrnam grangs las tha dad pa'i rdzas ma grub la de dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa las de lta bu'i gcig pa mi rtogs so //
analyzed: 'di yongs su gyur pa'i rtag pa ni gtan du gnas pa'i rtag pa bzhin du srid bar mi 'gyur ro // rnam grangs las tha dad pa'i rdzas ma grub la de dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa las de lta bu'i gcig pa mi rtogs so //
translated: The permanence of the transformation of substance is not possible, like the permanence of enduring forever.üîΩSubstance is not established as different from the nominal.

original: rnam grangs pa rnams ni bya ba dang byed pa ngo bo mtshungs pa rnams la rdzas su mngon par zhen nas blo dman pa rnams kyis gzhan yang mtshan nyid mi mthun pa mi rtogs so //
analyzed: rnam grangs pa rnams ni bya ba dang byed pa ngo bo mtshungs pa rnams la rdzas su mngon par zhen nas blo dman pa rnams kyis gzhan yang mtshan nyid mi mthun pa mi rtogs so //
translated: Those of inferior intellect, who are attached to substance in the similarity of action and agent of the nominal, do not understand that it is different.

original: 'bras bu tha dad pa ni kho bo cag la ma grub pa nyid de /
analyzed: 'bras bu tha dad pa ni kho bo cag la ma grub pa nyid de /
translated: The difference of effect is not established for us,

original: gzugs la sogs pa 'ga' zhig gi bya ba dang byed pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa 'ga' zhig gi bya ba dang byed pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: because it is the action and agent of some form and so on.

original: de bzhin du khas blang bar bya bar brjod do //
analyzed: de bzhin du khas blang bar bya bar brjod do //
translated: Thus, it is said that one should accept it.

original: 'bras bu ni dus mnyam pa dang mi mnyam pa rnam pa gnyis te de la sngar yod pa las 'di 'byung ba ni tha dad pa'i rgyu mtshan yin na de ni mi srid de /
analyzed: 'bras bu ni dus mnyam pa dang mi mnyam pa rnam pa gnyis te de la sngar yod pa las 'di 'byung ba ni tha dad pa'i rgyu mtshan yin na de ni mi srid de /
translated: The effect is twofold: simultaneous and non-simultaneous. If this arises from what exists previously, it is a different cause, but that is impossible.

original: chos dang chos can dus mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos dang chos can dus mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the property and the possessor of the property are simultaneous.

original: drus mnyam pa 'bras bu tha dad pa ni ma nges pa yin te rnam par phye ba'i yongs su gyur pa ni snam bu la sogs pa la srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: drus mnyam pa 'bras bu tha dad pa ni ma nges pa yin te rnam par phye ba'i yongs su gyur pa ni snam bu la sogs pa la srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If the effect is simultaneous, the difference is uncertain, because the transformation of the divided is possible in cloth, etc.

original: 'bras bu gcig pa nyid du brjod kyi don dam par de'i tshogs pa'i nang du 'dus pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu gcig pa nyid du brjod kyi don dam par de'i tshogs pa'i nang du 'dus pa'o //
translated: The effect is said to be one, but in reality it is included in the collection of causes.

original: snam bu la sogs pa ni rnam par phye ba'i yongs su gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: snam bu la sogs pa ni rnam par phye ba'i yongs su gyur pa yin no //
translated: Cloth, etc. are the transformation of the divided.

original: 'bras bu du ma byed pa mthong yang chos can gyi ngo bo las tha dad pa med pa'i phyir dang / gcig tu mi byed pa la 'gal ba med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'bras bu du ma byed pa mthong yang chos can gyi ngo bo las tha dad pa med pa'i phyir dang / gcig tu mi byed pa la 'gal ba med pa'i phyir /
translated: Although the effect is seen to produce many, because there is no difference from the nature of the possessor of the property, and because there is no contradiction in not producing one,

original: 'dir rgyu nyid 'bras bu'i bdag nyid du khas ma blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dir rgyu nyid 'bras bu'i bdag nyid du khas ma blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: here the cause is not accepted as having the nature of the effect.

original: gang gi phyir rgyu gcig gi bdag nyid las 'bras bu gcig gi bdag nyid du khas len pa na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rgyu gcig gi bdag nyid las 'bras bu gcig gi bdag nyid du khas len pa na /
translated: Because when one accepts that one effect has the nature of one cause,

original: de las gzhan pa'i ngo bo med pas de gzhan gyi bdag tu khas blang bar mi bya ste /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i ngo bo med pas de gzhan gyi bdag tu khas blang bar mi bya ste /
translated: then since it has no nature other than that, one should not accept it as having a different nature.

original: 'on kyang sngar 'ga' zhig yod pa nyid la sngar med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'on kyang sngar 'ga' zhig yod pa nyid la sngar med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: However, it is because it was previously existent that it is not existent previously.

original: de la yul dang dbang po dang yid la byed pa gcig la gcig nye bar len bas byas pa'i ngo bo tha dad ba rnams dang nye ba'i bye brag can rang dang gzhan pa'i skad cig ma re rer yod pa na yod pa de rgyu mtshan yin la
analyzed: de la yul dang dbang po dang yid la byed pa gcig la gcig nye bar len bas byas pa'i ngo bo tha dad ba rnams dang nye ba'i bye brag can rang dang gzhan pa'i skad cig ma re rer yod pa na yod pa de rgyu mtshan yin la
translated: There, the different natures that are produced by the mutual appropriation of the object, the sense faculty, and mental attention, and the individual instances of self and other in each moment that have the distinction of being near, that existence is the reason.

original: / de yang du mar byed par rjes su byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: / de yang du mar byed par rjes su byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And because it is similar to the production of many.

original: du ma byed par khas blangs pa la 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: du ma byed par khas blangs pa la 'gal ba med do //
translated: There is no contradiction in accepting the production of many.

original: gang gi phyir gcig byed pa yang de yod pa yod pa de rgyu mtshan yin la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gcig byed pa yang de yod pa yod pa de rgyu mtshan yin la /
translated: Because when one produces one, that existence is the reason.

original: de yang du ma byed bar mtshungs so //
analyzed: de yang du ma byed bar mtshungs so //
translated: And that is similar to the production of many.

original: 'o na ni de dang nye ba'i rnam par shes pa'i @243a * //
analyzed: 'o na ni de dang nye ba'i rnam par shes pa'i @243a * //
translated: But the effect of the consciousness that is similar to it is possible.

original: mtshan nyid kyi 'bras bu srid pa de skyed pa'i rang bzhin kho nar de dag nges pa yin no //
analyzed: mtshan nyid kyi 'bras bu srid pa de skyed pa'i rang bzhin kho nar de dag nges pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, they are ascertained as having the nature of producing that.

original: 'bras bu'i rang bzhin la ltos nas rgyu skyed bar byed par rnam par 'jog pa de'i phyir rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin re re dag gis ji ltar gzhan 'bras bu skyed pa yin /
analyzed: 'bras bu'i rang bzhin la ltos nas rgyu skyed bar byed par rnam par 'jog pa de'i phyir rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin re re dag gis ji ltar gzhan 'bras bu skyed pa yin /
translated: Since the cause is posited as producing the effect in dependence on the effect, how can each of the natures of consciousness produce another effect?

original: yang na de yod na de dag skyed pa'i rang bzhin du 'gyur na /
analyzed: yang na de yod na de dag skyed pa'i rang bzhin du 'gyur na /
translated: Or, if they have the nature of producing that,

original: des kyang rnam par shes pa kho na byed par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: des kyang rnam par shes pa kho na byed par mi 'gyur te /
translated: then that consciousness would not be the agent,

original: de gzhan skyed pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: de gzhan skyed pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: because it has the nature of producing another.

original: 'di la nyes pa med de /
analyzed: 'di la nyes pa med de /
translated: There is no fault here.

original: de dag du ma'i 'bras bu byed pa ni rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag du ma'i 'bras bu byed pa ni rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because their nature is to produce many effects.

original: de ltar na de'i gnas skabs su re re'i bye brag gis rigs mthun pa dang cig shos kyi skad cig ma skyed pa'i bdag nyid du de dag de yod pa las mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar na de'i gnas skabs su re re'i bye brag gis rigs mthun pa dang cig shos kyi skad cig ma skyed pa'i bdag nyid du de dag de yod pa las mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus, in that situation, because of the particularities of each, they are seen to exist as the nature that generates the subsequent moments of the same type.

original: de la rnam par shes pa skyed pa'i rang bzhin kho na yin pa'i phyir de skyed pa'i rang bzhin rgyun mi 'chad do //
analyzed: de la rnam par shes pa skyed pa'i rang bzhin kho na yin pa'i phyir de skyed pa'i rang bzhin rgyun mi 'chad do //
translated: In that case, the nature that generates consciousness is uninterrupted because it is the nature that generates it.

original: de nyid dang mi mthun pa'i phyir rang bzhin gzhan skyed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de nyid dang mi mthun pa'i phyir rang bzhin gzhan skyed pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not the nature that generates another because it is incompatible with that.

original: des na de dag du ma'i bdag nyid du mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: des na de dag du ma'i bdag nyid du mi 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, they do not become the nature of many.

original: gcig gi bdag nyid du phul du byung ba'i 'bras bu'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig gi bdag nyid du phul du byung ba'i 'bras bu'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are the cause of the excellent effect in the nature of one.

original: de gzhan la ltos nas mi mthun pa las ldog pa la nye bar brten pa la sgra du mas brjod pa na dngos po du ma'i ngo bor bstan pa ni med de /
analyzed: de gzhan la ltos nas mi mthun pa las ldog pa la nye bar brten pa la sgra du mas brjod pa na dngos po du ma'i ngo bor bstan pa ni med de /
translated: When that is expressed by many words in dependence on another, it is not taught to be the nature of many things because it is based on the reversal of incompatibility.

original: bye brag du ma gcig pa'i bdag nyid la de bzhin brjod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bye brag du ma gcig pa'i bdag nyid la de bzhin brjod pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the many particulars are expressed in that way in the nature of one.

original: dper na gzugs dang bstan du yod pa dang thogs pa dang bcas pa zhes bya ba bzhin du rang bzhin tha dad pa'i rgyu mtshan ni sgra ma yin te gzhi mthun pa med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dper na gzugs dang bstan du yod pa dang thogs pa dang bcas pa zhes bya ba bzhin du rang bzhin tha dad pa'i rgyu mtshan ni sgra ma yin te gzhi mthun pa med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: For example, it is like the statement, ‚Äúform, demonstrable, and impeded,‚Äù but the reason for the difference in nature is not sound, because it would follow that there would be no common locus.

original: gal te de'i rgyu mtshan gcig pa yod pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de'i rgyu mtshan gcig pa yod pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that there is no single reason for that,

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: it is not so.

original: de dag gcig pa nyid kyi phan 'dogs pa la mi ltos pa ni mi rigs pa'i phyir ram ltos pa la ji ltar gcig pa las du ma'i 'bras bur mi 'gyur /
analyzed: de dag gcig pa nyid kyi phan 'dogs pa la mi ltos pa ni mi rigs pa'i phyir ram ltos pa la ji ltar gcig pa las du ma'i 'bras bur mi 'gyur /
translated: Because it is illogical that they are not dependent on a single entity that benefits them, or if they are dependent, how could a single entity not be the effect of many?

original: gal te du ma nyid kyi bdag nyid nye bar mi rigs pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te du ma nyid kyi bdag nyid nye bar mi rigs pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is illogical that they are of the nature of many,

original: ma yin te gzhi mthun pa med pa'i skyon de'i gnas skabs su thal bar 'gyur ba med do //
analyzed: ma yin te gzhi mthun pa med pa'i skyon de'i gnas skabs su thal bar 'gyur ba med do //
translated: it is not so, because the error of no common locus does not follow in that case.

original: sngon po la sogs pa la bdag nyid tha dad pa mngon sum gyis mthong ba med la /
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa la bdag nyid tha dad pa mngon sum gyis mthong ba med la /
translated: Blue and so on are not seen by direct perception to be different in nature.

original: 'bras bu tha dad pas de dag tha dad par rjes su dpag na ni 'brel pa med pa'i phyir dang / de 'dzin pa'i tshad ma med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu tha dad pas de dag tha dad par rjes su dpag na ni 'brel pa med pa'i phyir dang / de 'dzin pa'i tshad ma med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If you infer their difference from the difference of their effects, there is no logical relation, and there is no validating cognition to apprehend that.

original: sngon gyi 'bras bu ma yin du zin kyang dngos po rnams bdag nyid gcig pa kho na rtogs te @243b mar me la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: sngon gyi 'bras bu ma yin du zin kyang dngos po rnams bdag nyid gcig pa kho na rtogs te @243b mar me la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: Even if they are not prior effects, things are still apprehended as identical, just as a lamp, etc.

original: rjes su dpag pa ni ma yin te /üîΩde bzlog pa la yang gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma med pa'i phyir dang / gcig gis du ma byed par khas blangs pa gang yin pa gzugs dang ro dang dri dang reg bya'i bye brag rnams 'di la lar lhan cig 'byung bar nges pa'i tshad mas de yongs su mthong bar mi 'gyur te tha dad pa'i rgyu mtshan can lhan cig 'byung
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa ni ma yin te / de bzlog pa la yang gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma med pa'i phyir dang / gcig gis du ma byed par khas blangs pa gang yin pa gzugs dang ro dang dri dang reg bya'i bye brag rnams 'di la lar lhan cig 'byung bar nges pa'i tshad mas de yongs su mthong bar mi 'gyur te tha dad pa'i rgyu mtshan can lhan cig 'byung
translated: It is not an inference,üîΩbecause there is no validating cognition to refute that, and because the one is not accepted as the cause of the many.

original: bar nges pa mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bar nges pa mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The various forms, tastes, smells, and textures that are definitely simultaneous in this or that place are not seen by a validating cognition to have a single cause, because it is not logical that they have a single cause.

original: de'i rgyu mtshan rnams kyang rgyu gcig pa de la rag las nas skye bar nges pa ni lhan cig 'byung ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i rgyu mtshan rnams kyang rgyu gcig pa de la rag las nas skye bar nges pa ni lhan cig 'byung ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The reasons for that are definitely produced in dependence on that single cause, because co-occurrence does not exist.

original: gal te chos can gcig gi rang bzhin gyis gcig la lhan cig 'byung bar nges so zhe na /
analyzed: gal te chos can gcig gi rang bzhin gyis gcig la lhan cig 'byung bar nges so zhe na /
translated: If it is said that one is definitely co-occurring with one due to the nature of a single phenomenon,

original: ma yin te gcig pa ni du ma'i rang bzhin kho nar bsams pa'i phyir dang / du ma ni gcig gi ngo bo nyams su myong ba'i phyir de dang ldan pa'i du ma ni spang bar dka' ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma yin te gcig pa ni du ma'i rang bzhin kho nar bsams pa'i phyir dang / du ma ni gcig gi ngo bo nyams su myong ba'i phyir de dang ldan pa'i du ma ni spang bar dka' ba'i phyir ro //
translated: that is not so, because one is considered to have the nature of many, and many are experienced as the essence of one. Therefore, it is difficult to eliminate many that possess that.

original: de lta ma yin na chos dang chos can gyi tha dad pa ji ltar nges par 'gyur /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na chos dang chos can gyi tha dad pa ji ltar nges par 'gyur /
translated: If that were not so, how could the difference between the phenomenon and the subject be ascertained?

original: de ltar na bdag nyid kyi mdun na gnas pa la 'di chos can dang rnam grangs so zhes rnam par gzhag par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar na bdag nyid kyi mdun na gnas pa la 'di chos can dang rnam grangs so zhes rnam par gzhag par 'gyur te /
translated: In that case, it would be posited that what exists in front of oneself is the phenomenon and the enumeration.

original: gang gi tshe tha dad pa de'i tshe tha dad pa nyid yin na ni du mas kyang 'bras bu gcig tu mi 'gyur na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe tha dad pa de'i tshe tha dad pa nyid yin na ni du mas kyang 'bras bu gcig tu mi 'gyur na /
translated: When there is difference, if it is difference, then many would not become a single effect.

original: phan tshun phan 'dogs par byed pa la mi ltos na yul dang dbang po dang yid la byed pas lhan cig ba kho nas 'bras bu gcig rtsom pa mi rigs te /
analyzed: phan tshun phan 'dogs par byed pa la mi ltos na yul dang dbang po dang yid la byed pas lhan cig ba kho nas 'bras bu gcig rtsom pa mi rigs te /
translated: If they did not depend on each other for mutual benefit, it would be illogical for the object, sense faculty, and attention to produce a single effect only when they are in combination,

original: gcig pa nyid ni cung zad cig la lar skyed pa med do //
analyzed: gcig pa nyid ni cung zad cig la lar skyed pa med do //
translated: because a single entity does not produce anything anywhere.

original: de'i phyir rgyu dang 'bras bu thams cad kyi dngos po rgyun chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir rgyu dang 'bras bu thams cad kyi dngos po rgyun chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the entire continuum of cause and effect would be interrupted.

original: gcig pas du ma dang du mas gcig byed pa spangs pa na rnam pa gzhan ni mi srid pa'i phyir dang / sna tshogs rgyu med pa nyid kyang ma yin te yul dang dus dang rang bzhin so sor nges pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig pas du ma dang du mas gcig byed pa spangs pa na rnam pa gzhan ni mi srid pa'i phyir dang / sna tshogs rgyu med pa nyid kyang ma yin te yul dang dus dang rang bzhin so sor nges pa'i phyir ro //
translated: When the production of many by one and the production of one by many are rejected, another alternative is impossible, and it is not the case that variety is without a cause, because object, time, and individual nature are ascertained.

original: de'i phyir tshogs pa gcig la rag las pa'i skye ba nyid lhan cig 'byung bar nges pa'i dngos po rnams 'bras bu gcig byed par nges pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir tshogs pa gcig la rag las pa'i skye ba nyid lhan cig 'byung bar nges pa'i dngos po rnams 'bras bu gcig byed par nges pa kho na yin no //
translated: Therefore, the certainty of co-originating entities that depend on a single collection is the certainty of producing a single effect.

original: de bas na rang gi rgyun gyi skad cig ma dang cig shos kyi nye bar len pa cig car byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na rang gi rgyun gyi skad cig ma dang cig shos kyi nye bar len pa cig car byed pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the momentariness of its own continuum and the momentariness of the appropriated aggregates are simultaneous.

original: ji ltar gcig las du ma'i 'bras bur mi 'gyur /
analyzed: ji ltar gcig las du ma'i 'bras bur mi 'gyur /
translated: How could the effect not be multiple when the cause is multiple?

original: de'i phyir ji ltar 'bras bu tha dad pas tha dad pas tha dad par brtag pa yin /
analyzed: de'i phyir ji ltar 'bras bu tha dad pas tha dad pas tha dad par brtag pa yin /
translated: Therefore, how could the effect be considered to be different when the cause is different?

original: rdzas dang rnam grangs dag ngo bo gcig par brjod na gcig pas du ma'i 'bras bu nus pa'i phyir ji ltar mi skyed pa yin /
analyzed: rdzas dang rnam grangs dag ngo bo gcig par brjod na gcig pas du ma'i 'bras bu nus pa'i phyir ji ltar mi skyed pa yin /
translated: If substance and enumeration are said to be the same entity, then because the one is capable of producing the many, why wouldn‚Äôt it produce them?

original: rang bzhin ni dngos po yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin ni dngos po yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the essence of a thing is substance.

original: @244a * // de lta ma yin na de ni rang bzhin med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: @244a * // de lta ma yin na de ni rang bzhin med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were not so, it would follow that it would be essenceless.

original: rang bzhin gcig pa'i rdzas dang rnam grangs de 'bras bu tha dad pa dngos po ni gcig dang 'brel pa yin no snyam nas /
analyzed: rang bzhin gcig pa'i rdzas dang rnam grangs de 'bras bu tha dad pa dngos po ni gcig dang 'brel pa yin no snyam nas /
translated: If you think that substance and enumeration, which are the same in essence, are related to a single thing that is different from the effect,

original: 'bras bu tha dad pas tha dad par brjod pa na /
analyzed: 'bras bu tha dad pas tha dad par brjod pa na /
translated: then when you say that the effect is different because the cause is different,

original: 'di ni ngo tsha med par bsal bas spang bar 'os pa yin /
analyzed: 'di ni ngo tsha med par bsal bas spang bar 'os pa yin /
translated: this is a shameless display that should be rejected.

original: bye brag pa rnams kyang rdzas gcig pa'i rdzas dang / yon tan dang las dang 'du ba'i rgyur brjod pa na /
analyzed: bye brag pa rnams kyang rdzas gcig pa'i rdzas dang / yon tan dang las dang 'du ba'i rgyur brjod pa na /
translated: The Vai≈õe·π£ikas say that substance is the cause of substance, quality, action, and inherence that are of the same substance.

original: las ni gcig la 'brel pa'i bye brag gi 'du byed pa'i rgyu mtshan can gcig pa du ma byed pa spong ba na rang gis byas pa la zhe sdang bas spong ba yin no //
analyzed: las ni gcig la 'brel pa'i bye brag gi 'du byed pa'i rgyu mtshan can gcig pa du ma byed pa spong ba na rang gis byas pa la zhe sdang bas spong ba yin no //
translated: When they say that action is the cause of the formation of inherence that is related to one thing, they are rejecting that one thing performs many actions.

original: 'dir nus pa tha dad pa ni rgyu mtshan ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dir nus pa tha dad pa ni rgyu mtshan ma yin te /
translated: Here, difference in potency is not the reason,

original: gang gi phyir de gcig pa la mi ltos na ji ltar de nus pa nges pa'i don la brten nas slar cha shas med pa gsal bar byed pa yin /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de gcig pa la mi ltos na ji ltar de nus pa nges pa'i don la brten nas slar cha shas med pa gsal bar byed pa yin /
translated: because if it does not depend on one thing, how could it be that it is the basis of the ascertainment of potency?

original: gang las gcig pa'i bdag nyid phul du byung bas du ma'i nus pa la phan 'dogs pa de kho na las 'bras bu du ma byed pa yin no zhes bya brgyas par brjod pas chog go //
analyzed: gang las gcig pa'i bdag nyid phul du byung bas du ma'i nus pa la phan 'dogs pa de kho na las 'bras bu du ma byed pa yin no zhes bya brgyas par brjod pas chog go //
translated: It is sufficient to say that the many effects are produced from that alone, which is the cause of the enhancement of the many potencies by the single nature.

original: yul dang dus dang rang bzhin tha mi dad par khas blangs pa de yang mi 'thad pa nyid de /
analyzed: yul dang dus dang rang bzhin tha mi dad par khas blangs pa de yang mi 'thad pa nyid de /
translated: The assertion that the object, time, and nature are not different is also untenable.

original: de lta na yul dang dus dag tha mi dad kyang gzugs dang ngo dang dri dang reg bya rnams rnam grangs pa'i ngo bos tha dad pa de'i phyir ji ltar rang bzhin yang tha mi dad par grub /
analyzed: de lta na yul dang dus dag tha mi dad kyang gzugs dang ngo dang dri dang reg bya rnams rnam grangs pa'i ngo bos tha dad pa de'i phyir ji ltar rang bzhin yang tha mi dad par grub /
translated: In that case, although the object and time are not different, form, taste, smell, and tactility are different by way of their categorized natures. Therefore, how could they be established as not different in terms of their nature?

original: gang gi tshe rdzas dang rnam grangs dag kyang gcig la rjes su 'jug pa dang ldog pa'i ngo bo yin pa de'i tshe bum pa dang snam bu bzhin du dngos po gnyis su 'gyur gyi gcig gi ngo bo ni ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi tshe rdzas dang rnam grangs dag kyang gcig la rjes su 'jug pa dang ldog pa'i ngo bo yin pa de'i tshe bum pa dang snam bu bzhin du dngos po gnyis su 'gyur gyi gcig gi ngo bo ni ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: When substance and enumeration are the same, but have the nature of being engaged and disengaged, then, like a pot and a cloth, they become two things, but not the nature of one.

original: de'i phyir ji ltar tha mi dad par grub pa yin /
analyzed: de'i phyir ji ltar tha mi dad par grub pa yin /
translated: Therefore, how could they be established as not different?

original: rjes su 'jug pa dang ldog pa'i ngo bor mi rigs te ;
analyzed: rjes su 'jug pa dang ldog pa'i ngo bor mi rigs te ;
translated: It is illogical that they are the nature of being engaged and disengaged.

original: de dag rjes su 'jug pa can dang / ldog pa can la rag las pa'i phyir dang / de'i phyir rjes su 'jug pa dang ldog pa dang ldan pa dag gi rang bzhin las gzhan du na brjod par bya'i /
analyzed: de dag rjes su 'jug pa can dang / ldog pa can la rag las pa'i phyir dang / de'i phyir rjes su 'jug pa dang ldog pa dang ldan pa dag gi rang bzhin las gzhan du na brjod par bya'i /
translated: Because they depend on that which is engaged and disengaged, therefore, it should be said that they are different from the nature of that which is engaged and disengaged.

original: de dag rjes su 'jug pa dang ldog pa nyid rang bzhin yod pa nyid kyis yod pa la rag mi las pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: de dag rjes su 'jug pa dang ldog pa nyid rang bzhin yod pa nyid kyis yod pa la rag mi las pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: Because their engagement and disengagement would not depend on the existence of intrinsic reality.

original: / dran pa dran par byed pa rang bzhin du mi 'gyur te khyab pa dang ldog pa'i rang bzhin gyi mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir rang bzhin tha dad par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: / dran pa dran par byed pa rang bzhin du mi 'gyur te khyab pa dang ldog pa'i rang bzhin gyi mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir rang bzhin tha dad par brjod par bya'o //
translated: Memory would not be the nature of memory, because it has the character of a nature that is pervasive and disengaged, so it should be said to be a different nature.

original: gal te sa la sogs pa'i ngo bor rang bzhin yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te sa la sogs pa'i ngo bor rang bzhin yin no zhe na /
translated: If it is a nature in the nature of earth, etc.,

original: 'dir yang tha mi dad do zhes bya ba /
analyzed: 'dir yang tha mi dad do zhes bya ba /
translated: here also it is said to be nondifferent.

original: gang gi tshe 'dra bar brjod na de ni tha dad pa kho na @244b yin te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe 'dra bar brjod na de ni tha dad pa kho na @244b yin te /
translated: When it is said to be similar, it is only different,

original: 'dra ba'i dbang du byed pas 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dra ba'i dbang du byed pas 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is similar in being similar in terms of the object of reference.

original: de'i phyir don gnyis su 'gyur na gcig la ngo bo gnyis ni med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir don gnyis su 'gyur na gcig la ngo bo gnyis ni med do //
translated: Therefore, there would be two objects, but one thing does not have two natures.

original: 'on te gcig ni gnyis kyi ngo bo spangs pa de tha mi dad par khas len na de lta na ji ltar gzugs dang sgra ngo bo gnyis 'dir rang bzhin du brjod pa yin /
analyzed: 'on te gcig ni gnyis kyi ngo bo spangs pa de tha mi dad par khas len na de lta na ji ltar gzugs dang sgra ngo bo gnyis 'dir rang bzhin du brjod pa yin /
translated: But if one accepts that one thing is nondifferent from the nature of two things, having abandoned the nature of two things, then how could form and sound be said to be its nature?

original: de'i gcig pa ji ltar gnyis kyi ngo bo yin /
analyzed: de'i gcig pa ji ltar gnyis kyi ngo bo yin /
translated: How could the oneness of that be the entity of two?

original: gcig gi rang bzhin de bkag pas gnyis kyi ngo bo yin no snyam na /
analyzed: gcig gi rang bzhin de bkag pas gnyis kyi ngo bo yin no snyam na /
translated: If you think that the entity of two is the negation of the nature of one,

original: 'on te rang bzhin gcig pa yang khas ma blangs pas de lta na ji ltar de gcig tu brjod pa yin /
analyzed: 'on te rang bzhin gcig pa yang khas ma blangs pas de lta na ji ltar de gcig tu brjod pa yin /
translated: then since you do not accept a single nature, how could you say that it is one?

original: re zhig du ma rnams rgyu gcig las skye ba'i phyir thams cad du nye bar len pa'i rgyu mtshan gyi byed pa tha dad pas rgyu tha dad par mi 'grub ste /
analyzed: re zhig du ma rnams rgyu gcig las skye ba'i phyir thams cad du nye bar len pa'i rgyu mtshan gyi byed pa tha dad pas rgyu tha dad par mi 'grub ste /
translated: First, because many are produced from a single cause, in all cases the reason for their appropriation is not established to be different, because their cause is not different.

original: 'bras bu gcig byed pa ma yin pa'i yang phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu gcig byed pa ma yin pa'i yang phyir ro //
translated: This is because they do not produce a single effect.

original: gcig kyang yongs su 'gyur ba'i rnam par dbye ba dang rnam par ma phye ba'i yongs su 'gyur bas 'bras bu tha dad par khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig kyang yongs su 'gyur ba'i rnam par dbye ba dang rnam par ma phye ba'i yongs su 'gyur bas 'bras bu tha dad par khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Also, because one is accepted to be different in terms of its effect due to the transformation of its parts and the transformation of its parts that are not differentiated.

original: rjod par byed pa gcig pas brjod par bya ba gcig pa'i phyir yang gcig pa la rnam grangs du ma mi srid pa'i phyir dang / byas pa dang ma byas pa sna tshogs pa'i rung ba rnams rjod par byed pa dang brjod par bya ba gcig pa nyid la lar mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rjod par byed pa gcig pas brjod par bya ba gcig pa'i phyir yang gcig pa la rnam grangs du ma mi srid pa'i phyir dang / byas pa dang ma byas pa sna tshogs pa'i rung ba rnams rjod par byed pa dang brjod par bya ba gcig pa nyid la lar mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the one expression expresses the one object, it is impossible for the one to have many synonyms, and it is impossible for the various suitable objects, some of which are expressed and some of which are not, to be the one object of the one expression.

original: nus pa tha dad pa yul tha dad par brjod pa na lan bshad zin no //
analyzed: nus pa tha dad pa yul tha dad par brjod pa na lan bshad zin no //
translated: We have already explained the reply to the objection that different powers would have different objects.

original: rnam par shes pa gcig gi yul ma yin pa'i dang re re la yang rnam par shes pa du ma skye ste /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa gcig gi yul ma yin pa'i dang re re la yang rnam par shes pa du ma skye ste /
translated: Many consciousnesses arise in regard to each object that is not the object of a single consciousness.

original: de lta na zla ba la sogs pa la mang pos mthong ba na de ji ltar gcig pa nyid du khas blang bar bya ba yin /
analyzed: de lta na zla ba la sogs pa la mang pos mthong ba na de ji ltar gcig pa nyid du khas blang bar bya ba yin /
translated: If that were so, then when many people see the moon, how could it be accepted as one?

original: mang po rnams kyang rnam par shes pa gcig gi yul yin par srid pas sngon po la sogs pa rnams gcig tu thal bar 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: mang po rnams kyang rnam par shes pa gcig gi yul yin par srid pas sngon po la sogs pa rnams gcig tu thal bar 'gyur ro ;
translated: Since many people can have the same object of a single consciousness, it follows that blue and so on would be one.

original: 'di ltar gcig gnyis kyi ngo bo yin no zhes bya ba 'di dag ni thams cad du rnam pa 'ga' zhig kyang 'brel pa med do //
analyzed: 'di ltar gcig gnyis kyi ngo bo yin no zhes bya ba 'di dag ni thams cad du rnam pa 'ga' zhig kyang 'brel pa med do //
translated: Thus, the statement ‚ÄúIt is the entity of one and two‚Äù is not related to anything at all.

original: rnam par shes pa yang sngon po'i gzugs brnyan las skyes pa na ser por snang ba rnam par bcad nas bye brag can du snang ba yin gyi 'di yang khyod kyi gnyis kyi ngo bor ni med do ;
analyzed: rnam par shes pa yang sngon po'i gzugs brnyan las skyes pa na ser por snang ba rnam par bcad nas bye brag can du snang ba yin gyi 'di yang khyod kyi gnyis kyi ngo bor ni med do ;
translated: Also, when consciousness arises as a reflection of a blue form, it appears as a specific object by excluding the appearance of yellow. But it does not exist as the entity of two for you.

original: /'on te rdzas dang rnam grangs dag kyang lhan cig 'dres pa'i phyir mi'i seng ge bzhin du gcig pa 'dren ma'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir gnyis kyi ngo bor brjod do zhe na /
analyzed: /'on te rdzas dang rnam grangs dag kyang lhan cig 'dres pa'i phyir mi'i seng ge bzhin du gcig pa 'dren ma'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir gnyis kyi ngo bor brjod do zhe na /
translated: But if you say that because substance and enumeration are mixed together simultaneously, like a human lion, they are the entity of a mixture that is one, therefore they are called the entity of two,

original: de mi rigs te /
analyzed: de mi rigs te /
translated: that is illogical.

original: mi'i seng ge 'dren ma'i ngo bor ma grub ste /
analyzed: mi'i seng ge 'dren ma'i ngo bor ma grub ste /
translated: A human lion is not established as the entity of a mixture.

original: rdul phra rab du ma dang 'brel pa'i ngo bor lhan cig pa de yang rdul @245a * //
analyzed: rdul phra rab du ma dang 'brel pa'i ngo bor lhan cig pa de yang rdul @245a * //
translated: That which is simultaneous in the entity that is related to many atoms is also not established as the entity of a human lion.

original: phra rab re re mi'i seng ge'i ngo bor mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: phra rab re re mi'i seng ge'i ngo bor mi 'gyur te /
translated: Each atom is not the entity of a human lion.

original: de'i steng gi cha ni seng ge'i gzugs yin la 'og gi cha ni mi'i gzugs yin na rigs gzhan de nyid mi'i seng ge yin pas 'dren ma'i ngo bo med do //
analyzed: de'i steng gi cha ni seng ge'i gzugs yin la 'og gi cha ni mi'i gzugs yin na rigs gzhan de nyid mi'i seng ge yin pas 'dren ma'i ngo bo med do //
translated: If the upper part of a lion is the form of a lion and the lower part is the form of a man, then the other type is a man-lion.

original: sna tshogs ba'i ngo bo ni 'dren mar brjod do //
analyzed: sna tshogs ba'i ngo bo ni 'dren mar brjod do //
translated: A mixture is said to be a variety.

original: sna tshogs pa ni du ma'i ngo bo yin te du ma'i ngo bo yin na gcig gi ngo bo ga la yin /
analyzed: sna tshogs pa ni du ma'i ngo bo yin te du ma'i ngo bo yin na gcig gi ngo bo ga la yin /
translated: A variety is a multiplicity. How can a multiplicity be a unity?

original: du ma nyid de dag kyang nags dang dpung zhes bya ba bzhin du mang po rnams las 'bras bu gcig pa mthong ba'i phyir gcig gi tha snyad du byed do //
analyzed: du ma nyid de dag kyang nags dang dpung zhes bya ba bzhin du mang po rnams las 'bras bu gcig pa mthong ba'i phyir gcig gi tha snyad du byed do //
translated: Even a multiplicity is designated as a unity because a single effect is seen, as in the case of a forest or an army.

original: blun po blo zhan pa phyin ci log pa gang yin pa de dag de ltar re zhig rgyus so so ba nyid du yul dang dus dang rang bzhin rnams gcig sgrub par byed pa tshogs pa rnams kyang rnam grangs pa la 'khrul pa yin no //
analyzed: blun po blo zhan pa phyin ci log pa gang yin pa de dag de ltar re zhig rgyus so so ba nyid du yul dang dus dang rang bzhin rnams gcig sgrub par byed pa tshogs pa rnams kyang rnam grangs pa la 'khrul pa yin no //
translated: Thus, fools, whose minds are weak and confused, imagine that a cause is a unity, even though it is a multiplicity, and that a collection of causes is a unity, even though it is a multiplicity.

original: de lta na rnam grangs ni yul dang dus dang rang bzhin dag rnam grangs pa'i ngo bos tha dad par sngar bshad pa dang / chos dang chos can bkag pas gnyis dang ldan pa mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta na rnam grangs ni yul dang dus dang rang bzhin dag rnam grangs pa'i ngo bos tha dad par sngar bshad pa dang / chos dang chos can bkag pas gnyis dang ldan pa mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In that case, the enumeration is as previously explained, with the object, time, and nature being different by virtue of being the enumerated entities, and because the property and the possessor of the property are negated, it is impossible for there to be a combination of the two.

original: rdzas dang rnam grangs ngo bo'i phyir //
analyzed: rdzas dang rnam grangs ngo bo'i phyir //
translated: Because of the nature of substance and enumeration,

original: dngos po gnyis kyi ngo bor grags //
analyzed: dngos po gnyis kyi ngo bor grags //
translated: it is renowned as having the nature of two entities.üîΩThey are distinguished by the names of being the same nature

original: de dag bdag nyid gcig pa dang // tha dad ming sogs kyis 'byed pas //
analyzed: de dag bdag nyid gcig pa dang // tha dad ming sogs kyis 'byed pas //
translated: and being different.

original: dbang po yi ni shes pa la //
analyzed: dbang po yi ni shes pa la //
translated: In the case of the consciousness of the sense faculties,

original: dngos po'i ngo bo mi snang ba //üîΩsgra yi spyod yul min na cis //
analyzed: dngos po'i ngo bo mi snang ba // sgra yi spyod yul min na cis //
translated: the nature of the entity does not appear.üîΩIf it is not the domain of sound,

original: de ming tha dad tha dad 'gyur //
analyzed: de ming tha dad tha dad 'gyur //
translated: why would it be different from that sound?

original: don dam par ni gcig pa nyid //
analyzed: don dam par ni gcig pa nyid //
translated: In the ultimate, it is said to be the same,

original: ces bya la sogs de bzhin gsungs //
analyzed: ces bya la sogs de bzhin gsungs //
translated: and so on, in the same way.

original: sgra yi byed pa'i don dag ni //
analyzed: sgra yi byed pa'i don dag ni //
translated: The meaning of the function of sound

original: dbang po'i blo la snang med phyir //
analyzed: dbang po'i blo la snang med phyir //
translated: does not appear to the mind of the sense faculties.

original: mthong ba bzhin du de yi sgra //
analyzed: mthong ba bzhin du de yi sgra //
translated: Like seeing, that sound

original: rtogs pa yi ni spyod yul lo //
analyzed: rtogs pa yi ni spyod yul lo //
translated: is the domain of the conceptual mind.

original: gal te rtags des tha dad nyid //
analyzed: gal te rtags des tha dad nyid //
translated: If that difference is due to a sign,

original: ming gis tha dad 'gyur zhe na //
analyzed: ming gis tha dad 'gyur zhe na //
translated: If you say that they are different by name,

original: 'ga' zhig ldog pa'i tha dad pa //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig ldog pa'i tha dad pa //
translated: Then some would be different by exclusion,

original: dngos po la ni rnam 'gags min //
analyzed: dngos po la ni rnam 'gags min //
translated: But not by the cessation of an entity.

original: grangs tha dad kyang gzhan 'dod pa'i //
analyzed: grangs tha dad kyang gzhan 'dod pa'i //
translated: Some assert that they are different in number,

original: tshig las tha dad med phyir ro //
analyzed: tshig las tha dad med phyir ro //
translated: But not different by word,

original: de phyir brtags pa nyid kyang ni //
analyzed: de phyir brtags pa nyid kyang ni //
translated: Therefore, even the imputed

original: rnam 'gas tha dad par 'gyur gyi //
analyzed: rnam 'gas tha dad par 'gyur gyi //
translated: Would be different in some way.üîΩThose who say that words are

original: gang dag gi tshig dngos po'i dbang //
analyzed: gang dag gi tshig dngos po'i dbang //
translated: Under the power of entities

original: zhes bya sogs kyis dngos la min //
analyzed: zhes bya sogs kyis dngos la min //
translated: And so on, are not [different] in terms of the entity.

original: 'jig pa med pa ldog med pa //
analyzed: 'jig pa med pa ldog med pa //
translated: Without destruction, there is no cessation,

original: ldog pa 'jig par brjod pa yin //
analyzed: ldog pa 'jig par brjod pa yin //
translated: Cessation is said to be destruction.

original: rdzas kyi rnam grangs 'jig pa na //
analyzed: rdzas kyi rnam grangs 'jig pa na //
translated: When the categories of substance are destroyed,

original: 'jig na bdag min cis mi 'dod //
analyzed: 'jig na bdag min cis mi 'dod //
translated: Why not assert that the self is destroyed?

original: gal te rnam grangs ngo bo zhes //
analyzed: gal te rnam grangs ngo bo zhes //
translated: If the categories are the nature,

original: rdzas kyi rang bzhin nyid yin no //
analyzed: rdzas kyi rang bzhin nyid yin no //
translated: They are the very essence of substance.

original: ci de gzhan ba'i ngo bor 'gyur //
analyzed: ci de gzhan ba'i ngo bor 'gyur //
translated: Would that become a different nature?üîΩIf not, then it would be destroyed in the same way.

original: gal te min na de bzhin 'jig / ji ltar rdzas dag gnas @245b pa las //
analyzed: gal te min na de bzhin 'jig / ji ltar rdzas dag gnas @245b pa las //
translated: How is it that later, from the abiding of substances,

original: phyis byung de yang de bdag gam //
analyzed: phyis byung de yang de bdag gam //
translated: That also becomes its nature?

original: 'gal ba'i chos ni gnas pa na //
analyzed: 'gal ba'i chos ni gnas pa na //
translated: When contradictory qualities abide,

original: rnam grangs su zhig ci zhig 'gyur //üîΩgang phyir de la brtag pa yi //
analyzed: rnam grangs su zhig ci zhig 'gyur // gang phyir de la brtag pa yi //
translated: How many? What are they?üîΩIf you think that they are different

original: tha dad ngo bor gal te 'dod //üîΩgal te rnam grangs tha dad dngos //üîΩrdzas kyi ngo bos 'gyur zhe na //
analyzed: tha dad ngo bor gal te 'dod // gal te rnam grangs tha dad dngos // rdzas kyi ngo bos 'gyur zhe na //
translated: In terms of their characteristics,üîΩThen,üîΩIf you think that they are different in terms of their substances,

original: de 'di tha dad med gyur pa //
analyzed: de 'di tha dad med gyur pa //
translated: Then they would not be different in terms of their characteristics.

original: 'di la 'brel pa med nyid yin //
analyzed: 'di la 'brel pa med nyid yin //
translated: In that case, there would be no connection between them.üîΩIf you accept that the substance and the attributes

original: rdzas dang rnam grangs rang bzhin dag / gcig pa nyid du khas len na //
analyzed: rdzas dang rnam grangs rang bzhin dag / gcig pa nyid du khas len na //
translated: Are the same,üîΩThen it follows that some things would arise and some would not,

original: gcig las skye dang mi skye dang // 'jig dang mi 'jig thal bar 'gyur //
analyzed: gcig las skye dang mi skye dang // 'jig dang mi 'jig thal bar 'gyur //
translated: And some things would perish and some would not.

original: de'i phyir mtshan nyid tha dad pas //
analyzed: de'i phyir mtshan nyid tha dad pas //
translated: Therefore, because their characteristics are different,

original: de dag tha dad nyid mi 'gyur //üîΩgal te 'bras bu tha dad pas //
analyzed: de dag tha dad nyid mi 'gyur // gal te 'bras bu tha dad pas //
translated: They are not the same.üîΩIf you think that they are different

original: rang bzhin des tha dad 'gyur na //
analyzed: rang bzhin des tha dad 'gyur na //
translated: Because their effects are different,

original: rang bzhin tha dad med gyur des //
analyzed: rang bzhin tha dad med gyur des //
translated: Then, because their natures are not different,üîΩThey would not be different.

original: tha dad med na de bzhin du //üîΩrang bzhin kho nas tha dad pas //
analyzed: tha dad med na de bzhin du // rang bzhin kho nas tha dad pas //
translated: If they are not different,

original: cis na tha dad grags mi 'gyur //
analyzed: cis na tha dad grags mi 'gyur //
translated: Why are they not renowned as the same?

original: phyis 'byung 'bras bu tha dad pas //
analyzed: phyis 'byung 'bras bu tha dad pas //
translated: The later arising of different effects

original: de yi tha dad byed pa min //
analyzed: de yi tha dad byed pa min //
translated: Does not make them different.

original: rang bzhin 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir //
analyzed: rang bzhin 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir //
translated: Because its nature is unchanging,

original: 'jig pa'i rgyu ni mi rigs so ;
analyzed: 'jig pa'i rgyu ni mi rigs so ;
translated: It is illogical that it has causes of destruction.

original: / gcig des tha dad med pa na //
analyzed: / gcig des tha dad med pa na //

analyzed: gal te de dag tha dad grub //

analyzed: de bzhin thug pa med par 'gyur //

analyzed: shes la snang ba med pa la //

analyzed: tha dad med yongs ma spangs par //

analyzed: tha dad rtog pas byas par 'gyur //

analyzed: tha dad med don brdzun par 'gyur //

analyzed: gzhan min pa yi rgyu can yin //

analyzed: gcig la gnyis pa'i ngo bo med //

original: phan tshun med pa'i ngo bo yang //
analyzed: phan tshun med pa'i ngo bo yang //

original: rnam grangs yin na tha dad med //
analyzed: rnam grangs yin na tha dad med //

analyzed: de ltar de ni gzhan zhig yin //

original: tha dad skad cig mas 'jig par //
analyzed: tha dad skad cig mas 'jig par //

analyzed: cis na mi @246a * //

original: 'dod 'gal zhe na //
analyzed: 'dod 'gal zhe na //

analyzed: tha dad mtshan nyid 'dod bya min //

analyzed: tha dad pa tha dang med pa'i skyon //

analyzed: rgyu min dper na sbrang rtsi bzhin //

analyzed: dper na ma ga dh'a can bzhin //

analyzed: rno ba'ang mkhris pa skyed pa min //

analyzed: rang gi bdag 'dres ci mi 'dod //

analyzed: nus la ltos pa'i 'bras yin na //

analyzed: skyon gang ji ltar 'byung ba yin //

translated: Thus, since it is impossible for the nature of destruction and shape to be different in some way, the co-operating causes also have a multiple effect. This is the example.

original: 'di bye brag pa'i 'dod pa'i dogs pa bsu ba ni yon tan ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'di bye brag pa'i 'dod pa'i dogs pa bsu ba ni yon tan ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The Vaise·π£ika‚Äôs assertion is anticipated: ‚ÄúThe shape of the clay lump, etc.‚Äù

original: dbyibs ni cha shas kyi bkod pa yin par brjod de /
analyzed: dbyibs ni cha shas kyi bkod pa yin par brjod de /
translated: Shape is said to be the arrangement of parts.

original: de yang ldan pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de yang ldan pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: And since it is the characteristic of possession,

original: yon tan gyi ngo bo yin no //
analyzed: yon tan gyi ngo bo yin no //
translated: it is the nature of the qualities.

original: de'i phyir 'jig pa'i rdzas las gzhan pa nyid de rdzas dang dbyibs ni ma 'dres pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'jig pa'i rdzas las gzhan pa nyid de rdzas dang dbyibs ni ma 'dres pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, it is different from the substance of destruction, because substance and shape are of an unmixed nature.
