analyzed: zhing dang sa bon la sogs pa ma tshogs pa la myu gu skyed pa'i rang bzhin nam skad cig ma'i nus pa'i ngo bo med pas de'i rang bzhin skyed pa dang mi skyed pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir 'dir ma nges pa ma yin no //
translated: Since a sprout does not have the nature of generating itself, or the nature of momentary potency, when such things as the field and seed are not assembled, it is not indefinite in terms of whether it generates that nature or not.

original: gang gi phyir gang dang gang gi ngo bo yin pa de ni rang gi rgyus bskyed pa nyid de dang 'dra bar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gang dang gang gi ngo bo yin pa de ni rang gi rgyus bskyed pa nyid de dang 'dra bar 'gyur gyi /
translated: Because whatever is the nature of something is generated by its own cause as just like that.

original: de ni rgyu'i ngo bo gzhan la ltos pa med na ni ma nges par 'byung bar 'gyur na ngo shes pa'i 'dra ba'i yul la tshogs pa tha dad pa'i ngo bos gnod pas tshad ma ma yin pa des na 'dra ba grub pa med do //
analyzed: de ni rgyu'i ngo bo gzhan la ltos pa med na ni ma nges par 'byung bar 'gyur na ngo shes pa'i 'dra ba'i yul la tshogs pa tha dad pa'i ngo bos gnod pas tshad ma ma yin pa des na 'dra ba grub pa med do //
translated: If that were not dependent on another cause, it would arise without certainty. But since it is undermined by the different natures of the assembly of the object of recognition, it is not valid cognition. Therefore, similarity is not established.

original: skad cig ma zad pas snga ma de nyid de dag gi gnas skabs kyi dngos po tha dad par nges pa yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pas ngo shes pa med pa'i yul gcig pa med pas bsal to //
analyzed: skad cig ma zad pas snga ma de nyid de dag gi gnas skabs kyi dngos po tha dad par nges pa yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pas ngo shes pa med pa'i yul gcig pa med pas bsal to //
translated: The exhaustion of the momentary is ascertained as the different states of that previous one. Thus, since there is no object of recognition, the single object is refuted.

original: de ltar ni mtshungs pa'i ngo bo dang yul tha dad pa'i sgo nas 'di dag kyang de la gzhan dang gzhan las skye ba yin no zhes bya ba 'di bshad zin pa de yul bstan pa'i don du 'dir nye bar bkod do //
analyzed: de ltar ni mtshungs pa'i ngo bo dang yul tha dad pa'i sgo nas 'di dag kyang de la gzhan dang gzhan las skye ba yin no zhes bya ba 'di bshad zin pa de yul bstan pa'i don du 'dir nye bar bkod do //
translated: Thus, these are also said to be produced from other, in the sense of having a different nature and a different object. This has already been explained. It is set forth here in order to indicate the object.

original: cung zad cig 'ga' zhig gi rgyu yin no zhes bshad zin to ;
analyzed: cung zad cig 'ga' zhig gi rgyu yin no zhes bshad zin to ;
translated: It has already been explained that something is the cause of something else.

original: / de ci su zhig gi rgyu yin zhes bya ba'i nus pa gcod pa nang gi bdag nyid can rnams la re zhig bstan pa ni de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: / de ci su zhig gi rgyu yin zhes bya ba'i nus pa gcod pa nang gi bdag nyid can rnams la re zhig bstan pa ni de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: What is that? It is said, ‚ÄúThat is the capacity of internal nature.‚Äù

original: de la ni de rnams la'o //
analyzed: de la ni de rnams la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to those.

original: skad cig ma tha ma'i nus pa'i ngo bo'i skad cig ma'i dngos po rnams la bar du gcod pa can no //
analyzed: skad cig ma tha ma'i nus pa'i ngo bo'i skad cig ma'i dngos po rnams la bar du gcod pa can no //
translated: The capacity of the final moment is the capacity of the entity of the final moment.

original: sogs pa smos pa ni gang bdag nyid shin tu ring ba'am nye ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sogs pa smos pa ni gang bdag nyid shin tu ring ba'am nye ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúand so on‚Äù refers to those that are very far away or very close, and so on.

original: de'i yul chod pa med pa gang la de chod pa med pa'o //
analyzed: de'i yul chod pa med pa gang la de chod pa med pa'o //
translated: The object of that is unobstructed. That is unobstructed.

original: yul chod pa med pa la sogs pa gang yin pa de ni yul chod pa med pa ste /
analyzed: yul chod pa med pa la sogs pa gang yin pa de ni yul chod pa med pa ste /
translated: That which is not obstructed is not obstructed.

original: gzugs dang dbang po la sogs pas ni yid la byed pa dang 'dra ba'i dbang po la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs dang dbang po la sogs pas ni yid la byed pa dang 'dra ba'i dbang po la sogs pa'o //
translated: The form, faculty, etc. are the faculty, etc. that are similar to the mental activity.

original: de yang tshogs pa ni tshogs pa can gyi mtshan nyid bshad do //
analyzed: de yang tshogs pa ni tshogs pa can gyi mtshan nyid bshad do //
translated: And that collection is explained as the characteristic of the collection.

original: yul la sogs pa ma chod pa ni yul dang 'dir dbang po la sogs pa'i tshogs pa de rnam par shes pa skyed par nus pa'i rgyu yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no //üîΩde yod pa nyid ni de yod kyi gzhan yod na yang med pas 'di dag tsam rgyu @253a * //
analyzed: yul la sogs pa ma chod pa ni yul dang 'dir dbang po la sogs pa'i tshogs pa de rnam par shes pa skyed par nus pa'i rgyu yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no // de yod pa nyid ni de yod kyi gzhan yod na yang med pas 'di dag tsam rgyu @253a * //
translated: The unobstructed object, etc. are the collection of the object, faculty, etc. that are the cause of the ability to generate consciousness, not anything else.

original: mtshan yin pas nus pa dang mi nus pa rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: mtshan yin pas nus pa dang mi nus pa rnam par gzhag go //
translated: The mere existence of that is the existence of that, not the existence of something else. Therefore, these alone are the characteristics. Thus, the distinction between the possible and the impossible is established.

original: gang dbang po la sogs pa de dag phan tshun nye bar sdud pa'o //
analyzed: gang dbang po la sogs pa de dag phan tshun nye bar sdud pa'o //
translated: That which is the mutual convergence of those faculties, etc.

original: sogs pa smos pa ni bar du chod pa dang 'grib pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sogs pa smos pa ni bar du chod pa dang 'grib pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúetc.‚Äù includes obstruction, diminution, etc.

original: rten dang rgyu dang rkyen gyi khyad par la dngos su byed pa'i rkyen las tha dad pa'i rnam par shes pa de skyed par nus pa'i rgyu ni de yod na yod pa nyid du mthong ba nyid do //
analyzed: rten dang rgyu dang rkyen gyi khyad par la dngos su byed pa'i rkyen las tha dad pa'i rnam par shes pa de skyed par nus pa'i rgyu ni de yod na yod pa nyid du mthong ba nyid do //
translated: The cause that is able to produce that consciousness, which is different from the dominant condition, is seen to exist when it exists.

original: nus pa de dag las byung ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: nus pa de dag las byung ba yin zhe na /
translated: If it is said that it arises from those potencies,

original: rang gi zhes bya ba de ji skad bshad pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi zhes bya ba de ji skad bshad pa'o //
translated: ‚Äúits own‚Äù is as previously explained.

original: de la 'di 'dra ba dang nus pa gang yin pa de gnyi ga yang de'i rgyur bshad do //
analyzed: de la 'di 'dra ba dang nus pa gang yin pa de gnyi ga yang de'i rgyur bshad do //
translated: Both of those, which are like that and are potencies, are explained as its causes.

original: gang bzlas nas bshad pa ni gzhan dag rkyen gzhan dang nye ba nyid las skye ba ni brgya la zhig gzhan du yang 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de'i lan gdab pa'i phyir dang de dag nus pa dang mi nus pa'i rgyu de rnam par gzhag pa ni sngon
analyzed: gang bzlas nas bshad pa ni gzhan dag rkyen gzhan dang nye ba nyid las skye ba ni brgya la zhig gzhan du yang 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de'i lan gdab pa'i phyir dang de dag nus pa dang mi nus pa'i rgyu de rnam par gzhag pa ni sngon
translated: What is repeated and explained is to answer the objection that ‚Äúarising from other occurs when other conditions are present,‚Äù and to establish that cause as able or unable.

original: med pa ni dngos po yul ring pa'am shin tu rung bar du chod pa la sogs pa'i dus so //
analyzed: med pa ni dngos po yul ring pa'am shin tu rung bar du chod pa la sogs pa'i dus so //
translated: The time of the object is distant, very distant, or obstructed, and so on.

original: phan tshun rjes su 'gro ba la sogs pa'i rten dang rkyen nye ba na phyis med pa ni de'i gnas skabs dor ba dang bar du chod pa la sogs pa rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: phan tshun rjes su 'gro ba la sogs pa'i rten dang rkyen nye ba na phyis med pa ni de'i gnas skabs dor ba dang bar du chod pa la sogs pa rtogs pa'o //
translated: The absence of subsequent existence, etc., is understood from the fact that the conditions and causal factors of mutual dependence are not present later on, or that they are interrupted, etc.

original: so sor med pa ni dngos po re re'i dus su yod pa'am bdog pa'i rgyu med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: so sor med pa ni dngos po re re'i dus su yod pa'am bdog pa'i rgyu med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The absence of individual existence is due to the absence of a cause for the existence or possession of each entity.

original: de'i phyir nus kyang ngo //
analyzed: de'i phyir nus kyang ngo //
translated: Therefore, even though there is the capacity,üîΩthe word ‚Äúeven‚Äù indicates that the capacity of the cause is also not due to the prior or subsequent existence of the individual, but rather, it is due to the mode of existence of the prior and subsequent states of the individual.

original: kyang gi sgras ni rgyu'i nus pa mang po yang sngon dang phyi ma dang so sor yod pa las byung ba ni snga ma dang phyi ma dang so sor yod pa'i gnas skabs kyi ngo bor gyur pa'i tshul gang dag la rkyen gzhan dang nye ba las ci'iüîΩphyir skye ba yin /
analyzed: kyang gi sgras ni rgyu'i nus pa mang po yang sngon dang phyi ma dang so sor yod pa las byung ba ni snga ma dang phyi ma dang so sor yod pa'i gnas skabs kyi ngo bor gyur pa'i tshul gang dag la rkyen gzhan dang nye ba las ci'i phyir skye ba yin /
translated: Why is it that, when the conditions are present, the effect arises from the assemblage of causes, but not from the absence of causes?

original: sngon dang phyis dang so sor cis na mi skyed ces skyon brjod pa na sngon dang phyis dang so sor skyed pa'i mtshan nyid la des mi go ste 'byar ba ma yin no //
analyzed: sngon dang phyis dang so sor cis na mi skyed ces skyon brjod pa na sngon dang phyis dang so sor skyed pa'i mtshan nyid la des mi go ste 'byar ba ma yin no //
translated: When this is stated as a fault, namely, ‚ÄúWhy does it not arise prior to or subsequent to the assemblage of causes, or from the absence of causes?‚Äù it is not understood that the characteristic of arising is prior to or subsequent to the assemblage of causes, or that it is not connected with the assemblage of causes.

original: res 'ga' gzhan du yang 'gyur ro zhes gang bshad pa de yang 'dis bsal ba yin no snyam nas des na zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: res 'ga' gzhan du yang 'gyur ro zhes gang bshad pa de yang 'dis bsal ba yin no snyam nas des na zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Since this is the case, the meaning of the above statement is as follows.

original: gang gis gang dag gang gi gnas skabs su nges pa de ni gzhan du 'gyur ba med de skad cig ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gis gang dag gang gi gnas skabs su nges pa de ni gzhan du 'gyur ba med de skad cig ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That which is ascertained as a particular thing at a particular time does not change into something else, because it is momentary.

original: gang 'byung ba de ni de nyid ma yin pa'am de dang 'dra ba gzhan dang 'dra bar gyur pa des na rgyus so //
analyzed: gang 'byung ba de ni de nyid ma yin pa'am de dang 'dra ba gzhan dang 'dra bar gyur pa des na rgyus so //
translated: That which arises is not that very thing, but something else that is similar to it.

original: de dag ni dbang po la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de dag ni dbang po la sogs pa'o //
translated: Those are the sense faculties and so on.

original: phan tshun nye bar 'gro ba ni gzhan dang gzhan rung ba'i yul du tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: phan tshun nye bar 'gro ba ni gzhan dang gzhan rung ba'i yul du tshogs pa'o //
translated: Mutual approach is the assembly of different objects in a suitable place.

original: bar du chod pa spang ba'i rgyu gang yin pa de @253b ni rnam par shes pa skyed par nus pa'o //
analyzed: bar du chod pa spang ba'i rgyu gang yin pa de @253b ni rnam par shes pa skyed par nus pa'o //
translated: The cause that removes obstructions is able to generate consciousness.

original: rgyu ni de'i lhan cig byed pa'i rkyen dbang po la sogs pa'i nus pa rnams rang gi skad cig ma skyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu ni de'i lhan cig byed pa'i rkyen dbang po la sogs pa'i nus pa rnams rang gi skad cig ma skyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The cause is the power of the sense faculties and so on, which are its cooperative conditions, because they generate their own moments.

original: de ltar byed pa de'i nus pa'i rgyu ni phan tshun nye bar 'gro ba la sogs pa'i rten pa'i rkyen gyi bye brag gi lhan cig byed pa dbang po la sogs pa ni res 'ga' zhig gzhan du 'gyur ba med do //
analyzed: de ltar byed pa de'i nus pa'i rgyu ni phan tshun nye bar 'gro ba la sogs pa'i rten pa'i rkyen gyi bye brag gi lhan cig byed pa dbang po la sogs pa ni res 'ga' zhig gzhan du 'gyur ba med do //
translated: The cause of the potential for such activity is the specific supporting condition of mutual approach, etc., which is the cooperating cause of the sense faculties, etc. Sometimes, they do not change into something else.

original: phan tshun nye bar 'gro ba la sogs pa'i rten rkyen gyi bye brag med kyang yod pa des ci zhig brjod pa yin na res 'ga' zhig gzhan du 'gyur ba ba yang yin pa'o //
analyzed: phan tshun nye bar 'gro ba la sogs pa'i rten rkyen gyi bye brag med kyang yod pa des ci zhig brjod pa yin na res 'ga' zhig gzhan du 'gyur ba ba yang yin pa'o //
translated: If the specific supporting condition of mutual approach, etc., does not exist, what is the point of saying that sometimes they do not change into something else?

original: des na 'ga' zhig kyang la lar skyed pa yin no zhes bya ba la gzhan du 'gyur ba srid pas phan tshun nye bar 'gro ba la sogs pa'i rten pa'i rkyen gyi bye brag gis nye bar len pa dang lhan cig byed pa rnams nus pa'i rgyu yin
analyzed: des na 'ga' zhig kyang la lar skyed pa yin no zhes bya ba la gzhan du 'gyur ba srid pas phan tshun nye bar 'gro ba la sogs pa'i rten pa'i rkyen gyi bye brag gis nye bar len pa dang lhan cig byed pa rnams nus pa'i rgyu yin
translated: Therefore, since it is possible that something produces something else, the specific supporting conditions of mutual approach, etc., are the cause of the potential for the cooperating causes and the appropriated aggregates.

original: te / dbang po la sogs pa nye bar len pa'i nus pa'i rgyus dbang po la sogs pa skyed pas de med na yod pa ni mi rigs so //
analyzed: te / dbang po la sogs pa nye bar len pa'i nus pa'i rgyus dbang po la sogs pa skyed pas de med na yod pa ni mi rigs so //
translated: The cause of the potential for the appropriated aggregates is the sense faculties, etc., and the cause of the potential for the sense faculties, etc., is the appropriated aggregates. Since the sense faculties, etc., are produced by the cause of the potential for the appropriated aggregates, it is illogical that they exist without the appropriated aggregates.

original: lhan cig byed pa gang gis 'bras bu gcig byed par nges pa de dang de med na de skyed pa ma yin te de nyid tshogs pa gcig la rag las pa de mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lhan cig byed pa gang gis 'bras bu gcig byed par nges pa de dang de med na de skyed pa ma yin te de nyid tshogs pa gcig la rag las pa de mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If the co-operating cause by which the effect is definitely produced is absent, then it is not produced, because it is dependent on that very single assemblage.

original: rnam pa de lta bu'i rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po so sor nges pa'i bdag nyid rnams la rtsod pa med pa ni gzhan la yang mthong bar bstan pa ni tshul 'dis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rnam pa de lta bu'i rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po so sor nges pa'i bdag nyid rnams la rtsod pa med pa ni gzhan la yang mthong bar bstan pa ni tshul 'dis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The fact that the nature of cause and effect is ascertained individually is not disputed in other cases as well. This is illustrated by the words ‚Äúthis method‚Äù and so on.

original: gang dag gzhan pa'i rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po so sor nges pa tshul bshad pa gang yin pa de ni gzhan la yang thams cad du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: gang dag gzhan pa'i rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po so sor nges pa tshul bshad pa gang yin pa de ni gzhan la yang thams cad du blta bar bya'o //
translated: The method by which the nature of cause and effect is ascertained individually in other cases should be seen in all cases.

original: thams cad la zhes bya ba brjod pas skad cig ma ma yin pa rnams la so sor nges par ma gyur cig snyam na /
analyzed: thams cad la zhes bya ba brjod pas skad cig ma ma yin pa rnams la so sor nges par ma gyur cig snyam na /
translated: If it is said that ‚Äúall‚Äù refers to momentary things, and that it is not the case that non-momentary things are ascertained individually,

original: skad cig ma re re la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: skad cig ma re re la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: the response is that ‚Äúeach moment‚Äù and so on.

original: gang la skad cig skad cig las gzhan dang gzhan gyi rang bzhin tha dad pa'i rjes su 'gro ba can gyi nus pa las 'byung ba de la 'dir don gcig byed pa so sor nges pa'i lhan cig byed par blta'o //
analyzed: gang la skad cig skad cig las gzhan dang gzhan gyi rang bzhin tha dad pa'i rjes su 'gro ba can gyi nus pa las 'byung ba de la 'dir don gcig byed pa so sor nges pa'i lhan cig byed par blta'o //
translated: Here, the simultaneous operation of the various causes is seen to be the capacity to produce a single effect, which is different from moment to moment.

original: gang dag dngos po brtan pa gcig pu'i ngo bo can dag ni ma yin pa'o gzhan gyis brtags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang dag dngos po brtan pa gcig pu'i ngo bo can dag ni ma yin pa'o gzhan gyis brtags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are not things that have a single, permanent nature, because they are imagined by others.

original: de rnams la yang brtan pa ni rgyun la brten nas bshad pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams la yang brtan pa ni rgyun la brten nas bshad pa'o //
translated: Permanence is explained in terms of a continuum.

original: gcig pu smos pa ni skad cig ma gcig yod pa'i phyir brtan par 'dzin to //üîΩci'i phyir dngos po brtan pa las yang gcig pu'i @254a * //
analyzed: gcig pu smos pa ni skad cig ma gcig yod pa'i phyir brtan par 'dzin to // ci'i phyir dngos po brtan pa las yang gcig pu'i @254a * //
translated: The word ‚Äúsingle‚Äù is used because a single moment is apprehended as permanent.

original: ngo bor mi 'dod do zhe na /
analyzed: ngo bor mi 'dod do zhe na /
translated: Why is it not accepted that a permanent thing has a single nature?

original: ngo bo nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúIt is not reasonable that a thing would arise from itself,‚Äù etc.

original: su dag dngos po rang nyid las mi 'byung na bdag nyid kho na'i ngo bo gzhan las 'byung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: su dag dngos po rang nyid las mi 'byung na bdag nyid kho na'i ngo bo gzhan las 'byung ba ma yin no //
translated: If a thing does not arise from itself, it does not arise from another.

original: de'i phyir bstan pa'i don ni gal te 'bras bu skyed par nus pa'i rang bzhin yin pa de bas na mi byed par mi 'thad de /
analyzed: de'i phyir bstan pa'i don ni gal te 'bras bu skyed par nus pa'i rang bzhin yin pa de bas na mi byed par mi 'thad de /
translated: Therefore, the meaning of the teaching is this: If it is the nature of something to be able to generate an effect, then it is untenable that it does not generate it.

original: thams cad du byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thams cad du byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: It would generate it at all times.

original: gzhan du na nus pa med pa'i ngo bo yin pa de yang byed pa mi 'thad pas thams cad du dngos po byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan du na nus pa med pa'i ngo bo yin pa de yang byed pa mi 'thad pas thams cad du dngos po byed pa ma yin no //
translated: Otherwise, if it is the nature of something to be unable to generate an effect, then it is untenable that it generates it. Therefore, things do not generate effects at all times.

original: gang yang des 'ga' zhig byed pa res 'ga' ma yin pa mi rigs te /
analyzed: gang yang des 'ga' zhig byed pa res 'ga' ma yin pa mi rigs te /
translated: Moreover, it is illogical that it sometimes generates an effect and sometimes does not.

original: des na skad cig ma med pa dag de'i 'bras bu byed par nus pa'i ngo bo nyid la lhan cig pa dang lhan cig ma yin pa gnas skabs dag gcig gi ngo bo yin pa'i phyir 'ba' zhig pa dag kyang de'i 'bras bu byed par thal bar 'gyur
analyzed: des na skad cig ma med pa dag de'i 'bras bu byed par nus pa'i ngo bo nyid la lhan cig pa dang lhan cig ma yin pa gnas skabs dag gcig gi ngo bo yin pa'i phyir 'ba' zhig pa dag kyang de'i 'bras bu byed par thal bar 'gyur
translated: Therefore, if things that lack momentary impermanence have the nature of being able to generate an effect, then it follows that even things that are not coexistent or not noncoexistent would generate that effect, because the states of being coexistent and not coexistent are the same in terms of having the nature of being able to generate an effect.

original: bas don gcig byed pa'i so sor nges pa'i mtshan nyid ni lhan cig byed pa rnams las 'byung bar ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: bas don gcig byed pa'i so sor nges pa'i mtshan nyid ni lhan cig byed pa rnams las 'byung bar ga la 'gyur /
translated: Therefore, how could the characteristic of the individual ascertainment of performing a single function arise from coexistent causes?

original: gzhan gyis 'dir gzhan dang lhan cig byed pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te gal te 'ba' zhig pa 'di skad cig ma med pa'i nus pa'i ngo bo yin pa de lta na yang gzhan dang lhan cig byed pa'i 'ba' zhig ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan gyis 'dir gzhan dang lhan cig byed pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te gal te 'ba' zhig pa 'di skad cig ma med pa'i nus pa'i ngo bo yin pa de lta na yang gzhan dang lhan cig byed pa'i 'ba' zhig ni ma yin te /
translated: Someone might say, ‚ÄúHere, the so-called ‚Äòalone‚Äô is the nature of the capacity that is not momentary. Even if that is so, it is not alone in acting together with others.

original: 'di yang 'di'i ngo bo gzhan dang lhan cig byed pa gang rang gi 'bras bu byed pa'i nus pa'i ngo bo yod pa 'ba' zhig gis ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'di yang 'di'i ngo bo gzhan dang lhan cig byed pa gang rang gi 'bras bu byed pa'i nus pa'i ngo bo yod pa 'ba' zhig gis ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: This is also the nature of that which acts together with others. It is not alone in acting to produce its effect by the nature of the capacity.‚Äù

original: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas ci 'ba' zhig gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas ci 'ba' zhig gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The Proponent of the Middle Way says, ‚ÄúWhat is this so-called ‚Äòalone‚Äô?‚Äù

original: gzhan dang lhan cig pa nyid kyi rang gi 'bras bu byed kyi 'ba' zhig pas ma yin no zhes bya ba de 'ba' zhig pa'i ngo bos mi nus pas mi sbyor gyi gzhan gyis yin no snyam du bsams nas gzhan 'dri pa ni ma gtogs so zhes dgongs
analyzed: gzhan dang lhan cig pa nyid kyi rang gi 'bras bu byed kyi 'ba' zhig pas ma yin no zhes bya ba de 'ba' zhig pa'i ngo bos mi nus pas mi sbyor gyi gzhan gyis yin no snyam du bsams nas gzhan 'dri pa ni ma gtogs so zhes dgongs
translated: The Proponent of Consciousness thinks, ‚ÄúThe effect is produced by that which acts together with others, not by the alone. Since the alone is not able to do that, it does not join with others. It is only the other that produces the effect.‚Äù

original: nas nus na ci'i phyir mi skyed ces bya ba smos te /
analyzed: nas nus na ci'i phyir mi skyed ces bya ba smos te /
translated: If it is able, why doesn‚Äôt it produce it?

original: skad cig ma med pa'i 'ba' zhig pa nus pa'i ngo bo kho na gzhan du yod na ni skad cig ma med pa nyams pa yin no //
analyzed: skad cig ma med pa'i 'ba' zhig pa nus pa'i ngo bo kho na gzhan du yod na ni skad cig ma med pa nyams pa yin no //
translated: If it exists as only able, without momentariness, then momentariness is lost.

original: nus na ci'i phyir mi byed /
analyzed: nus na ci'i phyir mi byed /
translated: If it is able, why doesn‚Äôt it produce it?üîΩIf it is able, it does not produce it because of the condition of simultaneity.

original: nus na mi byed pa ni lhan cig pa'i gnas skabs kyis sbyor ro zhes bya ba lhan cig pa kho na byed par 'dod kyi 'ba' zhig pa nus pa med pa'i ngo bo yin par khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: nus na mi byed pa ni lhan cig pa'i gnas skabs kyis sbyor ro zhes bya ba lhan cig pa kho na byed par 'dod kyi 'ba' zhig pa nus pa med pa'i ngo bo yin par khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that only simultaneity is asserted to be the cause, and that only the nature of what is able is the cause.üîΩMoreover, if it is asserted that only the head is cut off, even though it is able, it does not cut, then NƒÅgƒÅrjuna says, If it does not cut, etc.

original: yang na 'ba' zhig pa gal te mgo bo gcod pa de lta na yang mi byed do zhes 'dod na mi byed na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te 'ba' zhig pa ni res 'ga' zhig kyang 'bras bu byed par nus pa med na /
analyzed: yang na 'ba' zhig pa gal te mgo bo gcod pa de lta na yang mi byed do zhes 'dod na mi byed na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te 'ba' zhig pa ni res 'ga' zhig kyang 'bras bu byed par nus pa med na /
translated: If only the head is not able to produce an effect at any time,

original: ji @254b ltar nus par brtag par bya /
analyzed: ji @254b ltar nus par brtag par bya /
translated: how can it be imagined to be able?

original: 'dir gang nus pa'i ngo bos gdon mi za bar 'bras bu byed par nges pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dir gang nus pa'i ngo bos gdon mi za bar 'bras bu byed par nges pa ma yin te /
translated: Here, it is not definite that what is able by nature necessarily produces an effect.

original: gzhan la yang mthong ngo snyam du sems nas gzhan gyis gal te thag pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: gzhan la yang mthong ngo snyam du sems nas gzhan gyis gal te thag pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: He thinks, I see it in another, and so he says, If another sees a rope, etc.

original: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas bzhad gad byed pa ni rtse ba'i ngang tshul can zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas bzhad gad byed pa ni rtse ba'i ngang tshul can zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The proponent of the conclusion laughs at him, saying, You are a child, etc.

original: lha rnams dga' ba ni blon po drang po'o //
analyzed: lha rnams dga' ba ni blon po drang po'o //
translated: The gods are pleased with him, i.e., the ministers are honest.

original: de bde pa skyed pa'i phyir dga' ba'i rang bzhin can no //
analyzed: de bde pa skyed pa'i phyir dga' ba'i rang bzhin can no //
translated: He is of a joyful nature, i.e., he is the cause of their joy.

original: rtse ba ni byis pa'i chos so //
analyzed: rtse ba ni byis pa'i chos so //
translated: Play is a childish thing.

original: de dang chos mthun pas ni shes rab nyams par bshad do //
analyzed: de dang chos mthun pas ni shes rab nyams par bshad do //
translated: He is said to have impaired wisdom, i.e., he is similar to a child.

original: skyid de bar skyes pa ni bstan bcos la mi sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: skyid de bar skyes pa ni bstan bcos la mi sbyor ba'o //
translated: He is born in a happy place, i.e., he does not apply himself to the treatises.

original: mi sbyor ba'i blo ngan pa gang yin pa de ni byas kyang dngos po brjod pa'i ngang tshul can yang byed pa'o //
analyzed: mi sbyor ba'i blo ngan pa gang yin pa de ni byas kyang dngos po brjod pa'i ngang tshul can yang byed pa'o //
translated: The bad mind that does not apply itself is of the nature of expressing things even though they are not so.

original: byas pa ni rab tu brtsams pa'o //
analyzed: byas pa ni rab tu brtsams pa'o //
translated: He has done it, i.e., he has undertaken it.

original: yang byed pa zhes bya ba ni slar yang rtsom pa'o //
analyzed: yang byed pa zhes bya ba ni slar yang rtsom pa'o //
translated: He does it again, i.e., he undertakes it again.

original: gang la slar yang rtsom par byed ce na /
analyzed: gang la slar yang rtsom par byed ce na /
translated: Where does he undertake it again?

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Thus he says, If another sees a rope, etc.

original: sa bon bzhin du ma nges pa yin no zhes bya ba'i gnas skabs des 'di dag bsal ba yin no //
analyzed: sa bon bzhin du ma nges pa yin no zhes bya ba'i gnas skabs des 'di dag bsal ba yin no //
translated: Thus, this refutes the assertion that the effect is not definite like a seed.üîΩThis is the same as saying that it is illogical for something to be productive if it is not momentary, since the nature of a productive entity is incompatible with the nature of a single cause that produces a single effect.

original: 'di nyid skad cig ma med pa'i nus pa'i ngo bo nyid la lhan cig byed pa nyid kyis 'bras bu gcig byed pa'i ngo bo 'gal bas 'ga' zhig byed par 'thad pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i mjug bsdu ba ni de lta bas na zhes bya baüîΩsmos te / 'bras bu byed par nus pa'i ngo bo gzhan du 'gyur ba mi srid pa'i phyir res 'ga' zhig kyang mi nus pas na mi srid pas de'i chos kyi 'bras bu byed pa 'di lta bu ni tha ma'i gnas skabs bzhin du lhan cig byed pa'i gnas skabs dngos
analyzed: 'di nyid skad cig ma med pa'i nus pa'i ngo bo nyid la lhan cig byed pa nyid kyis 'bras bu gcig byed pa'i ngo bo 'gal bas 'ga' zhig byed par 'thad pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i mjug bsdu ba ni de lta bas na zhes bya ba smos te / 'bras bu byed par nus pa'i ngo bo gzhan du 'gyur ba mi srid pa'i phyir res 'ga' zhig kyang mi nus pas na mi srid pas de'i chos kyi 'bras bu byed pa 'di lta bu ni tha ma'i gnas skabs bzhin du lhan cig byed pa'i gnas skabs dngos
translated: The conclusion is stated in the line ‚ÄúTherefore, the effect is not possible.‚ÄùüîΩSince it is impossible for the nature of a productive entity to change into something else, it is never unproductive.üîΩTherefore, the effect of such a productive entity is not possible, just like the final state of a thing.

original: po'i 'bras bu byed pa bzlog tu mi rung ngo /
analyzed: po'i 'bras bu byed pa bzlog tu mi rung ngo /
translated: Thus, the production of an effect by a thing in the state of a co-operating cause is not tenable.

original: gal te skad cig ma med pa'i 'ba' zhig ni nus pa med pa nyid de /
analyzed: gal te skad cig ma med pa'i 'ba' zhig ni nus pa med pa nyid de /
translated: If something is not momentary, it cannot be productive.

original: des na 'ba' zhig ni mi byed pa lhan cig pa'i gnas skabs 'di nyid kyi nus pa dang lhan cig byed pas skye'o //
analyzed: des na 'ba' zhig ni mi byed pa lhan cig pa'i gnas skabs 'di nyid kyi nus pa dang lhan cig byed pas skye'o //
translated: Therefore, it is not produced by the power alone, but is produced by the power in combination with the cooperating conditions.

original: de'i phyir lhan cig byed pas byed do zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir lhan cig byed pas byed do zhe na /
translated: Therefore, it is produced by the combination of the power and the cooperating conditions.

original: tha ma'i gnas skabs na zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: tha ma'i gnas skabs na zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The response to that is, ‚ÄúAt the final stage . . . .‚Äù

original: nus pa las skye ba 'dra ba sngon nus pa med par yod pa'o //
analyzed: nus pa las skye ba 'dra ba sngon nus pa med par yod pa'o //
translated: The production from the power is similar to the existence of the power previously without power.

original: de'i nus pa gang yin pa de las skye ba de'i rang gi ngo bo nyid du spyod pa la sogs pa rnams 'dod pa de dag nus pa dang mi nus pa'i ngo bo tha dad par mngon par 'dod pa ni rnam pa 'gas tha dad kyang de'i ngo
analyzed: de'i nus pa gang yin pa de las skye ba de'i rang gi ngo bo nyid du spyod pa la sogs pa rnams 'dod pa de dag nus pa dang mi nus pa'i ngo bo tha dad par mngon par 'dod pa ni rnam pa 'gas tha dad kyang de'i ngo
translated: The power of that is produced from that. The nature of that is the performance of the action and so on. Those who assert that the power and the powerless have different natures are in some way different, but they assert that they are realized to be of the same nature.

original: bo nyid du rtogs pa'i phyir ro zhes 'dod na de sngon med pa skye ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: bo nyid du rtogs pa'i phyir ro zhes 'dod na de sngon med pa skye ba nyid yin no //
translated: If that is asserted, then that which did not exist previously is produced.

original: 'o na med pa'i dngos po de skyed pa gang yin pa de ni ngo bo'i nus pa yin no //
analyzed: 'o na med pa'i dngos po de skyed pa gang yin pa de ni ngo bo'i nus pa yin no //
translated: Now, the production of that nonexistent thing is the power of the nature.

original: ngo bo gcig pa'i nus pa nyid sngar med pas skyed par mi nus @255a * //
analyzed: ngo bo gcig pa'i nus pa nyid sngar med pas skyed par mi nus @255a * //
translated: The power of the same nature is unable to produce the previously nonexistent.

original: zhes pa mi rigs te /
analyzed: zhes pa mi rigs te /
translated: This is not reasonable.

original: de dag ngo bo tha dad par thal bar 'gyur te chos 'gal ba gnas pas mtshan nyid tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag ngo bo tha dad par thal bar 'gyur te chos 'gal ba gnas pas mtshan nyid tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it follows that they would be different entities, since they would have different characteristics, because contradictory attributes would abide in them.

original: gal te nus pa dang ldan pa skyed pa dang mi skyed pa ngo bo nyid gcig par rtogs pa kho na ji ltar spong bar nus pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te nus pa dang ldan pa skyed pa dang mi skyed pa ngo bo nyid gcig par rtogs pa kho na ji ltar spong bar nus pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If you think that it is only possible to abandon the apprehension of the entity of that which possesses the capacity as that which produces or does not produce,

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: then that is not so.

original: tshad mas rtogs pa las gzhan du rtogs pa la khyed rjes su 'brang na zla ba gnyis pa la sogs pa yang spang bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: tshad mas rtogs pa las gzhan du rtogs pa la khyed rjes su 'brang na zla ba gnyis pa la sogs pa yang spang bar mi bya'o //
translated: If you follow the apprehension of that which is other than that which is realized by valid knowledge, then you should not abandon the apprehension of two moons and so on.

original: gal te gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma srid pas khyad du gsod pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma srid pas khyad du gsod pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If you think that you disregard them because it is possible for a valid cognition to contradict them,

original: 'dir yang nges pa gcig gi ngo bo la skyed pa dang mi skyed pa phan tshud 'gal bas gnod par cis na mi 'dod /
analyzed: 'dir yang nges pa gcig gi ngo bo la skyed pa dang mi skyed pa phan tshud 'gal bas gnod par cis na mi 'dod /
translated: then why do you not accept that they are contradicted here as well? Since that which produces and that which does not produce are mutually contradictory in the entity of a single ascertainment.

original: rdo rje rdo ba'i chos can de'i ngo bos skyes pa yin no zhes rnam par 'byed pa nyid kyi snga ma dang phyi ma'i dus dag zad pa med na ji ltar tha dad par rtogs par 'gyur /
analyzed: rdo rje rdo ba'i chos can de'i ngo bos skyes pa yin no zhes rnam par 'byed pa nyid kyi snga ma dang phyi ma'i dus dag zad pa med na ji ltar tha dad par rtogs par 'gyur /
translated: If the prior and subsequent moments of the vajra and stone are not exhausted, how could one understand them to be different?

original: rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu mi skyed pa cig car skyed par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu mi skyed pa cig car skyed par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: And it follows that consciousness and so on would not produce their effects sequentially, but all at once.

original: gal te mig la sogs pa dang nye ba las sngon nus pa med pa las skye ba ni rim pa dang ldan pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te mig la sogs pa dang nye ba las sngon nus pa med pa las skye ba ni rim pa dang ldan pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that the prior moment of the vajra produces its effect sequentially, in dependence on being proximate to the eye and so on,

original: gal te de ltar rnam pa gcig pa snga ma dang phyi ma dag gi dbang du byas pa ngo shes pa skye ba na snga ma'i nus pa tha dad pa'i rdo ba la sogs pa'i gzung bar bya ba la yang rjes su dpag pa'am don gyis go bas
analyzed: gal te de ltar rnam pa gcig pa snga ma dang phyi ma dag gi dbang du byas pa ngo shes pa skye ba na snga ma'i nus pa tha dad pa'i rdo ba la sogs pa'i gzung bar bya ba la yang rjes su dpag pa'am don gyis go bas
translated: then if recognition arises in dependence on the prior and subsequent moments being the same, it would follow that the prior moment of the vajra would be the object of apprehension of the subsequent moment of the vajra.

original: gnod pas nyams su myong ba tshad ma ma yin no zhes khas blang par bya'o //
analyzed: gnod pas nyams su myong ba tshad ma ma yin no zhes khas blang par bya'o //
translated: Therefore you should accept that the experience of harm is not a valid cognition.

original: de ltar skyed pa dang mi skyed pa'i ngo bo gcig pa 'gal ba'i phyir nus pa kho nas sngar ma myong ba skyed do //
analyzed: de ltar skyed pa dang mi skyed pa'i ngo bo gcig pa 'gal ba'i phyir nus pa kho nas sngar ma myong ba skyed do //
translated: Thus, because it is contradictory for a single entity to both generate and not generate itself, it is only potential that generates what has not previously been experienced.

original: 'dra ba gzhan 'byung ba 'dzin par byed pa na tshu rol mthong ba gcig tu 'khrul pa dang sen mo la sogs pa bregs nas yang skye ba bzhin du cis na mi 'dod /
analyzed: 'dra ba gzhan 'byung ba 'dzin par byed pa na tshu rol mthong ba gcig tu 'khrul pa dang sen mo la sogs pa bregs nas yang skye ba bzhin du cis na mi 'dod /
translated: If you hold that a different similar entity arises, why do you not accept that the perception of a single entity is mistaken, and that nails and so on grow after being cut?

original: 'on te lhan cig byed pa'i rkyen dang nye ba'i mtshan nyid las nus pa de'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir sngon med pa skye bar thal bar mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te lhan cig byed pa'i rkyen dang nye ba'i mtshan nyid las nus pa de'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir sngon med pa skye bar thal bar mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: But if you say that because the nature of that potential is characterized by the proximity of the cooperating conditions, it is not the case that a previously nonexistent potential arises,üîΩthen we reply that this is not the case for others, such as the NaiyƒÅyikas, and so on.

original: rigs pa can la sogs pa gzhan dag smos pa 'dir ma yin pas de'i ngo bo ma yin pa zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: rigs pa can la sogs pa gzhan dag smos pa 'dir ma yin pas de'i ngo bo ma yin pa zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore it says, ‚ÄúIt is not the case that it is not their nature.‚Äù

original: gzhan gang dag sa bon la sogs pa don gyi nus pa lta bu de'i ngo bo yongs su spangs nas phyi ma'i byed pa po nyid kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan gang dag sa bon la sogs pa don gyi nus pa lta bu de'i ngo bo yongs su spangs nas phyi ma'i byed pa po nyid kyang ma yin no //
translated: Others, such as the NaiyƒÅyikas, completely abandon the nature of the potential of the seed and so on and assert that the subsequent agent is not the same.

original: gang las she na nus pa zhes bya ba bshad pa ni de gzhan pa'i lhan cig byed pa'i rkyen gyi mtshan nyid gang yin pa de nyid la khyad par gyi sgras brjod do zhes rigs pa can gyis khas blangs pa de nyid kyi phyir de yod na yodüîΩpa nyid kyis 'bras bu skyed do//
analyzed: gang las she na nus pa zhes bya ba bshad pa ni de gzhan pa'i lhan cig byed pa'i rkyen gyi mtshan nyid gang yin pa de nyid la khyad par gyi sgras brjod do zhes rigs pa can gyis khas blangs pa de nyid kyi phyir de yod na yod pa nyid kyis 'bras bu skyed do//
translated: Therefore, when it exists, it generates the effect because it exists.

original: @255b de yang lhan cig byed pa'i rkyen rnams ni skad cig ma med pa gang yin pa de rnams la thal bar 'gyur ba 'di mi 'dogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: @255b de yang lhan cig byed pa'i rkyen rnams ni skad cig ma med pa gang yin pa de rnams la thal bar 'gyur ba 'di mi 'dogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Moreover, this consequence does not apply to those that are not momentary and are cooperative conditions.

original: skad cig ma nyid don gcig byed par nges pa'i mtshan nyid la lhan cig byed pa nyid 'dod par khas blangs so //
analyzed: skad cig ma nyid don gcig byed par nges pa'i mtshan nyid la lhan cig byed pa nyid 'dod par khas blangs so //
translated: We accept that being momentary and being a cooperative condition are synonymous.

original: gzhan yang skad cig ma med pa rnams la don gcig byed pas so sor nges pa bsal ba'i rgyu lhag pa ni gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gzhan yang skad cig ma med pa rnams la don gcig byed pas so sor nges pa bsal ba'i rgyu lhag pa ni gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Moreover, the additional reason that refutes the assertion that those that are not momentary perform a single function is stated in the line ‚ÄúMoreover, those that are not momentary.‚Äù

original: skad cig ma med pa dngos po gang yin pa 'di lhan cig byed pa mtha' dag dang ldan pa rang gi 'bras bu byed par 'dod pa yin na /
analyzed: skad cig ma med pa dngos po gang yin pa 'di lhan cig byed pa mtha' dag dang ldan pa rang gi 'bras bu byed par 'dod pa yin na /
translated: If you assert that any thing that is not momentary produces its own effect when it is endowed with all the assemblage of causes,

original: re zhig de dang de nyid ci'i phyir mi byed /
analyzed: re zhig de dang de nyid ci'i phyir mi byed /
translated: then why does it not produce that effect at that time?

original: rgyu gang gis de'i 'bras bu byed pa ngo bo nyid kyis de'i tshe byed pa yin no //
analyzed: rgyu gang gis de'i 'bras bu byed pa ngo bo nyid kyis de'i tshe byed pa yin no //
translated: Since the cause that produces its effect does so by its very nature, it would produce it at that time.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir sngon yang byed par 'gyur ba des na don gcig byed par so sor nges pa'i dngos por ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir sngon yang byed par 'gyur ba des na don gcig byed par so sor nges pa'i dngos por ga la 'gyur /
translated: Since it is the nature of that very thing to produce its effect, it would also produce its effect earlier. Therefore, how could it be a thing that is individually determined to produce a single effect?

original: ji lta ba de mthong ba la rigs pa gzhan btsal bas ci zhig bya /
analyzed: ji lta ba de mthong ba la rigs pa gzhan btsal bas ci zhig bya /
translated: What need is there to seek another reason for seeing it just as it is?üîΩIn that case, it is not reasonable for anything to be that way.

original: de ltar na thams cad la 'di mi rigs so snyam du gzhon nu ma len sems nas skyed pa mthong ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de ltar na thams cad la 'di mi rigs so snyam du gzhon nu ma len sems nas skyed pa mthong ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: When Kumarila thinks this, he says, ‚ÄúIt is seen that . . .‚Äù

original: gang gi phyir de nyid don gcig byed pa mthong ba des na mthong ba'i stobs kyis byed pa yin no zhes kho bos smra'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de nyid don gcig byed pa mthong ba des na mthong ba'i stobs kyis byed pa yin no zhes kho bos smra'o //
translated: Since it is seen that it produces a single effect, I say that it produces its effect by the power of being seen.

original: sngar byed pa ma mthong ba des na mi byed do zhes bya ba 'di mthong ba'i rigs pa'i 'thad pas ci zhig bya snyam na /
analyzed: sngar byed pa ma mthong ba des na mi byed do zhes bya ba 'di mthong ba'i rigs pa'i 'thad pas ci zhig bya snyam na /
translated: If you think, ‚ÄúSince we do not see that it existed earlier, we say it does not exist now,‚Äù what is the point of this reasoning that relies on seeing?

original: skad cig ma med par khas len pa la don gcig byed par ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skad cig ma med par khas len pa la don gcig byed par ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not established that that which lacks momentary impermanence performs a single function.

original: rang gi mthong bas 'bras bu byed pa de'i phyir 'di bshad par rigs pa ma yin no zhes bzhad gad byed pa ni mthu chen po can zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rang gi mthong bas 'bras bu byed pa de'i phyir 'di bshad par rigs pa ma yin no zhes bzhad gad byed pa ni mthu chen po can zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The response to that is ‚ÄúWhat is the point of this reasoning that relies on seeing?‚Äù

original: mthu chen po can gyi mthong ba ni nus pa chen por gyur pa'o //
analyzed: mthu chen po can gyi mthong ba ni nus pa chen por gyur pa'o //
translated: The response to that is ‚ÄúThe seeing of those with great power is of great ability.‚Äù

original: gang gi phyir khyed kyi rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po 'di dag ma tshang bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir khyed kyi rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po 'di dag ma tshang bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: Because your cause and effect would not be incomplete,

original: gal te rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir dngos po'i 'bras bu byed pa de nyid kyi lan cis na mi brjod /
analyzed: gal te rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir dngos po'i 'bras bu byed pa de nyid kyi lan cis na mi brjod /
translated: why do you not respond by saying that the effect of a thing is the performance of its function, since that is the nature of cause and effect?

original: gang gis 'bras bu byed pa mthong ba lan du byed pa yin no snyam na /
analyzed: gang gis 'bras bu byed pa mthong ba lan du byed pa yin no snyam na /
translated: If you think that the response is the seeing of the performance of the function,

original: rang gi ngo bo tsam gyis byed pa ni bdag nyid yod pa rtsam gyis rnam pa sna tshogs pa rnams la sbyor bar byed pa de ji ltar nus pa chen po tsam ma yin /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo tsam gyis byed pa ni bdag nyid yod pa rtsam gyis rnam pa sna tshogs pa rnams la sbyor bar byed pa de ji ltar nus pa chen po tsam ma yin /
translated: How could it not be a great power, since it is the cause of the various things by its mere existence?

original: 'dir 'ga' zhig gis kyang nus pa ma yin 'on kyang brgya la 'ga' zhig ci zhig ltar bsgribs pa'am mi sdod pa la //
analyzed: 'dir 'ga' zhig gis kyang nus pa ma yin 'on kyang brgya la 'ga' zhig ci zhig ltar bsgribs pa'am mi sdod pa la //
translated: Here, some may say that it is not a power, but rather that something is somehow obstructed or not present.

original: 'dir khyod kyi zhes bya ba @256a * //üîΩni zhes brjod pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir khyod kyi zhes bya ba @256a * // ni zhes brjod pa'o //
translated: Here, ‚Äúyour‚Äù is expressed.

original: mthong ba las 'das pa ni de las rgal ba'o //
analyzed: mthong ba las 'das pa ni de las rgal ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúBeyond seeing‚Äù means transcending that.

original: de dang gzhan du brjod pa 'di dag skyed pa'i chos de dang 'di ni mi skyed pa'i chos yin pa de'i phyir rgyud med par 'gyur bas 'di kho bo cag gi bsam pa ni sems la gdung bar byed do //
analyzed: de dang gzhan du brjod pa 'di dag skyed pa'i chos de dang 'di ni mi skyed pa'i chos yin pa de'i phyir rgyud med par 'gyur bas 'di kho bo cag gi bsam pa ni sems la gdung bar byed do //
translated: Since this is expressed as different from that, the dharma that produces this is not the dharma that produces that. Therefore, there would be no continuum, and this torments our minds.

original: gzhan gyis kho bo ni de'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gzhan gyis kho bo ni de'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Others say, ‚ÄúWe do not assert that it is that,‚Äù and so on.

original: kho bo rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bo spangs nas /
analyzed: kho bo rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bo spangs nas /
translated: We reject the nature of cause and effect.

original: dngos po rnams kho bo cag gis mthong ba'i dbang gis 'bras bu byed par ni mi smra ste /
analyzed: dngos po rnams kho bo cag gis mthong ba'i dbang gis 'bras bu byed par ni mi smra ste /
translated: We do not say that things produce effects due to our seeing them.

original: 'on kyang ngo bo nyid kyis de yod pa de la 'bras bu byed pa ngo bo yin pa de'i phyir rang gi 'bras bu byed pa de mthong ba 'ba' zhig mi skyed de //
analyzed: 'on kyang ngo bo nyid kyis de yod pa de la 'bras bu byed pa ngo bo yin pa de'i phyir rang gi 'bras bu byed pa de mthong ba 'ba' zhig mi skyed de //
translated: However, since that which exists by its own intrinsic reality produces an effect, it is its essence. Therefore, it is not that it sees its effect and then produces it.

original: de dag byed pa po'i rang bzhin du mthong ba ni ji ltar gnas pa'i dngos po shes par byed kyi med pa'i rang gi ngo bo byed pa ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de dag byed pa po'i rang bzhin du mthong ba ni ji ltar gnas pa'i dngos po shes par byed kyi med pa'i rang gi ngo bo byed pa ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: Since it is seen to be the essence of the agent, it causes the thing that exists as it is to be known. It does not cause the nonexistence of its own essence.

original: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas 'di yang yod pa bden pa zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas 'di yang yod pa bden pa zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The proponent of tenets says, ‚ÄúThis is also true.‚Äù

original: kho bo cag rigs pa la rjes su chags pa rigs par brjod pa la cis na btang snyoms su byed pa 'dir yang khyed kyis thams cad kyi tshe rigs pa brjod pa spangs pa yang ras 'ga' zhig rigs pa dang ldan par smra ba la dga' ba skye
analyzed: kho bo cag rigs pa la rjes su chags pa rigs par brjod pa la cis na btang snyoms su byed pa 'dir yang khyed kyis thams cad kyi tshe rigs pa brjod pa spangs pa yang ras 'ga' zhig rigs pa dang ldan par smra ba la dga' ba skye
translated: Since we are attached to reasoning, why are we indifferent to the expression of reasoning? In this case, you reject the expression of reasoning at all times.

original: ste / 'o na de ci yin zhes dris pa na /
analyzed: ste / 'o na de ci yin zhes dris pa na /
translated: If it is asked, ‚ÄúWell then, what is it?‚Äù

original: de dag 'bras bu skyed pa zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de dag 'bras bu skyed pa zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: it is said, ‚ÄúThey are the generators of the effect.‚Äù

original: 'bras bu skyed pa'i chos ni dngos po'i 'bras bu byed pa'i chos so //
analyzed: 'bras bu skyed pa'i chos ni dngos po'i 'bras bu byed pa'i chos so //
translated: The phenomenon that generates the effect is the phenomenon that produces the effect of a thing.

original: rgyu des na rkyen mtha' dag dang ldan pa rnams ni lhan cig byed pa'i tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu des na rkyen mtha' dag dang ldan pa rnams ni lhan cig byed pa'i tshogs pa'o //
translated: By that cause, those that possess all the conditions are the collection of co-operating causes.

original: gang dag 'bras bu mi skyed par btang snyoms su gyin 'dug pa ma yin par rtogs pa'i phyir khyed kyis rigs pa brjod pa 'di yang yod par bden no //
analyzed: gang dag 'bras bu mi skyed par btang snyoms su gyin 'dug pa ma yin par rtogs pa'i phyir khyed kyis rigs pa brjod pa 'di yang yod par bden no //
translated: Since it is understood that they are not indifferent to not generating the effect, this reasoning that you have stated is also true.

original: 'on kyang 'di dag 'di ltar blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: 'on kyang 'di dag 'di ltar blta bar bya ste /
translated: However, this should be seen as follows:

original: ci de dag mi sdod par skyed pa'i chos kyi ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: ci de dag mi sdod par skyed pa'i chos kyi ngo bo nyid do //
translated: Is it the nature of a phenomenon that generates without remaining?

original: ci de dag tha ma'i gnas skabs de kho na'i tshe ni tshogs pa'i gnas skabs su gang de ma thag tu 'bras bu skyed pa de kho na skyes pa yin nam /
analyzed: ci de dag tha ma'i gnas skabs de kho na'i tshe ni tshogs pa'i gnas skabs su gang de ma thag tu 'bras bu skyed pa de kho na skyes pa yin nam /
translated: Is it that at just that final occasion, at the occasion of the collection, only that which immediately generates the effect is generated?

original: yang na sngon yang phan tshun spangs pa'i gnas skabs su byung zin pa yang yin /
analyzed: yang na sngon yang phan tshun spangs pa'i gnas skabs su byung zin pa yang yin /
translated: Or, they are mutually exclusive states that have already occurred in the past.üîΩIf that very thing that is arisen is the agent, then, as was explained earlier, it is contradictory for it to be the entity of something that is not arisen.üîΩIf it is the entity of something that is not arisen, then it is contradictory for it to be the agent.üîΩIf it is the entity of something that is arisen, then it is contradictory for it to be the entity of something that is not arisen.üîΩIf it is the entity of something that is not arisen, then it is contradictory for it to be the agent.

original: de la de nyid skyes pa nyid yin na med pa'i ngo bo gzhan skyes pas 'di byed pa po nyid yin na ni sngar bshad pa'i skyon gyis 'jigs pas /üîΩgzhan gyis yod pa gang zhig yin //üîΩzhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de la de nyid skyes pa nyid yin na med pa'i ngo bo gzhan skyes pas 'di byed pa po nyid yin na ni sngar bshad pa'i skyon gyis 'jigs pas / gzhan gyis yod pa gang zhig yin // zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: If it is the entity of something that is arisen, then it is contradictory for it to be the entity of something that is not arisen.üîΩIf it is the entity of something that is not arisen, then it is contradictory for it to be the agent.üîΩIf it is the entity of something that is arisen, then it is contradictory for it to be the entity of something that is not arisen.üîΩIf it is the entity of something that is not arisen, then it is contradictory for it to be the agent.üîΩIf it is the entity of something that is arisen, then it is contradictory for it to be the entity of something that is not arisen.üîΩIf it is the entity of something that is not arisen, then it is contradictory for it to be the agent.

original: 'pho ba dang skyes pa ni 'pho @256b ba dang skyes pa ste de bkag pa ni mi 'pho ba dang ma skyes pa'i brtan pa gcig pu'i ngo bo gang dag gi dngos po de dag nam yang ngo bo nyid 'ga' zhig 'dir dmigs pa med pa 'gal ba'i
analyzed: 'pho ba dang skyes pa ni 'pho @256b ba dang skyes pa ste de bkag pa ni mi 'pho ba dang ma skyes pa'i brtan pa gcig pu'i ngo bo gang dag gi dngos po de dag nam yang ngo bo nyid 'ga' zhig 'dir dmigs pa med pa 'gal ba'i
translated: If it is the entity of something that is arisen, then it is contradictory for it to be the entity of something that is not arisen.üîΩIf it is the entity of something that is not arisen, then it is contradictory for it to be the agent.üîΩIf it is the entity of something that is arisen, then it is contradictory for it to be the entity of something that is not arisen.üîΩIf it is the entity of something that is not arisen, then it is contradictory for it to be the agent.üîΩIf it is the entity of something that is arisen, then it is contradictory for it to be the entity of something that is not arisen.üîΩIf it is the entity of something that is not arisen, then it is contradictory for it to be the agent.üîΩIf it is the entity of something that is arisen, then it is contradictory for it to be the entity of something that is not arisen.üîΩIf it is the entity of something that is not arisen, then it is contradictory for it to be the agent.üîΩIf it is the entity of something that is arisen, then it

original: phyir ro // skad cig ma rnams la ji srid du mthong ba'i ngo bo las gzhan du 'gyur ba de srid du de gzhan yin pa'i phyir mi 'pho ba dang / mi skye ba snga ma dang phyi ma'i ngo bo rnams brtan pa'i ngo bo ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: phyir ro // skad cig ma rnams la ji srid du mthong ba'i ngo bo las gzhan du 'gyur ba de srid du de gzhan yin pa'i phyir mi 'pho ba dang / mi skye ba snga ma dang phyi ma'i ngo bo rnams brtan pa'i ngo bo ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If the entities of the prior and subsequent moments are not stable, then the entities of the prior and subsequent moments are not different from the entity that is seen.

original: 'dir da ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: 'dir da ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: In response to this, the present verse begins with the words, ‚ÄúIf they are not stable . . . ‚Äù

original: 'di'i tshig 'di kho bo cag 'dra ba'i tshig yin no zhes mi 'dod na de'i phyir mi sdod par zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: 'di'i tshig 'di kho bo cag 'dra ba'i tshig yin no zhes mi 'dod na de'i phyir mi sdod par zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: If you do not accept that these words are similar to our own, then the response would be, ‚ÄúThey do not remain . . . ‚Äù

original: gang gi tshe 'di dag 'dis mtshungs par mi 'gyur ba de'i tshe lhan cig byed pa mtha' dag gi 'bras bu'i gnas skabs las sngar yang mi sdod par skyed pa'i ngo bo ni 'bras bu byed pa'i ngo bo mi thogs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe 'di dag 'dis mtshungs par mi 'gyur ba de'i tshe lhan cig byed pa mtha' dag gi 'bras bu'i gnas skabs las sngar yang mi sdod par skyed pa'i ngo bo ni 'bras bu byed pa'i ngo bo mi thogs pa'o //
translated: When they are not the same as this, then prior to the time when the effect is present, they do not remain as the entities that produce it. The nature of producing the effect is not obstructed.

original: 'bras bu mi skyed pa yang yin no zhes smras pa'i don ci zhig yin /
analyzed: 'bras bu mi skyed pa yang yin no zhes smras pa'i don ci zhig yin /
translated: What is the meaning of the statement, ‚ÄúThey do not produce the effect‚Äù?

original: reg pa can gyi bsams pa dngos po rnams kyi lhan cig byed pa'i nye ba dang mi nye ba la ltos pa'i byed pa po ma yin pa'i rang bzhin gyi rnam par gzhag pa dang / ngo bo nyid des mi 'pho ba dang / mi skye ba brtan pa gcig pu'i ngo bo nyid ma yin la /
analyzed: reg pa can gyi bsams pa dngos po rnams kyi lhan cig byed pa'i nye ba dang mi nye ba la ltos pa'i byed pa po ma yin pa'i rang bzhin gyi rnam par gzhag pa dang / ngo bo nyid des mi 'pho ba dang / mi skye ba brtan pa gcig pu'i ngo bo nyid ma yin la /
translated: The intention of the one who touches is that the nature of things is not an agent in dependence on the proximity or non-proximity of the cooperating conditions, and that it is not a nature that is immutable, non-arisen, stable, or singular.

original: sngar yang rang gi 'bras bu skyed pa'i ngo bo ma yin no //
analyzed: sngar yang rang gi 'bras bu skyed pa'i ngo bo ma yin no //
translated: And previously, it is not a nature that produces its effect.

original: 'on kyang lhan cig byed pa'i rkyen mtha' dag nye ba yin no zhes de'i 'dod pa'i dogs pa bsu ba ni /
analyzed: 'on kyang lhan cig byed pa'i rkyen mtha' dag nye ba yin no zhes de'i 'dod pa'i dogs pa bsu ba ni /
translated: However, all the cooperating conditions are proximate.

original: gal te de'i ngo bo nyid ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: gal te de'i ngo bo nyid ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: The anticipation of his objection is stated in the passage beginning with ‚ÄúIf its nature . . .‚Äù

original: de dag bsal ba ni 'o na ni 'ba' zhig kyang gzhan la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de dag bsal ba ni 'o na ni 'ba' zhig kyang gzhan la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The response is stated in the passage beginning with ‚ÄúIn that case, even the solitary . . .‚Äù

original: brgya la lhan cig byed pas rang gi 'bras bu skyed pa'i ngo bo 'ba' zhig dang de las bzlog pa'i ngo bo gzhan ma yin par ci'i phyir mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: brgya la lhan cig byed pas rang gi 'bras bu skyed pa'i ngo bo 'ba' zhig dang de las bzlog pa'i ngo bo gzhan ma yin par ci'i phyir mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If, in some cases, the nature of the production of its effect by the cooperating conditions is not solitary, and in other cases, it is not a nature that is the opposite of that, why is it not immutable?

original: dngos po thams cad tha dad pa //üîΩzhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: dngos po thams cad tha dad pa // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: All things are different.

original: dngos po tha dad pa ni dngos po'i mtshan nyid tha dad pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po tha dad pa ni dngos po'i mtshan nyid tha dad pa'o //
translated: Things that are different have different characteristics.

original: gal te de'i 'bras bu skyed par byed pa dang skyed par mi byed pas tha dad pa yin te /
analyzed: gal te de'i 'bras bu skyed par byed pa dang skyed par mi byed pas tha dad pa yin te /
translated: If they are different in terms of whether they produce their effect or not,

original: 'bras dang nas kyi sa bon bzhin du ji ltar dngos po tha dad par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'bras dang nas kyi sa bon bzhin du ji ltar dngos po tha dad par mi 'gyur te /
translated: then how could they not be different things, like rice and barley seeds?

original: ngo bo las gzhan pa'i dngos pos ni ma yin te gang gi phyir de tha dad kyang tha mi dad na rang bzhin med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //üîΩ'o na ni bdag nyid skyed par byed pa dang skyed par mi byed pa'i ngo bo spangs pa'i phyir rkyen gzhan pa'i ngo bo la ltos pa'i @257a * //
analyzed: ngo bo las gzhan pa'i dngos pos ni ma yin te gang gi phyir de tha dad kyang tha mi dad na rang bzhin med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro // 'o na ni bdag nyid skyed par byed pa dang skyed par mi byed pa'i ngo bo spangs pa'i phyir rkyen gzhan pa'i ngo bo la ltos pa'i @257a * //
translated: But they are not different things in terms of their nature, because if they were different but not different, then it would follow that they would lack any nature.

original: phyir skyed par byed pa dang / skyed par mi byed pa'i ngo bos de tha dad kyang gang las dngos po tha dad par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyir skyed par byed pa dang / skyed par mi byed pa'i ngo bos de tha dad kyang gang las dngos po tha dad par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: But if they are different in terms of whether they produce their effect or not, then they would be different things, because they would depend on the nature of other conditions.üîΩBut if they are different in terms of whether they produce their effect or not, then how could they not be different things, since they are different in terms of whether they produce their effect or not?

original: de gzhan la ltos pa'i ngo bo nyid tha dad pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de gzhan la ltos pa'i ngo bo nyid tha dad pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that is the characteristic of a different intrinsic reality that is dependent on another.

original: lhan cig byed pa nyid yin yang //
analyzed: lhan cig byed pa nyid yin yang //
translated: Even though they are co-operators,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says,

original: gal te dngos po gang yin pa 'di la lhan cig byed pa gzhan mngon par 'dod na nam zhig khyed kyi lan 'di mi slu bar 'gyur /
analyzed: gal te dngos po gang yin pa 'di la lhan cig byed pa gzhan mngon par 'dod na nam zhig khyed kyi lan 'di mi slu bar 'gyur /
translated: if you assert that this thing has another co-operator, then when will your answer not be deceptive?

original: de'i rang gi ngo bos nye ba yin pas ma nges par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i rang gi ngo bos nye ba yin pas ma nges par 'gyur ro //
translated: Since it is close by in its own intrinsic reality, it would be uncertain.

original: rang gi ngo bos ma yin na 'di dag yod pa ma yin te /üîΩde ltar na dngos po ni don dam par na de nyid gzhan gyi byed pa por 'gyur gyi de la byed pa po nyid du bshad pa ni rtogs pas sprul pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bos ma yin na 'di dag yod pa ma yin te / de ltar na dngos po ni don dam par na de nyid gzhan gyi byed pa por 'gyur gyi de la byed pa po nyid du bshad pa ni rtogs pas sprul pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: If it is not in its own intrinsic reality, then these do not exist.üîΩThus, in reality, that itself would be the agent of another, but the explanation of it as the agent is not just a creation of understanding.üîΩIt is not that the agent of another is not an agent, because it is not the case that the agent of another does not perform the action.

original: rtogs pa'i rjes su byed pa ni don byed pa gzhan med de bram ze'i bu la sreg pa nye bar btags ba sreg pa rag las pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rtogs pa'i rjes su byed pa ni don byed pa gzhan med de bram ze'i bu la sreg pa nye bar btags ba sreg pa rag las pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not the case that the agent of another does not perform the action, because the action is not performed by the agent of another.

original: de'i phyir phan mi 'dogs pa'i dngos po la 'bras bu ltos par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i phyir phan mi 'dogs pa'i dngos po la 'bras bu ltos par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, an effect does not depend on a thing that does not assist it.

original: de spangs pa nyid lhan cig byed pa rnams las 'byung ba'am /
analyzed: de spangs pa nyid lhan cig byed pa rnams las 'byung ba'am /
translated: Because it arises from the assemblage of causes and conditions, or

original: gang de rnams las kyang mi 'byung bas so //
analyzed: gang de rnams las kyang mi 'byung bas so //
translated: because it does not arise from them at all.

original: de dag kyang gzhan gyi ngo bos byed pa yin gyi rang nyid byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag kyang gzhan gyi ngo bos byed pa yin gyi rang nyid byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And they are not agents by their own nature, but by the nature of another.

original: des na thams cad du rang kho na byed pa po nyid ma yin la gzhan gyi ngo bos kyang byed pa po ma yin pa'i phyir thams cad du byed pa po med pas cung zad cig kyang 'ga' yang skyed pa med do //
analyzed: des na thams cad du rang kho na byed pa po nyid ma yin la gzhan gyi ngo bos kyang byed pa po ma yin pa'i phyir thams cad du byed pa po med pas cung zad cig kyang 'ga' yang skyed pa med do //
translated: Therefore, in every case, it is not the same thing that is the agent, nor is it the agent by the nature of another. Since there is no agent in any case, nothing is produced by anything.

original: de'i gang gi ngo bo kho nas dngos po'i 'bras bu byed kyi gzhan gyi ngo bos ni ma yin pas lan gyi go skabs med do //
analyzed: de'i gang gi ngo bo kho nas dngos po'i 'bras bu byed kyi gzhan gyi ngo bos ni ma yin pas lan gyi go skabs med do //
translated: Since a thing produces an effect by its own nature alone, not by the nature of another, there is no opportunity for a reply.

original: des na gzhan dang lhan cig dang gzhan 'ba' zhig pa zhes bya ba de mi g-yo ba nyid do //
analyzed: des na gzhan dang lhan cig dang gzhan 'ba' zhig pa zhes bya ba de mi g-yo ba nyid do //
translated: Therefore, the statement ‚Äúit is produced by another together with itself‚Äù is not tenable.

original: yang rang gi ngo bo gang gis skyed par byed pa 'di lhan cig pa dang lhan cig pa ma yin pa'i gnas skabs dag thams cad du yod pa de'i tshe rang gi 'bras bu skyed par byed pa yang brtan pa'i ngo bo sngon yang lhan cig ma yin
analyzed: yang rang gi ngo bo gang gis skyed par byed pa 'di lhan cig pa dang lhan cig pa ma yin pa'i gnas skabs dag thams cad du yod pa de'i tshe rang gi 'bras bu skyed par byed pa yang brtan pa'i ngo bo sngon yang lhan cig ma yin
translated: Moreover, if that which is the nature of the cause exists in all circumstances, whether simultaneous or not simultaneous with its effect, then the nature of the cause that generates its effect would be stable.

original: pa'i gnas skabs de kho na gang lhan cig pa'i gnas skabs kyi dus la mi sdod par skyed pa'i rang bzhin du 'gyur bar zad do //
analyzed: pa'i gnas skabs de kho na gang lhan cig pa'i gnas skabs kyi dus la mi sdod par skyed pa'i rang bzhin du 'gyur bar zad do //
translated: It would be the very nature of the cause that is not simultaneous with its effect, and it would not remain at the time of being simultaneous with its effect.

original: de'i phyir ji ltar res 'ga' zhig mi skyed par bral ba yin /
analyzed: de'i phyir ji ltar res 'ga' zhig mi skyed par bral ba yin /
translated: Therefore, how could it sometimes not generate its effect and be disconnected from it?

original: yang res 'ga' gzhan gyis smras pa rang gi rgyu 'di rkyen gzhan la ltos nas rang gi 'bras bu skyed pa na ngo bo nyid kyis skye'o zhes bya ba 'ga' zhig gis byed pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: yang res 'ga' gzhan gyis smras pa rang gi rgyu 'di rkyen gzhan la ltos nas rang gi 'bras bu skyed pa na ngo bo nyid kyis skye'o zhes bya ba 'ga' zhig gis byed pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Moreover, it is not the case that the cause itself, when generating its effect in dependence on other conditions, is made to generate its effect by something else, as when it is said, ‚ÄúIt generates its effect by its own nature.‚Äù

original: @257b lhan cig byed pa dang lhan cig byed pa ma yin pa'i gnas skabs 'di ngo bo tha dad pa rkyen gzhan la ltos nas rang gi 'bras bu skyed pa'i rang bzhin ni thams cad du med pa de'i phyir lhan cig pa nyid de yin na yang zhesüîΩbya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: @257b lhan cig byed pa dang lhan cig byed pa ma yin pa'i gnas skabs 'di ngo bo tha dad pa rkyen gzhan la ltos nas rang gi 'bras bu skyed pa'i rang bzhin ni thams cad du med pa de'i phyir lhan cig pa nyid de yin na yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚ÄúEven if they are co-present‚Ä¶‚Äù

original: rang gi ngo bo nyid kyis byed pa yin pa'i phyir dang de sngon yang yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo nyid kyis byed pa yin pa'i phyir dang de sngon yang yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are active by their own nature and because they existed previously.

original: rkyen gzhan la ltos pa de las thob pas de'i bdag nyid phul du byung ba mi skyed pa phan 'dogs pa'i mtshan nyid 'di mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rkyen gzhan la ltos pa de las thob pas de'i bdag nyid phul du byung ba mi skyed pa phan 'dogs pa'i mtshan nyid 'di mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Since they obtain that from other conditions, it is illogical that they would not generate a superior nature of their own, which is the characteristic of being helpful.

original: de lta ma yin na ha cang thal bar 'gyur bas 'ba' zhig 'bras bu byed pa sel bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na ha cang thal bar 'gyur bas 'ba' zhig 'bras bu byed pa sel bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, because of the absurd consequence of overextension, the refutation of the activity of the effect alone would not be established.

original: ji ltar lhan cig byed pa dang lhan cig byed pa ma yin pa'i gnas skabs kyi dngos po tha dad par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir rkyen gzhan la ltos pa'i rang gi 'bras bu byed pa'i rang gi ngo bo la yang gzhan gyi ngo bos byed pa po yin
analyzed: ji ltar lhan cig byed pa dang lhan cig byed pa ma yin pa'i gnas skabs kyi dngos po tha dad par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir rkyen gzhan la ltos pa'i rang gi 'bras bu byed pa'i rang gi ngo bo la yang gzhan gyi ngo bos byed pa po yin
translated: Because the entity that is a simultaneous or nonsimultaneous condition would not be different, the nature of the effect that is produced in dependence on other conditions is also produced by another nature.

original: te / rkyen gzhan dang nye bar rtogs pa'i dus su byed pa po nyid yin gyi sngon ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di'i don to //
analyzed: te / rkyen gzhan dang nye bar rtogs pa'i dus su byed pa po nyid yin gyi sngon ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di'i don to //
translated: The meaning of this is that it is a producer when it is recognized as being in proximity to other conditions, but it is not prior to them.

original: des kyang 'di res 'ga' zhig 'bras bu byed pa'i ngo bo ni thams cad du ma yin no zhes brjod na /
analyzed: des kyang 'di res 'ga' zhig 'bras bu byed pa'i ngo bo ni thams cad du ma yin no zhes brjod na /
translated: If you say that the nature of the effect that is produced sometimes is not always produced,

original: ji ltar thams cad du rang gi 'bras bu skyed pa'i rang bzhin du 'di bshad par 'gyur /
analyzed: ji ltar thams cad du rang gi 'bras bu skyed pa'i rang bzhin du 'di bshad par 'gyur /
translated: then how can you explain that it is always the nature of the effect that is produced?

original: 'o na ni de ltar ngo bo tha dad pa nyid du de dang de ma yin pa'i dus su sgrub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'o na ni de ltar ngo bo tha dad pa nyid du de dang de ma yin pa'i dus su sgrub par 'gyur ro //
translated: If you say that it is not always the nature of the effect that is produced, then it would be established that it is sometimes the nature of the effect that is produced and sometimes not.

original: de'i phyir skad cig ma rnams don gcig byed par nges pa'i mtshan nyid lhan cig byed pa nyid yin no zhes par nges so //
analyzed: de'i phyir skad cig ma rnams don gcig byed par nges pa'i mtshan nyid lhan cig byed pa nyid yin no zhes par nges so //
translated: Therefore, it is certain that the characteristic of the simultaneity of the moments is the certainty of their producing a single effect.

original: gzhan gyis gzhan dag skyon mtshungs par brjod par 'dod pa ni gang gi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa ni go bla'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyis gzhan dag skyon mtshungs par brjod par 'dod pa ni gang gi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa ni go bla'o //
translated: The opponent‚Äôs desire to express the same fault in another way is stated in the words ‚ÄúIf it is said . . .‚Äù and so on, which are easy to understand.

original: gal te skad cig ma rnams de ltar yang ji ltar mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gal te skad cig ma rnams de ltar yang ji ltar mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If the moments are like that, why is it not so?

original: ji lta bu'i skyed pa ni bshad zin to zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: ji lta bu'i skyed pa ni bshad zin to zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúThe kind of production has already been explained.‚Äù

original: lhan cig byed pa rnams kyis tha mi dad par skyed par byed pas mtha' ma'i rkyen gyi ngo bos nus pa nyid do //
analyzed: lhan cig byed pa rnams kyis tha mi dad par skyed par byed pas mtha' ma'i rkyen gyi ngo bos nus pa nyid do //
translated: Since the co-operating causes produce without distinction, they are capable by the nature of the final condition.

original: lhan cig skyed kyang skad cig ma gang dag sngon dang phyis dang so sor nus pa med do zhes bya ba 'dir de ji ltar skad cig ma la rung ba yin /
analyzed: lhan cig skyed kyang skad cig ma gang dag sngon dang phyis dang so sor nus pa med do zhes bya ba 'dir de ji ltar skad cig ma la rung ba yin /
translated: Even though they are produced together, the moments are not capable individually before or after. How is this possible for a moment?

original: gang la mtha'i skad cig ma skyed pa'i ngang tshul can gzhan du 'gyur /
analyzed: gang la mtha'i skad cig ma skyed pa'i ngang tshul can gzhan du 'gyur /
translated: For whom, the final moment has the nature of producing, there is a change.

original: mtha' ma'i skad cig ma las sngon dang phyi ma dang tha dad pa'i ngo bo gzhan du 'gyur te /
analyzed: mtha' ma'i skad cig ma las sngon dang phyi ma dang tha dad pa'i ngo bo gzhan du 'gyur te /
translated: It is different from the prior and subsequent entities that are different from the final moment.

original: tha ma'i skad cig mar gyur pa de nyid lhan cig byed pa'i rgyun gyis phan 'dogs pa'i ngo bo la ltos nas skyed pa'i chos ni ma yin pa'i phyir @258a * //
analyzed: tha ma'i skad cig mar gyur pa de nyid lhan cig byed pa'i rgyun gyis phan 'dogs pa'i ngo bo la ltos nas skyed pa'i chos ni ma yin pa'i phyir @258a * //
translated: Because the final moment itself is not a phenomenon that is produced in dependence on the entity that is assisted by the collection of its coemergent causes.

original: skad cig ma med pa'i phyogs la bshad pa'i skyon 'dir mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skad cig ma med pa'i phyogs la bshad pa'i skyon 'dir mi 'gyur ro //
translated: This error that is explained in the context of momentariness does not occur in the context of nonmomentariness.

original: skad cig ma ma yin pa'i phyogs la gang gis she na /
analyzed: skad cig ma ma yin pa'i phyogs la gang gis she na /
translated: In the context of nonmomentariness, what is the error?

original: byed pa po dang byed pa po ma yin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: byed pa po dang byed pa po ma yin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The text says, ‚ÄúThe agent and nonagent, etc.‚Äù

original: byed pa po ni tha ma'o //
analyzed: byed pa po ni tha ma'o //
translated: The final moment is the agent.

original: byed pa po ma yin pa ni de las gzhan pa de dag gi ngo bo'o //
analyzed: byed pa po ma yin pa ni de las gzhan pa de dag gi ngo bo'o //
translated: The other moments that are different from that are nonagents.

original: tha dad pa de yang tha mi dad par brjod par 'dod pa na gcig pa nyid du brjod la /
analyzed: tha dad pa de yang tha mi dad par brjod par 'dod pa na gcig pa nyid du brjod la /
translated: When it is asserted that those that are different are not different, they are said to be the same.

original: de ltar na byed pa po ni gang mtha' rgyu las skyes pa dang byed pa po ma yin pa rgyu gang yin pa de ni gzhan pa ste de yang tha mi dad par brjod par 'dod pa ni gcig pa nyid du bshad pa des na byed pa po
analyzed: de ltar na byed pa po ni gang mtha' rgyu las skyes pa dang byed pa po ma yin pa rgyu gang yin pa de ni gzhan pa ste de yang tha mi dad par brjod par 'dod pa ni gcig pa nyid du bshad pa des na byed pa po
translated: Since it is asserted that they are not different, they are explained to be the same.

original: dang byed pa po ma yin pa de dag gi ngo bo de dag chos can gcig la 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dang byed pa po ma yin pa de dag gi ngo bo de dag chos can gcig la 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
