original: de ltar de las skye ba yang gzhan yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar de las skye ba yang gzhan yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The effect of the assemblage is produced by the assemblage itself.üîΩThe effect of the assemblage is produced by the assemblage itself

original: 'on te lhan cig byed par phan tshun 'bras bu skyed pa'i rjes su 'brang ba'i khyad par gyi rgyu mtshan gyis gzhan pa'i khyad par mi skyed do //
analyzed: 'on te lhan cig byed par phan tshun 'bras bu skyed pa'i rjes su 'brang ba'i khyad par gyi rgyu mtshan gyis gzhan pa'i khyad par mi skyed do //
translated: Or, do they not generate a different effect due to the reason of the distinction of following the generation of an effect through mutual assistance?

original: rang bzhin kho nas de dag de la rung ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: rang bzhin kho nas de dag de la rung ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Because they are suitable for that by their very nature.

original: de'i phyir lhan cig byed pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /üîΩlhan cig byed pa rnams ni zhing dang sa bon la sogs pa phan tshun 'bras bu skyed ba rjes su 'brang ba'i khyad par de las skyed par rung bar rtag tu gnas pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir lhan cig byed pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / lhan cig byed pa rnams ni zhing dang sa bon la sogs pa phan tshun 'bras bu skyed ba rjes su 'brang ba'i khyad par de las skyed par rung bar rtag tu gnas pa ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚ÄúThe mutual assistance of co-existent causes is not always present.‚ÄùüîΩThe mutual assistance of co-existent causes, such as the field and seed, is not always present as the cause of generating a distinction that follows the generation of an effect.

original: gang gis rung ba'i gnas skabs ni rtag tu rjes su nus bas rtag tu rjes su 'brel pa zhing dang sa bon la sogs pa 'bras bu skyed pa dang rjes su 'brel pa'i bye brag ni skyed par byed pa'i bye brag las 'gyur na gang gi phyir khyad
analyzed: gang gis rung ba'i gnas skabs ni rtag tu rjes su nus bas rtag tu rjes su 'brel pa zhing dang sa bon la sogs pa 'bras bu skyed pa dang rjes su 'brel pa'i bye brag ni skyed par byed pa'i bye brag las 'gyur na gang gi phyir khyad
translated: Because the state of suitability is always followed by the ability, it is always followed by the distinction of generating an effect, such as the field and seed. The distinction of following the generation of an effect arises from the distinction of the generator.

original: par med pa las kyang khyad par gyi 'bras bu yang skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di dag spangs so //
analyzed: par med pa las kyang khyad par gyi 'bras bu yang skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di dag spangs so //
translated: And also, a special result would arise from a cause that does not exist.

original: 'di ga las she na /
analyzed: 'di ga las she na /
translated: From what is this known?

original: de yod pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de yod pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚Äúbecause of the existence of that, etc.‚Äù

original: de dag zhing dang sa bon la sogs pa rnams yod par rung ba'i yul dang nye bar phrad pa'o //
analyzed: de dag zhing dang sa bon la sogs pa rnams yod par rung ba'i yul dang nye bar phrad pa'o //
translated: That is, the existence of the field, seed, etc., is the condition of the presence of the object.

original: 'bras bu gsal bar mthong ba'i phyir ni 'bras bu skyed par mthong bas so //
analyzed: 'bras bu gsal bar mthong ba'i phyir ni 'bras bu skyed par mthong bas so //
translated: ‚ÄúBecause of the clear perception of the result‚Äù means because the production of the result is perceived.

original: med pa ni phan tshun phrad ba dang bral bas 'bras bu dang bral ba mthong bas 'bras bu mi skyed pa mthong bas so //
analyzed: med pa ni phan tshun phrad ba dang bral bas 'bras bu dang bral ba mthong bas 'bras bu mi skyed pa mthong bas so //
translated: ‚ÄúBecause of the absence of the result‚Äù means because the absence of the result is perceived when there is no contact between the two, i.e., when there is no contact between the cause and the result.

original: gal te 'bras bu skyed par nus pa'i khyad par du skyed pa ni thams cad kyi tshe ring bar gnas par 'gyur bas de'i tshe yang thams cad kyi tshe khyad par du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te 'bras bu skyed par nus pa'i khyad par du skyed pa ni thams cad kyi tshe ring bar gnas par 'gyur bas de'i tshe yang thams cad kyi tshe khyad par du 'gyur ro //
translated: If the special cause that is capable of producing the result always exists, then the result would always be produced, because the cause would always be present.

original: de yang de brgyud pas 'bras bu 'byung ngo snyam na de yod pa dang med pa dag 'bras bu skyed pa dang mi skyed par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yang de brgyud pas 'bras bu 'byung ngo snyam na de yod pa dang med pa dag 'bras bu skyed pa dang mi skyed par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If you think that the effect arises from that which is in the process of ceasing, then that which exists and that which does not exist would not arise and would not not arise, respectively.

original: de'i phyir lhan cig byed pa'i 'bras bu skyed pa ni nus pa'i khyad par las rung ba'i gnas skabs na skye'i thams cad du ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir lhan cig byed pa'i 'bras bu skyed pa ni nus pa'i khyad par las rung ba'i gnas skabs na skye'i thams cad du ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the effect of the assemblage of causes and conditions arises from the special power of the assemblage, not from all of them.

original: gang gi lhan cig byed pa logs shig tu gnas pa na thug pa med pa'i 'jigs pas khyad par grub par nye bar gnas @262b pa med do //üîΩde phan tshun thog mar phrad pa'i skad cig ma 'byung ba yod par sbyor ba ma yin pa nyid do /
analyzed: gang gi lhan cig byed pa logs shig tu gnas pa na thug pa med pa'i 'jigs pas khyad par grub par nye bar gnas @262b pa med do // de phan tshun thog mar phrad pa'i skad cig ma 'byung ba yod par sbyor ba ma yin pa nyid do /
translated: If the assemblage of causes and conditions exists separately from the effect, then the effect would not arise, because of the fear of infinite regress.üîΩTherefore, the effect does not arise from the assemblage of causes and conditions that exists separately from it.üîΩThe effect does not arise from the assemblage of causes and conditions that exists simultaneously with it, because the effect that exists simultaneously with the assemblage of causes and conditions would not be related to the assemblage of causes and conditions.

original: rgyu des na dang po'i khyad par gyi 'bras bu skyed pa dang rjes su 'brel pa'i lhan cig byed pa dus mtshungs pas phan mi 'dogs te /üîΩzhing dang sa bon la sogs pa mi skyed pa dang skyed pa 'di 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu des na dang po'i khyad par gyi 'bras bu skyed pa dang rjes su 'brel pa'i lhan cig byed pa dus mtshungs pas phan mi 'dogs te /üîΩzhing dang sa bon la sogs pa mi skyed pa dang skyed pa 'di 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The effect does not arise from the assemblage of causes and conditions that exists prior to it, because the effect would arise without a cause.üîΩThe effect does not arise from the assemblage of causes and conditions that does not exist, because that which does not exist has no activity.üîΩThe effect does not arise from the assemblage of causes and conditions that both exists and does not exist, because that which both exists and does not exist has no activity.üîΩThe effect does not arise from the assemblage of causes and conditions that neither exists nor does not exist, because that which neither exists nor does not exist has no activity.üîΩTherefore, the effect does not arise from the assemblage of causes and conditions.

original: des na tshogs pa'i gnas skabs bzhin du thams cad kyi tshogs pa'i gnas skabs su 'byung ba'i skad cig ma rnams kyang khyad par de skyed pa'i ngo bos mi skyed pa las tshogs pa'i gnas skabs na skyed pa'i phyir dper na skad cig ma rnams don gcig bar
analyzed: des na tshogs pa'i gnas skabs bzhin du thams cad kyi tshogs pa'i gnas skabs su 'byung ba'i skad cig ma rnams kyang khyad par de skyed pa'i ngo bos mi skyed pa las tshogs pa'i gnas skabs na skyed pa'i phyir dper na skad cig ma rnams don gcig bar
translated: For example, the moments are individually ascertained as the specific conditions of the production of a single effect.

original: byed pa so sor nges ba'i mtshan nyid kyi lhan cig byed pa de bzhin du brtan pa'i rang bzhin yang 'gyur te thabs thams cad zab pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byed pa so sor nges ba'i mtshan nyid kyi lhan cig byed pa de bzhin du brtan pa'i rang bzhin yang 'gyur te thabs thams cad zab pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Just as they are coemergent causes, in the same way they are also stable by nature, because all the methods are profound.

original: skad cig ma yin par smra ba na nad snyoms pa nyid la lhag par sems pa bzhin du de nyid la mchog tu byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skad cig ma yin par smra ba na nad snyoms pa nyid la lhag par sems pa bzhin du de nyid la mchog tu byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one asserts that they are momentary, then just as one focuses on the balance of the disease, one should focus on that alone.

original: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas skabs su gzhan bzhad gad byed pa ni kho bo ni yang dang yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas skabs su gzhan bzhad gad byed pa ni kho bo ni yang dang yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The proponent of tenets says, ‚ÄúI am not saying that they are momentary,‚Äù and so on.

original: gal te yang dang yang brjod kyang 'jig rten gyi rigs rtogs par 'gyur na brgya phrag smras pas ci zhig bya //
analyzed: gal te yang dang yang brjod kyang 'jig rten gyi rigs rtogs par 'gyur na brgya phrag smras pas ci zhig bya //
translated: If the world were to understand the meaning of the treatise by reading it over and over, what would be the use of writing hundreds of treatises?

original: lan gnyis dang gsum gzhan gyi don la mi 'jug pa la kho bo cag yang dang yang du rjod par byed pa la cung zad kyang yid skyo bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lan gnyis dang gsum gzhan gyi don la mi 'jug pa la kho bo cag yang dang yang du rjod par byed pa la cung zad kyang yid skyo bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: We are not at all tired of explaining again and again to those who do not understand the meaning of the treatise even when it is explained two or three times.

original: de ltar rgol ba la bstan bcos byed pas rnam grangs gzhan gyis la lar de nyid kyi don gsal bar byed pas zlos pa yongs su spong ba la 'bad pa de dag ni gnas ma yin bas yongs su ngal pa nyid do //
analyzed: de ltar rgol ba la bstan bcos byed pas rnam grangs gzhan gyis la lar de nyid kyi don gsal bar byed pas zlos pa yongs su spong ba la 'bad pa de dag ni gnas ma yin bas yongs su ngal pa nyid do //
translated: Thus, those who strive to avoid the fault of repetition by clarifying the meaning of the treatise in other ways in some places are just tired for no reason.

original: gal te skyo ba med pa de lhan smos shig ce na /
analyzed: gal te skyo ba med pa de lhan smos shig ce na /
translated: If you say, ‚ÄúExplain it again without being tired,‚Äù

original: gang gi phyir lhan cig byed pa rnams ni khyad par du mi skyed pa'i phyir lhan cig byed pa nyid don dam par na 'ga' zhig tu srid de /
analyzed: gang gi phyir lhan cig byed pa rnams ni khyad par du mi skyed pa'i phyir lhan cig byed pa nyid don dam par na 'ga' zhig tu srid de /
translated: because co-producing factors do not produce distinctions, co-production is not possible in any ultimate sense.

original: gang gi phyir skad cig dang po byung na sa bon la sogs pa de rnams med pa'i phyir 'bras bu skyed pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i khyad par du byed pa'i lhan cig byed pa spangs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir skad cig dang po byung na sa bon la sogs pa de rnams med pa'i phyir 'bras bu skyed pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i khyad par du byed pa'i lhan cig byed pa spangs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Because when the first moment arises, the seed and so on are not present, the cooperative conditions that would distinguish the production of the effect are abandoned.

original: 'on kyang don gcig byed pa kho na'i lhan cig byed pa rnams ni don dam par na lhan cig byed ba nyid du sngar bshad pa'i rigs pa rnams kyis srid pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang don gcig byed pa kho na'i lhan cig byed pa rnams ni don dam par na lhan cig byed ba nyid du sngar bshad pa'i rigs pa rnams kyis srid pa yin no //
translated: However, the cooperative conditions that perform only one action are ultimately possible as cooperative conditions, by the reasonings explained earlier.

original: de yang thog mar phrad pa la rten pa yod pa nyid yin na cis na lhan cig byed par mi @263a * //
analyzed: de yang thog mar phrad pa la rten pa yod pa nyid yin na cis na lhan cig byed par mi @263a * //
translated: Moreover, if they exist in the beginning, when they meet, why would they not become cooperative conditions?

original: 'gyur / gzhan gyis smras pa don gcig byed par khas blangs na de'i tshe so so'i gnas skabs de na skyed par nus par khas blangs pas de'i gnas skabs lha bur so so ba la yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'gyur / gzhan gyis smras pa don gcig byed par khas blangs na de'i tshe so so'i gnas skabs de na skyed par nus par khas blangs pas de'i gnas skabs lha bur so so ba la yang 'gyur ro //
translated: Another says: If one accepts that they perform one action, then at that time, one accepts that they are able to produce in their individual states, so they would also be individual cooperative conditions in their own states.

original: de lta na de'i gnas skabs kyang phan tshun khyad par med pa kho nar skyed do //
analyzed: de lta na de'i gnas skabs kyang phan tshun khyad par med pa kho nar skyed do //
translated: In that case, they would also produce each other's states without any difference.

original: de dag so so bas kyang de khyad par du byed na ji ltar thal bar mi 'gyur /
analyzed: de dag so so bas kyang de khyad par du byed na ji ltar thal bar mi 'gyur /
translated: If they are different, then why would it not follow that the effect would be different from the cause?

original: gang dag tshogs pa dang ma tshogs pa'i gnas skabs 'ga' zhig la khyad par yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang dag tshogs pa dang ma tshogs pa'i gnas skabs 'ga' zhig la khyad par yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is a difference between the states of the assembly and nonassembly of the conditions.

original: gal te yin na nyes pa ci zhig tu 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gal te yin na nyes pa ci zhig tu 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If that is so, what fault ensues?

original: de lta na 'bras bu skyed pa dang 'brel pa'i khyad par so sor byed par thal bar 'gyur ba de'i phyir khyad par las byung ba'i ngang tshul can myu gu la sogs pa'i 'bras bu'i khyad par bzhin du 'ba' zhig ba las lhan cig byed par 'gyur ro
analyzed: de lta na 'bras bu skyed pa dang 'brel pa'i khyad par so sor byed par thal bar 'gyur ba de'i phyir khyad par las byung ba'i ngang tshul can myu gu la sogs pa'i 'bras bu'i khyad par bzhin du 'ba' zhig ba las lhan cig byed par 'gyur ro
translated: In that case, it would follow that the conditions would individually produce a difference related to the generation of the effect. Therefore, like the difference of the effect, such as a sprout, which arises from a difference in conditions, the conditions would be co-operating causes.

original: zhes sems pa na 'di dag thams cad kyi lan btab zin to //
analyzed: zhes sems pa na 'di dag thams cad kyi lan btab zin to //
translated: We have already answered all of these points.

original: de lta na tshogs pa dang ma tshogs pa'i gnas skabs khyad par med pa kho nar skad cig mas 'jig pa yin no zhes gang brjod pa de ci khyad par tsam la ltos pa yin nam yang na 'bras bu bskyed par rjes su 'brel pa'i khyad par skyed
analyzed: de lta na tshogs pa dang ma tshogs pa'i gnas skabs khyad par med pa kho nar skad cig mas 'jig pa yin no zhes gang brjod pa de ci khyad par tsam la ltos pa yin nam yang na 'bras bu bskyed par rjes su 'brel pa'i khyad par skyed
translated: In that case, it is only when there is no difference between the states of assembly and non-assembly that it is said that it is destroyed by momentariness.

original: par byed ba la ltos pa yin /
analyzed: par byed ba la ltos pa yin /
translated: Is that which is said dependent on mere difference or is it dependent on the generation of a difference that is related to the generation of an effect?

original: gal te rdzas la sogs par rnam par rtog na ni de mi rigs so //
analyzed: gal te rdzas la sogs par rnam par rtog na ni de mi rigs so //
translated: If it is a conception of substance and so on, that is illogical.

original: 'ga' zhig khyad par tsam spangs pa'i gnas skabs ni mi srid de thams cad du rkyen gzhan dang gzhan rung ba'i rgyu mtshan gyis gzhan dang gzhan pa'i khyad par byung bas res 'ga' cung zad cig gcig pa nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig khyad par tsam spangs pa'i gnas skabs ni mi srid de thams cad du rkyen gzhan dang gzhan rung ba'i rgyu mtshan gyis gzhan dang gzhan pa'i khyad par byung bas res 'ga' cung zad cig gcig pa nyid ma yin te /
translated: It is impossible for something to exist in a state that is devoid of mere difference because in all cases, due to the reason of the suitability of other conditions, other and other differences arise.

original: rten dang grib ma dang nyi ma dang rlung dang grang ba la sogs ba bzhin du 'byung ba srid do //
analyzed: rten dang grib ma dang nyi ma dang rlung dang grang ba la sogs ba bzhin du 'byung ba srid do //
translated: Sometimes, it is not the same, but it is possible that it arises like a support, a shadow, the sun, wind, cold, and so on.

original: de yod kyang de dang 'dra ba'i rgyu tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yod kyang de dang 'dra ba'i rgyu tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Even though it exists, it is not a different cause that is similar to it.

original: 'di tsam du 'gyur te 'ga' zhig la lar 'bras bu dang rjes su 'brel pas yin gyi thams cad kyis thams cad la ma yin no zhes de yang sngar bshad zin to //
analyzed: 'di tsam du 'gyur te 'ga' zhig la lar 'bras bu dang rjes su 'brel pas yin gyi thams cad kyis thams cad la ma yin no zhes de yang sngar bshad zin to //
translated: This is the extent of it: it is related to some effects in some places, but not to all effects in all places. This has already been explained above.

original: bstan pa ni skad cig ma re re rgyan gzhan dang gzhan 'brel pas skad cig ma re re nus pa tha dad pa'i 'du byed rgyun dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: bstan pa ni skad cig ma re re rgyan gzhan dang gzhan 'brel pas skad cig ma re re nus pa tha dad pa'i 'du byed rgyun dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The teaching is that each moment is a continuum of formations with different potencies in each moment, due to the connection with other ornaments.

original: gal te yang 'ga' zhig las 'dra ba'i ngo bor rtogs ba de lta na yang tha dad pa kho na 'di dag ngo bo cung zad cig 'ga' zhig gi rgyu yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te yang 'ga' zhig las 'dra ba'i ngo bor rtogs ba de lta na yang tha dad pa kho na 'di dag ngo bo cung zad cig 'ga' zhig gi rgyu yin no zhe na /
translated: Even if one understands the similarity of some things, still they are only different. Some small part of their nature is the cause of some things.

original: skad cig @263b pa'i ngo bo rnams gzhan dang gzhan skyed pa la gcig pa med pa'i phyir zhes shin tu bsdus pa 'dir bshad pa dang / de ltar kho bo cag gis yang dang yang du brjod do zhes gnyi ga smos pa yang rigs so //
analyzed: skad cig @263b pa'i ngo bo rnams gzhan dang gzhan skyed pa la gcig pa med pa'i phyir zhes shin tu bsdus pa 'dir bshad pa dang / de ltar kho bo cag gis yang dang yang du brjod do zhes gnyi ga smos pa yang rigs so //
translated: Since the natures of moments produce other and other things, there is no oneness. This is the very condensed explanation here, and it is also correct to mention both, since we have stated this again and again.

original: ji ltar rnam pa gang gis dngos po'i rgyun la khyad par du skye ba de yang bshad zin to ;
analyzed: ji ltar rnam pa gang gis dngos po'i rgyun la khyad par du skye ba de yang bshad zin to ;
translated: We have already explained how the continuum of a thing is generated as a special state.

original: / de la skad cig ma snga ma ni rang gi ngang gis ldog pa kho nas khyad par can gyi skad cig ma skyed pas khyad par skyed pa yin no zhes bya'o //
analyzed: / de la skad cig ma snga ma ni rang gi ngang gis ldog pa kho nas khyad par can gyi skad cig ma skyed pas khyad par skyed pa yin no zhes bya'o //
translated: The prior moment is said to generate a special state because it generates a subsequent moment that is special, since it is destroyed by its intrinsic nature.

original: 'on te 'bras bu skyed par nus pa'i khyad par skyed par byed pa'i khyad par la ltos pas snga ma bzhin du thog mar phrad pa la rten par phan tshun khyad par med pa yin no zhes mngon par 'dod pa de yang mi rigs so //
analyzed: 'on te 'bras bu skyed par nus pa'i khyad par skyed par byed pa'i khyad par la ltos pas snga ma bzhin du thog mar phrad pa la rten par phan tshun khyad par med pa yin no zhes mngon par 'dod pa de yang mi rigs so //
translated: But if you maintain that the prior moment generates a special state that is capable of generating an effect, then, as before, it must be admitted that the prior moment and the subsequent moment are not different from each other, since they are not dependent on contact.

original: gang gis 'bras bu skyed par nus pa'i khyad par skyed par byed pa ni zhing dang sa bon la sogs pa ci 'dra ba'i bar du chod pa la sogs pa spangs pa'i yul nye ba na de yod pa nyid de /
analyzed: gang gis 'bras bu skyed par nus pa'i khyad par skyed par byed pa ni zhing dang sa bon la sogs pa ci 'dra ba'i bar du chod pa la sogs pa spangs pa'i yul nye ba na de yod pa nyid de /
translated: That which generates a special state that is capable of generating an effect is present in the vicinity of the field, seed, etc., which is free from any obstruction, such as an intervening wall.

original: yod pa de tsam gyi rgyu mtshan dang skyed par byed par rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: yod pa de tsam gyi rgyu mtshan dang skyed par byed par rnam par gzhag go //
translated: It is only because of the existence of that that it is posited as the cause and the producer.

original: rnam pa de lta bu de yang thams cad la yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ji ltar so sor yang 'bras bu skyed pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i khyad par 'di dag skyed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam pa de lta bu de yang thams cad la yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ji ltar so sor yang 'bras bu skyed pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i khyad par 'di dag skyed par 'gyur ro //
translated: And since that kind of existence does not exist for all, how could they produce this particular effect that is in conformity with each?

original: gang gi phyir 'ba' zhig pa yang 'bras bu byed par thal bar 'gyur ba de bstan to//
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'ba' zhig pa yang 'bras bu byed par thal bar 'gyur ba de bstan to//
translated: It is shown that the consequence is that even the isolated would produce an effect.

original: gang dag yul rung ba can de ni rung ba'i yul de las byung bas rung ba'i yul can no //
analyzed: gang dag yul rung ba can de ni rung ba'i yul de las byung bas rung ba'i yul can no //
translated: That which has a suitable object is one that arises from that suitable object, and so it has a suitable object.

original: de la sogs pa gang dag bar du mchod ba'i yul can la sogs pa'i gnas skabs tha dad pa de bzhin du bshad do //
analyzed: de la sogs pa gang dag bar du mchod ba'i yul can la sogs pa'i gnas skabs tha dad pa de bzhin du bshad do //
translated: And so on means that, like that, it is explained that it has a different state that is an unsuitable object and so on.

original: de yang de'i gnas skabs tha dad pa yang de skad du rung ba'i yul can ni bar du ma chod pa'i yul la sogs pa'i gnas skabs kyi bye brag zhing dang sa bon la sogs pa rnams kyis nye bar bskyed pa gang yin pa de ni 'bras bu
analyzed: de yang de'i gnas skabs tha dad pa yang de skad du rung ba'i yul can ni bar du ma chod pa'i yul la sogs pa'i gnas skabs kyi bye brag zhing dang sa bon la sogs pa rnams kyis nye bar bskyed pa gang yin pa de ni 'bras bu
translated: Moreover, the object that is suitable to be called the different states of that is the state of the object that is not obstructed and so on, and it is generated by the specific states of the field, seed, and so on.

original: skyed par nus pa'i mtshan nyid 'bras bu byed pa'i ngang tshul can te /
analyzed: skyed par nus pa'i mtshan nyid 'bras bu byed pa'i ngang tshul can te /
translated: That is the result that has the nature of producing the result, which is characterized by the capacity to produce the result.

original: rnam pa de lta bu'i sa bon la sogs pas thams cad du ni ma yin no zhes bshad do //
analyzed: rnam pa de lta bu'i sa bon la sogs pas thams cad du ni ma yin no zhes bshad do //
translated: It is explained that seeds and so on that have that aspect are not everywhere.

original: ji ltar 'di dag so sor yang rnam pa de lta bu'i khyad par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar 'di dag so sor yang rnam pa de lta bu'i khyad par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How do they individually become that kind of specific state?

original: 'di dag kyang sngar bshad zin to //
analyzed: 'di dag kyang sngar bshad zin to //
translated: They were explained earlier.

original: de la bar du chod pa'i yul la sogs pa'i gzugs dang dbang po la sogs pa'i tshogs pa gang yin pa de rnam par shes pa skyed par nus pa'i rgyu yin no zhes @264a * //
analyzed: de la bar du chod pa'i yul la sogs pa'i gzugs dang dbang po la sogs pa'i tshogs pa gang yin pa de rnam par shes pa skyed par nus pa'i rgyu yin no zhes @264a * //
translated: The collection of form, sense faculties, and so on that is the state of the object that is not obstructed and so on is the cause that has the capacity to produce consciousness.

original: brjod pa de yang dpe tsam yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brjod pa de yang dpe tsam yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That is said to be merely an example.

original: 'dir yang de la bar du ma chod pa'i yul la sogs pa'i zhing dang sa bon la sogs pa'i tshogs pa gang yin pa de ni 'bras bu skyed pa dang rjes su 'brel pa'i khyad par skyed bar nus pa'i rgyu yin no zhes rtogs pa kho na'o//
analyzed: 'dir yang de la bar du ma chod pa'i yul la sogs pa'i zhing dang sa bon la sogs pa'i tshogs pa gang yin pa de ni 'bras bu skyed pa dang rjes su 'brel pa'i khyad par skyed bar nus pa'i rgyu yin no zhes rtogs pa kho na'o//
translated: Here too, the collection of the field, seed, etc., which is not obstructed by anything, is the cause that is able to generate the special effect that is connected with the generation of the effect.

original: de yang rnam pa de lta bu'i khyad par gyi skyed par byed pa po khyad par dang ldan pa gang las skyes pa de ni de dag phan tshun nye bar 'gro ba la sogs pa rten dang rkyen gyi bye brag gang yin pa de ni de'i rgyu yin
analyzed: de yang rnam pa de lta bu'i khyad par gyi skyed par byed pa po khyad par dang ldan pa gang las skyes pa de ni de dag phan tshun nye bar 'gro ba la sogs pa rten dang rkyen gyi bye brag gang yin pa de ni de'i rgyu yin
translated: Moreover, the special cause from which the generator of that kind of special effect arises is the special basis and condition of their mutual approach, etc. That is its cause,

original: te skyed par nus pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: te skyed par nus pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the cause that is able to generate.

original: 'di dag kyang sngar bshad zin to //
analyzed: 'di dag kyang sngar bshad zin to //
translated: These have already been explained above.

original: de dag kyang zhes bya ba smos te 'bras bu skyed par nus pa'i khyad par gyi skyed par byed pa po khyad par dang ldan pa gang las skyed pa de ni phan tshun nye bar 'gro ba la sogs pa rten dang rkyen gyi bye brag gang yin pa
analyzed: de dag kyang zhes bya ba smos te 'bras bu skyed par nus pa'i khyad par gyi skyed par byed pa po khyad par dang ldan pa gang las skyed pa de ni phan tshun nye bar 'gro ba la sogs pa rten dang rkyen gyi bye brag gang yin pa
translated: The special causes are the conditions that are the bases of mutual approach and so on.

original: de ni de'i rgyu yin te /
analyzed: de ni de'i rgyu yin te /
translated: They are the causes of those effects.

original: skyed par nus pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩde lta na phan tshun nye par 'gro ba la sogs pa'i rten bdag nyid ji lta ba'i rkyen gyis rung ba'i yul la sogs pa gnas skabs las skyes pa de dag lhan cig pa'i ngo bo nyid du grub ba shes pa'i rgyu nyid du bstan to zhes bya
analyzed: skyed par nus pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro // de lta na phan tshun nye par 'gro ba la sogs pa'i rten bdag nyid ji lta ba'i rkyen gyis rung ba'i yul la sogs pa gnas skabs las skyes pa de dag lhan cig pa'i ngo bo nyid du grub ba shes pa'i rgyu nyid du bstan to zhes bya
translated: They are causes because they are capable of producing effects.üîΩThus the conditions that are the bases of mutual approach and so on are the causes of consciousness because they are the conditions that are the bases of mutual approach and so on.

original: ba 'dis 'dir yang rtogs par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: ba 'dis 'dir yang rtogs par bya ba yin no //
translated: This should be understood in the same way as the explanation of the conditions that are the bases of mutual approach and so on.

original: de'i phyir gal te 'di dag kyang phan tshun mi skyed na khyad par du mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gal te 'di dag kyang phan tshun mi skyed na khyad par du mi 'gyur te /
translated: If these conditions do not mutually produce each other, they would not be special.

original: rang gi rgyus byed pa gang gis bsal bar nus /
analyzed: rang gi rgyus byed pa gang gis bsal bar nus /
translated: By what action of their own cause could they be distinguished?

original: rang gi kho na las skye ba khyad par rnams 'byung ba ni phan tshun de'i yon tan mi byed do //
analyzed: rang gi kho na las skye ba khyad par rnams 'byung ba ni phan tshun de'i yon tan mi byed do //
translated: But arising from itself alone, the distinctions do not mutually create its qualities.

original: gang gi phyir phan tshun khyad par du rung bar bstan pa ni mdzes te /üîΩde dag 'bras bu skyed par rung ba'i khyad par skyed par byed pa rnams re re nus kyang cha shas kyi 'bras bu skyed pa'am ma lus pa re res byed pa ni mi rigs so //
analyzed: gang gi phyir phan tshun khyad par du rung bar bstan pa ni mdzes te / de dag 'bras bu skyed par rung ba'i khyad par skyed par byed pa rnams re re nus kyang cha shas kyi 'bras bu skyed pa'am ma lus pa re res byed pa ni mi rigs so //
translated: It is taught that they are mutually suitable for distinction,üîΩbecause although each of them is capable of producing the distinction that is suitable for producing the effect, it is not logical that each of them produces the effect of the parts or the whole.

original: ji lta bu'i 'ba' zhig pa rnams kyi bya ba dang byed pa po'i khyad par du ma chod pa la sogs pa'i yul gyi zhing dang sa bon la sogs pa can so sor re re nas nus pa'i dngos po las mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba
analyzed: ji lta bu'i 'ba' zhig pa rnams kyi bya ba dang byed pa po'i khyad par du ma chod pa la sogs pa'i yul gyi zhing dang sa bon la sogs pa can so sor re re nas nus pa'i dngos po las mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba
translated: How is it that the activity and agent distinctions of the mere things, which are not obstructed by the object such as the field and seed, etc., do not arise from the capable thing individually and separately?

original: de dag sngon yang med phyis kyang med so so ba'i ngo bos kyang med pas nus pa yang sngon dang phyis dang tha dad pa'i ngo bos 'byung ba'i nyes pa dag gis gos pa med do zhes bya ba 'di dag kyang lan mang du bshad zin to //
analyzed: de dag sngon yang med phyis kyang med so so ba'i ngo bos kyang med pas nus pa yang sngon dang phyis dang tha dad pa'i ngo bos 'byung ba'i nyes pa dag gis gos pa med do zhes bya ba 'di dag kyang lan mang du bshad zin to //
translated: We have already explained this many times.üîΩTherefore, since we do not accept that a specific thing has a self that appropriates it and is related to it, and since it does not follow that it is a specific thing, from what does the effect arise?

original: des na rnam pa de lta bu'i khyad par rang gi nye bar len pa can dang rjes su la @264b 'brel pa khas mi len pa dang 'ga' zhig pa las thal bar mi 'gyur bas gang las 'bras bu skyed par nus pa'i khyad par du skyes pas 'brasüîΩbur yang 'gyur /
analyzed: des na rnam pa de lta bu'i khyad par rang gi nye bar len pa can dang rjes su la @264b 'brel pa khas mi len pa dang 'ga' zhig pa las thal bar mi 'gyur bas gang las 'bras bu skyed par nus pa'i khyad par du skyes pas 'bras bur yang 'gyur /
translated: It arises from a specific thing that has the ability to generate an effect.üîΩIf you again assert that, how could it be obtained?

original: slar yang 'di 'dod par gyur na rnyed par ga la 'gyur gang gi tshe myu gu la sogs pa'i 'bras bu ni lhan cig byed pa phan tshun 'bras bu skyed par nus pa'i khyad par brgyud par skyed par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: slar yang 'di 'dod par gyur na rnyed par ga la 'gyur gang gi tshe myu gu la sogs pa'i 'bras bu ni lhan cig byed pa phan tshun 'bras bu skyed par nus pa'i khyad par brgyud par skyed par byed pa yin no //
translated: When the effect, such as a sprout, is generated from a specific thing that has the ability to generate an effect through mutual cooperation, it is generated through a continuum.

original: 'bras bu skyed par nus pa'i khyad par yang bar du chod pa la sogs pa'i yul gyi rim pa tsam gyis yin pa de'i phyir 'bras bu rnam pa gnyis so zhes bya ba smos te gang gi phyir de ltar rnam par phye ba de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu skyed par nus pa'i khyad par yang bar du chod pa la sogs pa'i yul gyi rim pa tsam gyis yin pa de'i phyir 'bras bu rnam pa gnyis so zhes bya ba smos te gang gi phyir de ltar rnam par phye ba de'i phyir ro //
translated: The distinction of the ability to generate an effect is due to the mere sequence of the object, such as the non-obstructed, etc. Therefore, it is said that there are two types of effects. Because it is distinguished in that way, therefore.

original: ji ltar 'bras bu rnam pa gnyis pa yin zhe na lhan cig byed pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: ji ltar 'bras bu rnam pa gnyis pa yin zhe na lhan cig byed pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: How is there a twofold effect? It is said that due to co-operation, etc.

original: lhan cig byed pa bar du ma chod pa la sogs pa'i yul gyi mjug thogs su skyes pa can phan tshun snga ma'i gnas skabs la ltos pa'i khyad par can gyi skad cig ma'i mtshan nyid kyi khyad par de na phyi ma phyi ma khyad par can dang
analyzed: lhan cig byed pa bar du ma chod pa la sogs pa'i yul gyi mjug thogs su skyes pa can phan tshun snga ma'i gnas skabs la ltos pa'i khyad par can gyi skad cig ma'i mtshan nyid kyi khyad par de na phyi ma phyi ma khyad par can dang
translated: That which arises immediately after the object, such as the non-obstructed co-operation, etc., has the characteristic of a moment with a distinction that depends on the previous state, and that distinction is superior in the later moments.

original: chos khyad par can la sogs pa'i skad cig ma'i dngos po'i ngo bo nyid skyed pa'i chos gang yin pa de'i bdag nyid kyi 'bras bu gcig pa dang gzhan ni de las bzlog pa'o //
analyzed: chos khyad par can la sogs pa'i skad cig ma'i dngos po'i ngo bo nyid skyed pa'i chos gang yin pa de'i bdag nyid kyi 'bras bu gcig pa dang gzhan ni de las bzlog pa'o //
translated: The effect of the same nature as that dharma which produces the entity of a moment of a special dharma, etc. is the homogeneous cause; the opposite of that is the heterogeneous cause.

original: gang lhan cig byed pa nye ba tsam 'byung ba ni phan tshun byed pa dang khyad par phan tshun byed pa la mi ltos so //
analyzed: gang lhan cig byed pa nye ba tsam 'byung ba ni phan tshun byed pa dang khyad par phan tshun byed pa la mi ltos so //
translated: That which arises merely from the proximity of the assemblage of its causes is neither a mutual cause nor a cause of distinction.

original: 'dir dpe ni myu gu la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir dpe ni myu gu la sogs pa'o //
translated: The example here is a sprout, etc.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni 'bras chan la sogs pa gzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni 'bras chan la sogs pa gzung ngo //
translated: The word ‚Äúetc.‚Äù includes cooked rice, etc.

original: mi sdod par skyed pa'i rgyu'i tshul dbang po gang yin pa de'i rnam par shes ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: mi sdod par skyed pa'i rgyu'i tshul dbang po gang yin pa de'i rnam par shes ba lta bu'o //
translated: The sense faculty which is the cause of the arising of a non-abiding consciousness, such as the visual consciousness, etc.

original: snang ba las mun khung du zhugs pa'i dbang po bsal ba'i phyir khyad par 'di dag yin no //
analyzed: snang ba las mun khung du zhugs pa'i dbang po bsal ba'i phyir khyad par 'di dag yin no //
translated: These distinctions are made in order to distinguish the sense faculty which arises from light from the sense faculty which enters darkness.

original: 'di dag ga las she na /
analyzed: 'di dag ga las she na /
translated: Why are these distinctions made?

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bo nyid tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bo nyid tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the nature of cause and effect is different.

original: 'bras bu 'ga' zhig rgyu'i tshogs pa dang nye ba tsam las skye ba'i rang bzhin dang de las gzhan pa ni de'i yongs su 'gyur ba la ltos pa yin no //üîΩrgyu rnams kyang cung zad cig rang dang nye ba tsam gyis 'bras bu skyed pa'i ngo bo ni rang gi rgyu kho nas yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu 'ga' zhig rgyu'i tshogs pa dang nye ba tsam las skye ba'i rang bzhin dang de las gzhan pa ni de'i yongs su 'gyur ba la ltos pa yin no // rgyu rnams kyang cung zad cig rang dang nye ba tsam gyis 'bras bu skyed pa'i ngo bo ni rang gi rgyu kho nas yin no //
translated: Some effects have the nature of arising merely through proximity to the assemblage of causes, and others have the nature of transformation in dependence on that assemblage.üîΩSome causes have the nature of producing effects merely through proximity to their effects, and others have the nature of producing their effects in dependence on a series of transformations.

original: gang gis phan tshun byas nas khyad par brgyud pas rang gi 'bras bu byed pa la ltos pa yin gyi gzhan pa ni de las bzlog pa'i rang bzhin yin no //
analyzed: gang gis phan tshun byas nas khyad par brgyud pas rang gi 'bras bu byed pa la ltos pa yin gyi gzhan pa ni de las bzlog pa'i rang bzhin yin no //
translated: The former are those that produce their effects through mutual action, and the latter are those that produce their effects in a series.

original: dper na cung zad cig 'bras kyi myu gu skyed pa'i ngo bo dang gzhan ni de las @265a * //üîΩbzlog pa ste /
analyzed: dper na cung zad cig 'bras kyi myu gu skyed pa'i ngo bo dang gzhan ni de las @265a * //üîΩbzlog pa ste /
translated: For example, some seeds have the nature of producing rice sprouts and others have the nature of producing barley sprouts and so on.

original: 'bras kyi myu gu skyed pa'i rang bzhin de ni nas kyi myu gu skyed pa'i rang bzhin ma yin pa dngos po ni rang gi rgyu'i stobs kyis 'ongs pa tshad mas rtogs pa'i rang bzhin la brgal zhing brtag par mi rigs so //
analyzed: 'bras kyi myu gu skyed pa'i rang bzhin de ni nas kyi myu gu skyed pa'i rang bzhin ma yin pa dngos po ni rang gi rgyu'i stobs kyis 'ongs pa tshad mas rtogs pa'i rang bzhin la brgal zhing brtag par mi rigs so //
translated: The nature that produces a rice sprout is not the nature that produces a barley sprout. It is not reasonable to challenge and investigate the nature that is understood by valid cognition, which is the nature that comes about by the power of its own cause.

original: gang dang gang skyed pa'i rang bzhin du tshad mas rtogs ba de ci thams cad kyi rang bzhin de yin nam /
analyzed: gang dang gang skyed pa'i rang bzhin du tshad mas rtogs ba de ci thams cad kyi rang bzhin de yin nam /
translated: If something is understood by valid cognition to be the nature that produces something, is it the nature of everything?üîΩOr is it only the nature of that?

original: yang na ni de nyid kyi zhes de ltar dpyad pa 'jug pa na /
analyzed: yang na ni de nyid kyi zhes de ltar dpyad pa 'jug pa na /
translated: When one engages in such analysis,

original: de la thams cad du de'i rang bzhin yin na ni phyi ma bzhin du sngon yang de'i 'bras bu byed par thal bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: de la thams cad du de'i rang bzhin yin na ni phyi ma bzhin du sngon yang de'i 'bras bu byed par thal bar 'gyur la /
translated: if it is the nature of everything, then it follows that it would produce its effect earlier, as it does later.

original: gzhan gyi ngo bos ni byed pa po ma yin pas rang bzhin tha dad do //
analyzed: gzhan gyi ngo bos ni byed pa po ma yin pas rang bzhin tha dad do //
translated: Since it is not a producer by virtue of being something else, there is a difference in nature.

original: 'bras dang nas kyi sa bon bzhin du byed pa po ma yin pa'i gnas skabs dpyod pa ni de kho na nyid sems par brjod do //
analyzed: 'bras dang nas kyi sa bon bzhin du byed pa po ma yin pa'i gnas skabs dpyod pa ni de kho na nyid sems par brjod do //
translated: Analyzing whether or not something is a producer, like a rice seed or a barley seed, is said to be reflecting on reality.

original: 'dre ba gzhan 'byung ba'i rgyu mtshan gyis gcig tu ngo shes pa yin te skra dang sen mo la sogs pa rnams bregs pa las skye ba bzhin du 'dir yang 'gal ba med pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: 'dre ba gzhan 'byung ba'i rgyu mtshan gyis gcig tu ngo shes pa yin te skra dang sen mo la sogs pa rnams bregs pa las skye ba bzhin du 'dir yang 'gal ba med pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: It is recognized as one because of the reason of the arising of another connection, just as when hair and nails, etc., are cut.

original: / gang gi tshe rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bo nyid tha dad pas 'bras bu gnyis su rigs par bya'o //
analyzed: / gang gi tshe rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bo nyid tha dad pas 'bras bu gnyis su rigs par bya'o //
translated: When the nature of cause and effect is different, the effect should be understood as twofold.

original: de la ni de ltar gyur na'o //
analyzed: de la ni de ltar gyur na'o //
translated: In that case,

original: lhan cig byed pa rnams ni zhing dang sa bon la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: lhan cig byed pa rnams ni zhing dang sa bon la sogs pa'o //
translated: cooperating causes are the field, seed, etc.

original: de dag phan tshun rgyun gyis phan 'dogs pa la ltos pa'i rgyu mtha' ma'i gnas skabs su gyur pa gang yin pa de ni myu gu la sogs pa'i 'bras bu gang yin pa de skyed pa'i rgyu mtshan gyi lhan cig skyed pa'i rkyen skad cig ma dang po'i
analyzed: de dag phan tshun rgyun gyis phan 'dogs pa la ltos pa'i rgyu mtha' ma'i gnas skabs su gyur pa gang yin pa de ni myu gu la sogs pa'i 'bras bu gang yin pa de skyed pa'i rgyu mtshan gyi lhan cig skyed pa'i rkyen skad cig ma dang po'i
translated: The final state of the cause that depends on mutual assistance by a continuum is the condition of co-arising, the reason for producing whatever effect there is, such as a sprout.

original: mjug thogs su skad cig ma gnyis pa'i dngos po khyad par can gyi ngo bo ni gang khyad par gyi 'bras bu skyed par nus pa'i dang po las byung ngo //
analyzed: mjug thogs su skad cig ma gnyis pa'i dngos po khyad par can gyi ngo bo ni gang khyad par gyi 'bras bu skyed par nus pa'i dang po las byung ngo //
translated: The nature of the special entity of the second moment arises from the first, which is able to produce the special effect.

original: de dang de dag lhan cig byed pa rnams thog mar phrad pa la rten pa'i phan tshun khyad par du byas pa'i khyad par gang yin pa de ni skyed pa can ma yin te phan tshun nye bar 'gro ba la sogs pa la brten pa nyid kyi rkyenüîΩgyi bye brag la de 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dang de dag lhan cig byed pa rnams thog mar phrad pa la rten pa'i phan tshun khyad par du byas pa'i khyad par gang yin pa de ni skyed pa can ma yin te phan tshun nye bar 'gro ba la sogs pa la brten pa nyid kyi rkyen gyi bye brag la de 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: That which is distinguished by mutual distinction based on the initial contact of those co-operating causes is not productive, because that distinction arises from the particular conditions of mere mutual approach, etc.

original: des na 'bras bu skyed pa dang rjes su mthun pa la sogs pa gang gi khyad par las skad cig ma dang po dang nye ba'i lhan cig byed pa rnams dang gzhan sgrub pa'i khyad par skyed pa nyid dang mtshungs so //

translated: The statement that whatever is the nature of that is produced by the nature of that is not indeterminate.üîΩThe statement that whatever is the nature of that is produced by the nature of that is not indeterminate.üîΩThe statement that whatever is the nature of that is produced by the nature of that is not indeterminate.üîΩThe statement that whatever is the nature of that is produced by the nature of that is not indeterminate.üîΩThe statement that whatever is the nature of that is produced by the nature of that is not indeterminate.üîΩThe statement that whatever is the nature of that is produced by the nature of that is not indeterminate.üîΩThe statement that whatever is the nature of that is produced by the nature of that is not indeterminate.üîΩThe statement that whatever is the nature of that is produced by the nature of that is not indeterminate.

original: de la rigs pa gang gis skad cig ma rnams la rgyu dang 'bras bu yod pa de ni skad cig ma ma yin pa rnams la mi srid par bstan pa ni zhar la byung ba nye bar bkod pa de rdzogs nas /
analyzed: de la rigs pa gang gis skad cig ma rnams la rgyu dang 'bras bu yod pa de ni skad cig ma ma yin pa rnams la mi srid par bstan pa ni zhar la byung ba nye bar bkod pa de rdzogs nas /
translated: The statement that whatever is the nature of that is produced by the nature of that is not indeterminate.

original: rnal ma brjod pa ni de lta bas na gang ga bdag nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rnal ma brjod pa ni de lta bas na gang ga bdag nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The natural expression is stated in ‚ÄúTherefore, what is the nature of‚Ä¶‚Äù and so on.

original: gal te ngo bo nyid kyis mi gnas pa'i chos nyid kyi dngos po la 'jig pa'i rgyu dgos pa med na ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa chos 'byung bar 'gyur ram zhe na /
analyzed: gal te ngo bo nyid kyis mi gnas pa'i chos nyid kyi dngos po la 'jig pa'i rgyu dgos pa med na ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa chos 'byung bar 'gyur ram zhe na /
translated: If the nature of things that does not endure by way of its own nature does not require a cause of destruction, then would the nature of endurance arise?

original: dngos po gnas pa'i chos can la yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te gnas pa'i chos can la ni 'jig pa'i rgyu dag cung zad kyang mi dogs pas de ni rang gi rgyu las yang dag par skye'o //üîΩbrtan ba'i @267a * //
analyzed: dngos po gnas pa'i chos can la yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te gnas pa'i chos can la ni 'jig pa'i rgyu dag cung zad kyang mi dogs pas de ni rang gi rgyu las yang dag par skye'o // brtan ba'i @267a * //
translated: ‚ÄúEven for things that have the nature of endurance‚Ä¶‚Äù and so on. For those that have the nature of endurance, since there is no fear of a cause of destruction, they are produced from their own cause.

original: ngo bo gang yin pa de ni gzhan mi brtan par skyed par su zhig gis kyang bya bar mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ngo bo gang yin pa de ni gzhan mi brtan par skyed par su zhig gis kyang bya bar mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Since that which is stable by nature cannot be made unstable by anyone,

original: dngos po'i bdag nyid mi 'gyur na /
analyzed: dngos po'i bdag nyid mi 'gyur na /
translated: if the nature of things does not change,

original: rgyun kho na la bdag nyid rang gi ngo bo yongs su gtong bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyun kho na la bdag nyid rang gi ngo bo yongs su gtong bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: then the continuum itself would not relinquish its own nature.

original: yang na rtag pa'i chos kyang gzhan du rtogs so zhes 'dod na /
analyzed: yang na rtag pa'i chos kyang gzhan du rtogs so zhes 'dod na /
translated: Or, if you maintain that a permanent phenomenon is realized as something else,

original: de'i tshe gzhan du rtogs na de'i ngo bo kho na rtag pa'i chos can gyi bdag nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe gzhan du rtogs na de'i ngo bo kho na rtag pa'i chos can gyi bdag nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: then, when it is realized as something else, it is not the nature of a permanent phenomenon.

original: mi rtag pa'i chos kyi ngo bo ni sngar med pa las phyis byung ba rigs pa yin pa'i bdag nyid yin pa de la ni res 'ga' 'byung bar mi rigs so //
analyzed: mi rtag pa'i chos kyi ngo bo ni sngar med pa las phyis byung ba rigs pa yin pa'i bdag nyid yin pa de la ni res 'ga' 'byung bar mi rigs so //
translated: It is reasonable that the nature of an impermanent phenomenon is a nature that arises later from what did not exist previously, but it is not reasonable that it sometimes arises.

original: de'i ngo bo nyid ma yin par thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i ngo bo nyid ma yin par thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: It follows that it is not its nature,

original: 'gal ba'i chos nye bar gnas pa ni tha dad pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad zin to //
analyzed: 'gal ba'i chos nye bar gnas pa ni tha dad pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad zin to //
translated: because it has been explained that the presence of contradictory properties is the characteristic of difference.

original: de ltar gyur na snga ma nyid rnam par rtog pa'i ngo bo ni mi brtan pa'i chos yin no zhes bya ba dang de la 'jig pa'i rgyu don med do zhes bya ba'i skyon rnams brtag pa snga mar zad pas sngar bshad zin to //
analyzed: de ltar gyur na snga ma nyid rnam par rtog pa'i ngo bo ni mi brtan pa'i chos yin no zhes bya ba dang de la 'jig pa'i rgyu don med do zhes bya ba'i skyon rnams brtag pa snga mar zad pas sngar bshad zin to //
translated: If that were so, then the previously stated errors would apply: ‚ÄúThe nature of the conceptualized entity is an impermanent phenomenon,‚Äù and ‚ÄúThe cause of its destruction is purposeless.‚Äù

original: yang na 'di brtan pa'i ngo bo nyid 'ba' zhig pa 'di snga rmi brtan pa'i ngo bo yin na ni 'jig pa'i rgyu las skye ba yin gyi /
analyzed: yang na 'di brtan pa'i ngo bo nyid 'ba' zhig pa 'di snga rmi brtan pa'i ngo bo yin na ni 'jig pa'i rgyu las skye ba yin gyi /
translated: Or, if the nature of this stability alone is the nature of prior stability, then it arises from the cause of destruction.

original: gzhan du na ldog par mi rigs so zhe na ;
analyzed: gzhan du na ldog par mi rigs so zhe na ;
translated: Otherwise, it is illogical to reverse it.

original: pha rol las zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: pha rol las zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The response to that is ‚Äúfrom another.‚Äù

original: 'jig pa'i rgyu yis gnas pa'i chos can de las gzhan gyi ngo bo nyid du gnas pa'i chos nyid kyi mtshan nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'jig pa'i rgyu yis gnas pa'i chos can de las gzhan gyi ngo bo nyid du gnas pa'i chos nyid kyi mtshan nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: The cause of destruction is the characteristic of the nature of that which endures as another nature.

original: de sngon gnas pa'i chos ni rang gi rgyu las yang dag bar 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de sngon gnas pa'i chos ni rang gi rgyu las yang dag bar 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that which previously endured arises from its own cause.

original: ngo bo nyid las pha rol po ni gzhan gyi ngo bo nyid de de ni grub pa dang ma grub pa'i phyir dang rgyu tha dad pa'i phyir ji ltar de'i ngo bor 'gyur /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid las pha rol po ni gzhan gyi ngo bo nyid de de ni grub pa dang ma grub pa'i phyir dang rgyu tha dad pa'i phyir ji ltar de'i ngo bor 'gyur /
translated: The other, which is another nature from its own nature, is not that nature because it is established and not established and because its cause is different.

original: gal te da'i bdag nyid du snang ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te da'i bdag nyid du snang ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is because it appears as its nature,üîΩthen that is not so.

original: 'dra ba las tha dad par mi rtogs pas de bzhin du snang bar 'gyur gyi gang gi tshe 'di snga ma'i ngo bor gyur ba las gzhan du 'gyur ba de lta ma yin na tshad ma dang 'gal ba gang gis zlog bar 'gyur /
analyzed: 'dra ba las tha dad par mi rtogs pas de bzhin du snang bar 'gyur gyi gang gi tshe 'di snga ma'i ngo bor gyur ba las gzhan du 'gyur ba de lta ma yin na tshad ma dang 'gal ba gang gis zlog bar 'gyur /
translated: Since it is not perceived as different from what is similar to it, it appears to be just that. But when it is not like that, when it becomes different from what it was before, then what contradiction is there to prevent it?

original: gal te gzhan gyi ngo bo yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te gzhan gyi ngo bo yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is a different nature,

original: gang zhig gzhan gyi ngo bo yin na de ji ltar de yin gzhan gzhan gyi ngo bo yin pa ni mi rigs te ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang zhig gzhan gyi ngo bo yin na de ji ltar de yin gzhan gzhan gyi ngo bo yin pa ni mi rigs te ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: then how can it be that? It is not logical that something is the nature of another, because that would lead to an absurd consequence.

original: gang zhig gzhan gyi ngo bo yin @267b pa de cis der mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gang zhig gzhan gyi ngo bo yin @267b pa de cis der mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If you ask, ‚ÄúWhy is it not that which is the nature of another?‚Äù

original: dngos po tha dad pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: dngos po tha dad pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúBecause of the difference of entities,‚Äù and so on.

original: dngos po gzhan pa nyid de gzhan pa'i ngo bor 'gyur ba la nyes pa ci zhig yod ce na /
analyzed: dngos po gzhan pa nyid de gzhan pa'i ngo bor 'gyur ba la nyes pa ci zhig yod ce na /
translated: If you ask, ‚ÄúWhat is wrong with saying that the difference of entities is the nature of another?‚Äù

original: de lta na zhes bya ba smos te //
analyzed: de lta na zhes bya ba smos te //
translated: he says, ‚ÄúIn that case,‚Äù and so on.

original: dngos po gzhan du 'gyur ba ni 'jig pa'i rgyu la skyes pa'i rang bzhin no//
analyzed: dngos po gzhan du 'gyur ba ni 'jig pa'i rgyu la skyes pa'i rang bzhin no//
translated: The transformation of an entity is the nature of what arises from the cause of destruction.

original: dngos po snga ma ni rang gi rgyu la skyes pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po snga ma ni rang gi rgyu la skyes pa'o //
translated: The former entity is produced from its own cause.

original: 'pho ba med pa'i chos la gnas pa ni gnas pa ldog pa la brten par mi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: 'pho ba med pa'i chos la gnas pa ni gnas pa ldog pa la brten par mi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The abiding of a non-transitory entity is not dependent on the cessation of abiding.

original: 'jig pa'i rgyus dngos po gzhan skyed par byed pa'i phyir de gnas pa'i chos la gzhan du 'gyur ba'i ldog pa med do //
analyzed: 'jig pa'i rgyus dngos po gzhan skyed par byed pa'i phyir de gnas pa'i chos la gzhan du 'gyur ba'i ldog pa med do //
translated: Because the cause of destruction produces another entity, there is no cessation of the abiding of that entity as something else.

original: tho ba la sogs pas dngos po gzhan 'byung ba na gzhan ldog par rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: tho ba la sogs pas dngos po gzhan 'byung ba na gzhan ldog par rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not logical that the arising of another entity through a hammer, etc. is the cessation of another.

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that would lead to absurd consequences.

original: de nye ba nas de skyed pa yin pa yang sngar bshad zin to //
analyzed: de nye ba nas de skyed pa yin pa yang sngar bshad zin to //
translated: It has already been explained that the arising of that is from its own cause.

original: 'o na ni zangs ma la sogs pa sra ba la sogs pa'i ngo bo 'jig pa'i rgyus zhu ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gzhan skyed pa mthong ba nyid de snga ma 'pho ba med pa'i chos ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ni zangs ma la sogs pa sra ba la sogs pa'i ngo bo 'jig pa'i rgyus zhu ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gzhan skyed pa mthong ba nyid de snga ma 'pho ba med pa'i chos ma yin no zhe na /
translated: But the nature of another entity, such as the fluidity of copper, etc., is seen to be produced by the cause of the destruction of the nature of solidity, etc. Therefore, the former is not a non-transitory entity.

original: 'dis ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'dis ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: To respond:

original: bshad ma thag pa'i sra ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bshad ma thag pa'i sra ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The nature of solidity, etc., which has just been explained,

original: sogs pa smos pas ni snyi ba la sogs pa bsdu'o //
analyzed: sogs pa smos pas ni snyi ba la sogs pa bsdu'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúand so on‚Äù includes softness and so on.

original: me dang grang ba la sogs pas zangs ma dang gser la sogs pa dag snyi ba dang sra ba la sogs pa rang bzhin gzhan skyed par rnam par gnas pa'i ngo bo zangs la sogs pa bsal zhing spangs pa yin te skyon mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: me dang grang ba la sogs pas zangs ma dang gser la sogs pa dag snyi ba dang sra ba la sogs pa rang bzhin gzhan skyed par rnam par gnas pa'i ngo bo zangs la sogs pa bsal zhing spangs pa yin te skyon mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Just as a fire and cold and so on produce a different nature in copper and gold, and so on, and remove and discard the prior nature of copper and so on, in the same way, the prior nature of copper and so on would be removed and discarded by a cause of destruction.

original: de lta na 'on te snga ma 'pho ba med pa'i chos la gnas pa med par mi rigs te de la ngo bo gzhan 'byung ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de lta na 'on te snga ma 'pho ba med pa'i chos la gnas pa med par mi rigs te de la ngo bo gzhan 'byung ba yin no zhe na /
translated: If you think that it is not possible for a prior nature to remain without being transferred to another, and that it is only a different nature that arises,

original: de la yang zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de la yang zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: then NƒÅgƒÅrjuna explains:

original: sra ba la sogs pa'i ngo bo can gyi zangs ma la sogs pa snga ma sra ba dang snyi ba la sogs pa'i ngo bo rang gi ngang gis 'jig pa can yin pa'i phyir 'jig pa'i rgyu dang 'brel pas zhig pa yin no //
analyzed: sra ba la sogs pa'i ngo bo can gyi zangs ma la sogs pa snga ma sra ba dang snyi ba la sogs pa'i ngo bo rang gi ngang gis 'jig pa can yin pa'i phyir 'jig pa'i rgyu dang 'brel pas zhig pa yin no //
translated: In that case, the prior nature of copper and so on, which has the nature of solidity and so on, would be destroyed by the cause of destruction, because it would naturally disintegrate.

original: me la sogs pa smos pas ni chu blugs pa dang grang ba dang rlung la sogs pa lhan cig byed pa phan tshun nye bar 'dus pa la sogs pa rten gyi khyad par gyis phul du byung bar skyed pa dang / nye bar len pa la rag las pa sra ba la sogs pa'i ngo bo can gyi zangs ma la sogs pa rang gi ngang gis ldog pa yin no //üîΩde nyid kyi phyir nye bar len @268a * //
analyzed: me la sogs pa smos pas ni chu blugs pa dang grang ba dang rlung la sogs pa lhan cig byed pa phan tshun nye bar 'dus pa la sogs pa rten gyi khyad par gyis phul du byung bar skyed pa dang / nye bar len pa la rag las pa sra ba la sogs pa'i ngo bo can gyi zangs ma la sogs pa rang gi ngang gis ldog pa yin no // de nyid kyi phyir nye bar len @268a * //
translated: The mention of fire and so on indicates that the special support, such as the addition of water, cold, wind and so on, generates the special quality of hardness and so on, which is dependent on the primary elements, and that copper and so on, which is dependent on the appropriated aggregates, naturally ceases.

original: pa'i rgyu dang me la sogs pa lhan cig byed pa'i rkyen gyis nye bar len pa khyad par du skyed do //
analyzed: pa'i rgyu dang me la sogs pa lhan cig byed pa'i rkyen gyis nye bar len pa khyad par du skyed do //
translated: Therefore, the special quality of hardness and so on is generated by the special cause of the primary elements and the special condition of fire and so on.

original: gzhan kho na ni sra ba dang snyi ba la sogs pa'i ngo bo gzhan zhig go //
analyzed: gzhan kho na ni sra ba dang snyi ba la sogs pa'i ngo bo gzhan zhig go //
translated: The nature of hardness and so on is different from the primary elements.

original: snyi ba smos pa ni nye bar mtshon pa nyid yin pas snga ma sra ba dang snyi ba la sogs pa'i ngo bo can gyi zangs ma la sogs pa rnam par gnas pa'i bdag nyid sra ba dang snyi ba la sogs par 'gyur ba ni skyes pa yin
analyzed: snyi ba smos pa ni nye bar mtshon pa nyid yin pas snga ma sra ba dang snyi ba la sogs pa'i ngo bo can gyi zangs ma la sogs pa rnam par gnas pa'i bdag nyid sra ba dang snyi ba la sogs par 'gyur ba ni skyes pa yin
translated: The mention of malleability is just an illustration, therefore, the essence of copper, etc. that exists as hard, malleable, etc. is generated as hard, malleable, etc.

original: gyi yongs su gyur pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gyi yongs su gyur pa ni ma yin no //
translated: but it does not transform.

original: gzhan gyis 'dir de ni zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: gzhan gyis 'dir de ni zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Another says: Here, that which is hard, etc.

original: ji ltar gnas pa'i chos can du gyur pa la 'jig pa'i rgyus mi brtan pa'i ngo bo skyed do //
analyzed: ji ltar gnas pa'i chos can du gyur pa la 'jig pa'i rgyus mi brtan pa'i ngo bo skyed do //
translated: is the basis of the state of existing as it is, and the cause of destruction generates an essence that is unstable.

original: des na 'jig pa yin no zhes su zhig gis smras //
analyzed: des na 'jig pa yin no zhes su zhig gis smras //
translated: Therefore, it is destruction. Who says this?

original: gang gis gang yang pha rol las gzhan du 'gyur ba'i phyir na gzhan gyi ngo bo yin no zhes brjod de /
analyzed: gang gis gang yang pha rol las gzhan du 'gyur ba'i phyir na gzhan gyi ngo bo yin no zhes brjod de /
translated: Since it becomes different from what it was before, it is said to be a different essence.

original: 'on kyang de rang gis gnas pa'i chos can kho na rang gi rgyu las skye ba ni mi brtan pa'i ngo bo yin pas 'jig pa'i rgyu las mi skye bar ji ltar shes rang gi rgyu ji lta ba rnams kyis rang bzhin gyis gnas pa'i chos can khoüîΩna skye ba yin no snyam na ni me la sogs pa 'jig pa'i rgyu mi srid na gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'on kyang de rang gis gnas pa'i chos can kho na rang gi rgyu las skye ba ni mi brtan pa'i ngo bo yin pas 'jig pa'i rgyu las mi skye bar ji ltar shes rang gi rgyu ji lta ba rnams kyis rang bzhin gyis gnas pa'i chos can kho na skye ba yin no snyam na ni me la sogs pa 'jig pa'i rgyu mi srid na gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not so, because things that naturally endure arise from their own causes, and they do not arise from a cause of destruction, because they endure without one.üîΩBut if you think that a thing that naturally endures does not endure when it arises from a cause, then it is not possible for it to endure without a cause of destruction, such as fire.

original: gang gi tshe rang bzhin gyis gnas pa'i chos can rgyu las skye bar 'gyur ba de'i tshe mi srid kyang gnas pa ma yin na ni de'i phyir de'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa'i chos can yod pa las rang gi rgyu kho nas 'di gzhan gyi ngo borüîΩnges pa yin gyi /
analyzed: gang gi tshe rang bzhin gyis gnas pa'i chos can rgyu las skye bar 'gyur ba de'i tshe mi srid kyang gnas pa ma yin na ni de'i phyir de'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa'i chos can yod pa las rang gi rgyu kho nas 'di gzhan gyi ngo bor nges pa yin gyi /
translated: But if it does not endure, then it is certain that it is the nature of a thing that naturally endures to become something else through its own cause.

original: dper na me la sogs pa gzhan dang 'gal ba las 'jig par bdag nyid kyis snyams su myong ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na me la sogs pa gzhan dang 'gal ba las 'jig par bdag nyid kyis snyams su myong ba bzhin no //
translated: For example, you experience that fire and so on are destroyed by something else.

original: gzhan gyis zhes bya ba ni las su bya ba'i lnga pa dbye ba brjod pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan gyis zhes bya ba ni las su bya ba'i lnga pa dbye ba brjod pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúFrom another‚Äù is the fifth case, the dative, which expresses separation.

original: gzhan la ltos so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gzhan la ltos so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is ‚Äúin dependence on another.‚Äù

original: rang gi rgyu rnams kyis 'di'i ngo bo nges par bskyed pa yin te /
analyzed: rang gi rgyu rnams kyis 'di'i ngo bo nges par bskyed pa yin te /
translated: The nature of this is definitely generated from its own causes,

original: dper na khyed kyi 'gal ba la ltos nas rang nyid ldog par 'gyur ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na khyed kyi 'gal ba la ltos nas rang nyid ldog par 'gyur ba bzhin no //
translated: just as, for example, your contradiction is itself reversed in dependence on another.

original: de skad du /
analyzed: de skad du /
translated: Thus it is said:

original: de yi ngo bo yod pa yang //üîΩgang la ltos nas ldog 'gyur ba //
analyzed: de yi ngo bo yod pa yang // gang la ltos nas ldog 'gyur ba //
translated: The existence of its natureüîΩin dependence on anotherüîΩis like the hammer, etc.

original: dper na gzhan gyi 'gal ba dag / brjod bzhin tho ba la sogs yin //üîΩzhes bshad do //
analyzed: dper na gzhan gyi 'gal ba dag / brjod bzhin tho ba la sogs yin // zhes bshad do //
translated: that are said to be the contradiction of another.

original: gal te 'jigs pa ni 'gal ba dang nye ba na rang nyid ldog pa yin @268b na rgyu med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te 'jigs pa ni 'gal ba dang nye ba na rang nyid ldog pa yin @268b na rgyu med par 'gyur ro //
translated: If destruction is the reversal of itself when it is near to the contradiction of non-destruction, it would be causeless.

original: rgyu med pa yin na yul dang dus dang ngo bo nyid nges pa mi rigs pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: rgyu med pa yin na yul dang dus dang ngo bo nyid nges pa mi rigs pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: If it is causeless, is it not illogical that it is restricted to a particular place, time, and entity?

original: de ni zhes bya ba smos te 'jig pa zhes bya ba 'jig pa can las gang gis gzhan pa'i ngo bo ni 'gyur ba med do //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba smos te 'jig pa zhes bya ba 'jig pa can las gang gis gzhan pa'i ngo bo ni 'gyur ba med do //
translated: He says, ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to destruction. The nature of that which is different from the thing that is destroyed is not impermanent.

original: 'on kyang dngos po 'pho ba kho na 'jig pa yin te yang rang bzhin med pa'i phyir rgyu dang ldan pa mi rigs so //
analyzed: 'on kyang dngos po 'pho ba kho na 'jig pa yin te yang rang bzhin med pa'i phyir rgyu dang ldan pa mi rigs so //
translated: However, it is only the transference of an entity that is destruction, because it is devoid of intrinsic reality, it is not reasonable that it has a cause.

original: de ni de'i ma yin la 'ba' zhig pa ni rang nyid kho na ma yin pa de'i phyir 'byung ba med pas gang gi rgyu dang ldan par rtogs par bya /
analyzed: de ni de'i ma yin la 'ba' zhig pa ni rang nyid kho na ma yin pa de'i phyir 'byung ba med pas gang gi rgyu dang ldan par rtogs par bya /
translated: It is not that, and it is not just itself, therefore, since there is no origination, how could it be understood to have a cause?

original: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas lan ni 'di ni zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas lan ni 'di ni zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The proponent of tenets responds: This is said.

original: rnam par rtog pa gnyis las mi 'da'o zhes bshad zin to //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa gnyis las mi 'da'o zhes bshad zin to //
translated: It does not transcend the two misconceptions, as has already been explained.

original: rnam par rtog pa gnyis ci 'dra ba zhig ce na /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa gnyis ci 'dra ba zhig ce na /
translated: What are the two misconceptions like?

original: ci dngos po'i ngo bo rtog pa zhig gam zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: ci dngos po'i ngo bo rtog pa zhig gam zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: It is said, for example, ‚ÄúIs it the nature of an entity that is conceived?‚Äù

original: 'on te dus gzhan zhig tu gnas pa'i chos can du khas len pas rtag par rnam par rtog pa'i go skabs med do zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: 'on te dus gzhan zhig tu gnas pa'i chos can du khas len pas rtag par rnam par rtog pa'i go skabs med do zhe na ma yin te /
translated: If it is accepted that the subject endures at another time, there is no opportunity for the misconception of permanence.

original: de khas blangs na yang rtag pa nyid khas blangs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de khas blangs na yang rtag pa nyid khas blangs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Even if that is accepted, permanence would be accepted.

original: de lta na gang gi tshe logs shig tu gnas pa'i chos 'dir rang gis rgyu rnams kyi skyed pa de'i tshe lo gcig rdzogs pa gang yin pa phyi ma'i dus kyi lor gnas pa'i chos kyi ngo bo yin no //üîΩgang gi phyir 'di lor gnas pa de'i mtha' yang de nyid yin pa de'i phyir lo gzhan du gnas pa de'i mtha' yang thog mar lor gnas pa'i chos kyi ngo bo yongs su spangs pas lo gzhan du gnas par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na gang gi tshe logs shig tu gnas pa'i chos 'dir rang gis rgyu rnams kyi skyed pa de'i tshe lo gcig rdzogs pa gang yin pa phyi ma'i dus kyi lor gnas pa'i chos kyi ngo bo yin no // gang gi phyir 'di lor gnas pa de'i mtha' yang de nyid yin pa de'i phyir lo gzhan du gnas pa de'i mtha' yang thog mar lor gnas pa'i chos kyi ngo bo yongs su spangs pas lo gzhan du gnas par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In that case, when this phenomenon that exists separately is generated by its own causes, at that time, the entity of the phenomenon that exists in the later year, when the first year is completed, is the same.üîΩBecause the end of that which exists in the first year is that itself, therefore, the end of that which exists in the other year would also be the entity of the phenomenon that exists in the first year, and it follows that it would exist in the other year, having relinquished the first year.

original: dus gzhan du gnas pa'i chos su khas blangs kyang rtag pa khas blangs par 'gyur pas rtag pa'i rnam par rtog pa spang bar dka'o //
analyzed: dus gzhan du gnas pa'i chos su khas blangs kyang rtag pa khas blangs par 'gyur pas rtag pa'i rnam par rtog pa spang bar dka'o //
translated: Even if one accepts that the phenomenon that exists in another time is different, one would still accept that it is permanent, and therefore it is difficult to abandon the conception of permanence.

original: 'jig pa'i rgyu dang nye ba las rang nyid ldog pa yin no zhes khas blangs pas mi rtag pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang 'jig pa'i bdag nyid kyi rnam par yin pa de lta na 'jig pa'i rgyur mngon par 'dod pa nye bar rang nyid 'jig pa'i ngo
analyzed: 'jig pa'i rgyu dang nye ba las rang nyid ldog pa yin no zhes khas blangs pas mi rtag pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang 'jig pa'i bdag nyid kyi rnam par yin pa de lta na 'jig pa'i rgyur mngon par 'dod pa nye bar rang nyid 'jig pa'i ngo
translated: But since you accept that it ceases due to being near the cause of destruction, then the conception of impermanence and the nature of destruction would be the same.

original: bo gang yin pa de nyid yod pa'i ngo bor gcig pa'i phyir skyes pa tsam de nyid na 'jig par thal bar 'gyur bas ji ltar dus gzhan du gnas pa'i chos nyid srid pa yin /
analyzed: bo gang yin pa de nyid yod pa'i ngo bor gcig pa'i phyir skyes pa tsam de nyid na 'jig par thal bar 'gyur bas ji ltar dus gzhan du gnas pa'i chos nyid srid pa yin /
translated: In that case, since the cause of destruction is manifestly asserted to be the nature of self-destruction, and since that which exists is the same entity as that which is, it follows that it would be destroyed as soon as it arises. How could it be possible for it to endure for another moment?

original: de ltar brtag par byas na phyi ma'i rnam par rtog pa khas blangs pas dus gzhan du gnas pa 'di spang pa'i phyir rtag @269a * //üîΩpa nyid 'dir khas blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar brtag par byas na phyi ma'i rnam par rtog pa khas blangs pas dus gzhan du gnas pa 'di spang pa'i phyir rtag @269a * //üîΩpa nyid 'dir khas blang bar bya'o //
translated: If you analyze it in this way, since you accept the latter conception, in order to abandon endurance for another moment, you must accept permanence.

original: de la 'jig pa'i rgyu dang nye ba las rang nyid 'jig par 'gyur ba ji ltar dus gzhan khas blangs pa sngar ni rtag par gyur pa nyid la phyis ni mi rtag pa 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin du brjod par 'gyur ro zhes de ltar rnam pa gnyis brjodüîΩpar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la 'jig pa'i rgyu dang nye ba las rang nyid 'jig par 'gyur ba ji ltar dus gzhan khas blangs pa sngar ni rtag par gyur pa nyid la phyis ni mi rtag pa 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin du brjod par 'gyur ro zhes de ltar rnam pa gnyis brjod par 'gyur ro //
translated: Previously, it is accepted that it is permanent, but later it is said to have the nature of impermanence.üîΩAgain, it is said that the two modes are expressed:

original: yang smos pa ni phyi ma rtogs par gyur pa nyid la phyis ni mi rtag pa 'jig pa'i rang bzhin du brjod par 'gyur ro zhes de ltar rnam pa gnyis brjod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang smos pa ni phyi ma rtogs par gyur pa nyid la phyis ni mi rtag pa 'jig pa'i rang bzhin du brjod par 'gyur ro zhes de ltar rnam pa gnyis brjod par 'gyur ro //
translated: Later, it is accepted that it is impermanent, but later it is said to have the nature of destruction.

original: yang smos pa ni phyi ma la ltos pa'o //
analyzed: yang smos pa ni phyi ma la ltos pa'o //
translated: Again, the latter is dependent on the former.

original: gnyis su 'gyur pa ji 'dra ba zhig ce na /
analyzed: gnyis su 'gyur pa ji 'dra ba zhig ce na /
translated: What is the twofold mode?

original: rtag pa dang mi rtag pa'i rang bzhin tha dad pa gang yin pa de ltar 'di sngar rtag pa'i ngo bo gang yin pa de ni rtag par mngon par 'dod la /
analyzed: rtag pa dang mi rtag pa'i rang bzhin tha dad pa gang yin pa de ltar 'di sngar rtag pa'i ngo bo gang yin pa de ni rtag par mngon par 'dod la /
translated: Whatever is the nature of the different states of permanence and impermanence, in that way, whatever was previously the nature of permanence is asserted to be permanent.

original: rang nyid phyi nas zhig par brjod pa ni thams cad du skad cig ma re re kho na'i 'jig par brjod do //
analyzed: rang nyid phyi nas zhig par brjod pa ni thams cad du skad cig ma re re kho na'i 'jig par brjod do //
translated: The statement ‚Äúit is destroyed from the outside‚Äù means that it is destroyed in every instant.

original: de ltar ma yin na sngar bshad pa rigs pas phyis 'jig par mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar ma yin na sngar bshad pa rigs pas phyis 'jig par mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If it were not so, then it would be impossible for it to be destroyed later, as was explained earlier.üîΩOr, if it were not destroyed in every instant, then it would be impossible for it to be destroyed later.üîΩThus, it is said that it would never be destroyed.

original: yang na skad cig ma re re 'di 'jig par mi 'gyur ba de'i tshe phyis kyang de mi rigs pas thams cad du mi 'jig par rab tu smras zin pas snga ma la rtag par mngon par 'dod pa'i rang bzhin la 'jig pa'i rgyu nus pa thogs paüîΩmed pa des ci yang mi byed pa nyid do //
analyzed: yang na skad cig ma re re 'di 'jig par mi 'gyur ba de'i tshe phyis kyang de mi rigs pas thams cad du mi 'jig par rab tu smras zin pas snga ma la rtag par mngon par 'dod pa'i rang bzhin la 'jig pa'i rgyu nus pa thogs pa med pa des ci yang mi byed pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, the cause of destruction would be completely ineffective with regard to the nature that is asserted to be permanent.

original: 'o na 'jig pa'i rgyu nyid la nus pa med par gzhan gyis khas mi len gyi 'gal ba dang nye ba la ltos nas rang nyid 'jig par khas len to zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na 'jig pa'i rgyu nyid la nus pa med par gzhan gyis khas mi len gyi 'gal ba dang nye ba la ltos nas rang nyid 'jig par khas len to zhe na /
translated: Now, suppose someone said that the cause of destruction is not accepted as ineffective, but that it is accepted that it destroys itself in dependence on that which is to be destroyed and that which is near.

original: 'jig pa de nyid kyi rgyu mtshan ma yin par thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig pa de nyid kyi rgyu mtshan ma yin par thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It follows that the cause of destruction would not be the reason for that destruction.

original: de lta ma yin ba cung zad cig byed pa med do zhes bya ba 'di rgyu yod pa la ltos pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin ba cung zad cig byed pa med do zhes bya ba 'di rgyu yod pa la ltos pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is the definition of that which is dependent on the existence of a cause.

original: gal te rang gi rgyu kho na'i 'di nyes pa yin te /
analyzed: gal te rang gi rgyu kho na'i 'di nyes pa yin te /
translated: If you say that this is the fault of its own cause,

original: gang cung zad cig byed pa med kyang de la ltos na 'jig pa yin no //
analyzed: gang cung zad cig byed pa med kyang de la ltos na 'jig pa yin no //
translated: then it would be destroyed even though it does not perform the slightest function.

original: slar yang gnas pa ma yin pa la mngon par zhen pa de dag gis ci zhig bya /
analyzed: slar yang gnas pa ma yin pa la mngon par zhen pa de dag gis ci zhig bya /
translated: What is the use of insisting that it does not endure?

original: gang de la de ltar 'jug pa de'i phyir phan 'dogs pa la ltos pa nyid ni rang gi rgyu yis nges par sbyor na mdzes pa yin no //
analyzed: gang de la de ltar 'jug pa de'i phyir phan 'dogs pa la ltos pa nyid ni rang gi rgyu yis nges par sbyor na mdzes pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is proper to apply it to that which is dependent on the benefit of its own cause.

original: de lta ma yin na 'bras bu'i bdag nyid de yang de la nges par sbyor ba la gus par mi byed do //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na 'bras bu'i bdag nyid de yang de la nges par sbyor ba la gus par mi byed do //
translated: Otherwise, even if it is the nature of an effect, it would not be applied to that which is dependent on its own cause.

original: ji ltar cung zhig byed pa @269b med pa 'gal ba yin /
