analyzed: ji ltar cung zhig byed pa @269b med pa 'gal ba yin /
translated: How is it contradictory that it does not perform even the slightest function?

original: 'di 'gal ba med par mngon par 'dod na khyad par 'ga' yang med pas 'di ni gyi na'o //
analyzed: 'di 'gal ba med par mngon par 'dod na khyad par 'ga' yang med pas 'di ni gyi na'o //
translated: If you maintain that this is not contradictory, then it is useless because there is no difference.

original: gang yang dper na skad cig mar smra ba gzhan dag bum pa ni tho ba la sogs pa la ltos nas cung zad cig kyang byed pa med kyang ldog pa de bzhin du kho bo cag kyang dus gzhan du gnas pa can gyi dngos po yin no zhe
analyzed: gang yang dper na skad cig mar smra ba gzhan dag bum pa ni tho ba la sogs pa la ltos nas cung zad cig kyang byed pa med kyang ldog pa de bzhin du kho bo cag kyang dus gzhan du gnas pa can gyi dngos po yin no zhe
translated: Likewise, we also say that things that endure for another moment exist.

original: na / de yang gzhan gyi gzhung lugs mi shes par smra ba yin te /
analyzed: na / de yang gzhan gyi gzhung lugs mi shes par smra ba yin te /
translated: This is also a statement by someone who does not understand the opponent‚Äôs standpoint.

original: kho bo cag ni gang gi phyir rgyun zhes bya ba skad cig ma las tha dad pa yod pa ni ma yin te tho ba la sogs pa nye bas cung zad cig kyang ldog pa la byed pa med do//
analyzed: kho bo cag ni gang gi phyir rgyun zhes bya ba skad cig ma las tha dad pa yod pa ni ma yin te tho ba la sogs pa nye bas cung zad cig kyang ldog pa la byed pa med do//
translated: This is because what we call a continuum is not different from a moment. When a hammer and so on approaches, it does not have the slightest activity in ceasing.

original: skad cig ma kho na 'ba' zhig yod pa de yang rang nyid ldog pas tho ba la sogs pa la ltos pa ni ma yin te /üîΩrang gi ngang gis 'gog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skad cig ma kho na 'ba' zhig yod pa de yang rang nyid ldog pas tho ba la sogs pa la ltos pa ni ma yin te /üîΩrang gi ngang gis 'gog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Only a moment exists, and that does not depend on a hammer and so on because it ceases by itself.

original: gang yang gyo mo la sogs pa de dag bskyed pa'i mtshan nyid ma yin pa'i 'jug pa dang ldog pa yod pa gang yin pa ni 'dra ba gzhan byung ba'i 'khrul pa'i rgyu mtshan gyis 'jig rten pa gcig pa nyid mngon par zhes par khas len pas bum
analyzed: gang yang gyo mo la sogs pa de dag bskyed pa'i mtshan nyid ma yin pa'i 'jug pa dang ldog pa yod pa gang yin pa ni 'dra ba gzhan byung ba'i 'khrul pa'i rgyu mtshan gyis 'jig rten pa gcig pa nyid mngon par zhes par khas len pas bum
translated: Whatever is the occurrence and cessation of the characteristics of the production of those things, such as the pot, that are not the characteristics of the production of those things, such as the shards, is the cause of the error of the appearance of another similar thing.

original: pa la sogs pa ldog pa yin no zhes tha snyad du byed do //
analyzed: pa la sogs pa ldog pa yin no zhes tha snyad du byed do //
translated: Because the world accepts that as the same, it is said that the pot, etc., cease.

original: de la tho ba la sogs pa cung zad cig kyang byed pa med pa nyid du yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de la tho ba la sogs pa cung zad cig kyang byed pa med pa nyid du yod pa ma yin te /
translated: In that regard, the hammer, etc., do not exist without any function at all,

original: de yod pa nyid las de dag 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yod pa nyid las de dag 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they arise from their own existence.

original: mgyogs pa bsnun pa'i tho ba la sogs pa ni lhan cig byed pa'i rkyen yin te /
analyzed: mgyogs pa bsnun pa'i tho ba la sogs pa ni lhan cig byed pa'i rkyen yin te /
translated: The hammer, etc., that quickly strike are the cooperating conditions.

original: bum pa'i skad cig ma dang phan tshun nye bar 'dus pa la sogs pa'i rkyen gyi khyad par las gyo mo la sogs pa phul du byung ba skyed par 'gyur ba'i chos yin pa'i phyir dang / de yang de skyed pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bum pa'i skad cig ma dang phan tshun nye bar 'dus pa la sogs pa'i rkyen gyi khyad par las gyo mo la sogs pa phul du byung ba skyed par 'gyur ba'i chos yin pa'i phyir dang / de yang de skyed pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And that is because it has the nature of generating that.

original: ngo bo gnyis su khas blangs par thal bar 'gyur ba la sogs pa de bsal bar 'dod pas gzhan gyis gal te sngar rtag pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: ngo bo gnyis su khas blangs par thal bar 'gyur ba la sogs pa de bsal bar 'dod pas gzhan gyis gal te sngar rtag pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Since the consequence of accepting two natures and so on is refuted, the opponent says, If previously it is permanent and so on, wishing to dispel that.

original: 'di ga las she na /
analyzed: 'di ga las she na /
translated: Why is that?

original: ngo bo nyid gcig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid gcig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it has a single nature.

original: thams cad du ngo bo gcig pas thams cad du rtag pa yin gyi /
analyzed: thams cad du ngo bo gcig pas thams cad du rtag pa yin gyi /
translated: Since it has a single nature in all respects, it is permanent in all respects.

original: phyi nas mi rtag pa'i ngo bo ni mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyi nas mi rtag pa'i ngo bo ni mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Later, it is impossible for it to have an impermanent nature.

original: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas 'o na zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas 'o na zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The proponent of tenets says, Well then, if it is permanent, it is not suitable to be an agent.

original: dngos po thams cad du rtag pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi rang bzhin gyis 'jig pa mi 'jig par rtogs na ji ltar 'jig pa zhes @270a * //üîΩbya ba yin /
analyzed: dngos po thams cad du rtag pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi rang bzhin gyis 'jig pa mi 'jig par rtogs na ji ltar 'jig pa zhes @270a * // bya ba yin /
translated: If one understands that all things are essentially permanent by nature and do not disintegrate, then how could one say that they disintegrate?

original: ga las she na /
analyzed: ga las she na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de'i ngo bo nyid dang 'jig pa dag ni rtag pa'i ngo bo dang 'jig pa mi rtag pa'i ngo bo nyid ni phan tshun med pa'i ngo bo yin pa nyid kyi phyir phan tshun yongs su spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i ngo bo nyid dang 'jig pa dag ni rtag pa'i ngo bo dang 'jig pa mi rtag pa'i ngo bo nyid ni phan tshun med pa'i ngo bo yin pa nyid kyi phyir phan tshun yongs su spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the nature of that which is permanent and the nature of disintegration are mutually exclusive, since they are mutually exclusive.

original: mjug bsdu ba ni de lta bas na zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: mjug bsdu ba ni de lta bas na zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The summary is stated:

original: rtag pa'i chos la 'jig pa mi rung ba de'i phyir 'jig pa yod pa gang gi tshe gdon mi za bar 'byung ba'i byas pa'i ngo bo dang 'jig pa yod par pha rol po 'dod pa de'i tshe 'jig pa'i ngo bos 'jig par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rtag pa'i chos la 'jig pa mi rung ba de'i phyir 'jig pa yod pa gang gi tshe gdon mi za bar 'byung ba'i byas pa'i ngo bo dang 'jig pa yod par pha rol po 'dod pa de'i tshe 'jig pa'i ngo bos 'jig par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, since disintegration is not tenable for a permanent phenomenon, when the opponent asserts that disintegration exists and that the nature of the produced that definitely occurs exists, then at that time disintegration would occur due to the nature of disintegration.

original: gnas pa med pa'i phyir 'jig pa ste byed pa po'i tshigs kyi gha nya'i rkyen yin no //
analyzed: gnas pa med pa'i phyir 'jig pa ste byed pa po'i tshigs kyi gha nya'i rkyen yin no //
translated: Because endurance does not exist, disintegration is the condition of the affix gha√± in the causative.

original: de'i ngo bo gang yin pa des 'jig pa'i rang bzhin gyis mi gnas pa'i chos yin pa des na byas pa'i ngo bo dang lhan cig pa'i yod pa ni rang gi rgyud las byung ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i ngo bo gang yin pa des 'jig pa'i rang bzhin gyis mi gnas pa'i chos yin pa des na byas pa'i ngo bo dang lhan cig pa'i yod pa ni rang gi rgyud las byung ba yin no //
translated: Since its nature is that by which it does not endure, it is a perishable entity. Therefore, existence that is simultaneous with the nature of a product arises from its own cause.

original: de lta ma yin na gdon mi za bar 'byung bar khas blangs pa byas pa'i bdag nyid la 'jig pa yod pa mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na gdon mi za bar 'byung bar khas blangs pa byas pa'i bdag nyid la 'jig pa yod pa mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Otherwise, it would be illogical for the nature of a product, which is accepted as necessarily arising, to have destruction.

original: gal te yod pa nyid yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te yod pa nyid yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that it does exist,

original: de lta na yang zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de lta na yang zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: then he says, ‚ÄúIn that case, . . . ‚Äù

original: rang nyid kyis 'jig pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi ngo bo ma yin te /
analyzed: rang nyid kyis 'jig pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi ngo bo ma yin te /
translated: It is not that its own nature is the nature of destruction.

original: gzhan pa nyid mi srid pa'i phyir 'jig pa'i rgyu don med do //
analyzed: gzhan pa nyid mi srid pa'i phyir 'jig pa'i rgyu don med do //
translated: Because it is impossible for it to be different, the cause of destruction is pointless.

original: rnam par rtog pa dang po nye bar bkod pa de nyid bshad zin pas yang bshad par mi bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa dang po nye bar bkod pa de nyid bshad zin pas yang bshad par mi bya'o //
translated: Since the first conception has already been presented, it should not be presented again.

original: des na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni go bla'o //
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni go bla'o //
translated: The meaning of ‚ÄúIn that case . . . ‚Äù and so on is easy to understand.

original: de ltar na 'jig pa la ltos pa med pas nus pa yang don med do //
analyzed: de ltar na 'jig pa la ltos pa med pas nus pa yang don med do //
translated: Thus, since it is independent of destruction, potency is also pointless.

original: de'i rgyu dang 'brel pa las byas pa'i mtshan nyid dang yod pa ni sngon gyi slob dpon rnams kyis bstan cing bshad do //
analyzed: de'i rgyu dang 'brel pa las byas pa'i mtshan nyid dang yod pa ni sngon gyi slob dpon rnams kyis bstan cing bshad do //
translated: The characteristics and existence of that which is produced in dependence on its cause have been taught and explained by the former masters.

original: de'i bzlog na gnod pa can gyi tshad ma ji lta ba de rjes su myong ba de bstan pa ni lta bas na dngos po 'jig pa la zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i bzlog na gnod pa can gyi tshad ma ji lta ba de rjes su myong ba de bstan pa ni lta bas na dngos po 'jig pa la zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The demonstration of the valid cognition that refutes that is as follows: ‚ÄúBecause of seeing the destruction of things.‚Äù

original: 'di ltar sbyor ba ni gang dang gang gi dngos po yod pa la ltos pa med pa de dang de'i dngos por nges pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar sbyor ba ni gang dang gang gi dngos po yod pa la ltos pa med pa de dang de'i dngos por nges pa yin te /
translated: The syllogism is as follows: Whatever thing exists is not dependent on another for its existence, and that thing is ascertained to be existent.

original: dper na tha ma'i rgyu'i tshogs pa rang gi 'bras bu bskyed pa yin no //
analyzed: dper na tha ma'i rgyu'i tshogs pa rang gi 'bras bu bskyed pa yin no //
translated: For example, the final collection of causes produces its own effect.üîΩThe existence of the thing that is the nature of the produced is the destruction of the thing that is not dependent on another.

original: byas pa'i ngo bo'i dngos po yod pa'i 'jig pa ni gzhan gyis dngos po 'byung ba gdon mi za bar 'jig par khas blangs pa yang gzhan la mi ltos pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin @270b gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: byas pa'i ngo bo'i dngos po yod pa'i 'jig pa ni gzhan gyis dngos po 'byung ba gdon mi za bar 'jig par khas blangs pa yang gzhan la mi ltos pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin @270b gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: The statement ‚ÄúBecause of seeing the destruction of things‚Äù is a natural inference.

original: thal bar 'gyur ba bzlog pa la gnod pa can gyi tshad ma sngon gyi slob dpon gyis bstan to //
analyzed: thal bar 'gyur ba bzlog pa la gnod pa can gyi tshad ma sngon gyi slob dpon gyis bstan to //
translated: The former masters have taught the valid cognition that contradicts the reversal of the reductio.

original: des na de'i dngos por nges pa'i 'jig pa ni res 'ga' ba yin pa'i phyir skyes ma thag 'jig pa yin no //
analyzed: des na de'i dngos por nges pa'i 'jig pa ni res 'ga' ba yin pa'i phyir skyes ma thag 'jig pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, since the destruction that is ascertained to be its nature is occasional, it is momentary destruction.

original: yod pa gang yin pa de ni byas pa'i mtshan nyid kyi dngos po'o //
analyzed: yod pa gang yin pa de ni byas pa'i mtshan nyid kyi dngos po'o //
translated: Whatever exists has the nature of being produced.

original: 'jig pa ni 'jig pa'i rang bzhin yin no //
analyzed: 'jig pa ni 'jig pa'i rang bzhin yin no //
translated: Destruction has the nature of being destroyed.

original: 'jig pa nyid bsgrub par bya ba'i chos log na byas pa'i bdag nyid kyi yod pa ldog pa yin pa'i phyir byas pa dang ma byas pa'i mtshan nyid la skad cig ma'i yod pas rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa grub cing rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig pa nyid bsgrub par bya ba'i chos log na byas pa'i bdag nyid kyi yod pa ldog pa yin pa'i phyir byas pa dang ma byas pa'i mtshan nyid la skad cig ma'i yod pas rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa grub cing rdzogs pa'o //
translated: Since the reversal of the predicate of the probandum, destruction, entails the reversal of the existence that has the nature of being produced, the pervasion and the counter-pervasion are established and complete with regard to the characteristic of the momentary existence of the produced and the unproduced.

original: mi ldog pa bshad pas yod pa dang skad cig ma de'i bdag nyid du grub pa'i rgyu mtshan gyis rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag kyang nges pa yin no //
analyzed: mi ldog pa bshad pas yod pa dang skad cig ma de'i bdag nyid du grub pa'i rgyu mtshan gyis rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag kyang nges pa yin no //
translated: Since the non-reversal is explained, the pervasion and the counter-pervasion are ascertained by the reason of the establishment of existence and momentariness as having the same nature.

original: de ltar na de ni sngon gyi slob dpon gyis byas pa'i yod pa med pa'i ma byas pa'i yod pa rgyu med pa can ni rtag pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar na de ni sngon gyi slob dpon gyis byas pa'i yod pa med pa'i ma byas pa'i yod pa rgyu med pa can ni rtag pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Thus, the non-existence of the existence that is created by the former masters is the existence that is not created, which is causeless, and is called ‚Äúpermanent.‚Äù

original: rtag pa'i mtshan nyid spangs pas de ni rtag pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rtag pa'i mtshan nyid spangs pas de ni rtag pa ma yin no //
translated: Since it is devoid of the characteristics of permanence, it is not permanent.

original: yod pa skye ba dang ldan pa gang yin pa de bshad pa'i rigs pas gdon mi za bar 'jig par khas blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: yod pa skye ba dang ldan pa gang yin pa de bshad pa'i rigs pas gdon mi za bar 'jig par khas blang bar bya'o //
translated: That which is existent and possesses arising must be accepted as necessarily disintegrating by the reasoning that has been explained.

original: gzhan dus gzhan du gnas par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i lan bshad zin kyang gang dang gang yod pa de dang de ni skad cig ma yin no zhes thun mong du brjod kyi byas ba dang ma byas pa'i mtshan nyid kyi yod pa tha dad pa la ltos
analyzed: gzhan dus gzhan du gnas par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i lan bshad zin kyang gang dang gang yod pa de dang de ni skad cig ma yin no zhes thun mong du brjod kyi byas ba dang ma byas pa'i mtshan nyid kyi yod pa tha dad pa la ltos
translated: Although the response to ‚ÄúIt remains for another moment‚Äù has already been explained, it is said in general, ‚ÄúWhatever exists is momentary,‚Äù but the existence that has the characteristics of the created and the uncreated is not different.

original: pa med pa rgol ba rnon po yin no //
analyzed: pa med pa rgol ba rnon po yin no //
translated: The opponent who is skilled in debate should look at this.

original: byas pa nyid kyang gdon mi za bar 'jig pa yin no zhes gzhan gyis khas blangs pa la mi ltos pa de'i tshe 'jig pa mi ltos pa nyid du thams cad la mi 'grub bo //
analyzed: byas pa nyid kyang gdon mi za bar 'jig pa yin no zhes gzhan gyis khas blangs pa la mi ltos pa de'i tshe 'jig pa mi ltos pa nyid du thams cad la mi 'grub bo //
translated: Since it is not necessary to rely on the assertion of others, at that time, destruction is not established as not relying on anything.

original: gang dag 'jig par 'gyur ba bum pa la sogs pa la mthong ba de dag nyid la rgyu mi rigs pas de la mi ltos pa ni rung ngo //
analyzed: gang dag 'jig par 'gyur ba bum pa la sogs pa la mthong ba de dag nyid la rgyu mi rigs pas de la mi ltos pa ni rung ngo //
translated: Since it is not logical that the cause of that which is seen to be destroyed, such as a pot, is illogical, it is not necessary to rely on that.

original: gang yang yul la sogs pa bar du chod pa dang ri bo la sogs pa la 'jig pa dang mi 'jig pa ma mthong bas de dag nyid gdon mi za bar 'jig par khas blangs pa'i rgyu mtshan med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang yang yul la sogs pa bar du chod pa dang ri bo la sogs pa la 'jig pa dang mi 'jig pa ma mthong bas de dag nyid gdon mi za bar 'jig par khas blangs pa'i rgyu mtshan med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Since one does not see that which is obstructed by objects and so on, such as mountains, as destroyed or not destroyed, it is illogical to assert that they are necessarily destroyed.

original: mtha' ma 'jig pa ni ltos pa med pa bzhin du 'jig pa la khyad par med pas dngos po yang de'i ngo bor nges pa yin no zhes brjod par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mtha' ma 'jig pa ni ltos pa med pa bzhin du 'jig pa la khyad par med pas dngos po yang de'i ngo bor nges pa yin no zhes brjod par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Since the final destruction is like that which does not rely on anything, it is not possible to say that destruction is not different and that things are ascertained to be of its nature.

original: de'i ngo bo yang ltos @271a * //
analyzed: de'i ngo bo yang ltos @271a * //
translated: Since its nature also does not rely on anything, it is not possible to say that it is of the nature of that.

original: pa dang bcas pa'i phyir 'jig pa la ltos pa med pa nyid ma grub bo //
analyzed: pa dang bcas pa'i phyir 'jig pa la ltos pa med pa nyid ma grub bo //
translated: Therefore, it is not established that destruction does not rely on causes.üîΩJust as the nature of destruction of such things as the unproduced and space is not established as having the nature of destruction if it relies on causes,

original: ma byas pa dang nam mkha' la sogs pa rnams la 'jig pa'i ngo bo ltos pa dang bcas pa bzhin du ltos pa yod na 'jig pa'i rang bzhin du ma grub po //
analyzed: ma byas pa dang nam mkha' la sogs pa rnams la 'jig pa'i ngo bo ltos pa dang bcas pa bzhin du ltos pa yod na 'jig pa'i rang bzhin du ma grub po //
translated: so too, if it relies on causes, it is not established as having the nature of destruction.

original: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag de'i rgyu mtshan du mi rigs pa mthong ste /
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag de'i rgyu mtshan du mi rigs pa mthong ste /
translated: We see that neither positive nor negative concomitance is a reason for that.üîΩIf it is the case that the characteristic of destruction is contradictory with the characteristic of the function of a thing, then it is said that the valid cognition that contradicts it establishes its nature.

original: don byed par 'gal ba'i mtshan nyid yin pa de'i tshe gnod pa byed pa'i tshad mas de'i bdag nyid rab tu sgrub par byed par brjod par 'gyur ba yin no snyam nas phyogs snga ma slang pa ni gal te ngo bo nyid kyis 'jig pa zhes bya ba
analyzed: don byed par 'gal ba'i mtshan nyid yin pa de'i tshe gnod pa byed pa'i tshad mas de'i bdag nyid rab tu sgrub par byed par brjod par 'gyur ba yin no snyam nas phyogs snga ma slang pa ni gal te ngo bo nyid kyis 'jig pa zhes bya ba
translated: The opponent‚Äôs position is stated in the lines ‚ÄúIf destruction is asserted to be intrinsic‚Äù and so on.

original: smos te / bshad zin pa'i rigs pas 'jig pa bum pa la sogs pa la yongs su mthong du zin kyang yul la sogs pa bskal ba 'ga' zhig gam /
analyzed: smos te / bshad zin pa'i rigs pas 'jig pa bum pa la sogs pa la yongs su mthong du zin kyang yul la sogs pa bskal ba 'ga' zhig gam /
translated: Even though destruction is seen in such things as pots by the reasoning already explained, it is not the case that it is seen in all things.

original: ri bo la sogs pa la byas pa dang 'jig ba mi dmigs pa 'am nam mkha' la sogs pa byas pa ma yin pa'i yod pa de'i ngo bo yang mi 'jig pa'i ngo bo ma yin par yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ri bo la sogs pa la byas pa dang 'jig ba mi dmigs pa 'am nam mkha' la sogs pa byas pa ma yin pa'i yod pa de'i ngo bo yang mi 'jig pa'i ngo bo ma yin par yang 'gyur ro //
translated: The essence of that which exists, such as a mountain, etc., which is not observed to be produced and destroyed, or the essence of that which is not produced, such as space, etc., would not be the essence of that which is not destroyed.

original: yang smos pa ni srid par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang smos pa ni srid par 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, it is possible that

original: 'jig pa'i ngo bo de'i sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma med par dogs pa de dang 'di dag gis 'jig pa'i ngo bo ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir ltos pa med pa ma grub pa yin no //
analyzed: 'jig pa'i ngo bo de'i sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma med par dogs pa de dang 'di dag gis 'jig pa'i ngo bo ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir ltos pa med pa ma grub pa yin no //
translated: there is no valid cognition that establishes the essence of destruction. Those and these doubts about the essence of destruction are not established because the essence of destruction is dependent.

original: de'i dbang gis bsgrub par bya ba skad cig ma nyid yod pa'i ngo bor ma grub po //
analyzed: de'i dbang gis bsgrub par bya ba skad cig ma nyid yod pa'i ngo bor ma grub po //
translated: By the power of that, the probandum, momentariness, is not established as the essence of existence.

original: de'i rgyu mtshan gyi rjes su 'gro ba dang log pa yang ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i rgyu mtshan gyi rjes su 'gro ba dang log pa yang ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the concomitance and the reverse concomitance of that reason are not established.

original: yang 'dir dogs pa'i rgyu mtshan ci zhig yin gang gis na 'ga' zhig de ma yin pa la yang dogs pa yin snyam na /
analyzed: yang 'dir dogs pa'i rgyu mtshan ci zhig yin gang gis na 'ga' zhig de ma yin pa la yang dogs pa yin snyam na /
translated: Here, what is the reason for the doubt? By what is there doubt even in the absence of that?

original: thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid thams cad yin pa ni med pas zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid thams cad yin pa ni med pas zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Since the nature of all is not all,

original: rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i dngos po'i ngo bo mthong ste /
analyzed: rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i dngos po'i ngo bo mthong ste /
translated: the nature of various things is seen.

original: kha cig thogs pa dang bcas pa dang / kha cig thogs pa med pa dang / de bzhin du sngon po dang sngon po ma yin pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo dang / de bzhin du kha cig 'jig pa dang gzhan ni mi 'jig pa'i rang bzhin du phyogs snga ma dogs pa la ma yin te /üîΩkha cig de'i ngo bo ma yin pa la yang 'gyur ro zhes dogs na de bzhin du dngos po de ni skad cig pa ma yin pa nyid du 'gyur ba dang de la yod @271b pa dngos po nyid du thal bar 'gyur bas de ma yin pa'i ngo
analyzed: kha cig thogs pa dang bcas pa dang / kha cig thogs pa med pa dang / de bzhin du sngon po dang sngon po ma yin pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo dang / de bzhin du kha cig 'jig pa dang gzhan ni mi 'jig pa'i rang bzhin du phyogs snga ma dogs pa la ma yin te / kha cig de'i ngo bo ma yin pa la yang 'gyur ro zhes dogs na de bzhin du dngos po de ni skad cig pa ma yin pa nyid du 'gyur ba dang de la yod @271b pa dngos po nyid du thal bar 'gyur bas de ma yin pa'i ngo
translated: Some are impeded and some are unimpeded, and likewise, some are blue and some are not blue, and so on. Likewise, some are by nature destroyed and some are not destroyed.üîΩIf you suspect that it is not so, then it would follow that some things would not be that nature.

original: bo 'gyur dogs pa ga la yin /
analyzed: bo 'gyur dogs pa ga la yin /
translated: How could there be a suspicion that it would become a nature that is not that?

original: 'o na ji ltar skad cig ma ma yin pa dngos po med par thal bar 'gyur /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar skad cig ma ma yin pa dngos po med par thal bar 'gyur /
translated: Well, how could it follow that a non-momentary thing is a non-thing?

original: des na yod pa dang skad cig ma nyid kyi ngo bo yin pas rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa grub po zhe na /
analyzed: des na yod pa dang skad cig ma nyid kyi ngo bo yin pas rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa grub po zhe na /
translated: Therefore, since it is the nature of existence and momentariness, the forward and reverse pervasions are established.

original: dngos po'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: dngos po'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: To respond: Things that are related to existenceüîΩare not established as having the nature of existence.

original: 'di snyam du sems pa yin te 'dir re zhig 'di nyid rnam par dpyad par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di snyam du sems pa yin te 'dir re zhig 'di nyid rnam par dpyad par bya ste /
translated: The meaning of this is as follows: First, this should be analyzed:

original: ci dngos po de rnams kyi mtshan nyid rigs pa yin nam /
analyzed: ci dngos po de rnams kyi mtshan nyid rigs pa yin nam /
translated: Are the characteristics of those things reasonable?

original: de la yod pa dang 'brel pa'i mtshan nyid ni ma khyab pa yin te spyi la sogs pa rnams la med pa'i phyir ram /
analyzed: de la yod pa dang 'brel pa'i mtshan nyid ni ma khyab pa yin te spyi la sogs pa rnams la med pa'i phyir ram /
translated: A characteristic related to existence is not a universal because universals and so on do not exist.

original: mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa la yang yod pas khyab ches pa nyid do //
analyzed: mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa la yang yod pas khyab ches pa nyid do //
translated: Or it is too broad because it exists even in the son of a barren woman and so on.

original: mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa med pa'i phyir ji ltar yod pa dang 'brel pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa med pa'i phyir ji ltar yod pa dang 'brel pa yin zhe na /
translated: How can the son of a barren woman and so on be related to existence because they do not exist?

original: ma yin te gcig la gcig brten pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: ma yin te gcig la gcig brten pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: No, because they are mutually dependent.

original: gang gi phyir med pa de dag ni yod pa dang 'brel pa spangs pa nyid dang de spangs pa yod pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir med pa de dag ni yod pa dang 'brel pa spangs pa nyid dang de spangs pa yod pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because those that do not exist are abandoned by being related to existence and existence is abandoned by being related to nonexistence.

original: gal te yod pa ni yod pa dang 'brel pa yin pa de lta na 'o na te gzhan las yod pa'i mtshan nyid du brjod pa'i phyir yod pa dang 'brel pa yang don med do //
analyzed: gal te yod pa ni yod pa dang 'brel pa yin pa de lta na 'o na te gzhan las yod pa'i mtshan nyid du brjod pa'i phyir yod pa dang 'brel pa yang don med do //
translated: If existence is related to existence, then since existence is said to be the characteristic of the existent, the relation to existence is pointless.

original: de nyid kyi phyir dngos po yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir dngos po yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For that very reason, because things exist.

original: gal te don byed pa'i nus pa thams cad kyis stong pas de dag yod pa dang 'brel pa med pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te don byed pa'i nus pa thams cad kyis stong pas de dag yod pa dang 'brel pa med pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that because they are empty of all capacity for functional performance, they are not related to existence,

original: de ltar gyur na don byed nus pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa gang yin pa de nyid yod pa dang 'brel pas don byed nus pa nyid dngos po nyid du 'ongs pas yod pa dang 'brel pa don med do //
analyzed: de ltar gyur na don byed nus pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa gang yin pa de nyid yod pa dang 'brel pas don byed nus pa nyid dngos po nyid du 'ongs pas yod pa dang 'brel pa don med do //
translated: then in that case, since only that which possesses the characteristic of capacity for functional performance is related to existence, capacity for functional performance comes to be existence itself, and so the relation to existence is pointless.

original: de ltar na de bzhin du gzhan spyi la sogs pa rnams ji ltar rang gi ngo bos yod par 'gyur /
analyzed: de ltar na de bzhin du gzhan spyi la sogs pa rnams ji ltar rang gi ngo bos yod par 'gyur /
translated: So in the same way, how could universals and so on exist by their own intrinsic nature?

original: don byed nus pa ni 'di dag thams cad la yod pas de nyid yod pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: don byed nus pa ni 'di dag thams cad la yod pas de nyid yod pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: Since capacity for functional performance exists in all of them, that is the characteristic of existence.

original: skye ba dang 'jig pa dang gnas pa dang 'brel pa yod pa yin no zer ba de dag ni mi rigs so //
analyzed: skye ba dang 'jig pa dang gnas pa dang 'brel pa yod pa yin no zer ba de dag ni mi rigs so //
translated: But this is not reasonable.

original: gnas pa dang skye ba dang 'jig pa 'gal bas chos can gcig la mi rigs so //
analyzed: gnas pa dang skye ba dang 'jig pa 'gal bas chos can gcig la mi rigs so //
translated: Because endurance, arising, and ceasing are mutually contradictory, it is not reasonable that they should be related to a single entity.

original: gal te res 'ga' skye ba dang 'gag pa yin la res 'ga' gnas pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te res 'ga' skye ba dang 'gag pa yin la res 'ga' gnas pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that sometimes arising and ceasing exist and sometimes endurance exists,

original: skye ba dang 'jig pa ji lta ba de bzhin du gnas pa med do //üîΩgnas pa ji lta ba de bzhin @272a * //
analyzed: skye ba dang 'jig pa ji lta ba de bzhin du gnas pa med do // gnas pa ji lta ba de bzhin @272a * //
translated: then just as arising and ceasing exist, so endurance would not exist.

original: du skye ba dang 'jig pa med do //
analyzed: du skye ba dang 'jig pa med do //
translated: And just as endurance exists, so arising and ceasing would not exist.

original: ji skad bshad pa'i dngos po gcig gi mtshan nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji skad bshad pa'i dngos po gcig gi mtshan nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The characteristics of a single entity would not be as they have been explained.

original: de'i phyir dngos po gzhan gyi mtshan nyid dang 'brel pa'i nus pa mtha' ma sa de'i shes pa skyed par khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir dngos po gzhan gyi mtshan nyid dang 'brel pa'i nus pa mtha' ma sa de'i shes pa skyed par khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, because you accept that the final potency related to the characteristics of other entities generates the cognition of that entity,

original: gzhan gyis tshig gi don drug la sogs pa rnam par gzhag pa de nyid ni yod pa'i mtshan nyid du mi rigs te /
analyzed: gzhan gyis tshig gi don drug la sogs pa rnam par gzhag pa de nyid ni yod pa'i mtshan nyid du mi rigs te /
translated: the presentation of the six categories and so on by the other schools is not reasonable as the characteristics of existence.

original: nus pa thams cad dang bral ba yang dngos po med pa'i mtshan nyid yin no //
analyzed: nus pa thams cad dang bral ba yang dngos po med pa'i mtshan nyid yin no //
translated: The definition of non-existence is the absence of all capacity.

original: thams cad smos pa ni dngos po thams cad ni dngos po gzhan gyi nus pa dang bral pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir med pa bsal ba'i don du gang nus pa med pa gang yin pa de ni gcig tu nges pa'i med par brjod do //
analyzed: thams cad smos pa ni dngos po thams cad ni dngos po gzhan gyi nus pa dang bral pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir med pa bsal ba'i don du gang nus pa med pa gang yin pa de ni gcig tu nges pa'i med par brjod do //
translated: The word ‚Äúall‚Äù is used to exclude the non-existence of all things, because all things are essentially devoid of the capacity of another thing. The absence of capacity is said to be a non-existence that is a non-existence of one thing.

original: nus pa'i mtshan nyid ni skad cig ma'i yod pa yin no //
analyzed: nus pa'i mtshan nyid ni skad cig ma'i yod pa yin no //
translated: The definition of capacity is the existence of momentariness.

original: des na skad cig ma'i bdag nyid ni med par mi 'grub po //
analyzed: des na skad cig ma'i bdag nyid ni med par mi 'grub po //
translated: Therefore, momentariness is not established as a non-existence.

original: gang las rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: gang las rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa yin zhe na /
translated: From what is there concomitance and the absence of concomitance?

original: skad cig ma ma yin pa ni 'ga' yang gang yang rung ba tha ma'i shes pa skyed pa'i mtshan nyid kyi nus pa skad cig ma yin pa de'i nus pa dang bral bar 'gyur /
analyzed: skad cig ma ma yin pa ni 'ga' yang gang yang rung ba tha ma'i shes pa skyed pa'i mtshan nyid kyi nus pa skad cig ma yin pa de'i nus pa dang bral bar 'gyur /
translated: That which is not momentary is devoid of the capacity that is characterized by the production of any cognition whatsoever at the end.

original: gang 'dir nus pa thams cad kyis stong pa'i mtshan nyid kyi med pa dang 'gal bas sel bar byed pa'i yod pa skad cig ma'i bdag nyid du nyams su myong na ni gang gi rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa de yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gang 'dir nus pa thams cad kyis stong pa'i mtshan nyid kyi med pa dang 'gal bas sel bar byed pa'i yod pa skad cig ma'i bdag nyid du nyams su myong na ni gang gi rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa de yin no zhe na /
translated: If one experiences the existence that is the opposite of nonexistence, which is the characteristic of emptiness of all capacity, as having the nature of momentariness, then it would follow that whatever exists is momentary.

original: rim dang cig car dag gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rim dang cig car dag gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The response to that is ‚ÄúBy gradual or instantaneous action,‚Äù and so on.

original: stong pa dang nus pa thams cad kyis stong pa skad cig ma ma yin pa ni mngon sum ma yin gyi /
analyzed: stong pa dang nus pa thams cad kyis stong pa skad cig ma ma yin pa ni mngon sum ma yin gyi /
translated: That which is not momentary is not perceived as empty and as empty of all capacity.

original: 'on kyang de'i khyad par byed pa stong pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'on kyang de'i khyad par byed pa stong pa'i phyir ro //
translated: However, because it is the opposite of that, it is empty.

original: de lta na rim dang cig car dag gis bya ba byed pa la khyab ste rnam pa gzhan ni mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta na rim dang cig car dag gis bya ba byed pa la khyab ste rnam pa gzhan ni mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In that case, it is pervaded by gradual or instantaneous action, because another mode is impossible.

original: des na skad cig ma yin pa la khyab par byed pa'i nus pa de dag dang 'gal bas khyab par bya ba ldog pa yin te /
analyzed: des na skad cig ma yin pa la khyab par byed pa'i nus pa de dag dang 'gal bas khyab par bya ba ldog pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, because it is contradictory to that capacity that pervades momentariness, the pervaded is eliminated.

original: gang gi bya ba byed pa'i nus pa yang ldog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi bya ba byed pa'i nus pa yang ldog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the capacity to perform a function is also eliminated.

original: nus pa thams cad kyis stong pa'i mtshan nyid kyi med pa skad cig ma ma yin pa'i khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pas 'dren pa yin te /
analyzed: nus pa thams cad kyis stong pa'i mtshan nyid kyi med pa skad cig ma ma yin pa'i khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pas 'dren pa yin te /
translated: The nonobservation of a pervader that is, that the absence of an entity that is empty of all capacity is not momentary is what entails the contradiction.

original: 'gal ba dag gcig la mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gal ba dag gcig la mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is impossible for a contradiction to exist in a single entity.

original: des na ldog pa can gyi yod pa'i skad cig ma rnams ni gnas pa yin te @272b de'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des na ldog pa can gyi yod pa'i skad cig ma rnams ni gnas pa yin te @272b de'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, the existent that is the opposite of that is momentary, because it has that nature.

original: gang yang yod pa de ni skad cig ma kho na yin no zhes bya ba ni rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i ngo bos khyab pa grub par nges pa yin no //
analyzed: gang yang yod pa de ni skad cig ma kho na yin no zhes bya ba ni rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i ngo bos khyab pa grub par nges pa yin no //
translated: That which exists is only momentary is ascertained through the establishment of pervasion by the nature of positive and negative concomitance.

original: 'o na ni rnam pa gzhan mi srid pas myu gu la sogs pa'i 'bras bu la sa bon la sogs pa rim dang cig car la sogs pa dag gis byed par brjod na /
analyzed: 'o na ni rnam pa gzhan mi srid pas myu gu la sogs pa'i 'bras bu la sa bon la sogs pa rim dang cig car la sogs pa dag gis byed par brjod na /
translated: But if it is impossible for there to be any other aspect, then if the result, such as a sprout, is said to be produced by a seed and so on either sequentially or simultaneously and so on,

original: de nyid rnam pa gzhan dang bral pa'i 'bras bu skye bar ga las grub pa yin /
analyzed: de nyid rnam pa gzhan dang bral pa'i 'bras bu skye bar ga las grub pa yin /
translated: how could it be established that the result that is devoid of those aspects is produced?

original: rnam par gzhan ni dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa yin na ji ltar gtan med pa dang / yul la sogs pa la dgag pa 'ba' zhig tsam nyid yin /
analyzed: rnam par gzhan ni dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa yin na ji ltar gtan med pa dang / yul la sogs pa la dgag pa 'ba' zhig tsam nyid yin /
translated: If the other aspect is an observed object, how can it be utterly nonexistent?

original: dmigs pa'i rig byar ma gyur pa nyid ni yod pa nges pa ma yin te bskal pa yin pa'i phyir gang las med pa grub pa yin /
analyzed: dmigs pa'i rig byar ma gyur pa nyid ni yod pa nges pa ma yin te bskal pa yin pa'i phyir gang las med pa grub pa yin /
translated: It is not certain that the non-observation of an object is nonexistent, because it is possible. From what is it established that it does not exist?

original: de'i phyir rnam par gzhan don byed pa srid pas rim dang cig car ldog pas kyang don byed nus pa ldog pa ma yin na gang las skad cig ma yin /
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam par gzhan don byed pa srid pas rim dang cig car ldog pas kyang don byed nus pa ldog pa ma yin na gang las skad cig ma yin /
translated: Therefore, since it is possible that another aspect performs a function, the negation of the capacity to perform a function is not entailed by the negation of sequential or simultaneous activity. How can it be momentary?

original: nus pa thams cad dang bral ba'i mtshan nyid ni med pa yin na gang gis yod pa dang skad cig ma'i bdag nyid rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: nus pa thams cad dang bral ba'i mtshan nyid ni med pa yin na gang gis yod pa dang skad cig ma'i bdag nyid rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If the characteristic of being devoid of all capacity is nonexistence, how can it be concomitant with existence and momentariness?

original: ma yin te gnyi ga la yang skyon med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma yin te gnyi ga la yang skyon med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: No, because there is no fault in either case.

original: 'di ltar rim pa zhes bya ba ni go rims so //
analyzed: 'di ltar rim pa zhes bya ba ni go rims so //
translated: In this regard, ‚Äúsequential‚Äù means ‚Äúin order.‚Äù

original: 'bras bu gzhan dang lhan cig pa myu gu la sogs pa 'ba' zhig go //
analyzed: 'bras bu gzhan dang lhan cig pa myu gu la sogs pa 'ba' zhig go //
translated: The effect is only the sprout, etc., which is simultaneous with the other.

original: cig car yang de las gzhan pa'i sa bon la sogs pa 'bras bu dang lhan cig pa'o //
analyzed: cig car yang de las gzhan pa'i sa bon la sogs pa 'bras bu dang lhan cig pa'o //
translated: and simultaneously, from that seed, etc., the effect, which is simultaneous with it.

original: rnam pa gzhan ni myu gu la sogs pa de gnyi ga spangs pa yang gzhan du gyur pa rnams so //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan ni myu gu la sogs pa de gnyi ga spangs pa yang gzhan du gyur pa rnams so //
translated: The other kind is the sprout, etc., which is neither of the two.

original: de yang myu gu la sogs pa gzhan dang lhan cig pa dang 'ba' zhig pa'o //
analyzed: de yang myu gu la sogs pa gzhan dang lhan cig pa dang 'ba' zhig pa'o //
translated: And that is the sprout, etc., which is simultaneous with something else and which is alone.üîΩNonexistence is to be understood by means of perception, for if it existed, it would be perceived, but it is only the nature of the nonperception of something that is perceptible.

original: med pa ni mngon sum gyis rtogs par bya ba ste yod na mi dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa kho na'i ngo bo yin na rim dang cig car med pa dang / mi mngon pa dang mi dmigs pas so //
analyzed: med pa ni mngon sum gyis rtogs par bya ba ste yod na mi dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa kho na'i ngo bo yin na rim dang cig car med pa dang / mi mngon pa dang mi dmigs pas so //
translated: Since it is neither sequential nor simultaneous, and since it is not manifest, it is not perceived.üîΩSince the object of perception, which is an entity, is neither simultaneous with something else nor alone, the mere nonperception of its nature, which is the object that is devoid of it, etc., is the cause of the appearance of the perception of the object, etc.

original: dngos po'i dmigs par bya ba dang gzhan dang lhan cig ba dang 'ba' zhig pa med pa'i phyir des dben pa'i yul la sogs pa mngon sum la snang ba skyed pa'i rang bzhin mi dmigs pa kho na med par nges pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi thaüîΩsnyad 'jug go //
analyzed: dngos po'i dmigs par bya ba dang gzhan dang lhan cig ba dang 'ba' zhig pa med pa'i phyir des dben pa'i yul la sogs pa mngon sum la snang ba skyed pa'i rang bzhin mi dmigs pa kho na med par nges pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi thaüîΩsnyad 'jug go //
translated: It is only the nonperception that is the cause of the designation of the characteristic of nonexistence, etc.

original: de'i myu gu la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyi gnas skabs gnyis las phyi rol du gyur pa dgag pa ni @273a * //
analyzed: de'i myu gu la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyi gnas skabs gnyis las phyi rol du gyur pa dgag pa ni @273a * //
translated: The refutation of the other two possibilities, that the sprout is of the same nature as its own state or of a different nature from its own state, is similar to the previous refutations.

original: 'ga' zhig yul dang dus dag las yul gzhan la sogs pa'i rim gyis myu gu la sogs pa 'byung ba cig shos la med kyang nyes pa cung zad kyang med do //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig yul dang dus dag las yul gzhan la sogs pa'i rim gyis myu gu la sogs pa 'byung ba cig shos la med kyang nyes pa cung zad kyang med do //
translated: There is no fault in the arising of a sprout from a seed that is different from it in terms of place and time.

original: de'i phyir mngon sum kho nas rnam pa gzhan med par grub pas rim dang cig car dag gis ji ltar don byed par nus pa ma khyab par 'gyur /
analyzed: de'i phyir mngon sum kho nas rnam pa gzhan med par grub pas rim dang cig car dag gis ji ltar don byed par nus pa ma khyab par 'gyur /
translated: Therefore, since the nonexistence of another aspect is established by perception itself, how could the capacity to perform a function not be pervaded by sequential or simultaneous [causation]?

original: bstan bcos byed pas ji ltar mngon sum kho nas rnam pa gzhan med par gyur pa de bzhin du rang nyid kyis rim pa dang rim pa can ma yin pa la sogs pa 'di khas blangs pa bshad cing 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bstan bcos byed pas ji ltar mngon sum kho nas rnam pa gzhan med par gyur pa de bzhin du rang nyid kyis rim pa dang rim pa can ma yin pa la sogs pa 'di khas blangs pa bshad cing 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: The author of the treatise explains and will explain how he himself accepts this sequence and non-sequence, just as the nonexistence of another aspect is established by perception alone.

original: dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa yang rim dang cig car la sogs pa dag phan tshun rnam par gcod pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir rnam pa gzhan med par grub bo //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa yang rim dang cig car la sogs pa dag phan tshun rnam par gcod pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir rnam pa gzhan med par grub bo //
translated: Also, with respect to the characteristics of the object, since sequential, simultaneous, etc., are mutually exclusive entities, it is established that there is no other aspect.

original: de lta na phan tshun rnam par gcod pa'i ngo bo ni gcig dgag pa ni gzhan sgrub pa yin la de yang dgag pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta na phan tshun rnam par gcod pa'i ngo bo ni gcig dgag pa ni gzhan sgrub pa yin la de yang dgag pa ni ma yin te /
translated: Thus, with respect to mutually exclusive entities, the negation of one is the affirmation of another, and that is not a negation.

original: dgag pa dang sgrub pa dag 'gal bas gnyi ga dgag pa'i bdag nyid kyi rnam pa gzhan srid par ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: dgag pa dang sgrub pa dag 'gal bas gnyi ga dgag pa'i bdag nyid kyi rnam pa gzhan srid par ga la 'gyur /
translated: Since negation and affirmation are contradictory, how could there be another aspect that is the nature of both?

original: 'dir sbyor ba ni gang dang gang gi rnam pa bcad nas gang gi tshe cig shos kyi rnam par rnam par gnas pa de dang de la rnam pa gzhan mi srid do //
analyzed: 'dir sbyor ba ni gang dang gang gi rnam pa bcad nas gang gi tshe cig shos kyi rnam par rnam par gnas pa de dang de la rnam pa gzhan mi srid do //
translated: Here the syllogism is: Whatever is the exclusion of one aspect and the establishment of another aspect, that does not have another aspect,

original: dper na sngon po'i rnam pa rnam par bcad nas sngon po ma yin pa'i rnam pa rnam par gnas pa'i ser po bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na sngon po'i rnam pa rnam par bcad nas sngon po ma yin pa'i rnam pa rnam par gnas pa'i ser po bzhin no //
translated: like, for example, yellow, which is the exclusion of the aspect of blue and the establishment of the aspect of non-blue.

original: thams cad du rgyu dang 'bras bur gyur pa'i dngos po la yang rim dang cig car la sogs pa dag las rnam pa gzhan rnam par gcod pas de las gzhan pa'i rnam pa rnam par gnas pa'i rnam par bcad pa'i yul du byed pa'i phyir zhes bya ba
analyzed: thams cad du rgyu dang 'bras bur gyur pa'i dngos po la yang rim dang cig car la sogs pa dag las rnam pa gzhan rnam par gcod pas de las gzhan pa'i rnam pa rnam par gnas pa'i rnam par bcad pa'i yul du byed pa'i phyir zhes bya ba
translated: In all cases, with regard to things that are causes and effects, by the exclusion of other modes such as sequential and simultaneous, the exclusion of other modes is the object that is determined.

original: ni rang bzhin 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: ni rang bzhin 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
translated: This is the observation of intrinsic nature that is contradictory.

original: rnam par bcad pa'i rnam pas cig shos rnam par gnas pa la rnam pa gzhan ni mi srid pa de'i phyir phyi rol du gyur pa'i mtshan nyid yin no zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par bcad pa'i rnam pas cig shos rnam par gnas pa la rnam pa gzhan ni mi srid pa de'i phyir phyi rol du gyur pa'i mtshan nyid yin no zhes bya'o //
translated: By the exclusion of one mode, the other mode is determined. Since another mode is impossible, it is said to be the characteristic of the external.

original: des na dngos po gzhan gyi ngo bo dag phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des na dngos po gzhan gyi ngo bo dag phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, since the natures of other things are mutually exclusive, they are characterized by the exclusion of other.

original: 'di la yang gnod par byed pa gzhan yod par dogs pas thug pa med par dogs par mi bya ste /
analyzed: 'di la yang gnod par byed pa gzhan yod par dogs pas thug pa med par dogs par mi bya ste /
translated: Here, one should not fear an infinite regress, since there is a doubt that there is another sublater.

original: sngar 'gal bar rab tu grub pa dran pa tsam yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngar 'gal bar rab tu grub pa dran pa tsam yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it is merely the recollection of the previously well-established contradiction.

original: 'gal ba dmigs pa ni chos can la yod pa'i dngos po nye bar bstan pas 'gal ba @273b sgrub par byed pa nyid kyi gnod par byed pa de yang 'di la yod de /
analyzed: 'gal ba dmigs pa ni chos can la yod pa'i dngos po nye bar bstan pas 'gal ba @273b sgrub par byed pa nyid kyi gnod par byed pa de yang 'di la yod de /
translated: The observation of contradiction is the refutation that exists here, which establishes contradiction by demonstrating the presence of entities in the subject.

original: des na 'gal ba dag gcig la mi srid bas mi mthun pa'i dngos por nges te grang ba dang dro ba'i reg ba lta bu dang yod pa dang med pa lta bu'i zhes bya ba thug pa med pa ga la yin /
analyzed: des na 'gal ba dag gcig la mi srid bas mi mthun pa'i dngos por nges te grang ba dang dro ba'i reg ba lta bu dang yod pa dang med pa lta bu'i zhes bya ba thug pa med pa ga la yin /
translated: Therefore, since contradiction is impossible in a single thing, it is certain that they are incompatible, like the sensations of cold and heat, or like existence and nonexistence. How could there be an infinite regress?

original: de la skad cig ma ma yin pa rnams rim gyis 'bras bu mi byed pa la khyad par med pas mi byed pa'i gnas skabs bzhin no //
analyzed: de la skad cig ma ma yin pa rnams rim gyis 'bras bu mi byed pa la khyad par med pas mi byed pa'i gnas skabs bzhin no //
translated: In that regard, there is no difference between nonmomentary things and momentary things in that they do not gradually produce effects, so they are like the state of not producing effects.

original: lhan cig byed pa la ltos pa rnams gnyis kyang lhan cig byed par mi rigs pas nye bar dgod par mi bya'o //
analyzed: lhan cig byed pa la ltos pa rnams gnyis kyang lhan cig byed par mi rigs pas nye bar dgod par mi bya'o //
translated: Those that depend on the assemblage of causes and conditions are not suitable to be assembled as co-arisen causes, so they should not be posited as such.

original: thams cad la bya ba gcig byed pa'i dus de na byed par thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: thams cad la bya ba gcig byed pa'i dus de na byed par thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: If all things were to perform a single function at the same time, it would follow that they would perform that function,

original: byed pa po'i rang bzhin de nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byed pa po'i rang bzhin de nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that is the nature of the agent.

original: cig car yang rigs pa ma yin te mngon sum dang 'gal ba'i phyir dang / slar yang byed par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: cig car yang rigs pa ma yin te mngon sum dang 'gal ba'i phyir dang / slar yang byed par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: It is not logical that it is simultaneous, because that contradicts direct perception and it would follow that it would act again.

original: gal te byas zin pas ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te byas zin pas ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say, ‚ÄúIt is not because it has already acted,‚Äù

original: ma yin te nus pa ma zhig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma yin te nus pa ma zhig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: that is not so, because its potential has not disintegrated.

original: de lta ma yin na sngar yang mi byed par 'gyur te mi byed pa'i ngo bo dang khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na sngar yang mi byed par 'gyur te mi byed pa'i ngo bo dang khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If it were otherwise, it would not act even previously, because it would not differ from the state of nonaction.

original: gal te byas zin pas byed par mi nus pa'i phyir dang ro zhe na /üîΩde lta na nus pa dang mi nus pa dag gcig la 'bras bu thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te byas zin pas byed par mi nus pa'i phyir dang ro zhe na / de lta na nus pa dang mi nus pa dag gcig la 'bras bu thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: If you say, ‚ÄúIt is not because it cannot act having already acted,‚Äù

original: 'bras dang gso ma'i sa bon bzhin no //
analyzed: 'bras dang gso ma'i sa bon bzhin no //
translated: then it would follow that that which is able and that which is unable would be the same thing, like a rice seed and a barley seed.

original: rtag pa yang gang gi tshe cig car byed pa des na sngar yang yod pas de nyid kyis de byed par thal bar 'gyur de'i phyir chos sngar yang de bzhin du res 'ga' zhig cig car byed par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rtag pa yang gang gi tshe cig car byed pa des na sngar yang yod pas de nyid kyis de byed par thal bar 'gyur de'i phyir chos sngar yang de bzhin du res 'ga' zhig cig car byed par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is permanent, then when it acts simultaneously, it would exist previously, and therefore it would follow that it would act even previously. Therefore, like a phenomenon, it would not act sometimes even previously.

original: snga ma dang phyi ma dus dag gcig pa'i cha cig car byed pa ni don byed nus pa thams cad zla ba'i mtshan nyid can gyi med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: snga ma dang phyi ma dus dag gcig pa'i cha cig car byed pa ni don byed nus pa thams cad zla ba'i mtshan nyid can gyi med par 'gyur ro //
translated: If the earlier and later times were simultaneous, then all that is able to perform a function would be characterized by nonexistence.

original: ji ltar skad cig ma ma yin pa nyid rim dang cig car ma yin snyam na /
analyzed: ji ltar skad cig ma ma yin pa nyid rim dang cig car ma yin snyam na /
translated: If you think that it is not sequential or simultaneous, then it would not be momentary.

original: rim pa med pa'i phyogs de la yang sngar bshad pa'i skyon no //
analyzed: rim pa med pa'i phyogs de la yang sngar bshad pa'i skyon no //
translated: In that case, the previously explained faults would apply.

original: de ltar skad cig ma ma yin par gyur na mig la sogs pa la rag las pa rnams med par thal bar 'gyur bas skad cig ma nyid kyis yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar skad cig ma ma yin par gyur na mig la sogs pa la rag las pa rnams med par thal bar 'gyur bas skad cig ma nyid kyis yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If it were not momentary, then it would follow that those that depend on the eye and so on would not exist. Therefore, because they exist, they are momentary.

original: gang yod pa de ni skad cig mkho na yin no zhes yod pa 'jig pa'i bdag nyid du grub pas rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i ngo bo'i khyab pa grub pa yin no //
analyzed: gang yod pa de ni skad cig mkho na yin no zhes yod pa 'jig pa'i bdag nyid du grub pas rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i ngo bo'i khyab pa grub pa yin no //
translated: Since it is established that existence has the nature of disintegration, it is established that existence is pervaded by the nature of succession and reversal.

original: bram ze aa tsa ta yis rnam par sbyar ba'i 'grel ba las rang bzhin gtan tshigs @274a * //üîΩkyi dbang du byas pa'o /
analyzed: bram ze aa tsa ta yis rnam par sbyar ba'i 'grel ba las rang bzhin gtan tshigs @274a * //üîΩkyi dbang du byas pa'o /
translated: This is the section on the nature of the reason from the commentary composed by the brahman A≈õvajit.

original: // / de ltar rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyi de'i bdag nyid du grub ba'i rgyu mtshan gyi rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa nges pas ba bstan nas 'bras bu'i dngos por grub pa rgyu mtshan yin pa'i phyir de dang de dag mngon sum dang mi dmigs pa'i
analyzed: // / de ltar rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyi de'i bdag nyid du grub ba'i rgyu mtshan gyi rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa nges pas ba bstan nas 'bras bu'i dngos por grub pa rgyu mtshan yin pa'i phyir de dang de dag mngon sum dang mi dmigs pa'i
translated: Thus, having taught the pervasion and the counter pervasion by the reason of nature through the reason of the establishment of identity, the reason of effect is established as a thing. Since that is taught by the reason of direct perception and non-observation, it is included there.

original: rgyu mtshan gyis sngar bstan zin pa'i phyir der gtogs la gzhan yang gzhan dag la 'khrul pa'i rgyu bsal ba de'i yul bstan pa ni dong zhan zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: rgyu mtshan gyis sngar bstan zin pa'i phyir der gtogs la gzhan yang gzhan dag la 'khrul pa'i rgyu bsal ba de'i yul bstan pa ni dong zhan zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Moreover, in order to eliminate the cause of error for others, the object of that is taught.

original: gtan tshigs las tha dad pa'i dngos po go bar bya ba las 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs yin te /
analyzed: gtan tshigs las tha dad pa'i dngos po go bar bya ba las 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs yin te /
translated: The reason of effect is a different thing from the reason, because it is the effect of what is to be understood.

original: don gzhan ma yin pa ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so zhes bshad do //
analyzed: don gzhan ma yin pa ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so zhes bshad do //
translated: It is explained that the reason of nature is not a different object.

original: ci'i phyir don gzhan nyid 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir don gzhan nyid 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs yin zhe na /
translated: Why is a different object the reason of effect?

original: 'khrul pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: 'khrul pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Because there is no error.

original: 'bras bu nyid don gzhan pa la mi 'khrul pa yin gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu nyid don gzhan pa la mi 'khrul pa yin gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no //
translated: The effect is not mistaken with regard to something else, the object.

original: des na 'bras bu nyid las gzhan pa'i rgyu go bar bya bar brjod de /
analyzed: des na 'bras bu nyid las gzhan pa'i rgyu go bar bya bar brjod de /
translated: Therefore, the cause is understood as something other than the effect.

original: yang dag par ldan pa'i stobs kyis go par byed pa nyid yin na cha shas 'ga' zhig gis ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa sngar ji skad bshad pa /
analyzed: yang dag par ldan pa'i stobs kyis go par byed pa nyid yin na cha shas 'ga' zhig gis ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa sngar ji skad bshad pa /
translated: If it is understood by the power of association, it is not understood by some part.üîΩThe master has explained that it follows that everything would be the thing to be understood and the thing that understands.

original: gang thams cad du go bar bya ba dang / go bar byed pa'i dngos por thal bar 'gyur bar slob dpon gyis bshad pa de gzhan gyis 'dir yang 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs 'ga' zhig la yang thal bar 'gyur ro zhes dogs pas /
analyzed: gang thams cad du go bar bya ba dang / go bar byed pa'i dngos por thal bar 'gyur bar slob dpon gyis bshad pa de gzhan gyis 'dir yang 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs 'ga' zhig la yang thal bar 'gyur ro zhes dogs pas /
translated: Fearing that this would follow for some reason of effect here as well, he says,

original: gal te rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gal te rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúIf it is the thing called cause and effect,‚Äù and so on.

original: gal te 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs su brjod pa de'i tshe rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po yin pas rgyu'i go bar byed pa nyid do //
analyzed: gal te 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs su brjod pa de'i tshe rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po yin pas rgyu'i go bar byed pa nyid do //
translated: If it is stated as a reason of effect, then it is the cause that is understood because of being the thing called cause and effect.

original: de ltar gyur na thams cad du shes par bya ba dang shes par byed pa'i dngos por 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar gyur na thams cad du shes par bya ba dang shes par byed pa'i dngos por 'gyur te /
translated: If that were so, then everything would be the object of cognition and the instrument of cognition.

original: me'i spyi'i chos bzhin du bye brag gi chos kyang rtsva dang lo ma la sogs pa go bar bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: me'i spyi'i chos bzhin du bye brag gi chos kyang rtsva dang lo ma la sogs pa go bar bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: And just as the universal property of fire, so the particular properties of fuel, such as grass and leaves, would be the object of cognition.

original: du ba yang bye brag gi chos bzhin du rdzas dang sa la sogs pa spyi'i chos kyang go bar byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: du ba yang bye brag gi chos bzhin du rdzas dang sa la sogs pa spyi'i chos kyang go bar byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: And just as smoke is the particular property, so the universal properties of substance, earth, etc., would be the object of cognition.

original: gang las she na /
analyzed: gang las she na /
translated: From what?

original: rnam pa thams cad du bskyed par bya ba dang skyed par byed pa'i dngos po yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du bskyed par bya ba dang skyed par byed pa'i dngos po yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the entity that is produced and the producer in every way.

original: bskyed par bya @274b ba dang skyed par byed pa'i dngos po ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por brjod do //üîΩme dang du ba dag kyang cha shas kyis ni ma yin te /
analyzed: bskyed par bya @274b ba dang skyed par byed pa'i dngos po ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por brjod do // me dang du ba dag kyang cha shas kyis ni ma yin te /
translated: The entity that is produced and the producer is called the entity that is cause and effect.

original: 'on kyang rnam par thams cad kyis so //
analyzed: 'on kyang rnam par thams cad kyis so //
translated: Fire and smoke are not in part, but rather in every way.

original: de ltar na ji ltar me nyid dang rdzas nyid dang yod pa nyid la sogs pa rnams kyi spyi'i chos skyed par byed pa de bzhin du rtsva dang lo ma la sogs pa'i khyad par chos kyis kyang yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na ji ltar me nyid dang rdzas nyid dang yod pa nyid la sogs pa rnams kyi spyi'i chos skyed par byed pa de bzhin du rtsva dang lo ma la sogs pa'i khyad par chos kyis kyang yin no //
translated: Thus, just as the general properties of fire, substance, and existence, etc. are productive, so too are the specific properties of grass, leaves, etc.

original: dper na du ba'i du ba nyid dang skya bo nyid la sogs pa rnams kyi khyad par gyi chos skye bar rang nyid la nges pa de bzhin du spyi'i chos yod pa nyid dang / rdzas nyid la sogs pas kyang yin no //
analyzed: dper na du ba'i du ba nyid dang skya bo nyid la sogs pa rnams kyi khyad par gyi chos skye bar rang nyid la nges pa de bzhin du spyi'i chos yod pa nyid dang / rdzas nyid la sogs pas kyang yin no //
translated: For example, just as the specific properties of smoke, such as smokiness and paleness, etc. are produced, so too are the general properties of existence, substance, etc.

original: des kyang ji ltar de dag rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po yin pa de bzhin du go bar byed pa dang go bar bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des kyang ji ltar de dag rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po yin pa de bzhin du go bar byed pa dang go bar bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: And just as they are the cause and effect of each other, so too they are the understood and the means of understanding.

original: 'di dag de'i rgyu mtshan yin no zhes bya ba phyogs snga ma ba dogs pa la /
analyzed: 'di dag de'i rgyu mtshan yin no zhes bya ba phyogs snga ma ba dogs pa la /
translated: The opponent‚Äôs position is that these are the reasons.

original: 'dir rnam pa thams cad du skyed par byed pa dang bskyed par bya ba'i dngos po ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dir rnam pa thams cad du skyed par byed pa dang bskyed par bya ba'i dngos po ma yin te /
translated: Here, they are not the cause and effect of each other in every way.

original: des kyang de bzhin du go bar bya ba dang go bar byed pa'i dngos por gyur pa ga la yin /
analyzed: des kyang de bzhin du go bar bya ba dang go bar byed pa'i dngos por gyur pa ga la yin /
translated: How could it be the case that the thing that causes understanding is understood in that way?

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de med par ni rtsva dang shing la sogs pa de dag gi khyad par gyi chos med par 'byung ba'i du ba tsam nyid las khyad par gyi chos 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: de med par ni rtsva dang shing la sogs pa de dag gi khyad par gyi chos med par 'byung ba'i du ba tsam nyid las khyad par gyi chos 'byung ba'o //
translated: Because without that, the particular qualities of those things such as grass and wood would arise, and the particular qualities would arise from the mere arising of smoke.

original: de ltar de'i bdag nyid dang de las byung bar nges pa med pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: de ltar de'i bdag nyid dang de las byung bar nges pa med pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: Because there is no certainty that they are of the same nature or that one arises from the other.

original: ; de ltar de med par ni me med par rdzas la sogs pa spyi'i chos rnams 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: ; de ltar de med par ni me med par rdzas la sogs pa spyi'i chos rnams 'byung ba'o //
translated: In that case, without fire, the general qualities of substance and so on would arise.

original: me kho na las 'di 'byung ba yin no zhes bya ba de lta bu'i ngo bo ni de las byung bar nges pa med pas gang las bskyed par bya ba dang / skyed par byed pa'i ngo bor 'gyur /
analyzed: me kho na las 'di 'byung ba yin no zhes bya ba de lta bu'i ngo bo ni de las byung bar nges pa med pas gang las bskyed par bya ba dang / skyed par byed pa'i ngo bor 'gyur /
translated: Since there is no certainty that this is the nature of what arises from fire alone, how could there be a nature of what is produced and a producer?

original: gang gis na thams cad shes par bya ba dang shes par byed pa'i ngo bo yin pa med na de las 'byung bar nges pa'i bskyed par bya ba dang skyed par byed pa'i dngos po rnam par gzhag par mi nus so //
analyzed: gang gis na thams cad shes par bya ba dang shes par byed pa'i ngo bo yin pa med na de las 'byung bar nges pa'i bskyed par bya ba dang skyed par byed pa'i dngos po rnam par gzhag par mi nus so //
translated: If there were no such thing as the nature of the object of knowledge and the subject of knowledge, then the relation of the produced and the producer, which is ascertained to arise from that, could not be established.

original: gang gi phyir 'di ltar de bas na 'bras bu ni du ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'di ltar de bas na 'bras bu ni du ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Since this is the case, therefore the effect is smoke, etc.

original: ngo bo ji snyed cig ni du ba la sogs pa rnams so ;
analyzed: ngo bo ji snyed cig ni du ba la sogs pa rnams so ;
translated: The nature is as many as the smoke, etc.

original: /'di rang gir gtogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi gsum pa'o //
analyzed: /'di rang gir gtogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi gsum pa'o //
translated: This is the third characteristic that belongs to it.

original: med na mi 'byung ba ni med na mi srid pa'o //
analyzed: med na mi 'byung ba ni med na mi srid pa'o //
translated: Non-arising without is non-existence without.

original: ci med na mi srid pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci med na mi srid pa yin zhe na /
translated: What is non-existence without?

original: rgyu'i ngo bo ji snyed cig yin no zhes 'dir yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: rgyu'i ngo bo ji snyed cig yin no zhes 'dir yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The nature of the cause is as many as.

original: rgyu la brten pa'i ngo bo ji snyed cig med na 'bras bur gtogs @275a * //
analyzed: rgyu la brten pa'i ngo bo ji snyed cig med na 'bras bur gtogs @275a * //
translated: The nature of the cause is as many as the effect belongs to.

original: pa'i rang bzhin mi 'byung bar 'di dag gi rgyu yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: pa'i rang bzhin mi 'byung bar 'di dag gi rgyu yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: If it does not exist, it does not arise. These are the causes.

original: ci med na mi 'byung ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci med na mi 'byung ba yin zhe na /
translated: What is non-existence without?

original: rgyu'o // rgyu'i don gzhan pa'i yul rgyu yin te gzhi'i bdun pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu'o // rgyu'i don gzhan pa'i yul rgyu yin te gzhi'i bdun pa'o //
translated: The cause is the reason. The object that is the cause is the cause. The seventh case is the basis.

original: da ni rgyu yod pa'i ngo bo ji snyed pa rnams me'i rdzas la sogs pa med na mi 'byung ba dag gi rgyur gtogs pa'i spyi'i chos ni rgyu'o //
analyzed: da ni rgyu yod pa'i ngo bo ji snyed pa rnams me'i rdzas la sogs pa med na mi 'byung ba dag gi rgyur gtogs pa'i spyi'i chos ni rgyu'o //
translated: Now, the cause is the general property that belongs to the cause of whatever exists, which is not produced without the substance of fire, etc.

original: ci'i phyir 'bras bu go bar byed pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'bras bu go bar byed pa yin zhe na /
translated: Why is the effect the reason?

original: de'i 'bras bu nyid du nges pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu nyid du nges pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: It is said: because it is ascertained as its effect.

original: de nyid rgyur gtogs pa'i spyi'i chos de'i 'bras bu yin no zhes de lta bu'i ngo bor nges pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid rgyur gtogs pa'i spyi'i chos de'i 'bras bu yin no zhes de lta bu'i ngo bor nges pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The general property that belongs to the cause is its effect. Because there is such a nature that is ascertained.

original: rgyu'i spyi'i chos la res 'ga' zhig kyang de'i 'bras bu 'khrul pa med do //
analyzed: rgyu'i spyi'i chos la res 'ga' zhig kyang de'i 'bras bu 'khrul pa med do //
translated: The general property of the cause is never mistaken as the effect.

original: de ltar rgyur gtogs pa'i cha shas kyi phyi ma don du gnyer bas nges par dpyad na snga ma don du gnyer bas 'bras bur gtogs pa'i cha shas nges par dpyod do //
analyzed: de ltar rgyur gtogs pa'i cha shas kyi phyi ma don du gnyer bas nges par dpyad na snga ma don du gnyer bas 'bras bur gtogs pa'i cha shas nges par dpyod do //
translated: Thus, when the latter part that belongs to the cause is ascertained by seeking the purpose, the former part that belongs to the effect is ascertained by seeking the purpose.

original: gang dag ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gang dag ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: With regard to that, it is said: whatever... and so on.

original: 'bras bu'i chos dang de dag nyid kyi bdag nyid du gtogs pas rgyur gtogs pa'i chos rnams go bar byed do //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i chos dang de dag nyid kyi bdag nyid du gtogs pas rgyur gtogs pa'i chos rnams go bar byed do //
translated: and the general properties of the effect are understood in terms of the specific properties of the cause.

original: gang yang don gzhan pa srid pa ni du ba nyid dang skya bo la sogs pa khyad par gyi ngo bo de ni rgyur gtogs pa'i chos med na mi 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: gang yang don gzhan pa srid pa ni du ba nyid dang skya bo la sogs pa khyad par gyi ngo bo de ni rgyur gtogs pa'i chos med na mi 'byung ba'o //
translated: And the specific properties of the effect, such as being smoky, pale, and so on, which are different from the cause, are not possible without the specific properties of the cause.

original: 'dir yang de'i 'bras bu nyid du nges pa la ltos pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir yang de'i 'bras bu nyid du nges pa la ltos pa'o //
translated: Here, too, the ascertainment of the effect depends on the ascertainment of the cause.

original: 'bras bur gtogs pa de dag nyid kyi khyad par gyi chos rnams kyi rgyur gtogs pa'i spyi'i chos la ltos nas 'bras bu nyid du nges du nges pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bur gtogs pa de dag nyid kyi khyad par gyi chos rnams kyi rgyur gtogs pa'i spyi'i chos la ltos nas 'bras bu nyid du nges du nges pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The specific properties of the effect are ascertained as the effect in dependence on the general properties of the cause.

original: 'bras bur gtogs pa'i khyad par gyi chos de ni rgyur gyur pa'i spyi'i chos med na res 'ga' zhig kyang mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'bras bur gtogs pa'i khyad par gyi chos de ni rgyur gyur pa'i spyi'i chos med na res 'ga' zhig kyang mi 'byung ngo //
translated: The specific properties of the effect do not occur at all without the general properties of the cause.

original: de lta na de'i rgyu'i ni spyi'i chos kho na go bar bya ba yin la bye brag gi chos ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta na de'i rgyu'i ni spyi'i chos kho na go bar bya ba yin la bye brag gi chos ni ma yin no //
translated: Thus, the general properties of the cause are what is to be understood, not the specific properties.

original: 'bras bu yang bye brag gi chos kho na go bar byed pa yin gyi spyi'i chos ni ma yin pa des na 'bras bur nges pas so //
analyzed: 'bras bu yang bye brag gi chos kho na go bar byed pa yin gyi spyi'i chos ni ma yin pa des na 'bras bur nges pas so //
translated: The result is also understood only through specific properties, not through general properties, because it is ascertained as the result.

original: gang yang rgyu'i bye brag gi chos de'i 'bras bu nyid du nges pa'i 'bras bu tsam ni med pas de ni mi rtogs so //
analyzed: gang yang rgyu'i bye brag gi chos de'i 'bras bu nyid du nges pa'i 'bras bu tsam ni med pas de ni mi rtogs so //
translated: Since there is no mere result that is ascertained as the result of a specific property of the cause, that is not understood.

original: 'bras bu spyi'i chos ni rdzas la sogs pa gang yin pa de dag de'i 'bras bur nges pa med pas go bar byed pa med do //üîΩrgyu dang 'bras bu dngos po go bar byed @275b pa yin na rnam pa thams cad du go bar byed par thal bar gal la 'gyur gzhan mi 'dod pa'i dogs pa bsu ba ni gal te cha shas kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'bras bu spyi'i chos ni rdzas la sogs pa gang yin pa de dag de'i 'bras bur nges pa med pas go bar byed pa med do // rgyu dang 'bras bu dngos po go bar byed @275b pa yin na rnam pa thams cad du go bar byed par thal bar gal la 'gyur gzhan mi 'dod pa'i dogs pa bsu ba ni gal te cha shas kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The general property of the result, whatever it may be, such as substance, is not ascertained as its result, so it is not understood.üîΩIf the cause and result are understood as things, it would follow that they are understood in every way.üîΩIf you assert that the general property of the cause is what is understood and the specific property of the result is also what understands, then it would follow that the result is understood in every way.üîΩIf you assert that the general property of the cause is what is understood and the specific property of the result is also what understands, then it would follow that the result is understood in every way.

original: gal te rgyu spyi'i chos go bar bya ba yin la 'bras bu'i bye brag gi chos nyid kyang go bar byed pa yin pas de 'bras bu nyid du nges par 'dod na /
analyzed: gal te rgyu spyi'i chos go bar bya ba yin la 'bras bu'i bye brag gi chos nyid kyang go bar byed pa yin pas de 'bras bu nyid du nges par 'dod na /
translated: If you assert that the general property of the cause is what is understood and the specific property of the result is also what understands, then it would follow that the result is understood in every way.üîΩIf you assert that the general property of the cause is what is understood and the specific property of the result is also what understands, then it would follow that the result is understood in every way.üîΩIf you assert that the general property of the cause is what is understood and the specific property of the result is also what understands, then it would follow that the result is understood in every way.üîΩIf you assert that the general property of the cause is what is understood and the specific property of the result is also what understands, then it would follow that the result is understood in every way.üîΩIf you assert that the general property of the cause is what is understood and the specific property of the result is also what understands, then it would follow that the result is understood in every way.üîΩIf you assert that the general property of the cause is what is understood and the specific property of the result is also what understands, then it would follow that the result is understood in every way.üîΩIf you assert that the general property of the cause is what is understood and the specific property of the result is also what understands, then it would follow that the result is understood in every way.üîΩIf you assert that the general property of the cause is what is understood and the specific property of the result is also what understands, then it would follow that the result is understood in every way.üîΩIf you assert that the general property of the cause

original: de lta na cha shas kyis bskyed par bya ba dang skyed par byed pa'i dngos por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na cha shas kyis bskyed par bya ba dang skyed par byed pa'i dngos por 'gyur ro //
translated: In that case, it would be the object that is produced by its parts and the producer of its parts.

original: rgyu'i spyi'i chos kho na skyed par byed pa yin la bye brag ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rgyu'i spyi'i chos kho na skyed par byed pa yin la bye brag ni ma yin te /
