translated: The general characteristics of the cause are the producer, but the specific characteristics are not.

original: 'bras bu'i bye brag gi chos kho na bskyed par bya ba yin gyi spyi'i chos ma yin no zhes bya bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'bras bu'i bye brag gi chos kho na bskyed par bya ba yin gyi spyi'i chos ma yin no zhes bya bar 'gyur te /
translated: The specific characteristics of the effect are the produced, but the general characteristics are not.

original: rnam pa thams cad bskyed par bya ba dang skyed par byed pa'i dngos por mngon par 'dod pa'i phyir khas blangs dang 'gal lo zhe na /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad bskyed par bya ba dang skyed par byed pa'i dngos por mngon par 'dod pa'i phyir khas blangs dang 'gal lo zhe na /
translated: Since you assert that the entity is produced by and produces all aspects, you contradict your own tenets.

original: 'di dag gi lan ni cha shas kyis bskyed par bya ba dang skyed par byed pa'i dngos por thal bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di dag gi lan ni cha shas kyis bskyed par bya ba dang skyed par byed pa'i dngos por thal bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The response to this is that it does not follow that it is the object that is produced by its parts and the producer of its parts.

original: dngos po'i bdag nyid thams cad cha shas med par de khas blangs pa'i phyir go bar bya ba dang go bar byed pa'i dngos po yang rnam pa thams cad du mngon par 'dod pa'i phyir de ni nges bskyed par bya ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos
analyzed: dngos po'i bdag nyid thams cad cha shas med par de khas blangs pa'i phyir go bar bya ba dang go bar byed pa'i dngos po yang rnam pa thams cad du mngon par 'dod pa'i phyir de ni nges bskyed par bya ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos
translated: Because you accept that all entities are partless, you also assert that the entity that is the object of understanding and the entity that is the means of understanding are in every way the same.üîΩTherefore, the text says, ‚ÄúIt is not tenable to say that the effect is produced by the cause.‚Äù

original: te / gang 'bras bu ni rgyur gyur pa'i khyad par gyi chos kyis bskyed par bya ba yin na ni khyad par de gzung bar bya ba yin la /
analyzed: te / gang 'bras bu ni rgyur gyur pa'i khyad par gyi chos kyis bskyed par bya ba yin na ni khyad par de gzung bar bya ba yin la /
translated: If the effect is produced by the cause through a specific attribute, then that specific attribute is apprehended.

original: de'i tshe nges bskyed par bya ba'i khyad par gzung nas rgyur gyur pa'i khyad par gyi chos go bar bya ba nyid du mngon par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe nges bskyed par bya ba'i khyad par gzung nas rgyur gyur pa'i khyad par gyi chos go bar bya ba nyid du mngon par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: At that time, it is not tenable to assert that the specific attribute that is the object of understanding is the means of understanding.

original: de lta na du ba la sogs pa'i rtags kyi khyad par gyi ngo bo'i bye brag rnams 'bras bur gyur pa'i rdzas la sogs pa spyi'i gang yin pa de dag kyang go bar byed pa nyid du mngon par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta na du ba la sogs pa'i rtags kyi khyad par gyi ngo bo'i bye brag rnams 'bras bur gyur pa'i rdzas la sogs pa spyi'i gang yin pa de dag kyang go bar byed pa nyid du mngon par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In that case, the specific attributes of the reason, such as smoke, and the specific attributes of the substance, etc., that are the effect would also be asserted to be the means of understanding.

original: de lta na aa ka ru'i du ba bzung bar gyur pa las de nyid me rjes su dpog pa dang / du ba nyid kyi khyad par rdzas la sogs pas me rjes su dpog pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta na aa ka ru'i du ba bzung bar gyur pa las de nyid me rjes su dpog pa dang / du ba nyid kyi khyad par rdzas la sogs pas me rjes su dpog pa yin no //
translated: In that case, smoke that is grasped as the property of a smoky place is the inferential mark of fire, and the particularities of smoke itself are the inferential mark of the substance of fire and so on.

original: rnam pa thams cad du bskyed par bya ba dang skyed par byed pa'i dngos po yod pa tsam gyis go bar bya ba dang go bar byed par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du bskyed par bya ba dang skyed par byed pa'i dngos po yod pa tsam gyis go bar bya ba dang go bar byed par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: It is not that the mere existence of the object to be inferred and the inferential mark is understood as the object to be inferred and the inferential mark.

original: de ni shos pa la ltos pa'i phyir ro //üîΩde lta na yod pa tsam gyi rtags ni go bar byed pa ma yin te de shes par byed pa la @276a * //
analyzed: de ni shos pa la ltos pa'i phyir ro // de lta na yod pa tsam gyi rtags ni go bar byed pa ma yin te de shes par byed pa la @276a * //
translated: Because that depends on the cognition.

original: ltos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ltos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In that case, the mere existence of the inferential mark is not the inferential mark because it depends on the cognition of that.

original: shes par byed pa ni rang nyid nges pa la ltos nas shes bar bya ba'i don shes par 'gyur gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: shes par byed pa ni rang nyid nges pa la ltos nas shes bar bya ba'i don shes par 'gyur gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no //
translated: The cognition of the inferential mark depends on the ascertainment of itself and then the object to be inferred is cognized, but not otherwise.

original: ji ltar de med par 'byung ba ni de las 'byung bar nges pa med pa'i phyir zhes bshad ba na /
analyzed: ji ltar de med par 'byung ba ni de las 'byung bar nges pa med pa'i phyir zhes bshad ba na /
translated: As it was explained, that which occurs without it is not ascertained to arise from it.

original: rnam pa thams cad du bskyed par bya ba dang skyed par byed pa'i dngos po khas blangs pa 'di med par 'byung ba ni med pa yin no zhe na /üîΩkhyad par can ma yin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du bskyed par bya ba dang skyed par byed pa'i dngos po khas blangs pa 'di med par 'byung ba ni med pa yin no zhe na / khyad par can ma yin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: If you accept that a cause is a cause because it produces an effect, then it is impossible for that which is not an effect to be a cause.üîΩIf you accept that a cause is a cause because it produces an effect, then it is impossible for that which is not an effect to be a cause.üîΩIf you accept that a cause is a cause because it produces an effect, then it is impossible for that which is not an effect to be a cause.üîΩIf you accept that a cause is a cause because it produces an effect, then it is impossible for that which is not an effect to be a cause.üîΩIf you accept that a cause is a cause because it produces an effect, then it is impossible for that which is not an effect to be a cause.üîΩIf you accept that a cause is a cause because it produces an effect, then it is impossible for that which is not an effect to be a cause.üîΩIf you accept that a cause is a cause because it produces an effect, then it is impossible for that which is not an effect to be a cause.

original: gal te de skyed pa'i khyad par 'dzin pa spangs pa ni khyad par can ma yin pa'i 'bras bu tsam khas blangs pa'am /üîΩrtags kyi khyad par spangs pa'i rdzas la sogs pa yin pa de'i tshe khyad par med pa'i spyi yang brjod par 'dod pa yin no //
analyzed: gal te de skyed pa'i khyad par 'dzin pa spangs pa ni khyad par can ma yin pa'i 'bras bu tsam khas blangs pa'am / rtags kyi khyad par spangs pa'i rdzas la sogs pa yin pa de'i tshe khyad par med pa'i spyi yang brjod par 'dod pa yin no //
translated: If you accept that a cause is a cause because it produces an effect, then it is impossible for that which is not an effect to be a cause.üîΩIf you accept that a cause is a cause because it produces an effect, then it is impossible for that which is not an effect to be a cause.üîΩIf you accept that a cause is a cause because it produces an effect, then it is impossible for that which is not an effect to be a cause.üîΩIf you accept that a cause is a cause because it produces an effect, then it is impossible for that which is not an effect to be a cause.üîΩIf you accept that a cause is a cause because it produces an effect, then it is impossible for that which is not an effect to be a cause.

original: rgyur gyur pa'i khyad par yod pas kyang du ba tsam 'byung ba de'i khyad par can ma yin pa'i rdzas la sogs pa ni med kyang 'byung bas 'khrul pa yin pa'i phyir rnam pa thams cad du bskyed par bya ba dang skyed par byed pa de med pas
analyzed: rgyur gyur pa'i khyad par yod pas kyang du ba tsam 'byung ba de'i khyad par can ma yin pa'i rdzas la sogs pa ni med kyang 'byung bas 'khrul pa yin pa'i phyir rnam pa thams cad du bskyed par bya ba dang skyed par byed pa de med pas
translated: If you accept that a cause is a cause because it produces an effect, then it is impossible for that which is not an effect to be a cause.üîΩIf you accept that a cause is a cause because it produces an effect,

original: go bar bya ba dang go bar byed par mi 'dod do //
analyzed: go bar bya ba dang go bar byed par mi 'dod do //
translated: We do not accept that the reason is the same as the object to be established.

original: khyad par ni rjod par 'dod pa ma yin te de la 'khrul pa srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyad par ni rjod par 'dod pa ma yin te de la 'khrul pa srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Nor do we accept that the reason is a particular of the object to be established, because error is possible in regard to that.

original: 'di ltar gal te du ba tsam gyi rtsva dang shing la sogs pa'i khyad par med kyang 'byung ba yin /
analyzed: 'di ltar gal te du ba tsam gyi rtsva dang shing la sogs pa'i khyad par med kyang 'byung ba yin /
translated: Thus, although smoke is not a particular of grass, wood, etc., it does occur in them.

original: skyed pa'i khyad par ni ma yin te /
analyzed: skyed pa'i khyad par ni ma yin te /
translated: But it is not a particular of the effect, because it is not the case that whenever smoke is apprehended, the particular of the effect is necessarily apprehended.

original: gang gi tshe de 'dzin par nus pa de'i tshe khyad par go bar bya ba nyid du yod pa kho na ste rtags nges pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi tshe de 'dzin par nus pa de'i tshe khyad par go bar bya ba nyid du yod pa kho na ste rtags nges pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For, when it is possible to apprehend the effect, then the particular of the object to be established exists as something to be understood, because the reason is ascertained.

original: de lta na gal te rdzas nyid dang yod pa nyid tsam me yod pa las 'byung ba yin gyi du ba'i bdag nyid ma yin pas de'i khyad par ni mi 'khrul pa'i go bar byed pa yin yang bsal bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: de lta na gal te rdzas nyid dang yod pa nyid tsam me yod pa las 'byung ba yin gyi du ba'i bdag nyid ma yin pas de'i khyad par ni mi 'khrul pa'i go bar byed pa yin yang bsal bar mi bya'o //
translated: Thus, if the mere substance and existence of smoke occur from the existence of fire, but not the nature of smoke, then, although the particular of the object to be established is the nonerroneous means of understanding, it is not to be stated.

original: 'di gzhan gyi dogs pa brjod pa'i go skabs ni gal te res 'ga' zhig ces bya ba smos te /
analyzed: 'di gzhan gyi dogs pa brjod pa'i go skabs ni gal te res 'ga' zhig ces bya ba smos te /
translated: The opportunity for the statement of another's doubt is, If sometimes.

original: 'ga' zhig ni du ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig ni du ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Some means smoke, etc.

original: res 'ga' zhig ni dus kha cig tu'o //
analyzed: res 'ga' zhig ni dus kha cig tu'o //
translated: sometimes, at a certain time.

original: 'ga' zhig las ni me la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig las ni me la sogs pa'o //
translated: from some, fire, etc.

original: 'byung ba yang ni yod do //
analyzed: 'byung ba yang ni yod do //
translated: and also the elements.

original: thams cad ni du ba'o //
analyzed: thams cad ni du ba'o //
translated: all is smoke.

original: de dang 'dra ba ni /
analyzed: de dang 'dra ba ni /
translated: like that,

original: gang dang 'dra bar me la sogs pa gcig las 'byung ba mthong ba'o //
analyzed: gang dang 'dra bar me la sogs pa gcig las 'byung ba mthong ba'o //
translated: like that from which fire, etc. is seen to arise from one.

original: de las skyes pa ni rnam pa de lta bu'i skye ba ni rnam pa ji lta ba de gcig las 'byung bar mthong ba de 'dra ba nyid skye ba gang yin pa de ni rnam pa de lta bu'i skye ba'o //
analyzed: de las skyes pa ni rnam pa de lta bu'i skye ba ni rnam pa ji lta ba de gcig las 'byung bar mthong ba de 'dra ba nyid skye ba gang yin pa de ni rnam pa de lta bu'i skye ba'o //
translated: arisen from that, the arising of that kind is the arising of that kind which is seen to arise from one.

original: 'di dag tshad ma gang las nges pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'di dag tshad ma gang las nges pa yin zhe na /
translated: From what valid cognition is this ascertained?

original: 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs kyi rgyu dang 'bras bu'i @276b dngos po sgrub pa'i rgyu mtshan gyi rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa gang yin brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs kyi rgyu dang 'bras bu'i @276b dngos po sgrub pa'i rgyu mtshan gyi rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa gang yin brjod pa yin no //
translated: The reason is the effect, and the reason is the establishment of the causal relation, which is the invariable concomitance and the reverse concomitance.

original: gal te de lta na mngon sum dang mi dmigs pa dag gis du ba 'ba' zhig me'i tshogs pa'i 'bras bur gtogs pa ci de tsam gyis gzhan de dang 'dra ba'i de dang 'dra ba 'bras bu grub par 'gyur ram /
analyzed: gal te de lta na mngon sum dang mi dmigs pa dag gis du ba 'ba' zhig me'i tshogs pa'i 'bras bur gtogs pa ci de tsam gyis gzhan de dang 'dra ba'i de dang 'dra ba 'bras bu grub par 'gyur ram /
translated: If that is so, then by direct perception and non-apprehension, only smoke is included as the effect of the collection of fire and so on. By that alone, is the effect of that which is similar to that, that is, another fire, established?

original: de la de'i rgyu mtshan dag mngon sum dang mi dmigs pa dag gis byed pa med de /
analyzed: de la de'i rgyu mtshan dag mngon sum dang mi dmigs pa dag gis byed pa med de /
translated: In that regard, direct perception and non-apprehension are not the reasons for that.

original: gang la de dag kho na gzhan gyis byed pa de ni gzhan de'i 'bras bur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang la de dag kho na gzhan gyis byed pa de ni gzhan de'i 'bras bur 'gyur ro //
translated: That which is produced by those alone is the effect of that other.

original: de gzhan yin na ci zhig tu 'gyur /
analyzed: de gzhan yin na ci zhig tu 'gyur /
translated: If that is another, what would it be?

original: gang gis rnam pa de lta bu'i skye bar 'gyur /
analyzed: gang gis rnam pa de lta bu'i skye bar 'gyur /
translated: By what would it be produced in that way?

original: de lta na du ba'i gsal ba 'ga' zhig me la sogs pa las skye ba mthong ba de cis na bum pa la sogs pa las kyang khas mi len gzhan par khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta na du ba'i gsal ba 'ga' zhig me la sogs pa las skye ba mthong ba de cis na bum pa la sogs pa las kyang khas mi len gzhan par khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In that case, since some instances of smoke are seen to arise from fire and so on, why is it not accepted that some instances of smoke arise from a pot and so on? Because there is no difference between them.

original: gal te de dag las nyes pa cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de dag las nyes pa cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If that is so, what is the fault?

original: de ltar gyur na tshad ma med pas de ltar rnam par dbye ba'i bdag nyid la nges pa med pas de dang mi 'dra ba las skye bar dogs pa na de 'dra ba'i du ba la sogs pa dang rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag la nges
analyzed: de ltar gyur na tshad ma med pas de ltar rnam par dbye ba'i bdag nyid la nges pa med pas de dang mi 'dra ba las skye bar dogs pa na de 'dra ba'i du ba la sogs pa dang rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag la nges
translated: If that were the case, since there would be no valid knowledge, there would be no certainty about the nature of the classification, and therefore there would be doubt about arising from something dissimilar.

original: pa med na gang gis 'bras bu gtan tshigs go bar byed pa nyid yin /üîΩyul dang dus gcig na gnas par nges pa gang yin pa de kho na'i me'i khyad bar gyi rgyu can gyi du ba mngon sum dang mi dmigs pas rtogs kyi de nyid kyi rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa rtogs pa ni med de de yul gzhan na
analyzed: pa med na gang gis 'bras bu gtan tshigs go bar byed pa nyid yin / yul dang dus gcig na gnas par nges pa gang yin pa de kho na'i me'i khyad bar gyi rgyu can gyi du ba mngon sum dang mi dmigs pas rtogs kyi de nyid kyi rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa rtogs pa ni med de de yul gzhan na
translated: If there were no certainty about the concomitance and the reverse concomitance of such things as smoke, by what would the effect be made known as the reason?

original: mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That which is ascertained to exist at the same time and place as the object is understood by direct perception and non-apprehension to be the cause of the particular fire, but there is no understanding of its concomitance and reverse concomitance, because it is impossible for it to exist in another place.

original: de lta na 'on te de 'dra ba'i spyi'i bdag nyid rtags yin pas de'i rnam pa de lta bu yang skye bas sems rnam pa de lta bu'i rjes su 'gro ba'am ldog pa ga la yin /
analyzed: de lta na 'on te de 'dra ba'i spyi'i bdag nyid rtags yin pas de'i rnam pa de lta bu yang skye bas sems rnam pa de lta bu'i rjes su 'gro ba'am ldog pa ga la yin /
translated: In that case, since the general nature is the reason, how could the arising of that aspect be concomitant with or reverse from the mind that has that aspect?

original: de skad du /
analyzed: de skad du /
translated: It is said:

original: yul dang dus dang gnas skabs rnams //
analyzed: yul dang dus dang gnas skabs rnams //
translated: And in terms of place, time, and occasion,

original: tha dad nus pa tha dad la //
analyzed: tha dad nus pa tha dad la //
translated: The different capacities are different.

original: dngos rnams rjes su dpag pa yis //
analyzed: dngos rnams rjes su dpag pa yis //
translated: The existence of things is realized

original: rtogs pa shin tu rnyed par dka' //
analyzed: rtogs pa shin tu rnyed par dka' //
translated: Through inference, but that is very difficult.

original: zhes bshad do zhe na /
analyzed: zhes bshad do zhe na /
translated: This is explained.

original: grub pa'i mtha' smra ba la ma yin te /
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' smra ba la ma yin te /
translated: This is not so for the proponent of tenets.

original: de las byung ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /üîΩ'dir lan cig du ba la sogs pa'i tshogs ba las 'byung ba mngon sum dang mi dmigs pa dag gis nges pa'i ngo bo yang de 'dra ba dang de dang mi 'dra ba yod pa dag ji ltar bar yongs su mthong ba las gzhan pa nyid dang mtshungs
analyzed: de las byung ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / 'dir lan cig du ba la sogs pa'i tshogs ba las 'byung ba mngon sum dang mi dmigs pa dag gis nges pa'i ngo bo yang de 'dra ba dang de dang mi 'dra ba yod pa dag ji ltar bar yongs su mthong ba las gzhan pa nyid dang mtshungs
translated: The response is ‚Äúarising from that‚Äù and so on.

original: par dogs pa dang / de la me la sogs pa'i tshogs pa las skye @277a * //
analyzed: par dogs pa dang / de la me la sogs pa'i tshogs pa las skye @277a * //
translated: Here, the collection of smoke and so on arises from that, and through direct perception and nonobservation, the ascertained nature is seen to be like that and unlike that.üîΩFrom that, doubt arises, ‚ÄúIs it like that or is it not like that?‚Äù

original: ba'i du ba'i khyad bar lan cig nges pa gang yin pa de la ltos ba ni de las gzhan pa'i khyad par de dang 'dra ba dang gang de dang mi 'dra ba'i dngos po rnams kyang nus pa sna tshogs pa dang de las 'byung ngo zhes dogs pa
analyzed: ba'i du ba'i khyad bar lan cig nges pa gang yin pa de la ltos ba ni de las gzhan pa'i khyad par de dang 'dra ba dang gang de dang mi 'dra ba'i dngos po rnams kyang nus pa sna tshogs pa dang de las 'byung ngo zhes dogs pa
translated: The specific features of smoke that are ascertained once are dependent on that, and from that arise various potencies for things that are similar to that and for things that are not similar to that.

original: la / de bzhin du de yang lan cig me la sogs pa'i tshogs pa las 'byung bar nges ba de'i tshe dang 'dra ba nyid ni gzhan la ltos pa'o //
analyzed: la / de bzhin du de yang lan cig me la sogs pa'i tshogs pa las 'byung bar nges ba de'i tshe dang 'dra ba nyid ni gzhan la ltos pa'o //
translated: In the same way, when it is ascertained that it arises from the assembly of fire and so on, then that which is similar is dependent on another.

original: de la gang gi tshe de las gzhan pa de 'dra ba las de dang 'dra ba skye bar 'gyur ba de'i tshe de dang mi 'dra ba'i ngo bo ni me la sogs pa'i tshogs pa las skye ba'i ngo bo ma yin te /
analyzed: de la gang gi tshe de las gzhan pa de 'dra ba las de dang 'dra ba skye bar 'gyur ba de'i tshe de dang mi 'dra ba'i ngo bo ni me la sogs pa'i tshogs pa las skye ba'i ngo bo ma yin te /
translated: When that which is similar to that arises from that which is similar to that, then that which is dissimilar in nature does not arise from the assembly of fire and so on.

original: yongs su ma mthong ba'i du ba de yang me'i tshogs pa rgyu yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yongs su ma mthong ba'i du ba de yang me'i tshogs pa rgyu yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: That smoke which is not seen would also be the cause of the assembly of fire.

original: de dang 'dra ba'i ngo bo ni me la sogs pa'i tshogs pa dang mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba'i rgyu'i ngo bo las skye ba'i phyir dang / des na me la sogs pa'i tshogs ba rgyu ma yin pa'i phyir de nyid lhan cig pa de las byung bar mthong ba'i du ba gang yin pa de yang mi 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dang 'dra ba'i ngo bo ni me la sogs pa'i tshogs pa dang mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba'i rgyu'i ngo bo las skye ba'i phyir dang / des na me la sogs pa'i tshogs ba rgyu ma yin pa'i phyir de nyid lhan cig pa de las byung bar mthong ba'i du ba gang yin pa de yang mi 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: And the effect that has a nature similar to that of the assemblage of fire, etc., arises from a cause that has a nature dissimilar to that of the assemblage of fire, etc. Therefore, since the assemblage of fire, etc., is not the cause, the smoke that is seen to arise from that assemblage would not occur.

original: gang 'di'i rgyu ma yin pa de dang de ni lan 'ga' yang de las 'byung bar mi 'gyur te de rgyu med par thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang 'di'i rgyu ma yin pa de dang de ni lan 'ga' yang de las 'byung bar mi 'gyur te de rgyu med par thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: That which is not the cause of something never produces it, because it would follow, absurdly, that anything could produce anything.

original: de las 'byung ba ma yin pa zhes bya ba las de smos ba ni me la sogs pa'i rgyu brjod par 'dod pa gzung ngo //
analyzed: de las 'byung ba ma yin pa zhes bya ba las de smos ba ni me la sogs pa'i rgyu brjod par 'dod pa gzung ngo //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthat which does not arise from it‚Äù is stated in the phrase ‚Äúthat which does not arise from that‚Äù in order to include the cause of fire, etc., which is not mentioned.

original: de ma yin pa ni de med pa'o //
analyzed: de ma yin pa ni de med pa'o //
translated: That which is not that is the absence of that.

original: de dang mtshan nyid mi mthun pa dang de dang mi 'dra ba brgya byin gyi spyi bo la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de dang mtshan nyid mi mthun pa dang de dang mi 'dra ba brgya byin gyi spyi bo la sogs pa'o //
translated: That which is dissimilar to that is unlike that, such as the head of Indra, etc.

original: de'i phyir 'byung ba'i ngang tshul can de ni de las byung ba'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'byung ba'i ngang tshul can de ni de las byung ba'o //
translated: Therefore, that which has the nature of arising is arisen from that.

original: de dang 'dra ba'i mtshan nyid de'i du ba'i dngos po'o //
analyzed: de dang 'dra ba'i mtshan nyid de'i du ba'i dngos po'o //
translated: The nature of that smoke is similar to that.

original: lan 'ga' yang ni lan cig kyang ngo //
analyzed: lan 'ga' yang ni lan cig kyang ngo //
translated: Even once means even one time.

original: me la sogs pa de las mi 'byung bas yod par 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: me la sogs pa de las mi 'byung bas yod par 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is contradictory that it exists without arising from that fire, etc.üîΩIf it were similar, then the nature of that which is similar to that assemblage of fire, etc. would be the cause of that similarity.

original: de 'dra ba yin du zin na me la sogs pa'i tshogs pa de las de dang 'dra ba'i ngo bo ni de dang 'dra ba nyid rgyu yin no zhes lan cig 'byung ba kho nas mngon sum dang mi dmigs pa dag gis rtogs par bya ba yin na
analyzed: de 'dra ba yin du zin na me la sogs pa'i tshogs pa de las de dang 'dra ba'i ngo bo ni de dang 'dra ba nyid rgyu yin no zhes lan cig 'byung ba kho nas mngon sum dang mi dmigs pa dag gis rtogs par bya ba yin na
translated: It is understood by direct perception and non-apprehension,

original: / gang las 'khrul par dogs par bya /
analyzed: / gang las 'khrul par dogs par bya /
translated: from where could there be doubt of error?

original: des na ci 'dra ba'i du ba dang me la sogs pa'i tshogs pa las byung bar mthong ba de 'dra ba de ni de'i ngo bos de dang 'dra ba nyid du 'byung bas so //
analyzed: des na ci 'dra ba'i du ba dang me la sogs pa'i tshogs pa las byung bar mthong ba de 'dra ba de ni de'i ngo bos de dang 'dra ba nyid du 'byung bas so //
translated: Therefore, whatever smoke arises from an assemblage of fire, etc. is similar to that which is seen to arise from that assemblage of fire, etc. It arises as similar to that by the nature of that.

original: gang du ba yod pa de la me'i tshogs pa yod par rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa nges pa yin no //
analyzed: gang du ba yod pa de la me'i tshogs pa yod par rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa nges pa yin no //
translated: Wherever there is smoke, there is the presence of a collection of fire, etc., and the absence of smoke is invariably concomitant with the absence of a collection of fire, etc.

original: yang na gzhan du bshad par @277b bya ste ;
analyzed: yang na gzhan du bshad par @277b bya ste ;
translated: Or else, it should be explained differently:

original: 'dir mngon sum dang mi dmigs pa rgyu mtshan gyi 'bras bu dang rgyu'i dngos por grub po zhes sngar bshad zin to //
analyzed: 'dir mngon sum dang mi dmigs pa rgyu mtshan gyi 'bras bu dang rgyu'i dngos por grub po zhes sngar bshad zin to //
translated: It has already been explained that direct perception and non-apprehension establish the causal relation between the reason and the consequence.

original: de'i rgyu mtshan gyi rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag bstan par 'dod pa de ni mi rigs te /üîΩ'di ltar du ba 'ga' zhig me la sogs pa'i tshogs pa las gzhan la 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: de'i rgyu mtshan gyi rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag bstan par 'dod pa de ni mi rigs te / 'di ltar du ba 'ga' zhig me la sogs pa'i tshogs pa las gzhan la 'byung ba ste /
translated: The demonstration of the invariable concomitance and the reverse concomitance of that reason is not tenable,üîΩbecause sometimes smoke arises from a collection of fire, etc., and sometimes it arises from other things.

original: res 'ga' zhig 'di thog mar skye ba'i dus dang po ni me la sogs pa'i tshogs pa las kyang skye'o //
analyzed: res 'ga' zhig 'di thog mar skye ba'i dus dang po ni me la sogs pa'i tshogs pa las kyang skye'o //
translated: Sometimes, at the initial stage of its arising, it arises from a collection of fire, etc.

original: thams cad du de dang 'dra ba ni ma yin te du ba'i skad cig ma dang po ci 'dra ba 'byung ba'i skad cig ma gnyis pa la sogs rnams kyang mngon sum kho nas de dang 'dra ba de ni snga ma dang mtshan nyid mi mthun par rtogs
analyzed: thams cad du de dang 'dra ba ni ma yin te du ba'i skad cig ma dang po ci 'dra ba 'byung ba'i skad cig ma gnyis pa la sogs rnams kyang mngon sum kho nas de dang 'dra ba de ni snga ma dang mtshan nyid mi mthun par rtogs
translated: But it is not the same for all, because the second moment and so on of the arising of the first moment of smoke is just like the first moment of smoke, and that is understood to be dissimilar to the prior by direct perception alone.

original: te / rnam pa de lta bu'i skye ba zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: te / rnam pa de lta bu'i skye ba zhes bya ba ni /
translated: What is called ‚Äúarising in that way‚Äù

original: ji lta bu'i rnam pa'i me dang bud shing gi tshogs pa'i mtshan nyid dang por du ba skyes pa'i rnam pa de lta bu skye ba gang yin pa de ni rnam pa de lta bu'i skye ba yin no zhes bya ba 'di gang gis ma yin /
analyzed: ji lta bu'i rnam pa'i me dang bud shing gi tshogs pa'i mtshan nyid dang por du ba skyes pa'i rnam pa de lta bu skye ba gang yin pa de ni rnam pa de lta bu'i skye ba yin no zhes bya ba 'di gang gis ma yin /
translated: is that which arises in the aspect of smoke, which is the characteristic of the collection of fire and fuel in that way, and that is the arising in that way.

original: de ni du ba las kyang 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni du ba las kyang 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: But that is not so, because it arises from smoke.

original: de ltar gang dang gang las mthong ba de ni gzhan la yang yod par mthong bas thams cad la yid brtan du med do snyam du sems pas de ltar na zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de ltar gang dang gang las mthong ba de ni gzhan la yang yod par mthong bas thams cad la yid brtan du med do snyam du sems pas de ltar na zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Thus, since what is seen in one place is also seen in another, one thinks, ‚ÄúNothing can be trusted.‚Äù

original: me ma yin pa'i du ba las kyang du ba 'byung la brgya byin gyi spyi bo la sogs pa las kyang 'byung bas 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: me ma yin pa'i du ba las kyang du ba 'byung la brgya byin gyi spyi bo la sogs pa las kyang 'byung bas 'gal ba med do //
translated: Smoke also arises from non-fire, and it also arises from ≈öakra‚Äôs head and so on.üîΩThe opponent‚Äôs doubt is that fire and smoke are not invariably related.

original: me dang du ba la rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag ma yin no zhes sems pa phyogs snga ma'i dogs pas 'di skad du /üîΩskad cig dngos po kha cig tu //
analyzed: me dang du ba la rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag ma yin no zhes sems pa phyogs snga ma'i dogs pas 'di skad du / skad cig dngos po kha cig tu //
translated: To respond to this, BhƒÅviveka says:üîΩHow could a thing that is momentary

original: ji ltar rag las 'jug pa yin //
analyzed: ji ltar rag las 'jug pa yin //
translated: be related to something else?

original: rgyur grags pa ni yod pa las //
analyzed: rgyur grags pa ni yod pa las //
translated: From an existent that is renowned as a cause,

original: 'di 'byung de las yod pa yin //üîΩde phyir mes min du ba las //
analyzed: 'di 'byung de las yod pa yin // de phyir mes min du ba las //
translated: this effect arises, and it exists in that.

original: du ba srid yin ji lta ba'i //
analyzed: du ba srid yin ji lta ba'i //
translated: Therefore, it is possible that smoke arises from non-fire,

original: brgya byin spyi bo de bzhin de //üîΩsrid pa gang gis bsal bar nus //
analyzed: brgya byin spyi bo de bzhin de // srid pa gang gis bsal bar nus //
translated: and it is possible that smoke arises from ≈öakra‚Äôs head.

original: zhes bshad do zhe na /
analyzed: zhes bshad do zhe na /
translated: By what possibility could this be refuted?

original: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas ma yin te zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas ma yin te zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The Proponent of the Middle Way says, ‚ÄúNo, it is not so.‚Äù

original: bud shing gi tshogs pa las skyes pa ci 'dra ba'i du ba de 'dra ba kho na du ma las kyang 'byung ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: bud shing gi tshogs pa las skyes pa ci 'dra ba'i du ba de 'dra ba kho na du ma las kyang 'byung ba yang ma yin te /
translated: Smoke that arises from a collection of firewood does not arise from a mere multiplicity.

original: rgyu'i nus pa tha dad pas bdag nyid 'ga' zhig las 'dra bar nges pa yang mi 'dra ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu'i nus pa tha dad pas bdag nyid 'ga' zhig las 'dra bar nges pa yang mi 'dra ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the difference in the potency of the cause, some of the nature of the effect is certain to be different from the rest.
